name: Sprintec
comments: I have been on Sprintec for almost 3 months, and I hate it. My breasts feel like rocks or punching bags all the time. My period was almost a week late. eventually it started (my period) and now I'm still bleeding almost two weeks later with dryish blood clots, I'm scared this will trigger that thing that tampons do because they are dry and could get stuck, maybe I'm paranoid. But this pill makes me nauseating after about 22 hours after taking it, so I had to stop taking the pill in the morning. I'm switching as soon as I can!!! With PCOS I've been freaked out with the long bleeding and dry blood clots.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
Dr, pharmacist and insurance company were no help. Teva knows they have a defective device. 

Peel the label up on the backside. Twist the bottom section in your left hand - away from you. Throw the top section away!  Remove the white mouth cover.  Put the canister - dispenser side down, into lower section, lining up the nozzle. When secured, place both thumbs at bottom sides, below mouth piece. Put both pointer fingers at top sides of canister.  Get ready to use like a traditional inhaler - press down on canister and breathe in medication. Feel free to confirm your inhaler works by testing it - with mouthpiece directed away from your face. The two RedihHalers I tested this on - both actually gave out visible doses - something neither had done in a while. 

If you want to be extra safe - use the white mouthpiece cover when inhaler is not in use. But definitely throw out the heavy plastic piece with the Qvar label. Worthless junk for our landfills!

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: It definitely helped me to breathe better, but puts me at risk for thrush. Once in a while I get thrush in the throat, which is annoying and I have to stop using Advair for a few days, and I struggle to breathe again about two days later. Clears up pretty quick. It’s a good idea to eat yogurt after rinsing your mouth, so now I eat yogurt all the time.
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Apri
comments: This has been an awful experience for me. I’m having a polyp removed from my uterus and have to go on birth control for the surgery. I’ve been on it for 2 weeks and since the start, I’ve had extreme nausea, bad headaches, tired all the time, moody, and trouble sleeping. I just feel awful! I do NOT recommend this particular pill!!!

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: Break through bleeding, decreased sex drive, acne, weight fluctuates

name: Ajovy
comments: I took Ajovy for 2 months. Although, it worked almost instantly it came with side effects. It was as if there was a band pulling at my stomach tighter and tighter. The pressure was too much for me. I also gained almost 10 pounds in that short period. I’m now back on Aimovig . It worked for 2 years but not as well as Ajovy . Just less side effects for me. Unfortunately, as we all try these medications we find more side effects than listed. Some are worth the try . Good luck to all

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: So I’m currently on my fourth month of this pill right now and I’ve been nonstop bleeding for 3 weeks. I’ve also slightly broken out a little more than usual from this pill. But the 3 week period is insufferable, I’m definitely going to be switching pills

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
So I started using this over a year ago (I'm in Canada so its name is Biacna but it’s the same thing) 
The first month I did apply 3x/week and my acne got real bad, it was getting itchy and I was getting breakouts like I did in my pre teen years! So I changed up my whole routine, turned to cetaphil normal skin cleanser and use moisturizer with SPF and serum from cerave in the morning and at night I used moisturizer every time I wasn’t using the cream and oh my goodness 2 months after that I could already see a M A J O R  difference, I didn’t see my acne was that bad until I saw it improving! 
After that I used it every night but if my skins was getting flakey I stopped it until it became ok! 
It’s been maybe 3-4 months I’ve stopped using it and only used it when I start to see some break out, my skins is not perfect cause now I fight against acne scars but my pore are empty and no big cyst on the face yayyy

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I got on this pill when I was 17, a little over two years ago. Still to this day reading bad reviews of birth control scare me, but I hope I can calm some fears. I’ve had 0 bad experiences on this pill. It made my periods regular, minimal cramping and side affects (my PMS without birth control was AWFUL), and my skin is super clear. Hormones will affect everyone differently, but this pill works great for me. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a birth control option.

name: Sprintec
comments: Hello! I’ve been on Sprintec since I was 13 for horrible period cramps, and I’m now 19. After starting this birth control I could not go out on a hot day for too long or go to the gym for my normal time period because this medication completely ruined my joints. On their side effects list, it talks about inflammation at the knees or swollen ankles. I thought I had cankles for years. My knees would burn and become instantly  swollen and painful, I thought I just had a problem with circulation or joint issues. It turns out this birth control made my ankles and knees like this. Works 100% amazing for not getting pregnant, but definitely ruined my summer days and workouts. 1/10 review, if you’re having the same symptoms it’s because of this birth control.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I love this birth control. I’ve been on the Depo-provera shot, and it caused me to keep a period for over a year. I tried another pill to regulate it but it didn’t. It gave me horrid mood swings. But with Nortrel, I don’t have mood swings, I have experienced no weight gain, my periods are regular again!! I have been on it for nearly a year and will continue. I feel like I even feel happier, more upbeat, and less depressed.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: After having sex we noticed the condom broke, we were freaking out and were unsure if I finished in her. We went and got a Plan B 40 mins after the whole situation. The whole thing has been extremely stressful. About 6 days after taking the pill she started bleeding it was bright red had some clots and was just like a period. At times she was bleeding pretty heavy and had to put a tampon in and at other times she was just spotting. She bled for a total of four days and I’ve been really stressed I’m just wondering if anyone has had a similar experience? Has anyone bled about a week after and was it like your period? She also has pretty long periods her last 7 have all been 40+ days. We had sex 12 days into her new cycle.

name: Take Action
comments: I wanted to write a review to calm any women scared!! I had unprotected sex and unfortunately he came in me. It was right around when I was beginning my fertile window. I was super nervous and some reviews made it much worse. I took the pill 3 hours after and experienced fatigue and some nausea. A week after taking the pill I got my period again! Annoying that I have it since I just had it but better than no period! It’s gonna be okay ladies!

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I was switch from my pro air to the albuteral respiclick.  I will tell you now I think it is one of the worst  I have ever used.  I wake in the morning needing relief ASAP and respiclick sends me down a nightmarish road.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I had severe acne, now my skin is much better

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I gave up on the new Qvar Redihaler as it wasn't effective.  Went back to  the original aerosol Qvar version and all is back to normal for me with asthma under control.  The solution, order the old version from Canadian Pharmacy.  USA is the only country not carrying the original version (patent protection in USA is the reason they changed the design.).  I even reported the problem with the design to the FDA.  Please report the ineffective delivery method to FDA and pharma company, maybe we won't have to go to another country to get effective medicine.  My concern is that insurance companies are perfectly happy with people buying it direct from other countries so they don't have to cover it.  The pharma company is ok to as they still get the sale.  Feel bad for young children who certainly can't use the new delivery design.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments:
I had unprotected sex 2 days after my period Feb 6 and took Plan B less than 2 hours after. The next day I felt abdominal pain & it lasted for 3 days. After 4 days I had a random bleeding for 5 days Feb/ 10-Feb/ 14. 8 days later Feb/ 22 I had unprotected sex & I didn’t take any pills. I was supposed to have my period on Feb/30 but I didn’t I saw on multiple websites that plan B could pushes your period but for 7 days max. I finally decided to take a pregnancy test. I took 2 and both were negative. Today (10 days late) I felt the worst cramps and my period started
I know how hard the experience is & most of us go through it alone because we fear to be judged. You can seek support from the Crisis Text Line (they are really good). You’re not alone. It’s terrifying but you’ll get through it
Even if you have to get an abortion your information would never be released unless you want them to. You shouldn’t feel ashamed. You’re strong and you’ll get through this.

name: Ajovy
comments: After 31 years this is a miracle drug for me! Took two months to have effect then went from 15 migraines a month to zero!

name: ParaGard
comments: I've had mine for 3 years , first 2 years was amazing, I loved it because it’s no hormones. But as I’m moving on to my 3rd year, I feeling a lot more discomfort, random cramping in my uterus and cervix, especially around ovulation and spotting around ovulation as well, not sure if that’s normal but it kind of scares me. I plan on removing it soon, it just doesn’t feel right to me anymore. I feel like there is a foreign object that shouldn't be there, . So bummed out about going back on a birth control with hormones

name: ParaGard
comments: I really enjoyed the ease of not having to worry about birth control. However, I would not recommend this to anyone whose periods are even moderately painful. My periods doubled in length and the pain was debilitating. The IUD was great aside from the extremely negative effects it had on my period. I chose Paragard because I had difficulties with hormonal birth control in the past, but the pain I had with this IUD did not outweigh the benefits, so I had it removed. Insertion was also very painful, it was much worse than my recent insertion of a hormonal IUD. I would advise weighing the benefits and side effects of each option with your doctor and decide what is right for you. Unfortunately, a copper IUD was not right for me and my body.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I’ll start by saying that I was on depo injection for 8 years without any issue. I quit taking it because I wanted my periods to be regular again. My periods have always been extremely rough but about a year ago I started having cramps almost constantly. This went on for months before my doctor prescribed me Tri-sprintec. It got rid of the pain & my periods were light & short which I loved, but everything else got out of control. The first month was fine, but after that things started going downhill. I am not an emotional person & I found myself crying for no reason & so depressed that I barely got out of bed. It was a huge strain on my partner & I. I also had weighed 125 pounds my entire life & have now gained 40 pounds in the past year that seemed impossible to get rid of, even while eating healthy & exercising. I quit taking this a few weeks ago & already feel a million times better. Hoping that I can lose all this weight & start feeling normal again.

name: Sprintec
comments: Hello! I was on Sprintec for about 4-5 months, but eventually stopped using while switching to a new provider. It worked amazing as a birth control method, didn’t have any scares or concerns while on it, and too it continuously to avoid periods. however, after stopping I realized it had worsened my depression and made my emotions less predictable. I have since switched to Vienva and I’m hoping I don’t get any more mood swings. I didn’t have any other symptoms  while on it.

name: Sprintec
comments: Hello! I was on Sprintec for five months and it was awful. Experienced horrible acne and mood changes. I was a completely different person on this. I was constantly crying over everything and having mental breakdowns almost everyday. It was so bad that nobody wanted to be around me. It really put me in a bad place, I had really bad depression while on it and constant dark and negative thoughts. Everyone’s body reacts differently though, I just wanted to post this so if you experiencing negative thoughts. Please reach out to your doctor so they can help you.

name: Nuvigil
comments: Took Nuvigil for possible Narcolepsy and it made the fatigue much worse.  Felt like I went from tired to flat exhausted and nearly impossible to focus.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I have been excessively bleeding every day since the first day of taking this. DO NOT TAKE THIS! It’s been 3 months and I am still excessively bleeding and nothing is stopping it. I have made myself anemic and I am probably going to need a hysterectomy now and I’m only 27.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Uncertain about writing this because who knows what’s the stem of my declining mental health, but I stopped taking Junel FE a few weeks ago and we will see what happens. Like other views are saying: days of crying, increased anxiety, feeling like I’m going to break at any second, etc, etc. I guess time will tell if this is due to the pill, but timing does line up from when I started taking it. Be careful if you have struggled with mental health in the past. However made periods really light and painless.

name: Sprintec
comments: I started Sprintec when I was 16. I’m 19 now and I’ve never had acne, bloating, severe cramps, anxiety or depression, or spotting while on this pill. Prior to Sprintec I was on a birth control that literally made me want to end my life. I was shaking all day, crying for no reason, I became a complete psycho. Switching to Sprintec was like night and day. It also really helps keep my period regular! I feel very in control while on this medication. There is a day every time I get my period that my cramping is worse than others, but I feel like that’s just me. Overall this is a great bc pill and one I would recommend to others!

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: Terrible! Insurance just changed formulary adding wixela inhub, dropping advair for what they'll cover. I noticed a difference within a week, needing to use my albuterol inhaler nearly daily now when before hardly ever. I have a lot of mucus now when I didn't before. Everyone should be complaining to the FDA and their state insurance commissioner. Insurance companies should NOT be able to cover only cheaper drugs when they don't work and the FDA should require this drug is taken off the market. Horrible.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Ajovy
comments: I have had migraines for 13 years, usually 3-4 a week. I had chronic migraine. I went too many doctors. Tried every type of medication and had no luck.  Then I tried Ajovy. Since the first injection of Ajovy I had great relief. I am now on my 3rd month of taking it. It has been a life saver for me and my family. I still take abortive medicines for when I get a migraine, but it actually works quickly. Before abortive medication did not help very much. Also when I get a migraine it is more like a slight headache.  The day I get the injection I do feel a little tired, and the week before my next injection I get a little more headaches. The only side effect I have had is a little itching around the injection site on occasion. Also my digestion has changed and I do feel a little bloated or stuffed. But it is very minor in comparison to the great benefits. Like I said I still get headaches but they are minor. I encourage anyone to try it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took Balziva for 8 months when I was 23 and never bounced back. This medication elevated my sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) through the roof, and I started struggling with painful sex/burning from atrophy due to the dramatic reduction in free testosterone levels in my tissues. Women need to be aware that this is a common side effect of oral contraceptives, but you never hear about it from your doctor. I developed vestibulodynia, high-tone pelvic floor dysfunction, interstitial cystitis, and was finally diagnosed w/ a connective tissue disease called Sjogren's Syndrome. I'm on other meds for life for this disease, and I never had these issues before Balziva. Your hormones matter. Birth control is not a tic-tac. These medications are more extreme than most gynecologists care to acknowledge. Please consider avoiding this medication.

name: ParaGard
comments:
Positive Experience!

I was so nervous. I got it a few days ago and I love it so far. I took 600 mg of ibuprofen an hour before. The insertion was quick. They gave me stuff that numbs your cervix. It felt like a really intense period cramp for 10 seconds (during the measurement and insertion). It was definitely tolerable! I had cramping and low back pain for about 48 hours after but now I’m feeling great! I am experiencing some light spotting.

I switched because I was struggling with hormonal birth control. I tried the Nexplanon and 2 pills. I was constantly bleeding on the Nexplanon. And with the Nexplanon and pill I had been experiencing EXTREME fatigue. Think like needing 12 hours of sleep to even possibly feel like you got enough sleep. I have been off of hormones for 10 days now (I got it put in on the last day of my period) and I am already starting to notice my fatigue improve! I also believe the hormones were making my acne worse but it is too soon to tell.

name: Apri
comments: After years of suffering with PCOS symptoms- Apri has saved me! It has eliminated most of my acne. First month was harsh, but I knew with how out of whack my hormones were, I was going to have side effects adjusting, so I bared down and now I'm in the last week of my third pack! First month I had the worst morning sickness, I didn't know how I was going to handle it. Each month so far I've thrown up at least once in the first week.. I find the more often I eat, the less I feel the sickness. I've gained about 15lbs. My appetite has started calming down this month. I went from an A cup to C cup so far so I stopped wearing a bra. Some nights the pain is so bad I have to massage my breasts. I don't find I'm holding much water weight anywhere. I have experienced some headaches but I try to sleep them off. My periods are already lighter, but still adjusting overall. The best thing from all of this is my depression & mood swings have depleted. I'm meeting with my Dr to renew my prescription!l

name: Ajovy
comments: Ajovy changed my life from chronic migraine pain (nearly daily)  to gratefulness.   I've been taking the monthly injection for 20 months.  I still get cluster type headaches 4-8 times a month.  Eletriptan hydrobromide works to stop the pain.  Compared to daily pain, this is a life changing gift  after 11 years of life overlaid with migraine pain.  My neurologist also prescribes 20 mg daily of nortriptyline.  I have noticed only 2 minor side effects, elevated blood pressure and constipation.  I eat healthy as I cannot eat gluten, so legumes, vegetables, rice and yogurt are staples in my diet.  No matter how much fiber I intake, the constipation remains. I take a natural laxitive to help with that.  The other medication I must take is Synthroid for thyroid regulation.  No drug interactions seem to be cropping up after 20 months.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
Not sure why there are so many negative reviews, I've had nothing but an easy time with this medication.

I've been on it for about 7 years now. Initially I was on another pill but I deal with depression on and off and my period cramps were awful, so my doctor switched me to Junel because it's lower estrogen. My periods last 2-4 days and are relatively light, hardly any cramps, no acne... I've never had an issue. There's speculation that maybe it causes weight gain, but I work out regularly so it's not enough to mention.

name: Apri
comments: I’ve been on birth control for 11 years. For 8 years I was on Loestein 24 Fe and I had no issues. I had to switch to Apri because I changed insurances. At first I did not notice a difference, but now I can confidently say I have the absolute worst period cramps and bloating I’ve ever had. I dread getting my period. I’m not saying this will happen to everyone but it’s been miserable for me.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have been giving myself shots for decades. From Imitrex to testosterone daily. This is the absolute worst auto injector I’ve ever seen. Put a button on it or something, the pressing down not knowing when it’s going to fire in your leg is a very poor design, and at $700 a stupid one.   Now twice I have fired the injector into my leg and my hand jerked back a little bit at the initial injection, and a large amount of the medication ended up on my leg.   Costly design flaw.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: The dispenser is very awkward to use. I also cannot tell if meds are coming out every time. Wish I had my Advair back.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: Well in 2021 this is still an issue. 60 puffs left and it quit working. Glad this isn't an emergency inhaler. To make matters worse, I didn't notice it preventing any of my asthma attacks, they are just as frequent as ever.

name: Ajovy
comments: I’ve taken Ajovy since it came out. I can even go 4+ months until needing three injections again. It’s been a miracle. I used to have migraines all the time. I hated the way triptans made me feel (I took maxalt), and I worried about routinely forcing blood vessels in my brain to shrink. It seemed like a potentially bad idea for the long term. I went to the ER about 4 times a year, and PMS caused excruciating migraines. On Ajovy I think I’ve had three small migraines in the past year. I have noticed no side effects from the medicine, and I’m usually highly sensitive and get every side effect. I’ve truly had no issues at all. I’m surprised at all the bad reviews. Migraines ruined many years of my life. Anyone thinking about trying it, go ahead and get one injection. If it’s a miracle for you too, then count yourself lucky.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
All 3 QVars have stopped working just like everyone else says. The design is terrible. Please fix it. 

Medicine is ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Delivery method is negative stars

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments:
it’s been almost two months since I was put on this birth control for my acne. The first month was amazing! No negative side effects at all, I actually lost weight instead of gaining. 
I’m on my second pack, once I started week three of this pack it seems like everything has gone downhill. I'm having the worst cramps I’ve ever had, painkillers and heating pads are barely helping. I start my actual period in two weeks, right now it’s breakthrough bleeding. It’s really heavy, it’s been almost a week and neither of these are getting better. 
When pains do go away, it’s not permanent. They come in waves and it’s just so painful. Maybe this is normal but my doctor never told me I'd cramp up like this. The only peace I get is when I wake up and for the first hour or so it’s just slight pains. 
I definitely believe the birth control is causing this pain. I’m glad to see I’m not the only one going through this, makes me feel a little relieved.

name: Ajovy
comments: I experience itching & swelling at the injection site for 24hrs. After, I have no migraines. I would rather itch for those hours than have the devastating migraines. I would have unexpected migraines all the time. The inconvenience of small itch out weighs months of relief.

name: Ziac
comments: I was taking Brand necessary Ziac and  it was discontinued. I was never able to tolerate the generic Ziac/bisoprolol due to the side effects. I was searching for a similar product and came across a notice that the Brand Ziac was now available. I was happy  and looking forward to feeling better.  I was very surprised to find that the brand Ziac and Bisoprolol had the same imprint b 40. After some research I was told it is the same pill.  It is not the Brand Ziac that I took in the past. Be careful if you’ve had a reaction to the generic in the past. The pill says Ziac but it is the generic.

name: Apri
comments: I have been on the pill for about 3 months and I am having no negative side effects. I notice I still have mood swings closer to the end of my pack as if I'm PMSing. But I feel normal my anxiety is under control. My appetite picked up but I'm on the road to making some better diet changes. Don't listen to all the bad reviews because I've tried numerous birth control that has made me feel crazy or pain to worsen. This has been a breeze.

name: Sprintec
comments: I started sprintec Dec 2020 and it is March 1st tomorrow and all I can say is that my period went from being 2 weeks long and a mess to being only about 4 days long and light the past 2 months. My mood seems better. I was having horrible mood swings due to PCOS and in the last 2 months I've been calm and not stressed like before. I've maintained the same weight as when I started in Dec which is appx. 185 lbs. (No weight gain) I don't suffer from sore boobs or bloating. My face cleared up a little bit. My appetite is fine. So I personally have no complaints I guess.

name: Take Action
comments:
My bf I had sex and he finished in me the day after my period ended my fertile window was in approx. 4 days following, so I was a bit worried, but brushed it off.

 I took a take action 2 days later bc I was suddenly seeing babies and pregnant women literally everywhere I went (on tv, the grocery store, social media! Back to back baby!) so took it as a sign. 

When I tell you I have SYMPTOMS, I mean it. Sore boobs, mood swings, abdominal cramping, fatigue, fuzzy brain, nausea. It sucks. HOWEVER, I started my period again 9 days post unprotected sex/7 days post pill pop. This sucks, but I’m not pregnant. I will say, I took Plan B in 2019 and didn’t experience any of these symptoms so... get plan b. 

Also if you’re student, most clinics on campus offer Plan B brand for like $15.

(I rate this very effective, but do not recommend take action bc side effects)

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been using this for a week now to regulate my period and so far so good. My breast have moved up a size and my period finally stoped (I guess my body was craving estrogen lol).

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: So I am on my 2nd pack of pills.  The first time taking the pack my period was great, light, no heavy cramps and it went from 7 to 5 days. I am on the 2nd pack and I notice around ovulation time I have gotten a random period. Now every time I use the bathroom I see pinkish discharge now. I know my period suppose to come in a week.. I hope this pill doesn't have me bleeding every other week.

name: Aviane
comments:
At the beginning it was really bad. Awful mood-swings, very agitated at absolutely everything, bleeding for 21 days straight. After 4-5 months I did not see those mood swings anymore and had a regular cycle. Now on it for 2 years I noticed my cramps have been less painful. I went from fainting, vomiting and being unable to walk to being able to take one Advil and be in slight discomfort. Although it left me with depression I rather be constantly sad then to experience those awful cramps.

Pros: slightly better skin, regulated periods, bearable cramps, extra protection.

Cons (after a year): Depression, weight gain, spotting if a day was missed, more severe mood changes during periods, bit more tired throughout the day but can still sleep fine.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been on this birth control on and off for about 2+ years to help regulate my period. My period has been irregular from day one. I thought that I was the only woman experiencing severe mood swings, dark DARK thoughts, anxiety, anger, nightmares etc. but after reading a lot of the reviews I now feel validated in the way that I was feeling. I initially thought that the symptoms I listed above were coming from the stress and uncertainty of COVID and the huge shift in everyday life but after trial and error I've found that it's definitely the birth control. Being off of the birth control for a week or two has completely brought me back to myself and I haven't had any of the negative symptoms. I don't normally do reviews but wanted to share my experience and let you know that if you are experiencing these symptoms that you are NOT crazy it's the birth control, stop taking it and ask for an alternative.

name: Ajovy
comments:
Love this medication. It has helped tremendously with my migraines, however after about a week of taking the injection my anxiety is through the roof and I get horrible nightmare's. 
 My blood pressure is all over the place as well ...I'm trying to push forward and stay on the medication ajovy praying the side effects settle down I'm on month 3 so we will see ...

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I was on Breo for about 3 years and was breathing normally. I never had to use my albuterol inhaler. At the beginning of the year the price of Breo skyrocketed for me so I decided to try Wixela. It never worked. It started with a sore throat (I am very careful to rinse my mouth and spit out the water after each use.) After a few days the coughing started. I tolerated that only because it was a weekend and I couldn’t call my doctor. I am going back to Breo, I’m so angry that this drug was approved. My scenario was mild compared to what others are going through. Scary stuff.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Took this pill two weeks ago I took a pregnancy test yesterday and it was a big positive. 3 test that are positive it did not work for me!

name: Claravis
comments: This isn’t about the drug but about the packaging... THERES SO MUCH PACKAGING! I get it I don’t want to be pregnant either but damn I think I got rid an entire species by taking this drug for months

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I started this only a week ago and suddenly have a huge cystic pimples, cramping, nausea, and bloating. I also have been so irritable. I do not recommended at all

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I started Junel fe February 7 after a 10 week medical abortion. Here's my opinion 

•It did lighten the after abortion bleeding 
•I am getting more acne (I'm someone who never gets pimples so this is new)
•My anxiety and depression has heightened (I've always had these problems growing up but I'm noticing I'm becoming extremely empathetic & my anxiety, I have become self conscious and more of an introvert.)
•I feel like a ticking time bomb (I feel Like I'm going to cry at everything I'm very emotional  which is unlike me. I'm not sure if the birth control is at fault for ALL my emotional breakdowns)
•Not change in weight but I am also trying extremely hard to lose weight so I wouldn't say it's harder or easier to lose weight
• getting more headaches but usually fixable by taking a Tylenol
 I look Forward to updating you all on my experience. As a person who doesn't like birth control and has super sensitive hormones this birth control has not been horrible.

name: Antabuse
comments:
After taking it for about 2 weeks I tried a 50 ml (airline bottle) of Jack Daniels. I thought I was going to die. It may not work after a single dose but once it builds up in your system the effects can feel really bad.

As far as side effects. I found serious digestive issues every time I took it in the morning - even after food. Taking it before bed solved the side effects for me. If you are having side effects you might try taking it with food (or not) and at different times of day.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: Accidentally got bottom of Redi-Inhaler wet. Sat on unseen water puddle by sink. Immediately removed from puddle but next morning usage, device did not dispense any medicine. So read here about peeling off stickers, twisting the plastic canister to expose the silver canister. Dried all parts and Inhaler now still works using just the bottom half of the plastic canister with the mouthpiece. Top half of the plastic canister makes the counter work so I am letting that dry for a day to see if replacing that will restart the counter. Bottom line, do not let plastic canister get wet. Also, I too liked Qvar better when it was not a Redi-Inhaler. Was just easier.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Prior to taking this birth control my cycle was TERRIBLE. Throwing up, awful cramps first 5 days, heavy bleeding 7+ days.. I’ve been taking Junel a little under a year now and I love it. My cycle lasts around 3-4 days of super light bleeding and no cramps and no noticeable mood changes or weight gain. Some months I won’t even have bleeding- that’s how light it is! This is one of the many birth controls I have been on that has actually worked for me. Everyone is different and bodies all work differently so don’t rule it out if the reviews scare you!

name: Aviane
comments:
I was on aviane for 9 months before I started having side effects. At first, it was perfect: no period, great mood, lost weight, and no acne. Then right at 9 months, I started having severe depression and anxiety, to the point I almost took my own life. It was horrible, and nothing else has changed in my life. I decided to get off of it and stayed off for 5 months. For some reason, I stupidly got back on Aviane again 2 months ago and I immediately felt a horrible difference within the first week. I toughed out the month and then got off of it again. Since then I have still felt the side effects. I feel as if I developed depression and severe anxiety and it won't go away now. I have been off this pill for 6 months now and I feel as if I'm still on hormones. 
I suggest if you try this pill try keeping a journal to track how you feel. Mental health should come first! Be safe with any birth control it can get dark really quick.

name: Sprintec
comments: I'd say over all it's been good. My skin is super clear and I didn't gain any weight. However after being on it for now 7 months I've started to have more depressive episodes, and sometimes pretty poor self image. I've also had a good amount of severe mood swings. With all that said my periods are really light and non painful which in my opinion is an ok trade off due to my periods before hand being super painful. It does its job well for me, I just have to jump through the hoop of mild depression.

name: Sprintec
comments: The first month of Sprintec was a nightmare. I was nauseous everyday to the point where I could not eat somedays. My skin was not very bad before but got much worse on this pill. The pimples were painful and always covered my forehead. The moods I have experienced are the worst ever. I constantly want to cry, am angry, and sensitive to everything. Took for 3 months and so much increased anxiety this drug isn't for me.

name: Aviane
comments:
I really liked aviane, I had used it previously but had to go off because I was admitted into a unit where my hormones had to be properly monitored without any interference. I went on back on it again in September because I got a new boyfriend and wanted extra peace of mind. For the first couple months it worked great no super huge side effects, other than being a little bit more of a cry baby and more dryness. 
Made my periods lighter and my cramps way better, no weight gain. 
But the past two months I’ve gotten such bad breast tenderness that it changes everyday living and couldn’t even sleep because I’m a stomach sleeper, so I have an up coming doctors appointment to switch off of it.

name: Sprintec
comments: I’ve been on Sprintec for the last 3 months and it made my mental health go down so bad. I’m such a toxic person now. I hate it so much. It makes me hungry all the time and if I don’t eat my stomach hurts really bad. It makes me sleep a lot. I have negative thoughts very often. It just makes me very depressed and I don’t know why. And IM always tired and sleeping and I have no motivation at all. All I want to do now is stay in bed and I have no motivation to have a social life. Me as a person changed so much I have so many mood swings now.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started this pill after switching over from Sprintec--I get terrible migraines around my period so my Dr. suggested I go on a pill with less estrogen. I have been on the pill for over 4 months now and I can't stand it, I am finally taking myself off of it. I have not had my period ever since I switched over--I think the estrogen level may be too low in the pill for me, and causing a hormonal imbalance of sorts, because before I was on any pill at all, I was also having trouble getting my period, so I needed something to help induce it. I have not had period, I have been pretty emotionless, my migraines have increased (I previously had them under control -- only 3-4 a month, but now I'm back to 9-12), my libido is gone, I'm tired all day, fall asleep easy, but can't stay asleep, and my skin is dry. I ordered an at-home hormone test to hopefully see if my levels are out-of-whack, but right now, I believe the pill is causing some of these symptoms, and it is best to go off of it.

name: Ajovy
comments: Not an experience really, as I only received my first injection two days ago. This is just me asking how can there be side effects when supposedly there is no medication that doesn't have side effects. This drug is known as a biologic which means that it is made from natural resources and not from what the pharmaceutical companies make? I also was told that the major complaint was reaction at the injection site. I only had that for a day and that's it. Now I am shy as to continuing this for migraines. Have not found out yet if insurance will pay, not that far into it. Hoping for better than what I am reading here. Hope you all feel better.

name: Adipex-P
comments: Works very good . Very good at not being hungry at all, So hope I can keep it this why love it, no problems at all yet and I've been taking it for 2 weeks .

name: Nuvigil
comments: I have had allergies & asthma my whole life and was always too tired to do anything. I couldn't play sports, was told that I was lazy, was shunned and teased by my peers and misunderstood by my parents. When the Dr. put me on 250 mg. of Nuvigil, I was amazed at the difference! I had energy, endurance, clarity and the desire to do physical activities. I told everyone that I felt like a new person and they agreed. I was extremely discouraged when I was told that I could no longer get it, unless I was willing to shell out $5k per month. My Dr. said that it had to do with the problem with opiates and all of the drugs in that class were unavailable. I was devastated. I am now on Adderall, which is better than nothing, but not the same.

name: Lessina
comments: I have been on Lessina for about 3 months now. Before this I was on depo. This far I have had a few side effects such as gain weight, mood swings, and my first month I had the heaviest period I have ever experienced lasted almost 10 days. On a positive note my acne has cleared a lot. And I have been able to successfully skip my periods like I’ve wanted as well as having no babies! Everyone’s body is different

name: Sprintec
comments: SPRINTEC this is the worst birth control ever. At first I really liked it because this was my first experience with birth control. Until month two hit. Oh boy I was bleeding for a month straight. HORRIBLE. I wasn't even on my placebo week and I bled everywhere with HUGE blood clots. Not to mention when I wasn’t bleeding I was still experiencing the worst cramps ever. After 8 hours of taking it I would be so unbelievably nauseous. Don’t get me wrong it worked for one of my friends but NOT for me.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I left the office with my mom and tried it and immediately felt like I had ingested the smoke of 20 cigarettes (I'm super-square, I've had one inhalation of a cigarette in my life), making my chest feel constricted. She said to try it for a few days; I did and felt progressively worse. She also has mild asthma, so she tried it and also felt awful. We went back to the doctor pronto. He told us we were wrong, that Advair was in fact helping me and that I should keep using it. "Can I just have another prescription for my  Proventil inhaler?" "As your doctor, I really think Advair is better for you". I trashed the Advair inhaler/Disk and found another doctor who happily gave me my appropriate prescription for Proventil. I'm so glad I didn't have real health repercussions. Gross. Again, every other encounter I've had with a medical professional has been entirely on the up & up, brimming with care and knowledge.
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Adderall
comments: I take the 10 mg amphetamine with dextroamphetamine by Teva and it works great, better than the 15 mg.in my opinion. I see others mentioning generics by Alogen and Mallinckrodt here. Well I take a couple of other medications manufactured by these 2, on and off, most times it's Mallickrodt. Let me tell you, this is the WORST drug manufacturer on the market. The Alogen is junk too. I've been on a few medical chat sites just to see what I can find out about Mallinckrodt and see if others felt the same way and they absolutely do! Literally 100's of people have complained to the co. itself and to the FDA. This has been going on for a solid 5 years at least & the stuff is STILL pure unadulterated JUNK.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Do not let these reviews scare you!! Birth control is not a one-size-fits-all, and literally just depends on your body. This is the first pill that hasn’t caused negative side effects like depression, mood swings, or any other mental health problems that I’ve experienced with other pills. The only side effect I experienced was acne for the first 3 months, but that could have been due to stress or other factors. My skin eventually cleared and I have had no other problems with this pill!

name: QNASL
comments: Spray pump keeps malfunctioning and price too expensive. I liked how it helped my allergies but got tired of the pump breaking and the ridiculous price.

name: Sprintec
comments: This pill is so awful. I have been on it for 9 months. I have gained 10 lbs so far even though my eating habits have not changed. I have had almost constant breakthrough bleeding for the entire 9 months. Some days are barely noticeable but others are like a regular period. I feel tired and unmotivated to do things I used to enjoy. I have decided to stop taking this pill after at the end of this pack. I've had enough. Side effects are not worth it.

name: Amethyst
comments: My doctor recommended amethyst and the name was pretty but my experience on it was NOT. I only lasted 3 months and I’d say I probably had about 5 periods during that time. My periods would start in the middle of a pack, my cycle had been thrown out the window and everyday I wondered if I’d bleed or not. Believe  it or not, that was the least of my issues on amethyst- the worst issues being that I had completely broken out in cysts. It wasn’t just for the first month either, my skin continuously got worse for 3 months; I’d literally have a new pimple everyday. Now of course this affected my confidence badly but on top of that I was feeling so low everyday. I’d wake up ready to go back to bed. I was nauseous almost every day but especially after I’d take this at night. So basically cycle ruined, skin ruined, mental health ruined, BUT HEY, I HAD A SEX DRIVE! Yeah no, not worth the last 3 months of my life down the drain for that.

name: ParaGard
comments:
I went in for paragard because hormone free! Insertion I would say is a solid 8/10 disomfort, pain scale. I had mine inserted on my period so it wasn’t so bad. Cramping for the next period was more than normal, bleeding was heavier, but period was still only four days long. One extra day than normal three. On the last day of my period, I got some bad cramping and could feel the bottom coming through my cervix. Went to my gyno to have it checked, they did an ultrasound to confirm that it was displaced. 

NOW this is not a warning to not get it. I would still have gotten another if the ultrasound hadn’t revealed I have a somewhat heart shaped uterus. My dr didn’t have high confidence in another one staying in place either. I’m glad I had a dr that would be open with me about it. I would recommend paragard because I didn’t have a bad time with it, it prevented pregnancy and I ovulate like clock-work. Just be aware that sometimes they expel because of things like uterine shape.

name: Cryselle
comments: I’ve been taking this birth control for a year now. It is so not for me. My hair is falling out in clumps, my anxiety is terrible, I sometimes get 2-3 periods a month, and I’m getting acne in places I’ve never had acne. Not to mention I don’t usually gain so much weight but I’ve gained more in this year than I ever have. 1/10 for effort, but if your doctor recommends this, RUN!

name: Copaxone
comments: I had tried Copaxone after Avonex (which had caused horrific headaches 5 out of 7 days of the week) and after 2 months on the medication I had two horrible reactions 2 out of 3 days.   Same symptoms, second time sent me to the Emergency Room.   I really thought I was having a heart attack.   Freezing/Chills for hours, severe shaking, heart palpitations, - I thought I was the end of me.  Neurologist said those symptoms are rare, but twice in 3 days was a bit much.    Not to mention the daily injections and the pain after the injections in my legs and stomach.    Switched to Rebif.   Was on that for 7 years and have been off all medications for over a year.   MS symptoms getting worse but the side effects of all the newer medications make me question whether it is worse to take them or just naturally worsen.   I know that is sad, but I have young children and don't want to develop PML.   I wish they would come out with medications that don't have a laundry list of side effects.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have recently started this birth control back in December of 2020. I had come on this website to read reviews on what I was getting myself into. From all these reviews I was honestly expecting the worst. So far I have felt little to no side effects. I have felt great this entire time with the exception of slight nausea that went away with rest. I have felt moody but I am like that with or without medication. I started taking it to regulate my period and so far has helped me out great. I like knowing when I am going to start so I can be prepared, rather than it showing up by surprise. This pill has also caused me to lose weight, which I have been a fan of. I also have grown 2 bra sizes in the short months I have been taking this pill. Overall, my experience with Junel Fe has been a positive one, but who's to say it won't change as I continue on with it. I would like to remind you that everyone's body is different so what works for me may not work for you and vice versa.

name: Gianvi
comments: I've been on Gianvi for, I want to say, about 2.5-3 years now. For the most part, it's been a pretty good experience. However recently, I've been experiencing low sex drive and dryness during sex. It might have to do with being in a global pandemic, accompanied by anxiety and seasonal depression, so I'm reluctant to say its all from Gianvi. However I will be speaking to my PCP to see if she recommends a new brand. The new development of low sex drive/dryness has started to affect my relationship & I want to nip it in the bud

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was on Junel FE 1/20 for two years with no issues at all.  My heavy periods were finally light and I rarely got cramps. When COVID hit Walgreens told me that this birth control was on backorder because the manufacturer was changing the formula.  Transferred my script to Giant Eagle because they had a big supply.  November 2020 rolls around and I start having a period in the middle of the pill pack.  It caused me so much anxiety and money because my doctor ordered all these tests to see why I was bleeding.  Was becoming severely depressed with the darkest thoughts I have ever had in my life.  I would cry for days for no reason.  I felt so "out of body."  After three months of on and off bleeding, horrible anxiety and depression and a host of other symptoms my husband made me go off this pill cold turkey.  All my symptoms are now gone and I feel so much better.  This pill should be taken off the market for sure!   Whatever they changed is messing with so many woman.

name: Cryselle
comments: Hey I started 3 weeks ago and now I have huge mood swings its horrible.  My boyfriend  said he love me and I cried. This a TMI but the pill made me little more horny than usual. I eat way more, I ate 3 boxes of chocolate while crying and after that I ate chilli and McDonald’s. Not joking I've been eating like crazy for  last 2 weeks . It work good but be ready for depression

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I am 40 years old and was prescribed this medication by my OB. I was hesitant to take this medication after reading these reviews.  However, I have not experienced ANY of the side effects listed in the reviews.  My periods are no longer heavy, they last only a few days, my breasts are no longer tender or hurt during my cycle, and I no longer have painful periods.  The first month I did experience nauseous which almost stopped me from going further.  I sipped a coca-cola to calm my stomach and that subsided the side effect.  I just finished my third month and I feel great. No weight gain and I am no longer bloated.  I hope everyone has the same experience.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
Started using Biacna for hormonal acne, as well as regular acne I have on my forehead and T zone area. Applied every day for 4 hours for 4 days, and over night thereafter (took one day break after 4 days) and my skin has literally completely cleared up... it’s been exactly 7 days since I started using Biacna. I noticed a difference within 1-2 days, as it had stopped new pimples from forming immediately. 

I had around 10 pimples on my forehead, 5 on the cheeks each and 5 pimples on my chin/nose area. 

One week later all I have is 2 older pimples that are still healing but almost gone. I can’t believe how quick and effective this gel has been for me

It is drying, but completely worth it and I used a heavy moisturizer and avoided wearing foundation to avoid it looking flaky. Highly recommend trying it. I have combo skin, oily around the nose and chin, but also dry elsewhere. My skin is fair-light skin toned. 

Went from 20 pimples to 0 in 1 week! And. No new forming pimples

name: Ajovy
comments: Absolutely brilliant one migraine in a month compared to 3 a week for 30 years.  I've tried everything and nothing works except for sumitriptan but that makes me very drowsy.  But I'm getting very concerned at the side effects of Ajovy  swollen legs, constipation, lower back pain, anxious and fatigue - it's only been 3 months.  I am hoping it will get better as to me this is a wonder drug .

name: Gianvi
comments: I’ve been on this over a month all I do is cry and bleed I really don't like it. The Nurex nurse told me be patient it will improve but no way - this is horrible how my hormones are off the chart

name: Junel 1/20
comments: No negatives for me, light controlled periods. I felt like myself unlike other birth controls I’ve tried. In the beginning I did feel nausea from taking them but that went away after a few weeks. Other than that it’s been great!

name: Kariva
comments: I started taking Kariva to improve my skin and it only got worse. After only a week on this pill I started feeling horrible depression and anxiety plus my skin was breaking out worse than before. I went from having zero symptoms on my previous pill to having all the symptoms in the book. Break outs, weight gain, lower back pain, horrible periods, mood swings, etc. this was only after about 2 weeks on the pill. I just finished my sugar pills and couldn’t switch back to my old pill soon enough. Would not recommend this pill to anyone who has a history of depression and anxiety.

name: ParaGard
comments: I have had my Paraguard IUD for 9 years now. After reading all these reviews I feel I must be one of the lucky ones. I have never had an issue since I had it put in. I do have a period every 3 1/2 to 4 weeks. I do have one day of a heavy period but then it goes away altogether by the next day. My periods last about 3 days. 1 heavy, 2 barely. I also had a gastric bypass with it still in place and it also didn't have any impact. No medical issues. No pain. Some cramps more than usual. I am 46 and had it put in at 37.

name: Ajovy
comments:
I started taking Ajovy in September of 2020 for migraine prevention.  After taking it the second time I noticed that my hair growth had slowed down and that I was losing more hair than normal. After taking the third dose of Ajovy I really noticed that my hair was thinning and falling out much more.  I lost hair from my eyebrows and all the little body hairs have fallen off.  At this point the hair on my legs and underarms has stopped growing as well.
I called my neurologist to tell her what was happening and that I wanted to stop the medication.  Ajovy was not helping with the migraines after 3 months anyways.
I honestly wish that hair loss  was listed as a possible side effect of this medication by the FDA because I definitely would not have taken it to begin with.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I have been on this birth control for nearly 7 years. I never experienced weight gain or extra anxiety & my periods are now very predictable and only last 2 days (though they weren’t very heavy or long lasting in the first place). It has been very long since I started taking them so it’s hard to compare what I was like without them, but I do have vaginal dryness and a low sex drive which I believe is because of the pill.

name: Aviane
comments: I have been on Aviane for two years now. I was a healthy 140lb when I started and now I weigh 220 pounds. Aviane however did clear up my skin and made it glow! I am not blaming it for my weight gain but I am definitely making a comparison. I have horrible mood swings and get so angry at the littlest things. Those are unbearable. Other than that Aviane has done its job for the two years and I've never been pregnant.

name: Gianvi
comments:
I was on Gianvi for about 2 years and have recently gotten off of it. The first 5 to 7 months I felt quite emotional/anxious, I also went up about 1 cup size and my skin was perfect. However, it did prevent pregnancy, so I'm thankful for that. It also decreased the heaviness of my cycle. And it was free with BCBS! 

About 1.5 year in, I began noticing that I had vaginal dryness and my libido was super low as well. Since I was so dry, sex started becoming very painful and it seemed like no amount of lube could help. It has been just over 2 years and I have decided to get off Gianvi for a few months to see if my problems disappear. So far, it has been about 1 week and I feel really good. To anyone  reading this post, I suggest you always listen to your body and find an understanding provider who can help you create a plan that you both agree on. Good luck!

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: This is my second Qvar redihaler, and both stopped working at 90 doses. I've complained and nothing was done about. Seems like it's a known problem and the company does nothing. I'm out of 100 bucks now, but I'm going to ask my doc for something new.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I tried this for two weeks and had to stop. I noticed the physical side effects such as slight nausea and tender, swollen breasts. I was not imagining the mental ones would be this bad. Since taking this birth-control I literally felt like I was losing my mind. My anxiety went through the roof and I also was thinking more irrationally. I just didn't feel right. Finally I realized it was the birth control and decided to stop. Never again.

name: Take Action
comments: I had unprotected sex 2 days before ovulation. He came inside of me so I freaked. 16 hrs later I went to Walgreens & they were out of plan b so I resorted to Takeaction. It was my first time taking it, I read awful reviews so I was terrified. 3 days in, felt nauseous. 4-7 days after taking it nauseous, incredibly tired, mood swings, and an appetite increase. Day 8 extreme boob tenderness & severe back pain/cramping. I looked up symptoms & they all pointed to early pregnancy so I flipped out. Day 9, still boob tenderness, when I went to the bathroom I saw pink discharge (another early pregnancy symptom)I was so scared I prayed & cried every night, finally 11 days later I got a full period. My flow is heavier, I'm more bloated than normal, but I got it! This pill definitely impacts your hormones  but try not to stress out, let your body adapt and react, all you can do is wait and pray. Take a pregnancy test if you are a week or two late, before you stress. I hope this helps calm someone.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: Hi queens!! Like most of you I was searching on this site for peace of mind as I thought I was pregnant and was freaking out. I took Plan B 48 hours after having unprotected sex and I thought he pulled out but was unsure. Also had sex after I ovulated so I was freaking out. I also didn’t feel the side effects of the plan b and my period was 2 weeks late. I’m just here to say trust this pill works because it does!! You’ll be okay.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I started taking Nora-Be 4 days ago as a contraceptive while breastfeeding, and it is horrible. After about an hour of me taking it I'm getting diarrhea, and the day after the first pill I started bleeding out of no where HEAVILY and it hasn't stopped or even slowed down. Like soaking through a pad every hour type bad. I'm deciding to stop taking this immediately. I wish my doctor would have mentioned these side effects to me before hand.

name: Sprintec
comments: Literally the worst! I’m not one who can tolerate hormonal birth control well. This medication has made me so nauseous to the point where whenever I lay down after taking it I gag and throw up. I haven’t gained any weight on it. And it caused worse acne breakouts. Def gonna switch this one out. DO NOT TAKE if you have a sensitive stomach.

name: Sprintec
comments: Sprintec was WONDERFUL for me. The only reason I had to stop using it was because I had developed blood clots due to it being estrogen. I had no side effects and was on it, on and off for 7 years. I did gain weight but I think that was because I was still in college and was lazy but it was over a couple of years and not all at once. Did not lose my sex drive. Did not get pregnant once while being on it. I had skipped it a few times due to forgetting and I have taken it late but still didn't get pregnant.

name: Jolivette
comments:
I switched to Jolivette from Ortho-tricyclen because of the side effects, my PCP recommended a progesterone only pill to help with these. I became HORRIBLY depressed to the point that I was actually suicidal. I stuck to it for two months because I knew that most side effects go away by the end of the third month, but I couldn't deal with the fallout from this pill. I ended a relationship and I would cry in clinic, I felt so lost and alone, like taking this pill made me feel like I was separate from everyone else. It also made me a bottomless pit, I was always starving and gained a bit of weight. I also had a period every two weeks, not spotting, a full blown period. Got off the pill and within the week felt better. It was like the sun started shining again.

This pill work for some, but if you find yourself suicidal  when taking this, get off of it!

name: Nuvigil
comments:
I just wanted to share for anyone who experienced severe side effects with Provigil. 

On the lowest dose Provigil I experienced extreme hair loss, extreme stutters and physical tics, brain fog, nausea, dizziness, shortness of breath and hysteria. 

I went through Dex, ritalin and ritalin LA which didn't work for me. My doctor really pushed me to try Nuvigil which I was SUPER fearful of. 

I've been on 250mg Nuvigil about 2 weeks now and no signs yet of the side effects I experienced with other medications. 

Like others, I find I crash between 12-5pm, depending on the days activities and will probably be supplementing Dex in as an afternoon filler as previously discussed with my SS. 

My diagnosis is severe idiopathic Hypersomnia. If I forget my medication for just one day, I will sleep a minimum of 18 hours, longest so far is 36 hours. Nuvigil doesn't make me feel like a  zombie - awake, but nobody is home.

name: Lessina
comments: I use Lessina for both Birth Control and my PCOS, I ask for it by name. It has the right dosage that my cramps feel like nothing instead of putting me on the ground

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel Fe was my very first birth control. I got it because I read it would help with irregular periods and severe cramps. In my first 3 months of using it my periods were super light and I could actually start working again. The cramps were almost nonexistent. However, that all changed on month four: October 2020. I experienced what I call a "severe period." I was throwing up, passing out, and had labor cramps. This was pretty much normal for me before starting birth control, but after October, I decided to start skipping my periods by only taking the active pills. It was fine until December, when I started getting breakthrough bleeding. It started as just a couple days, then another time would be a few days, then it just came every day, along with cramps, and although tolerable, were still painful. It is currently February 9 2021, and I'm switching to another pill. Although Junel Fe cleared my acne, it made me more moody, gain 20lbs, and gave me abnormal breakthrough bleeding.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I thought I was LOSING MY MIND until I saw this! I was diagnosed as clinically depressed and referred to a suicide hotline yesterday, no lie. I’m not suicidal, but I’ve been depressed more depressed than I have ever been in my life the past few months. I’ve become detached, emotionless, and have lost all empathy. I cry all the time and hate being in the same room as myself. I’ve been bleeding for 4 MONTHS and I have no sex drive at all. I didn’t research Junel Fe 1/20 and depression before now because IT WASN’T LISTED AS A SIDE EFFECT. My boyfriend just suggested that I look into the pill as a “leave no stone unturned” thing, and voila. I’m not crazy. I’m flushing this stuff right now.

name: Adderall
comments: I take two 30 mg pills a day for ADHD and it has really made a huge difference in my life. I am able to focus on one task at a time and complete it. Works great for giving me the motivation I sometimes lack. Only issue is that when I was given the white or peach ones, they did not seem to work as well as the pink ones. Talked to doctor about it and she added to my prescription to only receive the pink ones. Curious if anyone else has had this issue

name: Ajovy
comments: Ajovy was my miracle drug, Chronic Migraine Cluster Headache days went from 15-20 down to 2-3 and much milder if they did occur.  After that first 12 months, (Insurance) I was switched to Aimovig which had very little effect and after trying for 2 months I gave up. Ubrelvy unfortunately failed as well. After appealing insurance Ajovy approved, once again back on and now my headaches are again stabilized for 9-months which is awesome. But I have since noticed a unexplained weight gain of 15 pounds (I follow a strict ketogenic diet) which I brushed off due to Pandemic stress over the last year. I'm also now experiencing Chronic Fatigue, Head Pressure, Dizziness, Restless leg syndrome, Panic Attacks and Chronic Insomnia.  I can't help but wonder if it's the Ajovy (CGRP use)? I'm stopping it for awhile to see if any of these possible side effects resolve. 15 pound weight gain is one thing not sleeping at all and being physically exhausted on a daily basis another.

name: Gabitril
comments: Began a new drug regimen with a new neurologist due to not being seizure free more than four months for most of my life. When I began Gabitril it was a whole new world. I got very dizzy at first but the longer I took it the more sharp I felt and the less dizzy. After that I went almost five years seizure free.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have been on Ajovy for over 6 months and it has helped significantly, however, I have just linked a lot of "issues" I have been dealing with as Ajovy side effects. Shortly after starting Ajovy, I started with severe itching on my scalp along with this "tightness" in my scalp which can only be described as tight bands across my scalp. I also have this feeling that my hair is tight to my scalp, as well as the texture of my hair has changed, too.  Shortly after this began, I started losing my hair on the top of my head.  I have also gained weight, developed chest tightness, and have been very anxious! I am disappointed that I did figure this out sooner, as these side effects have made me very depressed and self-conscious. Unfortunately, I just gave myself another injection, prior to figuring this out, but that will be my LAST shot! I hope with stopping this drug these side effects will dissipate and I will finally be able to grow my hair back and have a "normal" feeling on my scalp.

name: Cryselle
comments: At only 18, I’ve tried numerous different birth controls (around four, not including Cryselle) to regulate my periods, prevent severe cramping, and heavy flows. Ever since starting, I have been vomiting at least twice monthly and experience nausea frequently. It occurs at the beginning of the month always, and at times will happen towards the end as well...Almost as if it’s simultaneous with my cycle. I switched from morning consumption to at night, have tried consuming it with food- all to no avail, the same symptoms persist. I’ve been on Cryselle six months now. My doctor suggests the Depoprovera injection or an IUD due to my lack of success with oral contraceptives, both of which I have concerns towards. All of this for a normal period..

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: Forced by insurance to switch from side-effect-free Advair 500/50 to Wixela. At first I could not figure out why I was nauseous every morning and evening, and it only kept getting worse. After five or six days, the nausea was extreme and that evening I was vomiting and flu-like twenty minutes after my evening dose. Finally put it together, and realized Wixela was not only causing it, but was probably the reason my cough and phlegm level had been worse that week. Of course my doctor insisted it is "the same" and the insurance has denied my request to go back to Advair. This product is NOT the same. Reading the horror stories on here has convinced me that this medication is dangerous.  I will be rationing my precious Advair. Cannot afford $400 a month for it. Hopefully my doc with switch me to something else, but Advair works so well, I am livid.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Ziac
comments: Started with a low dosage of Ziac for 6 months during which I observed occasional chest pain, difficulty sleeping, muscle pain and weight gain. It did not control my blood pressure effectively so the dosage was increased to 10mg. Within a month of using the higher dosage I started suffering severe chest pain, pain behind my shoulder blades, constant stomach upsets with diarrhoea lasting days at a time. I developed gout, with stiff, burning joints and severe lower back pain. I also had chronic sinusitis and my hair started falling out. 24 hours after discontinuing this medication I started having severe heart palpitations which I did not have before using Ziac.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
I was starting to think it was all in my head untill I came across these reviews.
The change to the RediHaler obviously was not an improvement but a change meant to stave off the ability for other companies to produce generic equivalents. A prime example of what is wrong with our pharmaceutical industries.
My Peak Flow and FEV1 scores have been worsening and I've needed more albuterol since I received the RediHalers  (switching back to QVAR after being on another controller med). I tried the hack of twisting off the upper part of the actuator and depressing manually but that didn't seem to work because of the inner sleeve. But when I put the canister in an albuterol actuator it works fine but I now have to keep track of puffs.
Sent a letter to Teva QAS@tevapharm.com. 
To date there have been 985 adverse event reports submitted to the FDA by people like us and about the same kinds of problems.

name: Apri
comments: I was on Apri for about 4.5 years and everything was fine. I had a little acne here and there but nothing bad at all. Then all of the sudden my boobs started hurting immensely for months and I had no sex drive. I literally thought I was pregnant sometimes because of my symptoms. I swtiched of Apri and I have now been on Giavani for a little over a month and have had no significant symptoms but my sex drive is definitely back and no more boob pain!!

name: ParaGard
comments: I was on Mirena and I needed to get off of hormonal birth control. I was scared of cramping and bleeding too much on Paragard, so I was skeptical. But I really love Paragard. I feel like I can have carefree sex with my partner. I haven’t experienced any cramping whatsoever (but I never have cramps). And my period is only a day or two longer than usual, but not unmanageable or worrisome. We have different experiences with different types of birth control, and it’s not for everyone, but trying Paragard was worth the risk for me. I feel a lot more like myself, my anxiety is gone, I’ve lost a lot of weight, and I feel great. I would definitely give it a try, and I want to stay on Paragard until I have kids.

name: Aviane
comments: I was switched to this from Diane 35 after the birth of my 2 girls, I had been on Diane for 12 years and never had a problem. I've been on this pill for 1.5 years now and absolutely don't like it. Within the first month my acne got worse and has been a struggle since. If I am late taking my pill by even 5 hours I will start to spot but then when it comes time for my period half the time it doesn't come. PMS symptoms are worse as well.

name: ParaGard
comments: I have had my ParaGard in for about 5 years now and no babies have been made! Not even a scare! It has been amazing not having to worry about it because I have not been in a position to get pregnant yet. Then only down side is that I think it is starting to cause me to have several yeast infections. I have been having to take yeast infection medication at least once a month. I think it’s time to change it out or something but I really have loved my experience with it!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
If I could give this a -10/10 I would. I started 12 days ago and let me share my side effects that scared my ob/gyn: migraines, leg aches, hot flashes, NONEXISTENT libido, acne covering my entire face that we aren’t sure if it was acne or a reaction. Now for the mood swings- jeez I know my mood swings on my cycle but the complete and utter rage I felt from common everyday things (like if my sleeve cuffed up or something) I have never experienced anything like that while on this BC. It scared me because I didn’t know why I was getting so angry and I couldn’t calm myself down. I’m diagnosed with anxiety and depression, but it’s very very managed. I called my doc’s on call breaking down to have them prescribe anti anxiety meds and when I went in for an appointment to switch off this BC I scored a 20 out of 21 on the depression diagnostic test...a 10-12 point spike just while being on this medication. 

If you have mental health diagnoses DO NOT go on this brand of birth control.

name: Adderall
comments: Have used a generic for about 6 years now worked for me except it has turned me into a teeth grinder I do it all the time and now my teeth are worn to the point they are ruined.  My doctor said he never heard of that side effect but a recent visit to a dentist to try to fix my teeth I was told they see this all the time and this grinding may never go away. I need to find something that works without these side effects

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: This birth control was the worst I’ve taken. I used to get microgestin fe from planned parenthood and it didn’t make me bloated or cause any unwanted side effects other than occasional nausea. I switched to this one when I finally went through my insurance and this made me so nauseated all the time and so so so bloated. I thought I was crazy with my mood swings but I read other people had the same problems. I would cry at everything and the last week before my period every month I would have a complete breakdown one day and cry for hours on end and be depressed. I also waited so long to change it but reading all of this and how others reacted similarly I knew I needed to.

name: ParaGard
comments: I got pregnant after almost 4 years of use of ParaGard. Waiting to get the results of my ultrasound to see if its a regular pregnancy or an ectopic one. Do your research, the percentage of women getting pregnant while using it correctly is higher than they want you believe it is.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: YOU'RE GOING TO BE OKAY! Took this right after my partner and I got carried away and had him finish without a condom, and then realizing it was the day of my ovulation! I fell into a rabbit hole of looking up pregnancy symptoms and not believing in 3 negative tests that I delayed my period till day 45 (when I'm usually on a 30 day cycle), so I strongly advise against trying to convince yourself of a pregnancy that won't happen :) Your body has a very small window of getting pregnant each month, and even then it has to have everything ready in perfect timing to do so- which is still hard for people that are actually trying to conceive! So relax, and believe in that negative pregnancy test after 2 weeks. Definitely consider the use of contraceptives each time you have sex no matter what if you want to be stress free in the future.

name: Lessina
comments: rarely notice the side effects, some times nausea, maybe once or twice a year. Other than that no complains.

name: Kariva
comments: So I was on this Kariva pill for YEARS. Like 6 or 7 years. I never realized what this pill did to my mental health until I got off of it. I was ALWAYS tired, always had brain fog, and was always crying. I had ridiculous mood swings. I just hated how I was. I always felt awful. My sex drive was way low too. Coming off of this pill was the best decision I’ve ever made. Believe the negative reviews.

name: Aviane
comments: I was prescribed Aviane a year ago, and have since enjoyed my experience. My discharge is slightly thicker, but still has normal consistency from time to time. My period is very light, and my cramps are mild. Before, I used to have bad cramps. I will say that my libido seems to have slightly decreased, but I find I just need a little more time to warm up. Recently I have been experiencing anxious and depressive symptoms, but that could be a result of the COVID-19 Pandemic.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve noticed a lot of comments, saying not to take it, but I feel that a lot of people don’t understand that birth control effects each person differently no matter which birth control you take. So, if you are new to any birth control do not let these comments discourage you. Listen to your body and your doctor. Personally I love this birth control and it has made my skin clear, periods lighter, no weight gain and no noticeable mental changes. But, it could always be different for the next person. If your doctor is prescribing you Junel fe, take it and try it out, if its not good for you than there are other options.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I like so many others here have had a very bad experience with pro air. I have bad allergies and so I will regularly need my inhaler when working. I used Ventolin for years, and it was great, no complaints, but like so many others, my insurance decided the be greedy and switched me over to ProAir. It tastes awful, first of all, always makes me gag, and second it causes my attacks to get worse! Supposedly my insurance covers it, but it is more than 3x that of any inhaler I've ever gotten! I've only had it for a couple months, but I will be very strongly requesting to my doctor and pharmacy that I go back to ventolin very soon.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started the pill over 5 months ago. I dealt with very long (3 month) heavy periods. My doctor prescribe this birth control and at first it was amazing my cycles went normal etc. Then on 4th 5th month I started having headaches, emotional, then very bad chest pains at night when I laid in bed it felt like my heart was in pain. I started breaking out in hives at night. It was a total nightmare. I will not be taking these pills ever again!

name: ParaGard
comments: This is the second time I have had the paragard. First time no issues at all had it inserted after first child. Second one inserted after that again no issues. However 6 years into it. I started bleeding between periods and sex. Felt just off in other ways. Depressed weight gain all the other side effects here but not for one second did I think it was my IUD. Then my cervix started to get inflamed no matter what. All tests came back fine and the IUD was in perfect position. But pain and unusual side effects. I decided to have it removed and went back for my one month post check up just to see. Cervix was perfect. Nothing at all. No breakthrough bleeding. No bleeding after sex either. I don’t know if it was the Paragard but I do believe if your body doesn’t want something it definitely tells you. I feel better mentally and physically since removal. 43 year old healthy female otherwise.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was switched to Junel fe because I was spotting heavily in between my periods on my old prescription. I pretty much had a period all month long!
