On Junel fe, I had MINOR spotting when I started taking the pack, and now I have none! I have zero of the side effects discussed on here by other women. I have seen no weight gain but I am on a 1300 calorie diet, so that may be why. I love this prescription, it’s definitely worth the switch!

name: Apri
comments: I had normal, easy, regular periods before starting Apri. Over the course of 2.5 years of taking it I gained 50 pounds even with regular exercise and dieting even though I struggled to gain even 5 pounds before starting Apri. I did not feel like myself emotionally. I finally had enough and decided to stop taking it and the weight never went away even with continued diet and exercise. Most importantly: MY PERIODS NEVER CAME BACK. I started growing dark, thick hairs on my neck, chest, and stomach that also never went away.

name: Apri
comments:
Don't take it if you have anxiety.
I took Apri for 2 months and one week. It was prescribed to me for acne and painful cramps. It did the job with my cramps, I didn't get any and my periods were super light and manageable. My acne got worse for a bit but just started to clear up at the beginning of the 3rd month. Apri made my anxiety worse. I am a very anxious person. It wasn't the medication itself, but knowing the possibly dangerous side effects made me anxious. I would get super anxious randomly throughout the day, feel tightness in my chest, my heart would beat very hard. At night I would tremble and get pins and needles and leg cramps. It would take me about 3 hours to fall asleep. I would twitch when trying to fall asleep and would wake up throughout the night. I started taking CBD oil and it cleared up most of my physical anxiety, but I was still paranoid. I stopped taking Apri and after a week I felt perfectly normal again.

name: Ocella
comments:
I’m 25 years old and I’ve been on Ocella for 6 months. I would take my pill every single night at 9 pm to reduce any side effects. I’ve been on birth control as a teen for acne and thought I’d try it again for acne and pregnancy prevention.
CONS: This birth control has caused my acne to worsen, headaches, sensitive emotionally (I don’t cry easily btw but with this birth control I would cry easily) and lowered my sex drive. I gave it the benefit of the doubt to stick it out to see if my acne would clear up. In my case the acne cleared up on my forehead but moved from my forehead to my cheeks. The acne Ocella has caused are red pimples that are painful but not cystic because they have a white head. I wouldn’t ever breakout on my cheeks but mainly on my forehead and jawline.
PROS: works well for skipping periods, no break through bleeding. No nausea. No weight gain. Fuller breasts. Prevents pregnancy for my husband and I.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I used this pill for 4 months due to experiencing abnormal spotting/bleeding. Th pill did not work and I spotted everyday when I wasn’t on my period. My period also lasted for 7-11 days. It was the worst experience I had with birth control. I finally had to agree to get the IUD; hoping it works, day 2. I would not suggest Nora b if you are experiencing abnormal period/spotting.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I recommend trying something else. I’ve read many reviews and talked to many other women who have tried Junel Fe. I do not have a history of depression but within the first month, I was severely depressed. I could not stop crying for days. I made it through the first month but it was very hard. I almost felt like a zombie, constantly being dismal. Not to mention, I experienced all of the side effects on the list and more. It was honestly miserable. If you are prescribed this by your doctor, please do some further research before you take it. I do not think it’s for everyone.

name: Ajovy
comments: Ajovy has been great at reducing/almost eliminating migraines however the weight gain has been 30lbs in about 1.5 years . The doctors refuse to acknowledge any side effect that is not listed on the insert which is none except for rash at injection site. Also I have strange dizziness. Who really believes that there are no side effects?

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was originally prescribed Junel Fe 1/20 birth control due to my very painful cramps, bleeding, and after finding out I have anemia. The first month there was spotting for a couple of weeks, but then it went away. The cramps and bleeding definitely got better. This felt like a relief and I thought I was on track to making my life better. Unfortunately, halfway through my 5th month, I decided to stop taking these pills. I was experiencing very severe anxiety and depression. I normally am a pretty anxious person but I typically deal with it in my own ways. However, this was the worst of my life. I felt suicidal. I was worried about everything. I had a panic attack. I couldn't sleep well. My family and co-workers were noticing a change in my behavior and mood. It wasn't good. After I stopped taking them, a few days later I noticed I felt a lot more level-headed and less anxious. I really hope that others don't have to go through what I went through. I'm hoping this review might help someone out there.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I love this BC. I take it the same time every day and I haven't had any problems. It made my periods lighter and has been effective. I can't believe all the bad reviews because I have tried so many other with bad outcomes and switched to this one and it was the answer to my prayers!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started taking this medication almost 2 months ago to help with hormonal acne.  While it has helped some with the hormonal acne...   My periods before now were always on time, light and about 5 days long.  NOW I am getting a HEAVY period every 6-9 days.  This pill is GARBAGE.  I would rather have the hormonal acne.

name: Sprintec
comments: I have been on Sprintec a year and randomly it causes me to bleed for over a month straight. Which is expensive when it come to liners or ruining my panties. Since being on it I have gained weight while I watch my calories and work out a lot. As well, it causes breast pain. It made them bigger to the point I may need a reduction. Don’t forget to mention the emotions. I work hard to control it but I just want to cry all the time.

name: Cryselle
comments: I took cryselle for about a year or two. It was the worst birth control I’ve taken. It made me extremely moody and I felt angry, to the point that my friends and family could see the difference in my mood. It also made me gain 15 pounds so fast that I now have issues with my knees. I talked to my doctor and she switched me to Junelle Fe. I love Junelle and my family told me never to go back to Cryselle. But now I was told Junelle is on back order and they’re having me take Aurovela. I’m scared to switch since I really like Junelle.

name: Provigil
comments: My name is Lucille when I was 50 years old I started nodding out in the car and restaurants and it was very humiliating it was uncontrollable my family was very embarrassed I went to a neurologist and they took sleep studies and they said that I had sleep apnea which was unusual because I am but at the time I was 105 lb and I was not diabetic and I am borderline narcoleptic I am hypersomnia I was prescribed many medications they did not work such as adderal  which just come out they said it was a very unique medication. I had to fight the insurance to pay for it my doctor prescribed that after it was approved and I have to take 200 mg in the morning then  I would become myself I take that faithfully and another 200 mg at 1 p.m. and I do not have those episodes anymore of uncontrolled sleeping where I cannot function. I've been on provigil for 12 years now my doctor prescribes 100 mg Nuvigil in the afternoon with the 200 mg Provigil

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: For a few months on Tri-Sprintec, everything was fine, and then my acne got worse, now I have the worst acne of my life. I never even had pustules when I was in high school. Ironically, I clear up during my period, suggesting that the hormones in these did the complete opposite effect of what I had intended.

name: Take Action
comments: TAKE ACTION AND PLAN B IS THE TRUTH for me. Had unprotected sex with my fiancé on January 23rd around 12ish that morning and he finished inside me completely. Went to my local Kroger that morning 9 hours after it happened and got the take action because Plan B was all out and here it is 5 days later and Aunt Flo is currently paying me a visit! I was stressed and depressed thinking I was pregnant because of how long it was before i took it! No side effects at all!! Just be patient ladies!!

name: ParaGard
comments: My first 2 times having the IUD, I had no issues that I remember. 3 years ago, I was at my 10 year mark and got it replaced. Since then I have had constant BV's, weight gain and anxiety. After reading all of these comments, I am happy to know that I am not  the only one going through this. I believe there was some change made over the years to the BC.

name: ParaGard
comments: I am a very calm female with a good mental state, 23, good health, no kids. I got the bar in my arm and after 8 months of continuous bleeding, I reached an all time low of anxiety and depression (did not get out of bed or eat for 7 days). I got the bar removed and immediately felt better in the upcoming weeks. I was terrified to have any type of hormonal bc because I clearly don’t react well. So I got paraguard. Insertion was fine I cramped 2 days after and haven’t felt it, no problem at all but heavier periods. I developed several right ovarian cyst but you can get those simply by ovulating anyway normally (so I have to start a low dose of birth control to prevent cyst:( ) My IUD has also slipped lower after a year, happens in ~4%, so in 5 weeks I will have it replaced with paraguard again. Hopefully everything’s smooth. Perfect for someone who forgets to take the pill. Everyone reacts different but this has been amazing for me!

name: ParaGard
comments: The copper IUD is the worst birth control I've ever been on. The doctor who placed it raved about it and said it was awesome. Lucky for me, I haven't had anything horrible happen to my uterus, unlike so many other women and people with uteruses. But it's been in less than a year, and my period is so incredibly terrible that having the IUD has caused me to develop severe anemia and the need for blood transfusions. Absolutely terrible, should be illegal after everything it's done to too many people.

name: Seasonique
comments: It caused cystic like acne, migraines, weight gain, and jaundice.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took this pill for 2 months and I couldn’t regret it more. I’ve bled for over half of the month since I started, sometimes with no break between the spotting and my actual period. My anxiety has gotten significantly worse. I’ve experience migraines which is something completely new to me. Rather than cramping for a few days like I normally would, I would cramp for weeks when I was spotting and on my actual period. This pill was a very bad option for me. My sister had a similar experience with this birth control but my doctor decided to put me on it despite that and it was a huge mistake.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been taking this birth control for about 4 months now. I was on Ortho Tri-Cyclen for about 7 months. Mood swings, acne, bloating, anxiety you name it. I was advised to switch it a lower estrogen birth control and that’s when I started Junel Fe 1/20. I’ve had ultra light to no periods and my mood swings, bloating, anxiety GONE! I’ve had the best experience with this birth control. I’ve been on the IUD twice and nothing has been as good as this brand of birth control. I’ll get a cyst on my chin around the time I’m suppose to get my period but other than that everything has been great. I take my pill before bedtime.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
I’m a 22 year old female, and I’ve never had bad skin until this year. All of a sudden I got horrible skin, cystic acne all over my face and chest in November. I’m not sure what from, but having to wear masks hasn’t helped. I have been on the same birth control for years and I eat very clean. Yet my skin is the worst it’s ever been. I started using biacna topical gel prescribed by my doctor, and I’ve been using it for 2 weeks now. I’m SO HAPPY. My skin isn’t forming any new pimples or acne, all I have left are old ones that are healing. My skin looks and feels awesome. I would recommend trying since it’s not too expensive and super easy to apply. 

Also note that at first your skin may get worse before getting better,  and your skin gets dry while using it (mine also kind of burned at first) but after 2 weeks my skin has gotten used to the gel.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Honestly the worst birth control I’ve been on. This is the third birth control I’ve tried, and I get two periods per month with cramps and heavy bleeding on one. I’m also SUPER hormonal—more than I ever was with just my regular period. I am depressed and super irritable and tired and hungry. Would not recommend.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I still don't know if this pill works. I'm late a few days, my breast feel like they're going to explode and I get these light to moderate cramping every single day. I didn't feel symptoms right away, it actually started like a week after and it's been two weeks already. I took Aftera after ovulation so I hope it doesn't fail me.

name: QNASL
comments: I’m that guy with allergy, sinus, bronchitis rubbish since I was a little boy.  Been thru it all and after many, many years on Flonase from my primary, my allergist put me on QNASL...after just 4 doses I’m thinking “Where has this been all my life?”  I will report back after more doses.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have been on Ajovy monthly injections for five months.  It did help with the migraines at first but I have gained almost 25 lbs, my blood pressure is extremely high when it used to be low and I have had bleeding between periods. I am going off of it because the side effects are worse than the migraines.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started this pill back in September to regulate my period. I seem to have more cons than pros when it comes to this BC. I have definitely experienced depression and mood swings while taking it, during my placebo week I feel the best I possibly can be. Just whenever I’m taking the pill, I find myself never in a good mood. I also never experienced cramping until I started taking these pills. I’m definitely considering switching my BC or coming off of it completely because I’m sick of not feeling like myself.

name: Apri
comments: I am a 22 year old and I was only on Apri for almost three months and I couldn't handle the effects it was giving me. Before Apri I was on Tri-Sprintec for like five years and I had a breakthrough bleeding so my doctor prescribed me this. No joke, just two days taking it I started getting migraines and I feel into depression and I have never gotten migraines before. Since I was in finals, I had to fight through the effects but it was not fun. Before getting my period, I would get some strong cramps that felt like someone was stabbing me in my pelvic, having hot flashes, and wanting to just sleep all day. Including to this, my discharge started to become heavy like I would have to go to the bathroom to clean myself down there because I felt it leaking; was not fun. This was my effect on this and I don't think everyone would get this, this was how my body handled it. Just take precaution and ask your doctor too if this formula is okay for you.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: This medication is bad.  It should be taken off the market.  I got so sick on this.  I got a very bad headache, racing heart beat, and thrush, it made me nervous.  I just felt really bad.  The medication does not come out right - you either get too much medication or none at all it does not get into the lungs, it just stays in the back of the throat and that is how I got the thrush.  My doctor now has it so the prescription is dispense as written so the Pharmacist will now fill it with the Advair thank goodness.  Like I said Wixela Inhub should be taken off the market as it is dangerous.  If I could I would give it a 0 rating
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I wish I could still be on this pill. I started with Tri-Sprintec at the age 16 due to having irregular menstrual cycle and I am now 22 years old. When I was on this, it was like I wasn't even taking birth control. I did not have any sort of side effects and if I did then it was a minimal cramp that I can still go on about my day. If I could go back to this I would in a heart beat but since I had a breakthrough bleeding in-between my periods, my doctor took me off. I don't know if these work best for irregular periods but it was the best for me. Hopefully this is helpful to those who are thinking of taking this or are starting it/been on it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've only been taking Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 months now (I have my 3rd month but I don't know if I'm going to take it.) I get my prescription online through a service, and the only reason I switched to Junel Fe was because I had to renew my subscription and they didn't pick back up where I left off. I figured I'd give it a few months and see what happened. I mostly take birth control to help with my ovarian cysts and regulation. I immediately noticed with this medication that I have a lot more pain and cramps. It also did not regulate my period, as I have missed it since I've been taking this medication. I also struggle with anxiety and it not only doubled it, but has made me feel extremely depressed. Also, I have relatively clear skin, but I've been having acne breakouts since starting. I already messaged my doctor to see about changing.

name: Cryselle
comments: I was on Low-Ogestrel for about 6 years and then all of a sudden my pharmacy stopped carrying it so they gave me Cryselle. I was weary from the start because my body is so sensitive to changes in medication. The difference in the fillers was enough to cause me to have horrible breakthrough bleeding for multiple weeks. It helped with my cystic acne on my jaw and neck but I can't deal with the constant bleeding so switching to Syeda to see if that works!

name: Apri
comments:
I like this Apri brith control pill a lot! I was quite surprised running across all these negative reviews. I understand everyone has a different experience with Apri, and is affected everyone differently. Personally, I’ve had no problems although it’s only been a few weeks of being on it. If anything, my mood swings (from when I was BC free) have gone down DRASTICALLY. I feel much more chilled out and content. No cramping, headaches, etc. but slight anxiety. I have noticed a little weight gain but this is something that isn’t that big of a problem for me or detrimental. 

I was initially taking depo which caused me to bleed everyday straight for 3 months (the same amount I normally would at the start of a period, except EVERYDAY) and suffered from cramps from time to time and nausea. My doctor switched me over to Apri and so far I have little to no complaints. My skin has been consistently clear and I don’t feel fatigued.

name: Velivet
comments: I have been on Velivet for about 8 years now. I haven’t had any bad side effects besides some minor weight gain. Periods only are three days now and light, no breakouts (acne) and it is very easy to use every day and you know when your cycle starts exactly. I haven’t had any mood swings. I’m surprised by all the bad reviews I’m seeing on this pill as I haven’t had any issues but I have never missed a pill or got off birth control once I started this pill so I’m not sure if that has anything to do with it.

name: Gianvi
comments: I got on Gianvi at 19 years old when my periods were irregular and I had horrible cramps, to prevent pregnancy and help my acne. It helped my acne a lot and I was excited to finally not worry about pregnancy at a young age. I was skeptical about side effects at first but waited three months before judging my experience at all to make sure I was used to it. I ended up staying on Gianvi for about 6 months. My experience was terrible. I would’ve taken acne over the effects it had on my mental health any day. I had crippling anxiety everyday that I never experienced prior to. It eventually got so bad that I had panic attacks everyday and cried and didn’t eat for 3 days. I ended it immediately and while I still suffer from mild anxiety, it’s a million times better than it was when I took this. Please be careful and pay attention to your body

name: Take Action
comments: A few weeks ago I was worried and reading these reviews. I was unaware about the “plan b doesn’t work after ovulation” theory until after having unprotected sex during my fertile days. I literally kept myself up all night after being on google too long and ultimately convinced myself that I was pregnant. Safe to say, I am not. Don’t stress yourself out over everything you read online, sis.

name: Take Action
comments: DO NOT TAKE. I has unprotected sex with my man and he did finish in me. He got scared cause I told him i took my birth control 3 hours later than usual. I got the pill about 40 hours after we had sex. My period was 5 days late but I experienced horrible side effects. I got a nasty infection in my mouth my lips were covered with white patches I also got it in my private area as well. It hurt so bad I could not even sit down. Yes I’m not pregnant but this pill definitely gave me a nasty infection.

name: Adipex-P
comments: If taken the right way and not abused, an individual could really get that weight off.

name: Take Action
comments: I had sex three days ago and I just had my baby 7 months ago, my husband said he had already came in me a little, so he went full blown sploosh in there. So I got take action from walgreens and took it a few hours after yesterday, I started spotting and now I'm full on bleeding. I guess it worked. No side effects for me tho. which is cool. I read that if your ovulating it will not work, and if you over 163 lbs it may work but I'm 194 lbs and it worked perfectly.

name: Ajovy
comments: Did my first injection of Ajovy December 2020. I previously researched it and knew it was possible my headaches and migraines wouldn't go away in the first month. What I didn't read were the side effects such as nausea like no other every day for hours. It also never said my neck would be stiff, sore, and seize up randomly. I'm trying one more month for the migraine purpose and will go from there.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Reading the reviews on Junel 1/20 before I started did put some anxiety into me but personally speaking I’m having a pretty good experience with it. For the first 3 months I did experience some breakthrough bleeding but this was expected as my body was adjusting to the hormones and after that everything has been great. My periods are lighter and shorter, I didn’t go through mood swings, no weight gain, no vaginal dryness, no acne and (I’m not as active anymore) but no pregnancy as well. So pretty much whatever negative side effects there could have been, I thankfully didn’t get any.

name: Gianvi
comments:
I was on Gianvi for 8 years (from 18 years to 26 years) and it did WONDERS for my acne on my face and my back. I was prescribed it from my dermatologist. I had a regular period every month once my body adapted to the new hormone changes.

When I turned 26 I had to switch to my own insurance and Gianvi was no longer free on my new plan, so I switched to Junel Fe for all of 2020 - biggest mistake of my life. My periods were irregular / I would go months without even getting one, my mood swings were horrible, and my skin started to break out on my back and my face.

Last month I went back on my insurance to see how much Gianvi would be because I couldn't be on Junel Fe anymore, and Gianvi was free again! So I immediately switched back and my skin is already starting to improve. Gianvi is one of three qualified combination pills for acne purposes, so I highly recommend this if you are having acne problems.

name: Lessina
comments: I have been on Lessina for about 5 months now & I have definitely noticed a difference. My periods are shorter and lighter (a huge reason why I went on birth control in the first place is because I'm anemic & my periods were horrible). As many others have said, the migraines do happen often, but all my life I have been getting headaches regularly so it's nothing different. My skin has cleared up and I only have minor break outs due to wearing a mask (for COVID) & not the birth control. I experienced slight weight gain & my boobs grew which I was kinda happy about lol. Recently I missed a pill and spotted until my period started but it wasn't too bad. Definitely experience moody episodes before my period which I never experienced before but I will not be switching brands anytime soon because I'm happy with how it has been treating my periods.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started taking this birth control because I was bleeding when I was not suppose to be. I was on Junel Fe before switching to a higher dose of estrogen. At first, I loved it never had any issues. Period was regular and overall was good for me in the beginning. I have just hit a year on being on Junel Fe 1.5/30, and the past few months I had noticed when I start my new packs of birth control after my period week, I am an emotional wreck. The tiniest thing would set me off and I would be in tears and then 10 mins later I wouldn’t even understand why I was crying. Also it would make my mood swings intense getting back on it from my period week. I also feel as if my sex drive has decreased, could just be the time of the month but who knows. I personally think it is too much estrogen being put into my body once a start a new pack and then when I start my period I am like going cold turkey with no estrogen besides what is already inside my body.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel 1.5/30 is the second birth control brand that I’ve taken. I switched to it because I had a constant period for 2 months on the last brand. I’m just now finishing my 3rd pack of Junel and was shocked to see all of the bad reviews. Since I’ve only been on birth control for 6 months, I didn’t notice big changes until now. I have naturally thick hair and I have noticed that I have been losing a lot more than usual. I can run my fingers through my hair and several strands will come out. My skin is pretty clear for the most part, just a few pimples here and there but nothing major. My boobs haven’t gotten any bigger sadly lol or I haven’t gained much weight. In the day I have no appetite but am starving before bed. Sometimes I can only eat a few bites and then I feel sick. Also, I am more irritable and stressed, but that could be due to other problems. I don’t think I’ve been on it long enough to notice major changes but this is my experience so far.

name: lactulose
comments: Within an hour of taking a dose I experience severe nausea and sometimes throw up but when it starts working I feel somewhat better. I still feel constipated some but not as bad as I did. The taste keeps me from taking it twice a day as prescribed or it would probably work better.

name: Aviane
comments: I've been on this Aviane pill for about 1.5-2 years now and nothing had changed other than my period is regulated. My flow is extremely heavy for the first couple of days. My period usually lasts 5 days. I have really bad cramps to the point where I can't concentrate on what I am doing. My acne went away and my face is pretty clear but that's the only good thing. I am trying another birth control next month to see if it will make it lighter and have fewer symptoms. Aviane 28 isn't that bad and I will switch back if the other pill does not work out for me.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Tri-Lo-Sprintec was the first birth control I’ve ever been on. At first I wasn’t too sure about it. The first few months were roooouuugggghh. I’m talking depression I’ve never experienced before. I was crying over nothing, had tons of anxiety, and was suddenly super insecure. It was such a dark time in my life I legit thought I was going crazy and my poor boyfriend supported me through that nightmare. I stuck through it however (idk why) and surprisingly it all went away one day. It lasted about 3 months but after that I had no bad side effects - no weight gain, no acne, and it really helped me out with my period pain. I used to curl up in bed and cry because of how bad my cramps were and on this pill it was finally manageable. I still experienced a little pain but it felt like what a “normal” cramp was supposed to feel like compared to what I used to go through. Honestly overall a good experience but I had to go through a nightmare to get there and it really depends if you think it’s worth taking the risk.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I do not recommend this birth control at all. I was only able to take it for 6 days and I'd felt some changes leading up to the last day I took it. Nausea, bad headaches, eye aches, extreme moodiness, heart palpitations, dizziness, crying for no reason, I woke up in a bad mood and by the 6th day I had had enough. I switched back to my old birth control (I took junel only because I had a zero co-pay prescription) and I will GLADLY pay 30 dollars for it over this. Every side effect was gone the day after I stopped taking it.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I’ve taken Plan B multiple times and always got my next period on time or early. I took aftera because I thought I’d save 10 dollars because I didn’t think I needed it as much, but now I’ve missed my period for the next month after taking it. I’ve had PMS but no period. Pregnancy test came back negative but still no period. If you need to take, I recommend plan B over aftera!!

name: Take Action
comments: My guy and I had unprotected sex around the time I was ovulating. We got the pill and it within 24 hours of sex... my period was 2 days late. I took a test and it came back POSITIVE!! We had one other mishap about a year ago and I took plan B.. it worked perfect. Not Take Action! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU NOT WASTING YOUR MONEY ON THIS BRAND!!

name: Take Action
comments: I had unprotected sex 1/2/2021, took the pill the next day. My period was supposed to be on the 5th but I’m now 2 weeks late with brown/pinkish discharge and light cramping. I took a test and it was negative but I am very worried.. don’t know if this is side effects or if I am pregnant. I guess we’ll have to wait and see. Take plan B instead, this isn’t worth all the stress.

name: ParaGard
comments: I personally feel as though there isn’t enough research on the Paragard Copper IUD to make some of the claims that they made when mine was inserted 4 years ago. I believe it wears down in the body and causes a chemical reaction as your blood stream intakes more copper than it is supposed to. A lot of my symptoms lined up perfectly with copper toxicity, and I have been better since removal and treatment. The whole experience was excruciating every month and periods became a 3 week long ordeal (between mental health issues and pain that wouldn’t let up and pain that caused me to feel unable to sit comfortably, due to its’ severity and spotting for a month and skipping my period for months). I felt kind of dumb for having the left the ParaGard in for so long when I found out how many women usually make it at most 1 year with it. No thanks. Just because it was non hormonal doesn’t mean it didn’t keep me feeling completely unbalanced and in complete pain with a lot of mental health issues.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel Fe 1/20 was worst experience ever! First I became anxious and depressed and had no sex drive. My primary put me on anxiety medication. Then I gained so much weight that was never like me especially while dieting, then night sweats... the last straw was when I bled for a month straight... I wish I had looked up the reviews for this sooner because I would have stopped this way sooner.

name: ParaGard
comments: ZERO STARS for this if possible. After having the copper IUD for 6 years, I got pregnant with the IUD in place!!!!!!! (I always checked the strings) The IUD punctured my uterus. I had to have surgery- a medically necessary abortion (d&c), and to have the IUD cut from my uterus. If the baby had been in my fallopian tubes I could have died. The doc was going to give me chemo to end the pregnancy if the d&c hadn't worked. Six years of birth control is not worth the physical and mental pain I have had to endure over the last 3 weeks. Please read about women's personal experiences before you get the copper IUD! Now that I'm reading them, I'm realizing I have been suffering from copper toxicity as well, causing increasing anxiety & depression over that last six years. My mental state is better everyday now that my IUD has been removed. I'm starting to feel like my old self. I will never get another one. If you need a natural form of birth control, please google Fertility Awareness Method.

name: Gianvi
comments: I’ve been on this birth control for about 4 years. I was prescribed Gianvi for acne. I noticed that for 3 years my acne improved greatly. However, throughout the last year on it I noticed my acne was suddenly going back to how it was prior to taking birth control. I am considering switching to a new birth control because of this or just stopping birth control all together. I personally did not experience any side effects other than my period changing. I get my period about every 6 months now instead of every month and it’s very light. I asked my doctor about this and she said this was normal. This was nice plus as my period was rather heavy. Overall, I had a very positive experience on this birth control, however it’s no longer helping with my acne so I might have to switch.

name: Ajovy
comments: Been using Ajovy for 11 months at this point. The migraines are basically cut in half but haven't disappeared altogether. For the past few months, I have been experiencing severe vitamin D loss in my blood and my hair is falling out more than usual. My neurologist says it isn't linked together, but I am not that sure. If anyone is using this drug and is experiencing the same side effects, it might be linked. The more of us share, the more we will know.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Update from my post on July 26,2020. I am now 7 months in with the Junel Fe 1.5/30 pill. Haven’t experienced any bad symptoms yet other than the first few weeks on the pill sometimes I would wake up feeling very nauseous. Other than that haven’t had anything negative other than this pill makes my periods really irregular so I never know when it is starting. Because of that I’ve missed my period 2 times and freaked out and took pregnancy test that both came out negative. Right now I’m 2 weeks late but I’m not worried because ever since I’ve been on the pill it’s always been late. So far this pill hasn’t changed my mood, hasn’t made me depressed, I’ve gained a little weight but that might just be quarantine wait since I don’t walk a lot everyday. My sexual drive decreased a lil but I have a high sexual drive so it just turned it normal lol, and no bad acne. Like I said before each pill is different for everyone :)

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I would actually rather be a teen mom than continue taking this it genuinely made my life worse

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started on this Junel 1/20 birth control about 6 months ago and thought that it was great. I initially felt pretty good, no depression, it cleared up my skin, and I didn’t gain any insane amount of weight. I’ve gained maybe 5 pounds at worst. The first 2 months my periods were lighter and starting to get more regular. The next month I didn’t get my period. The following month I got it. Then last month I just got a brown spotting discharge. We use condoms and are very safe to pull out but the not so regular periods make my anxiety sky rocket. Which brought me to realize just how much this medication has increased my anxiety. I get anxious and my heart rate goes up about silly things like driving, eating, sleeping, and being home alone. Also Junel 1/20 has recently made me boobs grow a little bit. Overall it works pretty good for me. The only thing I worry about is my irregular periods and the anxiety I get. I hope in the future my periods get regular or I might switch to a different pill.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
I have had issues with 5 of the last 6 Qvar RediHalers as they would not dispense the last 20 to 50 doses. I  just bought another one even though my last one is showing 28 doses remaining. I can tell that the last 10 or so doses were not even delivered.
   I decided to try something . I took my old one and separated the top half of the body from the bottom half by unscrewing it. You may need to cut through the label if it  prevents you from twisting it open. Next, I removed the cannister by pulling its nozzle from the hole. I then took a can of compressed air using the long  skinny nozzle that comes with it, I stuck that nozzle right  into the hole that I pulled the cannister from and I sprayed. My thinking was that perhaps there was a blockage.  I put the cannister back in the hole, twisted the body halves  back together and gave it a try. It worked. It's been  just like new after 10 doses. Hope this helps.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: After using proair products I always get a yeast infection - vs using Ventolin. It doesn't seem to have the same effect as other inhalers either. The regular doses coming out are less effective than from a Ventolin inhaler for me.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments:
IF YOU ARE TAKING PORTIA 28 AND THINK IT MAY BE THE CAUSE OF YOUR ACNE THAT YOU CAN'T EXPLAIN, THROW IT AWAY. It gave me cystic acne when my skin was previously clear. I'm talking about clusters of painful, deep cystic acne that left scars and wouldn't go away for months. I became way more irritable and had intense mood swings, always feeling so "done" and tired. The first few weeks I couldn't even keep the pill down and woke up to throw up every night. I never got a good nights sleep due to this and my body was in a constant state of stress and exhaust. I only decided to search up reviews to see if I
 was the only one, 7 months in. Now I see that the majority are facing the exact same problems as me. I'm so frustrated that I didn't take just a second to research this brand because it would have saved me so much emotional distress and confusion.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took the Junel Fe 1/20 pill for 3 months to regulate my periods and hormone levels. During that time I lost about 12 lbs. When I stopped after 3 month hoping to conceive, I never got a period! So I waiting another month, but still nothing with negative pregnancy results. This is when my stomach started getting real bloated. I mean I looked 6 months pregnant. I'm so uncomfortable. I immediately gained 5 lbs. So I just went back on it and a week into resuming all bloating went away. Now this pill did not regulate my periods....

name: Sprintec
comments: NEVER USE THIS DRUG. I was on Sprintec for 3 weeks this past summer (2020) and I had horrible side effects, including extreme fatigue, nausea, and dizziness. I was also having some chest pain. My COVID tests kept coming back negative, so I thought nothing of it. I had been hiking, paddle-boarding, jogging. TURNS OUT, after finally going to the emergency room on a gut feeling, I suffered TWO pulmonary embolisms (blood clots), which traveled through my heart and to my lungs. They told me I am lucky to be alive. Women have died from birth control-induced blood clots. After looking into alternative reasons, it’s been determined that it was this birth control that caused it. Please don’t take this one, and be careful of other hormone-based birth controls. It’s uncommon for blood clots to occur, but if you are having any chest pain at all, or something doesn’t feel right, please seek medical care immediately!! I had no idea something like this could happen.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: My last period was Nov 28th and I had unprotected sex on the 30th. I took plan b the next morning and my emotions were all over the place. I felt like I wanted to cry forever. I was very depressed and not myself! I started to bleed 4 days later for about 3-4 days and was experiencing the WORST back cramps. My nipples have been really sore and sensitive the past two weeks so I thought I was pregnant considering my period hadn’t come when it was supposed to. Thank goodness it finally came on Jan 12th!

name: Sprintec
comments: I took Sprintec for 7 months and after seeing these reviews after a MONTH of bleeding (brown blood for the most part ) I am quitting this pill - my gyn tells me to keep taking but I refuse when this could risk my health. It hurts my vision, gives me cramps, induces nausea, and I'm hoping quitting will calm down my bleeding and reset my normal menstrual cycle. This will probably be the last birth control I ever take. For all the ladies wondering when the madness ends after quitting- I'll keep in touch and refresh this review when it stops and let you guys in on my quitting journey.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: Calm down I know you’re panicking. Take the pregnancy test if you’re late take 5 if you want if they all come back the same trust it. My period was almost a month late, 3 weeks and 5 days. Stress and the hormonal imbalance from the pill WILL DELAY YOUR PERIOD. Do not freak out, stop googling everything. It’s okay if you spotted a week after taking a pill, it’s normal to spot more than once, it’s normal to feel cramps at random times. I felt cramps 4 days before having my period and I usually feel them a day before having my period. Take the pregnancy test. Find an online gynecologist and tell them if you feel symptoms of anything but it is most likely plan b if your pregnancy test comes back negative. It affects women differently but discharge is also normal, take it easy honey, find some birth control if you can’t afford the mistake. I can’t and I learned my lesson. Pray and relax you’re fine.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: This is the worst inhaler I've every used. I was forced to switch to this due to insurance not covering name brand. I've had nothing but problems breathing since I started taking it. I've been fighting constantly with the insurance to cover the name brand, even at a higher price but it's super difficult. How can they still sell this stuff, it's horrible.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I didn’t have a great time on this pill. While it made my cramps subside, it did not regulate my period. however, i was only on it for a month and a half because the mental side effects were unbearable. I experienced crippling anxiety and heightened depression. I had no physical side affects aside from occasional mild headaches.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been taking this Junel Fe for almost 4 years, I had a 6 month gap after 2 years and boy was my life way better back then. I was definitely more motivated to do things. This pill makes me a depressed girl with vag problems. I get yeast infections more than I should, I barely eat any food that it’s becoming extremely unhealthy, I cry so much. My sex drive is extremely low. My symptoms of feeling sad and constant need to pee and reoccurring yeast infections. My periods are SO irregular it’s really annoying not knowing when I’ll get it. I lost a lot of weight and when I informed my obgyn she told me that’s not something I should be complaining about. Always looking at the cup half empty. This Junel Fe is definitely not worth all the side affects and complications in the long run. I honestly thought it was my mental health. But it wasn’t. Because that 6 month gap between stopping it and going back on it, was the happiest 6 months of my life. Avoid this birth control.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Omg so let me tell y’all about this EC! I took it once before in October, my November period was pretty regular I think a little late. Then I took it again in December, on the day after last day of my period day 6. I had spotting a week and a day later; blackish brownish light pink and bright red at one point. It lasted about two, three days. My period was due for on Jan 01, yall a week later still nothing. I took numerous test all negative; my period finally came on the 9th. Over a week after it was supposed to come. Thankful!! My period has never been that later tho ever, so I was nervous. Emergency contraceptives really mess with your hormones and mess with your body as well. I would recommend taking one only if absolutely necessary. I’ve popped enough plan b’s and other ec; and the effects like nausea, bloating, irregular cycles, and stress isn’t worth it to be taking it like vitamins. Hope this helps! I’m celibate now.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Please proceed with caution if your doctor recommends this drug. I did not have a good experience. I do think that my issues might have occurred with any low-estrogen BC pill, but I really wish I hadn't tried it. I only took Junel for about 3 months before I decided it wasn't worth it anymore. About 2 weeks after starting the pill, I got a UTI. From that day on, I was on a roller coaster of back to back UTIs, BV, and yeast. UTI, BV, yeast. I've spent hundreds of dollars on medication and doctor's appointments to fix these issues, and my body still isn't right. PLEASE don't take this pill without considering the potential effects on the bladder, urinary tract, and vaginal tissue. I had no mood changes, no weight gain, and no loss of sex drive, but these were minor pros compared to the cons. I was also having two periods/month - one heavy one in the middle of the active pills, and one during the placebo week (withdrawal bleeding, I'm guessing). Please be careful!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on Junel Fe 24 birth control for almost 2 years now. Ive have had no issues with it. Before I started my periods were irregular and nothing made sense. My doctor took my off my old birth control and started me on this one and I've never had any issues with it. I have gained some weight but I've been at a steady weight for a little over a year now. I recommend it but yet again everyone's body is different.

name: Lessina
comments:
I started Lessina almost 4 months ago I have not had a period since. I am not complaining but I am having a hard time losing weight retaining water etc. My head is always hurting and extremely exhausted. I'm worried about the no period. Going to call my doctor Monday to talk with them again as I don't know anyone else who has had periods completely stop. Only other method of birth control I know that has done that to me is the depo but been over a year off of that. 
I went on another pill sprintec prior to this one but just wanted something that wouldn't make me constantly want to eat. On Sprintec I had a 2 day period if that. In my opinion I feel my body needs to have a period to lose weight.

name: Adderall
comments:
Generic Adderall varies significantly depending on mfg. Reason being, the FDA says the mfg only has to “demonstrate” it “works in the same way “ as the brand-name. i.e. generic ingredients do 
Not have to be same which is why so many don’t work and/or make people feel sick. My experience, the only generic that works like the brand-name is Prasco, which acquired Teva’s generic xr in 2016. 
Few pharmacies use Prasco as their generic because it’s more expensive!  My Dr specifies “Prasco generic only” on my prescription for D-Amphetamine ER 30MG Salt combo. By law, the pharmacy must comply if Prasco is one of their overall suppliers. My insurance changed so I called Prasco to see if they sell to Costco. They do. Just takes a day or 2 for the pharmacist to order and fill my script. Walgreens used Prasco as their generic until recently. Now it’s Mallinckrodt which just filed for bankruptcy to settle a slew of opioid lawsuits. It’s all about $

name: Sprintec
comments: Everything seemed fine in the first few weeks of taking the pill and then right before starting my second pack, I started bleeding heavily and having the most awful cramps. It was like I was 13 years old all over again (keep in mind, I’m 25). So now I’m almost finished with my second pack and I’ve been bleeding heavily for like 2 1/2 weeks now. This birth control sucks. I do not recommend. I’m switching to another one as soon as I can.

name: Take Action
comments:
Hubby didnt pull out in time so the next morning he went and picked it up. I'm breast feeding my 10 month old as well. With in 2 days time we both had thrush (kinda a fungal yeast infection). His mouth was covered in those white patches and my nipples ached horribly. I also had headaches. And I'm bleeding its been like a week since I've taken the pill.  It's been like 2 weeks since my last period.  I would not recommend this for nursing moms. Bad bad bad idea!
But none the less. I'm not pregnant which is freaking great news cuz I don't need #6

name: Lessina
comments: Let me remind you that everyone's body is different and every time you begin a new birth control, it can take about 3 months before you fully adjust to it. So don't get anxious about the bad reviews. I began this pill because I would get hives a week before my period, insane acne breakouts on my back, & cramps all the time. I've been on this pill for a month & I can feel the difference this pill has made already. I have experienced simple symptoms like nausea but the nausea doesn't bother me. I noticed that it has reduced my appetite but not dangerously. I just find myself snacking less! Also, my sex drive has not gone (which is a first with birth control). I have a history of anxiety (GAD & OCD with panic attacks) & this pill hasn't made me more anxious. If anything, I feel that it improved my mood & balances my hormones perfectly. I'm confident that the symptoms I have experienced will minimize within that 3 month period. So give your body & the pill some time!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I started taking Junel 1/20 about 4 months ago after years of debating whether or not I wanted to mess with my hormones and risk making my acne and depression worse. The first two months sucked, emotionally. I would get very depressed during the placebo week for some reason, but I've always struggled with anxiety and depression so it wasn't something new and might not have been correlated to the pill. It has somewhat improved my skin, and I went from being an oily mess to having more dry/normal-looking skin. I still get a pimple or two every month, which I'm okay with.

No significant changes with weight or sex drive...yet.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I feel sorry for all of the bad experiences on here, but I love Tri-Sprintec! I was on it for 6 years until my doctor switched me to the mini pill to help my migraines. The mini pill didn't agree with me and switched back to Tri-Sprintec after just 3 months. On Tri-Sprintec I have regular periods, no cramping, my acne clears up, and I love that I have more wiggle room with late or missed pills without loss of protection. The only cons are headaches, but I’ve had migraines all my life and to be honest I’d rather have migraines than cystic acne. I’m on a mood stabilizer for depression, so I don’t notice any ‘extra’ depression or hormone irregularity, other than being a little emotional right before my period starts. It does make me kind of hyper/antsy, so I’d recommend taking in the morning or before regular workouts. Hope this review helps!

name: Cryselle
comments:
Do not take Cryselle. Terrible mood swings and irregular periods.
I started taking Cryselle for pregnancy prevention and to maintain regular periods at the age of 18. After less than 3 years later, I developed a severe blood clot in my right leg due to the amount of estrogen in this pill.

name: Adderall
comments: I was diagnosed with a severe case of narcolepsy about a year ago. I always thought it was my chronic fatigue that made me feel so sleepy all the time. I was finally referred to a sleep specialist who ordered a night and day time sleep study. When I received the results he told me I was a very sleepy person, his worst case in many years. I have been taking 20MG Adderall 3x a day. It does help but I'm still extremely tired throughout the day. The sleep doctor advised me in September that there's a newer medication that can be added to my Adderall but insurance didn't like to approve it and that in 6 months hopefully it will be easier to prescribe. I've seen somewhere that 60MG a day is the max for treating ADHD but that 90MG is the max for treating narcolepsy. I'm curious if that dose would improve my symptoms. Overall I'm happy with the medication as I never notice any side effects. I just want to feel more awake and less sleepy.

name: QNASL
comments: I have year round allergies and have tried everything, shots, antihistamines, Flonase and nothing ever worked. For 20 yrs I had three of four sinus infections a yr because of my allergies. My ENT finally put me on Qnsal and within three days my symptoms were gone. I was on it for four years and all of a sudden every pharmacy in a town was out of it and couldn't get it. That's been a year ago and I'm still waiting for them to get it in stock. I'm back to taking Flonase which drains down the back of my throat and leaves an awful taste in my mouth. I miss my Qnsal

name: ParaGard
comments: I have had the IUD for almost 10 months now and I am debating getting it taken out. I was prepared for more cramping and heavier periods (those are common side effects) but I wasn’t prepared for sharp cramping almost all the time. Before the IUD I had a very predictable cycle every 35ish days and got cramps the first day or two of period. Now I feel like I get a period randomly every 2-3 weeks and there is no way to track when I will be bleeding/cramping or not. I feel in almost constant pain. Then I’ve also felt much more anxious, depressed and irritable and have gained significant weight. There may be no way to know whether these symptoms are actually caused by the IUD or other things going on in my life, but they seem to have appeared right after insertion and are similar to other reviews. It’s hard to decide whether to get it removed because if I get it out, I have to try another option which may have similar side effects anyway. Bleh :/

name: Apri
comments: I have been on this pill for about a year to help with break through bleeding and horrible cramps. It took about 6 months but no more break through bleeding. It makes me have irregular periods but I don't mind because this is the first pill, injection, patch of any kind that has stopped my awful cramps. I did gain some weight but it is all worth it to not be in pain.

name: ParaGard
comments: I wanted to love my ParaGard, I really did. I had mine inserted in August of 2019. A few weeks after insertion I began having UTI's, dull bladder pain that lasted weeks if not months. In mid 2020 things started to get a little better, no more UTI's and less discomfort in my bladder. Now I seem to be getting what may be BV or yeast infections, and I mean constantly. Every other week pee burns for a couple hours until I take a probiotic. I believe it's the copper is messing with my natural vaginal biome that's causing me to be so prone to infections. I love that it is such an effective form of birth control, but the BV and yeast infections are unbearable. I see myself having it removed and replaced with Mirena in a few months if things don't get better. If you are someone prone to UTI's/yeast infections/BV, you may want to run in the other direction from ParaGard.

name: Sprintec
comments: Ok I love this pill. I know a lot of birth controls warn about gaining weight but it was the opposite for me I actually lost weight and my skin has never been clearer since I started. My periods are more regular and not super heavy. I still get my cramps but they aren’t terrible that’s the only real con but everything else is great

name: Ocella
comments: If you have IBS or any issues at ALL with your stomach, I do not recommend this pill. Not only was I severely depressed, moody, and anxious more than I had ever been in my life, but I also had terrible bowel movements and stomach pain and pelvic pain. I could not eat anything normally for 3 weeks and I've been off the pill for about 2 months now and my stomach is finally just now regulating. Everyone is different, but this pill was the worst mistake for me. (I was only on it for a month)

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started this pill December 8th when I started my 1st period after having my daughter and this pill has my period all out of whack. It is going on 4 weeks with this period and let's just say I'm over it. I'm about to stop this pill. DON'T TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL!!!!!!

name: Gianvi
comments: I started Gianvi after 3 months of using Yaz. I’m not happy at all. I’m due to start my 2nd pack today but I think that I’m just going to discontinue using it. Yesterday, I experienced serious mood swings and today isn’t any better. I’ve been an emotional wreck and I don’t like the way that it makes me feel.

name: Apri
comments: I started this Apri birth control pill when I was 18 and loved it. I didn’t notice/have any side effects. After being on it for about 6 years, I started getting recurrent yeast infections and break through bleeding before every period. I decided to stop taking the pill, due to several reasons with the intention of getting an IUD eventually. I realized after stopping this pill that I had zero sex drive at all while taking this - like zero. I wasn’t very sexually active before taking the pill, so I thought what I was feeling was normal. I now realize this pill heavily suppressed my sex drive. Also a few weeks after stopping this, I noticed a small bald spot on the back of my head and have also noticed hair thinning/loss. It’s common after stopping the pill and doesn’t happen to everyone, but is something I’m still going through 4 months after stopping this and just wanted people to know it can happen and that you’re not crazy if it does!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started taking Loestrin 1/20 in the middle of November and I did not experience any weight gain, my weight stayed the same, however I did notice more acne on my back as well as a few on my face, they went away however but I still noticed that my skin was breaking out more which defeated the purpose of taking the pill since I mainly like taking it for acne control. The worst side effect was bleeding for more than 2 and a half weeks almost 3 weeks on this pill. In the middle of December, I started bleeding even though I take the pills at the same time every single day. This is annoying, will be switching to a new pill once this pack is finished. Overall I would say that it is a good pill despite the constant bleeding which is annoying.

name: ParaGard
comments: Had the Paraguard for 4 years before FINALLY getting it removed. Worst experience ever. Horrible periods would last at least 12 days super heavy. Developed many ovarian cysts and was in excruciating pain during period. Horrible birth control.

name: Sprintec
comments: This medication Sprintec caused me to have several blood clots in both of my lungs. I almost died. I was admitted, had next day surgery and now have a $150,000 hospital bill.  I only took 1 pack and was on my second week on the next pack. I doubt have a family history of blood clots.  I wouldn't take this if I were you.  Especially not African American females.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: In the past 5 years, I have been on two different birth control pills. I decided to switch to Junel Fe because the other pill wasn’t helping with my period. This pill, however, was a huge mistake. I have been on it for a short time but it has made me extremely depressed. I have never has mental health issues in the past, and as soon as I started taking this pill I noticed huge mood swings. I cry all the time, and I am extremely emotional. I would not recommend this to anyone.

name: Aviane
comments: I just went on this birth control Aviane a few weeks ago and immediately suffered nausea for the first several days. As soon as that stopped I had the worst acne I have ever had in my life.  It has turned me into an emotional wreck where I cry for no reason. I know they say give it a few months, but I’m done with hormonal birth control this is the second kind I have taken and both ruin my life. It’s worse than being pregnant.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was previously on Microgestin for 5 years prior to this. The only reason for the switch is because Walmart doesn’t always carry the same generic. I didn’t realize it then, but realize now the awful side effects this caused me. ‘They’ say all genetics are the same, but I don’t believe that for a second. Microgestin was great. Junel gave me regular yeast infections, lots of bloating and water retention, more acne, and did nothing to help my pre menopausal symptoms (night sweats and hot flashes). It also made me way more emotional than I normally am. I hated this pill and wish I would have put two and two together more quickly.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: Let me just say this, this stuff will mess your whole cycle up. You may miss a period for a month and it won’t be regular. So, don’t panic. If your period hasn’t come yet, then take a pregnancy test. And if you’re still unsure, go to your primary care doctor to get a blood pregnancy test just to rule out your results. Also, I didn’t get pregnant.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: Do not rely on this product, it does not work and nothing comes out of the dispenser and all you do is waste pumps. My pharmacist tried to get it to work to no avail. I called the manufacturer, TEVA and their customer service rep told me to rinse it under warm water, nope still cannot dispense anything. This is my 4th. dispenser and they are all defective. I went back to using Ventolin which my insurance doesn't cover, but at least when I need a rescue inhaler, this one works. DO NOT BUY - terrible product.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Loestrin Fe 1/20 was my first experience with birth control at age 20. I initially wanted to start birth control to help my hormonal acne, as well as start contraception, and my doctor prescribed this one. My experience with Loestrin Fe 1/20 was ok. I didn't have any side effects that were too bad- no weight gain, no nausea or headaches, no bloating, no mood changes. However, by breasts were sore the entire time I was on this pill and after three months it was not helping my acne. In fact, it may have made it slightly worse. I did not have a horrible experience with this pill, and it did its job of preventing pregnancy. A lot of doctors will prescribe this brand if its your first time on BC, so it's worth trying it out for a few months before you decide if you want to switch or not. I ended up switching because of the acne issue. Apparently norethindrone acetate is one type of progestin hormone that can cause acne, oops.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments:
I have been on this pill Tri-Lo-Sprintec for about half a year now. My first 2/3 months on the pill gave me some headaches and nausea, but soon went away by the 3rd month. It makes my period last about 3-4 days and my cramps are not as severe. It seems great to stop pregnancy,since it hasn’t gotten me pregnant and I have sex very often. I do have 2 negatives tho. 
The first 2/3 months gave me bad breakouts, but since then it has been clearing up and only deal with pimples here and there. The main negative is how it controlled my hunger level. I’ll be extremely hungry but then barely eat when I get the chance. Some days this doesn’t happen but I’ve been noticing I don’t eat as much as I used to. I do get very hungry tho as I get closer to my period. If you’d like to know health wise to help you, I am about 5”6 and weigh 140 pounds. I suffer from depression and anxiety. My mental illness do not seem to worsen on this and I’ve been about the same weight. Only difference I have seen is slight breast growth.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I love it, I prefer it to the others I have tried.

name: Seasonique
comments: My mood swings have never been so bad. I used to only get bad PMS about a week before my period. Now it’s all the time. Also, between the last couple periods, I’ve been getting blood clots and constant dried blood so I was pretty much on my period for 3 months. This is the worst birth control I’ve ever been on

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started Junel Fe almost a year ago, and it hasn’t been bad except for the fact that it does not control my acne like I was told it would. I was previously on Yaz, which was amazing and kept my skin looking like porcelain, but switched due to it causing me to bleed a lot. My doctor said Junel would keep me acne free, but it has caused me to break out bad. I get clusters of white heads on my chin and my forehead and the weekly pimple somewhere on my face. I hate it. It has also caused my sex drive to drop significantly. I’m gonna give Yaz another shot and take my chances. Good at preventing pregnancy, but not for treating acne.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I was switched to Nora-Be from generic Beyaz. I have horrible issues with estrogen (mainly caused my PCOS and PMDD) and so I needed a progestin only option. Currently on pack one and will update again in a few months but it’s amazing how much my PMDD/intrusive thoughts have decreased since starting this. No issues with acne or weight so far. Birth control is so individual that it can be trial and error to see what works. There are so many different kinds of progestin that certain ones you swear by may be awful for other women. This is just my current experience with Nora-Be, will be back to update!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Whoaaa, so glad I'm not alone with all of these side effects!! After having my last baby I dealt with unbearable periods and cramps while ovulating, to the point it was getting in the way with every day life. Was checked for Endo and was cleared of that so my OB prescribed Junel Fe to me. First couple months seemed great! Very light and almost non existent cramps. After a few months migraine after migraine. Lashing out at my family for no reason, depression, felt like nothing in life mattered, and absolutely NO sex drive. The thought of sex made me feel sick to my stomach ( my poor husband lol ). After discussing with my husband that I felt the pill was to blame for all of this I stopped taking it. A little over a week later I am feeling amazing and am even starting to think about sex again. Yippy. Just hoping not to get pregnant lol . All in all...if this is prescribed to you please ask for something else!!

name: Take Action
comments: Please do not be discouraged ladies! Take Action worked for me. I took it within 36 hours with a full bottle of water. I was nauseous for about two days and other than that I was fine. No other side effects. My period came about a week early. My current weight is 203 pounds. I know this drug is not 100% effective but there is a HUGE possibility that it will work. #BeBlessed

name: Cryselle
comments: When I first started this birth control, I was extremely skeptical considering all of the reviews seemed to be negative. Prior to trying Cryselle, I was on 5 other birth control pills but had bad reactions to all of them. Severe acne, anxiety, depression, and non-stop spotting were some of the side effects I had on other pills. When I tried Cryselle, I had the best results yet. Light, little to no periods, no weight gain, no acne, no changes in mood. The first few weeks I felt a little fatigued, but it went away after a month or two. If you are skeptical about going on this birth control, I recommend giving it a go. It was definitely worth it, and it's been the best birth control I've ever been on, with no noticeable side effects.

name: Nora-Be
comments: This is the most awful birth control pill I’ve ever taken in my entire life, and I’ve tried several. I took it exactly on time every day for one week. Starting with day 3, I had a constant headache, nausea, acne, pain in my legs, generalized pain in my body (back, joints, etc). By day 5 I was bleeding a little, then by day 7 I was bleeding a LOT - like if someone just drew blood straight from my arm and dumped it in the toilet. It wasn’t even like normal period blood it was so bright red and thin. And on top of the other symptoms, I was dizzy and had cramping, too. It also gave me intense hot flashes and a slight fever, I was sweating practically all the time, and I would wake up several times a night. AWFUL I would absolutely never recommend this pill to anyone. If I could give it negative stars, I would.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on this birth control Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 1/2 almost 3 years. The first 2 years were great. Cleared up my acne, no PMS symptoms, period was light, no side effects. This past year or 1/2 year, I have had nothing but issues. Periods are a bit heavier & irregular, for the first time I got migraines 3 days in a row with some nausea. I also have started having panic attacks, a bit of depression, & anxiety, which is so unlike me. Thinking about going off of this.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I'M on day 19 of breakthrough bleeding. My doctor said to double up until the bleeding stops and I’m on day 5 of doubling up with no stopping. No other side effects other than the bleeding won’t go away

name: Take Action
comments: Took this pill after my boyfriend forgot to pull out. Went to get Plan B and Walgreens said they weren't getting much Plan B due to covid. This has the same exact medication as Plan B in it, sometimes I hear both plan b and take action can cause your periods to come late mine was 2 days late but no pregnancy.  It's like 5 to 10 dollars cheaper has the exact same medication in it and works just as good. Never will I waste my money on plan b again! I know plan b's ratings are higher but that's only because take action is new.

name: Qvar
comments: My doctor perscribed this for maintenance of my asthma. I've had non-stop symptoms for over a year with recent exacerbation that sent me to the ER. First few days were great. I noticed an almost instant improvement in my lung function. My breathing came easier, my lungs were clear of inflammation. By day 5 I had developed a consistent headache and pressure behind both eyes and extreme agitation that would make me tremble throughout the day. I had to stop taking it immediately per my doctor. It takes time for side effects to develop, so give it an honest go. But listen to your body for sure.

name: Take Action
comments: So I had unprotected sex on the Dec 13th I took the pill the next day Dec 14th I had bad headaches since on and off and dizziness and fatigue.  I would not recommend this pill Plan B has not done this to me ever.  My period was due Dec 24th (today) nothing not even spotting I took a few pregnancy test came back very faint lines I’m still in denial I’m going to give my period till the end of the month if not going to the doctors

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: I have unprotected sex on the 12 and I took the Plan B contraceptive pill about 33 hours after. He didn’t ejaculate into me but I was still afraid of precum so I took the pill. I ovulated on the 5 so it was 7 days after. My period was going to come the 19th but the pill delayed my period by 5 days as some side effects said. At first I had lots of brown discharge so I was afraid it wasn’t my period but implantation. Thankfully the next day red blood came which was me period. Before my period started my breasts were in lots of pain as well as bad cramps. After taking the pill I was feeling lots of fatigue for two days. But thankfully I got my period and my cramps are really bad. Please don’t have unprotected sex. This was my first pregnancy scare and my first time having sex and no one needs to go through so much worry and fear. Considering PMS symptoms and period symptoms are nearly the same this was very nerve wrecking. If you're worried, don’t be. It’ll be okay.

name: Aviane
comments: The first birth control that I’ve been prescribed and no problems whatsoever. At first, I was skeptical because of the common side effects and the negative reviews, but this brand has made my periods shorter and lighter (and no babies haha). The only side effect I have gotten is my boobs growing in size, but I ain’t got a problem with that lmao. I would highly recommend giving it a try :) *I’ve been on it for a little over 3 months now*

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I’m so glad to see others going through similar experiences to what I am.  I have only been taking Portia for two months and the side effects have been crazy.  To start, like many others have said, the mood swings are ridiculous.  I found myself feeling randomly depressed for no real reason and even crying on occasion (this is out of the norm for me), and my acne has gotten out of control.  I’m breaking out in places I hardly ever do and also in places I never have in the past.  Normally my acne is extremely mild and manageable.  My periods are also a lot heavier in the first couple of days which is another clear sign that this BC is too intense for me.  Normally messy periods coincide with messy side effects for me.  I was suggested to try this BC and I’ve already asked to change to something else, this is a terrible product and not at all worth the trouble.  Do not take this!

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: I had unprotected sex the last day of my ovulation window. My partner completely finished inside of me and I took plan b within an hour of having sex. I freaked out because I read reviews saying that the pill doesn’t work if you ovulated already. 2 days after taking the pill I had fatigue, major nausea, and lots of anxiety. 9 days after taking the pill, I started getting sharp pains on and off on my pelvis area. 2 days later I started getting brown/pinkish discharge. A day before my expected period day I began spotting. I officially got my period a 1 day later from the expected period day! This pill worked for me. The pill gives you similar symptoms to pregnancy and made my anxiety levels a lot higher. Be patient and good luck!!!

name: Ajovy
comments: I am so glad that I found site this today, because it reassures me that other people may have had similar experiences. I have had awful migraines for a few years--10 a month at least. After trying all sorts of remedies, my new neurologist recommended Ajovy, and I was really hopeful. I gave myself my second injection 5 days ago. The first month my migraines disappeared for about a week. Yesterday and today I suddenly got vertigo so badly mid-day that I had to lie down and put my feet up (although I don't have a headache today). I am really glad that I am off work and wasn't driving when it happened. My face and hands are tingling and I am having PVC's (I am already being treated for PVC's with medication but they are strong enough that they are breaking through). I can't be this dizzy and function as a mother and teacher. Unfortunately, I am not taking this stuff again.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I mostly love this pill, mostly. I have been using it continuously for the past two years, and out of those two years I've probably had my period about 6 times. With taking it continuously, I am not supposed to get my period. It's GREAT for a few months, you feel great, very good protection against conception, and easy. But, every now and then I will start to bleed randomly. If I keep taking the pill while bleeding, there is brown blood that will linger for about 2 weeks, BUT if its my actual if I stop my medicine for about 5-7 days, I can let myself have a period, and then start over. I really don't like it when I start spotting and bleeding randomly, with no clue. Has ruined underwear, and been embarrassing. I would say it's a  I really like it / really don't like it relationship with this birth control. It works spectacular against pregnancy, and is great for a little bit, until your vagina has enough and decides it needs to have a period, even though technically it isn't necessary.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I love this pill because it takes my appetite away and that's a good thing. No breast tenderness. No break through bleeding or nausea. No hair loss. I don't know if it is doing what it's supposed to be doing. It's too early to tell. But I'm not cramping and bleeding excessively. Thats good but even if I were that no appetite thing is the bomb diggaty!

name: Sprintec
comments: Horrible experience. I was on Sprintec for a little over a month. I always had a headache and felt nauseous once I began taking it. One day out of the blue I had serious shooting pains in my stomach and turns out I developed a cyst on my right ovary (never had this problem before) doctor told me that it looked like the cyst had been there for about a month. Mind you I just started taking the medicine a little over a month ago. I do not recommend. I normally don’t leave reviews but I needed to share my experience and hope this helps!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This birth control is horrible. I was switched to it from another and have had numerous side effects. Do not take this product. It has made me uncontrollably emotional for no reason and cause weight gain. Stay away.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel Fe 1/20 was the worst experience ever. It gives me a huge mood swings, including extremely easy to be irritated or very easy to cry for tiny details. What even worse is that my period is now out of order. Sometimes I have 0 periods within a month, but I have two periods within a horrible experience. I talked to kaiser doctor several times, and they refused to change the prescription.

name: ParaGard
comments: I had it for 9 yrs. Insertion left me in the worst pain I’ve ever felt for a few days. Bloating continued for months after. I became prone to infections and had many throughout the years. I started seeing vitamin deficiencies along with being significantly weaker, fatter and had more pains. I started having premature greying, cystic acne and ovarian pain. Year 9 it worsened. I also had fibromyalgia, diarrhea, low back pain and trouble staying asleep. The doc did verify an ovarian cyst but still didn’t suspect the IUD. A friend did. I got it out, rebalanced vitamin deficiencies and cut dairy.
