It has been 8 months post removal and orgasming is easier, there’s no pain during sex anymore, period blood doesn’t smell, taste isn’t off, bowels and sleep are normal. No more ovarian cyst. I still have some issues but they are improving. I would have never done this to myself if I had known how it does effect hormones and health significantly.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Don’t do it. Nausea, headaches (severe), heard about the spotting didn’t think it would happen to me but it did, cramps/abdominal pain. Save yourself. Estrogen made my stomach weak. Really bad mood swings, luckily my boyfriend is nice. Hungry all the time, empty feeling even after eating. Tired as anything.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: I promised myself if I got my period I would share so here I am with it 4 days early!! Trust me it works ladies! I had sex with my boyfriend 2 days before I was supposed to ovulate and I was freaking out because we were so into it he nutted in me. It was too late at night to get a Plan B but I went in the morning. They say if your already in your week of ovulation plan b “doesn't work” but I risked it anyways. I took the pill within 10 hours after I had sex hoping and praying it would work. I was very tired for 2 days once I took the pill but that’s all the side effects I had. Even if you think it too late ladies it’s not. Go and get a plan b it will work.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Hi. My 19 yr old daughter was taking Junel for 7 months and we found out she has a blood clot in her lungs so now my baby is taking blood thinners for 6 months to see if it will go away & if not she’s going to be on blood thinners for the rest of her life. So I’m so very annoyed so I’m just saying STOP taking this birth control now!!

name: Ajovy
comments: I was diagnosed with vestibular migraine in 2018. Mostly dizziness,  vertigo, mild headaches,  etc. I had a bad episode in August 2020, along with a migraine. In September, my neuro gave me a sample injection of Ajovy which broke the VM cycle and migraine.  I was soooo happy. After a few weeks of being on cloud nine, the following symptoms started: severe back, neck pain, bloating, constipation,  racing heart and palpation, agitation,  anxiety and panic, joint and muscle pain, fatigue (more than normal with VM), chest pain, difficulty breathing.  It takes about 5 months for your body to clear one dose. I have 2 more months. My back still hurts around my kidney area. Adding fuel to the fire, I got Covid-19 at the end of October 2020, which made all the symptoms worse. Im happy and thankful to God that I'm feeling better. Overall, if you suffer from chronic VM or migraine, I think it is worth a go, no pun intended. It maybe very successful for you.

name: Aviane
comments: I’ve been using this birth control for 6 months now, the first and second month this pill made me extremely sick by the 3rd month I was okay it then gave me really bad acne wish I’ve never had, it did eventually go away but also by the 3rd month  “it gave me a horribly low libido, I’m like the Sahara desert causing me to have very painful sex. I have try all kinds of libido boosters but nothing works.

name: Antabuse
comments:
I’ve been on an off Antabuse for the past 5 years. I’ve been a black out drinker for most of my 20’s and in 30’s managed it a little better (no blackouts at least) with the help of the drug. 
I am shocked by the messages from people whom it hasn’t affected when having a drink ! I guess everyone’s different but I wouldn’t trust everyone out there who say they have been taking it. We drinkers can be great at deceiving. I like Antabuse because it stops the obsession and longest I’ve been sober was about 18 months. Now I’m playing with fire a bit - I might binge on the weekend, regret it , take an Antabuse Tuesday , then stop taking it and try drinking on Friday. Every time I get an incredible red rash all over my body , including my face. I get heart palpitations and strong flu like symptoms. Blocked nose and banging headache. Just after one pill. So , I recommend don’t play around with it !

name: Sprintec
comments:
I just started taking this birth control about 3 weeks ago and here’s what I’ve noticed: (I’m 24)
-increased appetite 
-extreme lower back pain (I’m talking can’t bend over, that just started 2 days ago) 
-canker sores (unsure if this is related but I RARELY get them and right now I have 2)
-pain during sex 
-heavy vaginal bleeding for a few days when I started it 

Nothing else! So far it’s been ok. Not a fan of the side effects but it’s not horrible either.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I notice short dosing across lots of QVAR inhalers starting at 25 doses left. By 15 doses left, I might as well not use it. Frustrating because it on formulary. The company replaces them but who wants to call every month?  I have reported to FDA twice.  If not for this, would rate a 10.

name: Aviane
comments: Taking this birth control made me feel like I was going crazy. My mood swings were horrible and I was so irritable. I was so depressed while on it and it also gave me back acne. I also feel like I got way more yeast infections while I was on it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: It’s been working well for me besides the nausea and bloating. I worry because I haven’t gotten my period in a few months and I keep taking tests and they all come back negative so I assume it’s the pills stopping my period. I do get light spotting every now and then but that’s about it. I might switch because the whole no period thing scares me a bit but everywhere I read that’s a normal thing to happen. It’s also cleared up my skin tremendously and I only get like 1 pimple every month or so.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started out on Necon back in the 80's worked great but was taken off the market.  No side effects and perfect skin as well. I'm on Nortrel now as a hormone replacement therapy taking it continuously 1/35 and works perfectly for me. Without it I have horrible menopausal symptoms. This keeps me feeling well and happy. I need my hormones and this works. Please keep making it!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been taking Loestrin Fe 1/20 for almost 3 months and it is AWFUL!!! I have breakthrough bleeding more often than not and this stuff makes me vomit daily. I know it’s the pill because once I take the placebo pills no more vomiting. I do not recommend.

name: Sprintec
comments:
"Studies show no connection between the pill and weight gain..." I went over 15 years on a steady weight, steady diet, and activity level. Started this pill and within 4 yrs 25lbs gained. Yes this pill caused me to gain weight. 

PROS:
Reduced period cramps/pain
Period on a set schedule
Lighter shorter flow
Clear glowing skin (in combination with CeraVe and womens vitamin)
Calmer mood, no mood swings
Less anxiety
No babies

CONS:
No sex drive
Weight gain
Occasional feeling of morning sickness
Recurring bacterial vaginosis (while being sexually inactive)

name: Seasonique
comments: I was on this birth control Seasonique for 5 years and unfortunately didn’t recognize the bad side effects until a few months ago. I really enjoyed only have 4 periods a year but it wasn’t worth the MAJOR hair loss, almost daily panic attacks, weight gain and stints of depression. Since discontinuing taking the pill 3 months ago, I have lost 20 pounds without changing my diet or exercise, my mental health has improved, and I just feel better overall. This just wasn’t the right choice for me.

name: ParaGard
comments:
It astounds me that this method of birth control is even an option. I had it for a week and that was enough. Within the first few days I was experiencing joint pain, horrible anxiety, insomnia, anger, brain fog, irritability, all the long term side effects of copper toxicity. 

Looking back, my doctor never once mentioned anything about paragard. Upon removal he said, "that's surprising that you are experiencing this, it's just copper." Another friend of mine who works in the hospital also made the remark that, "copper toxicity doesn't exist." 

This literally blows my mind. The copper in paragard creates a toxic and hostile environment within the uterus. When you think about it, how on earth would this NOT effect our physical and mental health.
Moral of the story: it might be worth it, it might not. Listen to your body.

name: Aviane
comments: I have been on this pill (Aviane) for almost 4 months, and so far have had a pleasant experience! I’m not pregnant, have minimal cramps along with light and shorter periods. No noticeable weight gain or other side effects, just sometimes some nausea if I eat right before bed along with taking it. But overall recommend:)

name: Apri
comments: I have been taking Apri for 4 months now. I first went on the pill to regulate my hormones and treat acne. After reading the reviews I was hesitant. The first month was a little rough (slight breakouts and mood swings) but it did get better with time. I have really liked the pill and my experience has been good.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I used RediHaler for several years without a problem.  This year they began to stop working with about 50 puffs remaining.  When the first device stopped working, I called the company and received a replacement; lots of rigamarole and a conference call involved.  However, subsequent RediHalers have also malfunctioned.  The older version worked much better.

name: ParaGard
comments: I had the ParagGard IUD implanted 3 years 10 months ago.  I just had it removed yesterday.  It wasn't until I was relaxing on the couch with my family after dinner that I realized my nightly panic and anxiety wasn't setting in as expected.  In fact, I was, dare I say, my old self.  I had my phone near by and I typed in a search put into the simplest phrase possible, not expecting results: Does a copper IUD cause anxiety?  Google didn't have to think too hard before spilling article after article confirming it

name: Sprintec
comments: My experience using Sprintec has been horrible to say the least I have been on it for 2 months My anxiety is through the roof I wake up in the middle of the night with panic attacks, I have been bleeding for two months straight it’s the most traumatizing experience I ever had with birth control. Every morning I wake up it feels like my water broke and right when I think my period has stopped two days later it comes back even harder! I use super plus tampons and it doesn’t even last me through the night. Before this birth control I was having regular period that doesn’t last more than a week now I’m still on my cycle. Just want to share my experience because I wish I would’ve did more research before I tried this birth control.

name: Claravis
comments: My 15 year old daughter had really bad acne. They tried everything and nothing worked, OCBC, antibx, creams etc. Then they tried Claravis and it finally worked after a few months. But then she had to stop taking it because you can only take it for a certain amount of months. Well After a few months her acne is back with a vengeance and now she is very disappointed and sad, mainly because her dermatologist promised her it would be gone after she stops taking it. Even tho I knew nothing is never a 100% guarantee. So back to square one.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: DONT DO IT! Please refrain from using this. I’ve only been on it for 5 days and I have symptoms of extreme nausea, and the WORST headaches.

name: ParaGard
comments: I got ParaGard inserted as a birthday gift for my boyfriend! I’ve had it for almost a year now. Insertion was awful. It’s been a painful year for me with crazy amount of bleeding & cramps. First 6 months I had 10 day periods and intense cramping. I went back to the hospital and was told that Ibuprofen helps with bleeding. Now with Ibuprofen my periods are down to normal 4-6 day periods. It seems like every month my periods are getting shorter and less painful. One thing I really don't like is the cramp that I feel 3-4 days before my period starts. Out of nowhere I will have 3-4 hour long terrible cramps but no bleeding. I basically live addicted to Ibuprofen and I am always ready to take one as soon as a cramp starts. Despite of all the cons I am actually happy with it because my relationship with my boyfriend totally improved since we stopped freaking out about the possibility of me being pregnant. Also stay away from vibrators because it can cause cramping.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel is the worst birth control I have ever taken. I first started birth control 4 years ago to protect against pregnancy and regulate my period and have gone through a few brands. I paused birth control for a couple months before starting again with Junel. As soon as I started taking this pill my sex drive disappeared, I experienced vaginal dryness, extreme and constant breast tenderness, breast enlargement, depression, and stomach cramps. I would strongly recommend not taking this pill if you can help it. Most miserable experience I've had on birth control. I will say I didn't get pregnant and my period was regulated so it did it's job. My weight didn't fluctuate and my acne did, however there are a few other factors that could have contributed to that so I cannot blame Junel for that.

name: Sprintec
comments: My stomach has been causing me a lot of pain and my nipples are so tender for weeks on end! If my stomach isn't hurting I'm hungry CONSTANTLY and tend to over-eat even if I'm full, which is very unlike me usually. My depression is now much more random and intense, I am SO EXHAUSTED AND HAVE NO ENERGY ALL THE TIME! If anything my home life and sleep schedule has improved in the last couple months so it has to be this medication causing this constant exhaustion. I do not skip any periods, I occasionally will take my pill without food but rarely. I'm concerned because the nausea is causing me to miss work which is a big NO for me. I may need to switch to something else but I'm hoping as time goes by it will get better since I've only been using it for 2 months, but so far THIS MONTH IS MUCH WORSE than the last. I do believe it has helped prevent pregnancy but only 2 months isn't enough time to know for sure.

name: Lessina
comments: I have been on this birth control for about 3 months now. The first month was fine. Last month I started developing horrible boob pain and veins coursing all over them. Then I noticed spider veins on my hips and then on my butt. I have occasional leg pains. I’m wondering if anyone else has experienced this? I also have headaches, occasional nausea, lacking motivation, really bad appetite changes (one day super hungry, next day don’t wanna eat), starting to feel depressed and anxiety increasing by a ton. I just feel generally tired and am thinking of switching pills.

name: Sprintec
comments: I've been taking Sprintec for 3 months now and I have had no issues with it, besides from very mild break outs on my chin. I did notice more clotting during my period and occasionally watery discharge, but nothing problematic, these are just some slight changes I have noticed. I had never been on birth control before and after reading these reviews I was so nervous. I recommend trying it, keep in mind everyone reacts different and people are more likely to write reviews about bad experiences not good, especially with something like this! Hope it works for you too!

name: Amethyst
comments: I’ve been on about 5 brands of birth controls in the past 3 years, and this brand  Amethyst  was the worst I’ve ever been on. I was on for 6 months, I had breakthrough bleeding almost everyday, and when I wasn’t having breakthrough bleeding, I would bleed after sex. My mood was uncontrollable, and I couldn’t stand being on this pill.

name: ParaGard
comments:
Awful, creepy, unnatural, not worth it. Avoid this little alien. It hurts, but more, it is interrupting the most sensitive and valuable areas of the female body. There are so many risks and complications doctors won't tell you about.
Getting mine out in a week, so desperate to get it out of me, almost considering taking it out myself. 
It works by pumping your uterus with copper and causing a constant state of inflammation. I can feel mine, constantly. Like dull aching, irritation. 
Women need the truth. This is awful.

name: Sprintec
comments: I love Sprintec! I switched birth control to Nexplanon and had a terrible experience and switched right back to Sprintec. I’ve been on it for almost 5 years and the only issue I’ve had is spotting with some antibiotics. Overall great birth control and easy to skip periods if that’s something you’re looking for!

name: Ocella
comments: I was on Ocella when I was 16 for about three months. In those three months I became severely depressed, I was uncontrollably angry and sad every day of my life, I gained 20 pounds, and I became recluse. This might just be a unique experience for me but please talk to your doctor before you have your mind set on this birth-control. It barely helped with my cramps which is the reason I was taking it. I don’t think, in my opinion, that it was worth it. It took two years for the effects to wear off.

name: ParaGard
comments: Recently got the Paragard put in after avoiding birth control for 10+ years. I didn’t want anything with hormones and was terrified of birth control altogether. I did a ton of research and asked my OBGYN a million questions before finally deciding on Paragard. The insertion was WAY less painful/uncomfortable than I was lead to believe. Minor cramping for about 30 seconds and that’s it. She warned me about a “pinch” but I didn’t even feel it. Other than the first few days of bleeding/spotting, I barely remember it’s in there. No changes to my skin/mood/etc. I consider myself very lucky after reading all the reviews but every-body is different. It’s worth a go trying this out to see if it works for you because at the end of the day, they can just take it out if it doesn’t work for you. The first few periods weren’t exactly pleasant but what period is? I’ve read over time the additional pain/added days go away. Which IMO make this no hormone option well worth it.

name: silver nitrate
comments: I have been having treatment with silver nitrate on my Wound & it makes my skin look gray or kind of dark color. It is slowly improving my wound. Sometimes it causes a really bad burning pain on the wound when used.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been on this medication Junel Fe 1/20 for about 3 months now. I haven’t had side effects except for breast tenderness before the placebo week. Made my period super light and through the pack I experience periodical brown discharge. Other than that it’s great, I didn’t gain any weight and my sex drive is normal.

name: Ajovy
comments: Took my first shot 10/6/2020.  NOT ONE migraine for the whole month!  Towards the end of 30 days, I started feeling a small headache coming on, but nothing like a migraine.  Second shot 11/8/2020.  Within a few days, tendonitis .  I have never suffered from this condition.  I saw my ENT today and there is a hearing loss in one ear.  I'm not sure if it has anything to do with Ajovy.  It's be a month now since that 2nd shot.  No migraines, but the ringing won't stop!  I'm really hoping it does.  For now, seeing my ENT and neurologist to get to the bottom of this issue.  This drug is still just too new to experiment on people.

name: Ajovy
comments: My doctor gave me a sample of Ajovy and the first month was great. I went from having migraines 5 days a week to only one. The next month I received a 3-month pack for only $5. Sadly I had a two month gap then I went back on a Ajovy and it no longer had a positive effect. At the end of the 30 days I started to get very dizzy and somewhat disoriented. The dizziness lasted over a week. Then I would take a Ajovy again the next month then after three weeks I started to get very dizzy & now  my BP is elevated & my face gets numb -I’ve felt terrible for over 2 weeks now & after reading many of the testimonials here I figured it’s the medication side effects. I am no longer going to take this medication hope I can flush it from my system and will take recommendations on how to detoxify. I ended up searching “Ajovy is making me dizzy” and that’s how I found this helpful site. Thank you everyone for sharing. -G

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments:
Please don't use this drug Wixela Inhub. I started using Wixel 2 months ago.  I'm always afraid of new medicine so I started taking it at 2 puffs a day for my asthma.  
I developed sore throat, headaches, voice  hoarse, then heart racing.  I have a neurological illness as well so I thought it was the problem.  3 weeks ago I had a possible TIA (ministroke). I'm only 55. Lost sight totally in my left eye for hours with increased weakness and headache.  Today I thought to look into this inhaler for side effects.  Then checked the reviews here . I won't ever use this again. I  need to live to care for my daughter.  This medication shouldn't be on the market.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Sprintec
comments: I have only taken these pills for 19 days . At first I was so excited to eventually be skipping my period all together . I started to get mild cramps and light brown bleeding . My instinct was this is soooooo much better ! Literally was bragging. Two days later I have never in my life ever experienced cramping and pain like I have . The nausea and the abdominal pain is way more unbearable then my regular period. I would rather have my regular period back any day. I can feel my ovaries and they feel like they are about to burst . Cannot wait to call the doctor. Stopping immediately!!!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Ever since I started taking Junel fe, I’ve been having mood swings and I would get really irritated easily & emotional at times. Is only been a month and I am going to stop taking it. I know I should give it more time to work but I cannot deal with the dark thoughts. I’m anxious more & feel depressed. My mental health is more important than this.

name: Lessina
comments: Great BC  . I am sensitive to others . It took me 2 months to deal with some of the moody side effects but other than that my period is very light and consistent and I recommend

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I'm 24 and have been on this Junel Fe 24 pill for 6 years with no issues. Here's the thing  you need to give your birth control way more than 1-3 months before judging it. You will never find a good one if you switch them that often!!! Unless you're having a serious reaction to it, then wait it out 3 months until it regulates. This pill didn't make me gain weight or have any more acne than a 24 year old should have. Yes of course vaginal dryness is an issue.... if you're taking any birth control with progesterone in it you are going to have this issue. The whole purpose of this medication is to thicken your cervical secretions so that it can trap sperm better. No birth control is perfect but I promise this is a good one if you give it some time.

name: Ajovy
comments: Not a fan of this medicine Ajovy! It helped my migraines a little at first... but then stopped helping. I also experienced a TON of bad side effects. Bad nausea, vertigo, hair loss and weight gain. I’ve weighed 112 pounds for years and I now weigh 120 pounds and haven’t changed eating habits or anything. I feel like crying because I’ve gained this weight for no reason and it won’t go away but I’m not going to get any more injections so hopefully my body will go back to normal.

name: Cryselle
comments: I was having abnormal bleeding due to ovarian cysts so my gyno put me on birth control, even though I told her my body has never reacted well to any kind I’ve tried. I’ve been on it for 1.5 months now and my breasts have already increased a full cup size and they hurt so bad I have to put heat on them at night. My face was clear until I started Cryselle...I now have cystic acne and currently icing my face to bring down the inflammation. Only positive thing I can say is I haven’t bled for almost 2 months which is amazing , but I’d take abnormal bleeding anyway over these side effects.!!!

name: Amethyst
comments: I have horrible headaches with this birth control, I don’t know why. Besides that everything is fine but the headaches would last all day it was horrible. Anyone else??

name: Ajovy
comments: Life changing.  used to get pain that was 11/10 so horrible 90% of the time for 10 years straight, for last year and half on AJOVY I have my life back (KNOCK ON WOOD). I have zero side effects.. on Aimovig I had some stomach issues also then it stopped working after a few months. This one is amazing. I highly recommend for hormonal migraines and for people who have had them their whole lives like me since I was 5.. it is a miracle. I only get a couple a month now and they are half the pain. I haven't posted sooner because I am so scared to jinx it..

name: Ajovy
comments: I’ve had four injections for Ajovy so far. I’m really unsure about this injection. It has definitely helped my migraines.  But the side effects are horrible- bloating, rash at injection site, extreme fatigue, brain fog, pain in hand joints and palpitations. Ajovy nurse has told me to stop as I’m at risk of anaphylactic shock so it’s back to neurologist for me. Make sure you research this drug before taking it and consider pros and cons.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
I started using Biacna brand of clindamycin/tretinoin a week ago. I started using Tactu Pump Forte (benzoyl peroxide  adapalene mix)  a year ago to treat severe hormonal acne. Everything about my routine worked and my skin was fairly clear at a steady rate. Now,  with mandatory face coverings/masks my face has gone back to it's old ways. As much as I keep my face clean, I couldn't stop deep pimples from appearing. Almost instantly they would appear after wearing a face mask at work for over eight hours. I have an appointment to see a dermatologist but in the mean time I was prescribed Biacna. I can say this is a lot more gentle then benzoyl peroxide (BP) so my skin can handle it. My face feels soft, no pimples forming beneath the surface. I haven't had any purge, and I don't think I will. So far so good! I also got myself a nice cotton face mask that covers a lot of my face and so it doesn't rub and irritate. I clean my face masks daily and wear two throughout the day.
Highly recommend Biacna.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: I read these reviews so often that I promised I would write one when I got my period - after a 58-day cycle, I got it! This works! I took it during what I assumed was my fertile window even though I have a pretty irregular/long cycle. I was REALLY worried I could've already ovulated. I did not really experience any pregnancy-like symptoms other than cramping the morning after taking Plan B. My period ended up being 3 weeks late! While waiting for my period, what helped me was taking the cheap HCG strip pregnancy tests every so often just to be able to SEE the negative tests, and reading these reviews! Once it was 3 weeks after the plan B sex, I was confident the negative pregnancy tests were accurate. Keep calm and be ready for what may be a very long cycle!

name: Ajovy
comments: I have had severe headaches caused by nasal procedures that were done improperly. After seeing a cranial sinus specialist, he wanted neurological tests to rule out any unknown issues before surgery. After tons of xrays, MRI'S and nerve tests, I was cleared for surgery but the neurologist wanted to try Ajovy to see if it lessened the headaches while waiting to receive nasal surgery. It has been less than 2 weeks since they have me 3 injections and I did notice a reduction in the amount of pain but have developed serious neck and back pain. The neck pain is so bad that some days I can barely move it. The only change in the last 12 days has been the injections. Scary part is that they gave me 3 injections and I have no idea how long this pain will last. I will not receive any more because I truly believe Ajovy has caused the issues.

name: Gianvi
comments: The first couple weeks I started noticing my acne actually getting worse on this particular birth control Gianvi. I blamed it on outside stressors and the fact that maybe it was a flair up from starting a different birth control. Fast forward to months later and my acne hadn't really gotten any better and I noticed EXTREME mood swings (increased depression, suicidal thoughts, even what felt like mania at times) around the time of my period and it seemed like it got worse every period. Disclaimer: I do have a history of depression and take medication (fluoxotine) for that so it may have been drug interaction.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This birth control pill Junel Fe 24 gave me HORRIBLE ACNE! I was previously on generic Ortho-tricyclin Lo but switched to Junel after I had mild side effects. The first month was fine, but as soon as month two came I started getting painful cystic acne and white heads. By month 3 it's the worst it's ever been. I'm 30 years old and so embarrassed to show my skin, but the worst part is the pain its causing me! My periods are super short on this pill as well (2-3 days). After month 3 I went back on Ortho-tricyclin Lo and also went on Spironolactone. Worst BC experience ever.

name: Antabuse
comments:
I have been drinking heavily for the past 10 years.  Almost a bottle of Rum everyday starting from the time I get up till I sleep.  Also woke up in the middle of the night and drank again.  This completely ruined my personal and professional life.  Been through detox and rehab thrice already.  First time I took antabuse and drank on it, I threw up like crazy.  Then slowly I started faking taking it and back to drinking.  This time started antabuse and also naltraxone.  This is my second day of being sober.  I did drink on antabuse this time and except for a a very weird feeling in my stomach, it did not do anything.  May be my liver is beyond a point of responding to the drug. 
Long story short, combination of Naltraxone and Antabuse seem to be working for me so far.  I have a full bottle of Bacardi Rum but I don't want to (rather don't have a big urge to drink).  If you are really motivated, talk to your doctor about being on both these drugs.

name: Lessina
comments: I was prescribed Lessina post partum, and it has been super! Helped regulate my post partum depression, and anxiety. I however have an increase in appetite, and experienced mild headaches, and nausea for the first couple of weeks. I love the fact that it regulates my period, I always know when I'll have it, and am prepared! I definitely will continue to take love it.

name: Ajovy
comments: I did the drugs trial for Ajovy and had very high hopes. However after a couple of years of having the injections I didn't think they made a difference. The others on the trial all drooped out of taking it for the same reason. Lots of hype but not for me.

name: Adderall
comments: Adderall worked well for a year then it wore off even with medication free holidays. When trying a new medication and stopping I didn’t realize how out of breath it was making me, I thought it was because I was fat.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments:
My insurance changed recently due to a new job. I was taking ProAir HFA which worked very well giving me immediate relief. My new insurance does not cover it. I now have coverage for ProAir RespiClick from which I have gotten zero relief. I mean absolutely no relief, it’s completely ineffective. 
The process to inhale the medication is ludicrous. Breathe deeply (when you can barely breathe at all) and the hold your breath for 10 seconds! I thought I was going to pass out. 
Terrible, terrible! Shame on Teva and the FDA for selling this rubbish.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: OMG DO NOT TAKE THIS Junel Fe 24 PILL!!! I started this pill it was going ok and then suddenly I had no desire for sex at all which is unlike me because I’ve always had a high sex drive. I told my dr about it he was like that’s ok that’s a side effect. This pill made sex awful and painful because it made me dry. Therefore, I took it upon myself to stop the pill, well now I will not stop bleeding it’s not just a little blood it’s heavy like very heavy bleeding. My dr told me if I started my pill back it will stop the bleeding. I refuse to start that pill back I will just let the bleeding run it’s course and hopefully it stops soon because I am finally getting back to my pre pill sex drive.

name: Velivet
comments: I have been on this birth control pill Velivet for about two weeks and I can personally say that I’m quite upset. This is my third birth control. In the past two weeks I have experienced major cystic acne, depression, breast tenderness (the first week), and cramps while NOT on my period. I’m taking it in time daily but I’m going to stop taking this pill and I try another.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I like QVAR. Never had a problem with  it, used it to the very end.And  as a medication works excellent.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I have never had a problem with these inhalers, I prefer them to an inhaler you shake. I think a lot of the issues people are having is if they are unable to breath in strong enough to inhale the powder. The only issue I have is one of my inhalers went through the wash and I cannot figure out how to get a replacement because my dr won’t give me a new prescription. I have found that these last longer than my normal inhalers as well,

name: Ajovy
comments: Has anyone else experienced nausea so bad that has been going on for over a month. Seriously lost my appetite. Vertigo so bad that it wakes me in the middle of the night several times of spinning with no movements. Anxiety I have never experienced. 3 injections in and I’m done!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
After 5 years of taking tri-estarylla, I was put on this Nortrel 7/7/7 birth control because of new insurance and a new doctor.

I got pregnant on Nortel 7/7/7 on my third pack of taking it correctly. 

During the months of taking it: I was emotional and easily agitated. (I suffer with depression and bipolar 2 but my symptoms were out of the norm for myself). I also had severe headaches/ migraines.

Every person is different and we all react differently to every med, but I know how to take birth control and to get pregnant on it was an emotion rollercoaster. My husband and I have a beautiful baby, but I can't in good faith recommend to give this pill a chance if it can't even prevent pregnancy.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: So.. I had unproblematic skin for the past 4 years after using my birth control Diane 35. In March 2020, I decided to switch to an IUD instead of my combination pill, the progression of my skin slowly but surely lead to me having acne. I would say at the end of July I was prescribed the clindamycin/tretinoin gel to use nightly. Unfortunately, I would use it on and off and for this type of gel PLEASE do not use it on and off or it will not work and your skin will have to repurge. So I currently am heading into my 10th week on the gel and it is still a process. I have scars and just a few pimples reappearing. If I could recommend anything its to make sure you check in with yourself and stay positive. Acne is a normal and you are still beautiful with or without it. Im hoping that within the new year my skin will be clear again but I'm learning that taking care of my inside is just as important as my outside. Best of luck to everyone on their acne journey!

name: Ajovy
comments:
I have had bouts of migraines for 16 years multiple times a month. I started Ajovy like 14 months ago. I had immediate relief with the first 5 months only having less than 5 migraines. I didn't even refill my break through Rizatripten. Then on the 6 month they came back but not to the serious degree they once were. I did have to start using my break through pain medication. But then about 8 months later my migraines have seemed to stop again. I do like the new instant injection feature they just added to it. 
I am a male in my 50's and I feel I have had absolutely no side affects what so ever on this medication.  None!! Only problem I have is my insurance company keeps mucking me around telling to try the other injectable Aimovig? Strangely I though it was over price but they are only with in few dollars of each other?? So why are they trying to make me change?? Really odd!!

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I am 39 years old and after many failed anti acne medications ( antibiotics , LED therapy , chemical peels ) I was depressed , disappointed and I was about to get used to the idea that I will have to live with this skin condition for ever. One of my work colleagues convinced me to give another chance to topical medication and recommended me to us Acnatac gel ( this is the generic brand of clindamycin/tretinoin in Czech Republic ).I am on my 4 th day of using it and I have been using it every night I noticed that my skin got red and I have already slowly started purging.  I was about to give up but reading all the reviews convinced me to stick with it and hope that the purge period will not be too long or to painful (I have break outs now on my chin and around my mouth). I use Cerave cleanser ,La Roche Posay moisturizer and Acnatac every other night. I hope I will come back on this page in month with good news about how well my skin looks.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Yeah... no. I got switched to this brand Portia from Chateal (which I loved), and had a bunch of weird side effects. My acne got worse, I got stretch marks galore, and had pretty common chest pain. I got brown discharge most of the time. I skipped the placebos as I had really bad periods, but the pill really only took away the symptoms of a period but kept the bleeding. I don’t recommend if you’re using this brand to skip your periods.

name: Ajovy
comments: I've suffered from migraines for 50 years and have tried most everything out there, including Botox.  I started Ajovy 15 months ago and it worked wonders.   On Ajovy I average 3 migraines a month which for me is a miracle. After about ten months I started to get vertigo (which I had checked to rule out any medical causes) and the past two months I've been suffering from bloating and constipation as well - all out of the ordinary.  I am going to stop the Ajovy to see if this all clears up.    I love not suffering with the migraines for the first time in 50 years, but I need to know for sure if Ajovy is causing what I believe to be these side effects.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started Junel Fe 1/20 after I realized I needed to regulate my hormones. I would get nausea and diarrhea every time I was anxious. My first month on this pill, I felt amazing. The stomach problems went away. I didn't bleed that month, just brown discharge. I also noticed I had acne again which my face was spotless prior to the pill. The second month was the worst. I had bad nausea, had to pull over while driving to puke later at night (fixed by taking the pill at a later time). I was constantly miserable and sick every day. My sex drive was gone and I got a yeast infection the week before sugar pills. I didn't get my period and got brown spotting. The third month wasn't bad, no nausea but acne got worse. Over the three months I gained 15 lbs. It seems to be going back to normal now with my weight slowly but I still have no sex drive, I'm bloated, and feel like I'm getting another yeast infection (the week before the sugar pill). I'm hoping it will turn around but I am not a fan.

name: Take Action
comments: Me and my boyfriend has unprotected sex November 7th& 8th. November 9th we took take action. November 10th I started having back cramps similar to back labor. Along with extreme irritability and mood swings. November 15th, I started spotting I am not due for my period until the 26th! But I assume I am not pregnant since I’m bleeding.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have been on Ajovy for a little over a year. In that year, I have gained 40lbs. It works great for my migraines though. I am considering going off and back to Emgality. I had less issues with Emgality. The amount of weight I have gained was definitely not from an eating problem. The weight gain is causing more issues physically such as my fibro flares. Probably going to go back to Emgality. 40lbs weight gain in a year is ridiculous. When I take the injection, I feel crummy the next day and just overall yucky for that week after the injection. Great for migraines, but not so good in general on your body.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
This medication Nortrel 1/35 has really work well for me, I started taking it when I was 20 and have used it as my primary source of BC. I suppose I was lucky but I have not experienced any of the commonly mentioned side affects other than some mild cramping the 1 month I took it as my body adjusted to the hormones. Since then, ten years later, I have not had any weight gain, headaches or nausea and I can’t say that it has effects my mood either. My periods went from 8 heavy days of nightmare periods to 3 to 4 days of using a liner with only an occasional cramping. Most importantly after a decade of use I have not become pregnant or had a single pregnancy scare.
This pill has worked very well for me

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The Qvar RediHaler dispensers keep stopping and do not work properly; keep having to use rescue inhaler because these things DO NOT WORK CORRECTLY! Suppose to help control asthma not create a bigger issue...

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I took Junel Fe 1/20 for 6 months, it was prescribed to me to help with my (moderate) acne and also to help with my painful uncomfortable periods. The first two months my bleeding was very irregular but it stabilized after 3 months. In regards to helping with menstration it’s great! However it did virtually nothing for my skin and actually made my skin break out more frequently on my chin and around my mouth area.  I recently switched my birth control to Nikki, which is a generic form of Yaz. If you struggle with hormonal acne like me, I would not take Junel for that. Take a birth control pill that contains a progestin that’s anti-androgenic (Like Nikki, Yaz, Beyaz, ortho-tri-cyclen). 
In regards to mood on this pill (Junel) I didn’t really notice a difference. I did notice that I lost weight on this pill, perhaps it’s just a coincidence. And this pill lowered my libido substantially. That’s the side effect that does kind of suck. Overall I wouldn’t really recommend this pill.

name: QNASL
comments:
Was prescribed for year-round allergies. Initially it was awesome - odorless/tasteless, and didn't run down my throat.  A few months later I felt an irritation inside my nose with random nose bleeds. Drs said It wasn't from the Qnasl otherwise it would have happened sooner. 

My ENT diagnosed a nasal ulceration but not from the Qnasl. After months of tests they were all baffled and 11 months in the ulceration became a perforation! Discussing with my ENT  I asked again if it could be the Qnasl (which had been initially ruled out because the clinical trials only had 1 nasal ulceration and no perforations.)

I asked him to review everything because I'm the patient that gets those super rare side effects, and he finally agreed that it must be the Qnasl and I must stop taking it.

So after using Qnasl daily for 11 months it was finally decided that it  caused the septum perforation that I still have - 6 years later!

name: Velivet
comments: I have been taking the Velivet birth control for almost a year now and it’s been a terrible ride. My cramps are paralyzing (I had bad cramps before but these are worse) and they even happen when I’m not on period. The worst part has to be the constant emotional mood swings and change in sex drive. I do not cry normally but on this pill, I have full days where I cannot stop crying for no reason. My sex drive lowered significantly and it dries me out during sex even when I am in the mood which was never an issue before. I am easily irritable, overly sensitive and depressed when I’m on my period. I’ve tried to stick it out in hopes of it getting better but the side effects have actually enhanced overtime. I do not recommend it. Only positives are not getting pregnant and lighter periods but even the periods fluctuate.

name: Ajovy
comments: Ajovy has saved my life the past year!!! Works 3 weeks out of 4 wonderfully  usually.  Take monthly injections. Last week sometimes starts wearing off early.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: The first 3 months on Portia I had water retention, low appetite, nausea and lost some weight. But the pill immediately stopped my period. I am taking Portia for Endo. I've been taking it for close to a year and it works great! It keeps all of the symptoms away and I have had no acne or major weight gain.

name: Amethyst
comments: I’m 48 & suffered from HORRIBLE periods for years. I have fibroids & had several removed 5 years ago. They left a few smaller ones as they said they would not be an issue as I should go into menopause by the time they might have grown so the dr did not perform a hysterectomy. My periods are so bad I’m afraid to stand up or sleep for at least 2 days every month. I don’t like taking bc as the hormones make me crazy.  I have been taking Amethyst for almost 4 weeks now. No terrible side effects. My period did come a week early. But it has actually been tolerable! I went to the store & was not afraid of leaking.  I can exercise. I usually can’t run for 3-4 days per month on my period. Even if it doesn’t stop them completely I can live with the lighter days. If you have never experienced this you cannot even begin to imagine how horrible that feeling is.  I just want to feel normal again. I’m very hopeful the results only continue to get better & that my periods stop completely.

name: Qvar
comments: My Pharmacy has just sent me my Qvar 100 autohalerin the new design dispenser, (22 actuations) - this is a garbage design, and is very difficult to use correctly. Often the medicine doesn't come out of the inhaler properly even. Why oh why do they change what worked perfectly well - TEVA should be told to immediately offer the original design, there is no doubt some reason behind it, an increase in cost perhaps! This isn't even worth a 1 out of 10 to be frank!

name: Aviane
comments: I’ve been on this Aviane birth control for 8 months now and it’s made my PMS symptoms and depression soooo bad. Like a week before my period I feel like I’m going insane. I feel like every month it makes it worse and worse. Honestly I don’t think I can take this pill anymore it’s wrecking my mind. It always made me gain weight and my boobs are sore 24/7.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: Ladies this works, I promised myself if I got my period I would write a review. I had already ovulated, the condom broke while it was inside of me, AND I took this pill at hour 70. After three weeks tons of pregnancy tests, sore breasts, weird spotting (brown and pink.. was convinced it was implantation bleeding) I finally got my period. It was 4 days late and started out very slowly but it’s here. Trust the process, get off of google and remember that everyone’s body is different and will have a different reaction to the hormones.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was on  Ovral birth control at first for so long and was switched to Portia as a generic pill. I had constant spotting and the heaviest period I've ever had in my life that laster over 5 weeks and the only way to stop the period was to get off Portia.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I was prescribed this Tri-Sprintec birth control for my acne. The first month was wonderful, it got rid of all my acne and evened out my skin tone and for the first time in years I had clear skin. I thought it would be like this for the next month but I was wrong. I’m currently on the second round of pills and my skin broke out horribly with extremely painful cystic acne around my chin, jaw and nose area. It has been like this the entire month, I am about to finish this pack in a couple of days and hoping my skin calms down with the 3rd round of pills. I spoke to my doctor and she recommended finishing the 3rd round of pills to see if my acne calms down to see whether or not to prescribe me to another brand.

name: Antabuse
comments: I asked my dr for antabuse myself. I drank half a bottle of whisky every evening (and up to 1 bottle in the WE) with no hangover symptoms at all, nor stomach or other problems (that I know of anyway). I started taking antabuse immediately after getting it, the first 3 days 400mg (start dose) and after that  200 mg daily. During the weekend I used deodorant and skin disinfectant containing alcohol to check the effect but nothing happened.  Now I started drinking again, 2 whiskies daily at the moment, only 15 min. after taking 200 mg of disulfiram but still no effect at all. I really hoped that the disulfiram would keep me away from alcohol. Any users with 1st hand experience that have the same problem? It really baffles me that some can't even use hand disinfectant without getting a head ache and I can just keep on drinking. Just FYI: I'm not proud that my liver doesn't seem to respond to disulfiram, I'm past the stage (and age) that I thought this might be a cool thing.

name: Sprintec
comments: I do not recommend this birth control. I have gained thirty pounds in 6 months, tired all of the time, dark thoughts and anxiety, and low sex drive and pain during sex. I am getting off soon because I can not take it anymore. I can not lose weight no matter how hard I try. I was put on for my cysts which thankfully went away, but the side effects for my experience at least, a nightmare.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: This Wixela Inhub inhaler does not work at all and I think the problem at least with mine is no powder is coming out.  Like others the first few times it spit a gross amount of powder in my mouth but after about 10 uses that stopped and now zero powder is coming out.  I think it's a double edged sword; if powder comes out, it comes out in a consistency that is too big doesn't penetrate into the lungs.  When it stops doing this nothing comes out which it's probably clogged but there isn't any way to take it apart and clear a clog like you can with aerosol inhaler.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Antabuse
comments: I tried antibuse, first time I drank on it I was sick but after 48 hours it did nothing but but make my heart beat fast. You have to take it everyday  for the best results.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I have been taking Sprintec for about 7-8 months now. I started on the non-generic brand and seemed fine but just recently 3 weeks ago started the generic brand. It has been TERRIBLE! I have been to the ER three times this past week with the WORST stomach cramps ( not like period cramps ) more like all over abdominal muscle cramps. I am completely stopping this medication!

name: Ajovy
comments: I have been on Ajovy for 5 months and the only side effect I have noticed at heart palpitations (2 episodes lasted about a week each time). Otherwise this has been a game changer for me. I still have gotten a few migraines during the 5 months but I take rizotriptan when they come on and usually within an hour and a nap its gone. I have suffered debilitating cluster migraines for a while and so glad to have found ajovy!

name: Ajovy
comments: I used this drug for two months. The first month I had two migraine free weeks, but I had immense bloating, and constipation, triggering horrible acid reflux. Despite this, I carried on, thinking the pain was manageable. The next month the side effects hit way harder, making my acid reflux so bad that I couldn't speak for weeks. I do NOT recommend this drug for anyone who uses their voice frequently or suffers from acid reflux.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Today marks 4 months on birth control. My body has not felt the same since the day I started taking it. I no longer have cramps on my periods, that last up to 2 weeks now. Although I do not have cramps during my period, the newly formed ovarian cysts cramp me up a bit. Also the constant bloating and digestion pains aren't the best. There is a pro, I'm not pregnant.. that I know of. I've found that constantly chugging cranberry juice while downing ibuprophen has helped with my unwanted cramps in my uterus.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: So glad I saw these reviews before ordering another. Stopped working with over 50 left. Didn’t know it. Went from perfect never using my rescue, to four day long attacks, needing the rescue and oral steroids. Finally discovered the redihaler was sputtering after I inhaled. Wow.

name: Amethyst
comments:
Currently on week 6 of Amethyst and looking to switch. I really hoped the reviews I'd read magically wouldn't apply to me but alas, they did. The first 3 weeks were great! I started it on the second day of my period and it stopped it! Then I was free until 3 weeks ago. Now I've been bleeding since! At first it was just a little spotting, then brownish discharge (fun), then full on bleeding. Right, this is normal in the beginning, I get it... But I'm also having severe mood changes. I had been feeling great beforehand on a mood stabilizer for my emotional fluctuations- but once I started this I felt like I had digressed. I am now unpredictably emotional, irritable, and randomly sad. Oh! And my face broke out a lot! I had my acne under control so well :( So, time to find a new birth control because these are not side effects I can tolerate for the next potential 5-11 months. 
BUT! One positive- I had lots of sex without using condoms and didn't get pregnant. So, at least it's effective! Lol

name: AirDuo Respiclick
comments: From day one on AirDuo Respiclick feel 100 times better than using symbicort. While using symbicort I could hardly breathe and wheezed all the time. Air duo for a week and I feel great.

name: Provigil
comments: I was originally put on Provigil 15 years ago for shift work sleep disorder but I'm now on it for the fatigue that comes with MS.  My dose is 200 mg once a day worked well for me, but a new doc switched me to Nuvigil which isn't working well at all. I have to say there is a big difference between Provigil brand and the generic Modafinil. Modafinil is m much weaker and I often needed 400 mg a day depending on what I had to do.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: Advair Diskus helped my breathing by day two. I loved it at first, other than the cost. By week three my joints started to hurt and by 4th week I was having some real joint pain. After seeing the doctor and stopping the Advair discus the pain stopped within a few days. This has been a problem for me with some other COPD meds but this was by far the worst for pain  for me.
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for COPD, Maintenance:

name: Ajovy
comments: I had two rounds of Ajovy because I was having constant vestibular migraines. Until I took Ajovy, my symptoms had been unabated for over two months, but they hasn’t been particularly painful: severe dizziness, significant cognitive impairment, tinnitus, and discomfort of the eyes. After the first shot, I added regular migraine symptoms to the list: light sensitivity, sound sensitivity, and pain. After the second shot, the symptoms morphed again, and I started having a sensation that is very hard to describe: it was as if my brain was being squeezed from different directions and it was crackling under the pressure. About 8-10 weeks after the last shot, the weird sensation went away, but I still had the mix of vestibular and regular migraines.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was on HJunel fe 1/20 for 4 months. It was $45 every 3 months. It started off just fine. I felt great, no weight gain, no acne, my breasts were constantly sore and I grew in size but it wasn’t too much to complain for. My periods also improved. I noticed I was a bit more emotional but didn’t worry too much because I already have anxiety and thought it would level out. Month 4 hit me bad. I woke up after the first week and just cried. For some reason I felt hopeless in the world and no matter what I did I didn’t feel better. I tried vitamin b 12, changing my diet, nothing worked. After weeks of debating, I switched to Lutera which is a different progestin and I am finishing my first month and feel 100% better. I’m still emotional before my period but that is nothing out of the ordinary. Junel did it’s job at preventing pregnancy but the cost of my mental health was not worth it

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I been on birth control for the last 3 years ,  and this is the WORSE experience, the first 2 weeks on Junel Fe 1/20 I been vomiting and feeling sick eventually I started feeling more tired than usual and having panic attacks , I was about to finish the first pack when the situation got worse from panic attacks to crying for hours for no reason.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: Absolute garbage! I was switched over from Advair a week ago. My asthma has been completely under control for years with Advair. After one week of using this my chest gets tight a couple hours after using it and I have mucus building up in my lungs that causes me to cough and hack all day. I’m actually better off just not taking any medicine at all. How did this drug get approved?
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Cryselle
comments: I started this 3 months ago to stop my ovarian cyst from growing. Well that shrunk but a tiny fibroid I had grew 3 times it’s size and my new OB said it was from this pill. Now I have to get surgery and take 4 weeks off work because I have had nonstop cramping for 3 months and I’ve had a heavy period for over 3 weeks now (and I skip the placebo). My depression has gotten so bad I scored in the “severe depression “ category and life is so hard everyday so now I’m on antidepressants. This pill is a nightmare. OB is having me switch to progesterone only now.

name: ProAir HFA
comments:
My son has had ProAir HFA switched when Covid hit and its JUNK. I do not recommend leaving any pharmacy with this if you actual need to count on breathing or having a reliable inhaler.
It clogs all the time which is unacceptable if you have activities that involve being outside and possibly away from being able to wash it.
Even when its able to dispense properly the relief it provides is minimal at best. What a joke. Yes, I'm angry. I have worked hard to figure out what works for my kid and to have someone tell me I cannot do that is not acceptable.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: First of all THANK GOD!! I took the pill September 7th and my period was supposed to come September 21st. I ended up being 22 days late for my period, my period just came today Oct. 15. While I was waiting on my period I experienced dull cramps near my pelvis area and lotsss of discharge. Non the less it came and I couldn’t be happier

name: Gianvi
comments: I have been on Gianvi around 7 months now for PMDD. Prior to Gianvi I had the copper IUD which I didn't like. Every month would get suicidal depression before my period. I did the research found out about PMDD. I started taking Gianvi and my 1st month on it was happiest I'd been in awhile. I felt a lot more balanced and less stressed. Maybe it was placebo affect bc the following months weren't necessarily as great but my PMDD was still WAY better. Last month switched me to loryna which was making me feel so depressed and crazy I stopped taking it after 2 weeks. After a lot of desperate searching I found another pharmacy that carries Gianvi & am back on it. It has only been a few days & I feel back to normal. I haven't had any negative effects, no weight gain & if anything my skin has improved. I know birth control isn't necessarily the most natural or healthy thing but it is better than feeling suicidal every month. I have tried lots of different birth controls & this is the only one I have liked.

name: Qvar
comments: This medication (the drug) works great been on it since a child for over the past 20 years. Will be on the medication for the rest of my life. It has low ratings because of the actual inhaler device. So when I picked up my first box, I immediate ripped open the inhaler, twisted off the top half, and took out the canister. All I have is the canister, and I use another pump to get the medication out. So now it is like the original Qvar from back in the day that didn't have the dysfunctional redi-inhaler apparatus. I was placed on Alvesco when Qvar redesigned their product making the price go up. Asthma is not a condition you want to experiment with. This works for me and hopefully always will. I pay $216 for 120 inhalations (80mcg). I'm in grad school, but I still manage to make the costs work. Not an ideal cost, but oh well

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I was using Breo for years, thankfully because there was a coupon. Otherwise, my insurance would never cover it nor could I afford it. The coupon was discontinued during the pandemic (of course!), and I could not afford to purchase it even with some insurance coverage. My doctor prescribed Wixela, and it is basically worthless. It requires two inhalations a day vs. Breo's one, the inhaler itself is strangely designed, and I can feel the powder all over my tongue. The biggest issue is that I cannot breathe. One puff of Breo and I was out running five miles. With Wixela, I am gasping for air.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Apri
comments:
I started Apri about four months ago due to migraines during my period and pretty bad acne, especially leading up to my period. My pharmacist said this is what she takes and she takes it continuously so recommended I do that as well. For the first three months it worked great aside from my sex drive dropping to below zero. Not getting a period for the first time in nearly 15 years was amazing. It did help clearing my acne. 

However about a month ago I started spotting, had a couple mild headaches. Google said this was normal so didn't freak out. Last week I started bleeding much more heavily and having the WORST cramps I have ever had. Make me double over in pain cramps. Advil and Tylenol barely work. Came here looking to see if others have had this experience but instead found a ton of other symptoms people are experiencing as well. I'm afraid if I stop my migraines and acne will come back but I don't know if I can handle this for much longer.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started taking Junel Fe almost a year ago. I always heard horror stories on the internet and through friends about birth control pills. For the first few months it was fine, my periods were regular just did not last as long and were not so heavy. About, 4-5 months after taking it I missed 3 periods in a row. Then I got my period again for the next 3 months, and it was super heavy and was lasting 8 days or more. At first, I brushed it off and did not even think it was the pills doing this. I’ve also gained almost 20lbs. When I started to realize it could be because of my BC, I brushed it off because I tend to be a hypochondriac/overthinker. I didn’t realize what this pill was doing to my anxiety/mental health until my best friend, family and boyfriend noticed. I’ve always been a super happy, no stress, easy going person. I was lashing out on people for no reason and had the craziest mood swings. It works for a contraceptive though!

name: Take Action
comments: ahhh. So on Sept 29 my boyfriend came in me during sex. (I’m not on birth control) so later that night I got a take action from Walgreens. This was about 10 hours after the incident and I took it immediately. This was also 13 days before my period so I think that means I was fertile? Anyways, it’s been 2 weeks and I still feel nausea, I have mood swings, worst cramps ever, changes in bowel movements, and just waiting for some sort of blood. My period is supposed to start around the 10th of every month, and I’m pretty sure my period is starting but it’s a day late. I’ve taken several pregnancy tests every morning when I wake up and they have all been negative and it’s been 15 days now. I will add to this if anything else happens, but so far I think it worked?! Side effects are brutal though

name: Lessina
comments: I began taking Lessina last month and I DO NOT RECOMMEND! The first few weeks I had a consistent headache. Secondly my appetite largely increased. Then I was very very emotional! I am having breakdowns over everything that happened. My anxiety has been way worse and so have my intrusive thoughts. I thought for sure I at least won't have a bad period. WRONG! this has been the worst period I've had in years! Such heavy bleeding, nausea which caused me to have a panic attack, chills, headaches, the whole 9 yards. Please do not take this medicine.

name: Adderall
comments: The Adderal dose my doctor prescribed didn't seem to work that great(20 mg twice a day)  One day I had it after my oatmeal and it was more effective so after that I just scrunched up the pill like I did with oatmeal, but I didn't put it on anything.  I just took it like that. Works great!  Much more motivation to get tasks done so I can finish more!  Maybe you could try that if it sees not enough to work.  I use Sandoz.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments:
September 2nd 2020 was my last period to date. It’s now October 11th 2020 & still no period. 

My boyfriend and I had unprotected on the 8th. I tried to go get an emergency Plan B prescription - due to covid-19 I had to call and make an appointment for the NEXT DAY. So on the 9th we had unprotected, again... and was able to get a prescription from my doctor.

Little did I check.., according to my Fitbit I was ovulating on the 10th (The next day after I took the plan B). 

I’m pretty synchronized with the full moon during my cycle so I was caught by surprise when it didn’t show up in October.. I waited a week to take a pregnancy test at the same doctors & it was a negative. 

She told me to come back within two weeks if my period didn’t show up... it’s the 11th of October & I only got a few days left for my cycle to show its self.

Don’t be a fool to those sweet nothing-words your boyfriend whispers to you.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments:
Mild asthma patient, with everything under control using Advair Diskus 250/50. As with others, my insurance stopped paying for the brand name and had to switch to Wixela. My symptoms went from non-existent (with Advair) to bad to worse. Stopped taking Wixela and things got better and I only had regular(!) asthma. Paid out of pocket for the Advair and everything was wonderful again. 

One year later- Chest pain is better, but not like it used to be. I now need a higher dosage of Advair than ever before, I will need to pay $4,000 a year for it, but it keeps me healthy. 

FDA should do something.
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Adderall
comments: I was switched to Adderall but after 2 years switched to Ritalin. Adderall seems to open up parts of your brain best left closed. I started to see a 12 year old boy in the yard during the day he would be gone when I went to talk with him. My neighbors told me that in the 1970s he died here. You have to watch the dosage

name: Adderall
comments: I have been soooo sleepy for the past 15 years of my life. I finally found a PA that listened to me about my sleepiness. She has been great. I can not afford the recommended sleep study. I am currently taking 10mg extended release. It has helped but I am still falling asleep at work. My PA will meet with me in after a month on it. I’m not sure if I need an increased dosage or if it’s not working on me. It’s a struggle still. I don’t want to feel hopeless that I can’t find help.

name: Gabitril
comments: THE MEDICATION Gabitril IS NEVER IN STOCK! Both CVS and Walgreens have to wait way too long to fill prescriptions, putting patients in danger.  This is not a medication you can just stop taking.  Every 3 months there is a long delay, wholesaler McKessen (wholesaler for CVS and Walgreens) apparently doesn't receive any of the medication.

name: Ajovy
comments:
I’ve been on this since the very beginning of the year, a few days (3-4) upon taking monthly dose I’ve gotten Thrush Orally. I’ve never had it before... Their was an issue with a Prior Authorization for my insurance where I basically waited 2 months before I could take a dose where I didn’t get thrush. But when I started again a month ago I got it again and here I am now, writing about it with Thrush. I’m just scared, because how/why there’s no side effects that report this. 

Other than that though, it’s great, except last month I did have an increase in headaches and I found out that discontinuing you’re more likely to develop rebound headache.

name: Sprintec
comments: I normally try to avoid sharing my experience with birth control as we all know every woman is different ... but this pill is awful. The first month of taking this pill I experienced severe depression and suicidal thoughts. After the second month the thoughts went away but I was extremely sad. I also spotted for 3 months while taking this pill and experienced cramping Atleast one a week. I am now using Tri- Estarylla and It works very well.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This is the WORST pill out there. I was on Desetta 1/35 for years and had to switch pharmacies and they gave me Nortrel 1/35. I had extreme nausea that woke me up out of my sleep and caused me to throw up every morning. And no it was not morning sickness I had multiple pregnancy tests and blood tests done. I do not recommend this pill at all I’ve never had a medication make me feel so sick.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I had just recently been put on Wixela Inhub like everyone else who was on Advair. I have been taking Advair for many years having NO side effects at all, and it working very well for my asthma. As soon as I started using the Wixela Inhub I started to get severe heart palpitations/racing and after only a couple of days had to stop taking it!!!  WAY too dangerous!!  My pharmacist  said that if my Doctor fills out an "adverse side effect form" on it etc.... that he  will be able to put me back on Advair, and it still be covered!!  By the comments here and how I feel from the Wixela Inhub, it should be taken off the market!!
uses: Wixela Inhub (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Amethyst
comments:
I started taking Amethyst birth control to regulate my periods bc I have terrible pain and heavy bleeding. 
I  was on this pill for four and a half months. I spotted the entire time. It seemed like my period stopped but the daily spotting, having to wear a tampon or liner for so long was not great and going without sex was horrible. They say it takes awhile for your body to adjust, but to me it should not take that long. I started back on Nortrel. By the second day, I was no longer spotting. What a relief. Everyone's body is different. I'm in my early 40's. I didn't have issues with moods or skin issues or gaining weight.

name: Aviane
comments: This birth control was awesome. It's very hard for me to go on birth control because I am sensitive to hormones but this one was perfect. Only side effect I had was sore breast but it wasn't that serious for me. I'm on Lessina now so I no longer take it (they are related). It's perfect too but I don't have sore breast on it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments:
Omg... 2 weeks of taking the pill and I gained 8 pounds and got acne. I didn’t even noticed I gained weight till I went on the scale... 
My skin was clear before and I didn’t change my diet or anything! I work out everyday and was 115lb,  now I’m 123lb. I should have read the reviews before. Please don’t take this pill.... ur doctor be lying that it gets better but it won't

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: Tri-Sprintec was the first birth control I ever took. I was 17 years old and I took it until I was 19. Tri-sprintec caused me the worst years of my life. I was so depressed to the point where I could barely get out of bed sometimes. I got to a point where life was too much. I cried almost everyday for the last 2 months on this pill until I couldn’t take it anymore! I went to the doctor and she told me, surprisingly, that everything I was feeling was common taking Tri-Sprintec! She immediately switched me over to “Sprintec” and I have not been having issues with my hormones at all. The only thing I hate about this pill is that it takes away my sex drive.. I literally never get “in the mood” anymore and it sucks. I don’t even remember the last time I was horny... but I guess you have to give to receive.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Aftera worked 100% for me, I had unprotected sex and he came inside of me but 4-5 hours later I took Aftera and a week later I got my period. The cramps were a lot worse but it was definitely worth it.

name: ParaGard
comments:
Pain and bleeding, black bleeding, every time something touches my cervix. Can't wait to get it removed. Doctors and nurses do not warn you about the likelihood of copper toxicity. Two weeks in I am already experiencing insomnia, racing thoughts, irritability, and out of control emotions. I am unable to join usual social activities or connect with my family due to the pain and bleeding.

The insertion process was not "a pinch". It is traumatic and VERY painful. I am anxious about the removal process.

name: Lessina
comments:
This birth control is the only birth control (thus far) that doesn't give me side effects. I am so happy I came across this medication because I can still enjoy intimacy in my long term relationship. I did have nausea the first 3 days of taking it but it subsided.

However, I notice if I skip the sugar pills and go to the new pack, I get migraines. That's a simple fix by taking the whole pack rather than skipping to the next one. I was originally on Aviane but my insurance switched the brands. According to pharmacists, they are essentially the same thing. I'm very sensitive to hormones and I had no problems switching.

name: Apri
comments:
I have PCOS. My first gyno (useless) put me on Junel which gave me a period every other week and gave me a hemorrhagic ovarian cyst after 6 months.
Went off BC for a few years got a new Gyno who is AMAZING and she took a few days to get me the script for Apri (I think she was waiting for my blood work to come back, idk truly). 

I've been on it for 3 years and I've had a good time, I had no real symptoms other than my breasts increasing be one cup size. It also reduced the rate of facial hair growth for me, which is awesome, went from shaving ever other day to once every 4-6 days.
I'm moving on to Kyleena due to high blood pressure, but I’ll miss Apri.

name: ParaGard
comments: I got the ParaGard IUD inserted in 11/2019. I am scheduled to get it removed next month. It has been a horrible experience. I experience heavy crams and bleeding. The excessive bleeding led to ANEMIA. I want to warn people, if you experience heavy bleeding and lethargy after getting the ParaGard inserted please get tested for anemia - iron storage levels. It has impacted my entire life from having to take days off of work and being less energetic in general. Not to mention the heavy long lasting periods and horrible cramps that put me on bed rest for 5 days every month. It was not worth it for me and ParaGard needs to warn patients about these side effects more often.

name: Provigil
comments: Provigil has changed my life! I have been taking it for 6 months. I was prescribed 200mg. I usually take half a pill and I’m good to go for the entire work day. Before Provigil I was in danger of losing my job. I could not get out of bed. On weekends I would literally go to bed Friday night and not get dressed again until I forced myself out the door for work on Monday. After just a few days I felt like a new person! I don’t suffer any terrible side effects. The only thing is I have to make sure I am not talking excessively (as it tends to speed up my speech).  I now even go to the gym after work! Never ever would have dreamed of doing that previously! I am down 30 pounds (working hard at it) and I am enjoying my life! It gave me my life back!

name: Lessina
comments: Lessina is making me as manic as I was when I was off my bipolar medicine. I'm having extreme anxiety attacks that wake me up at 3am every night now. I'm very nauseous and wake up at any time through 3-8am and throw up, this is the first day that I haven't thrown up. I cried and had a manic breakdown over water yesterday??? I know it's from this birth control because I was doing a lot better a week ago. I started taking Lessina on Sunday. Now I experience migraines as well as moodiness, really hoping this goes away but if it doesn't I'm going to switch. The only pros of this medicine is you get nauseous and can't eat so your stomach looks flatter, haven't seen any difference in my boobs but they're sore as anything lol. I don't recommend this at all

name: Gianvi
comments: Does anyone experience stomach pain and discomfort from their birth control? I keep having to switch generic versions because after a few months by stomach will just generally ache all the time. Nikki seems to be bad as well as Loryna. I’m back to Giavani which was fine for the longest amount of time.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: My pharmacist switched me to Wixela because it was less expensive than Advair. Within 2 weeks my mouth was full of sores. My doctor wrote me a prescription for Advair only. My sores went away. I had been taking Advair for 11 years, at the time my insurance  paid enough for only a 10.00 savings when they switched me to Wixela. Now my insurance will not cover to the tune of my cost being $220.00 per month rather than $25.00 per month. Don't want to take the Wixela again. Don't know how I am suppose to pay this much when I have good insurance on my husband's work. But the drug Wixela is being pushed on me now. Horrible

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: I just wanted to leave a review of my experience in case someone else is going through a similar situation. So I had unprotected sex with a guy the day after I had already ovulated. Of course I read that plan b isn’t really effective during ovulation or after so I freaked out. He pulled out but I was still nervous about possible pregnancy so the next day (about 16 hours later) I took the plan b pill. I had cramping here and there in both my stomach and lower back. Little bit of nausea a few days after taking it. I stressed myself out so much from googling symptoms and what not. I thought for sure I might be pregnant, but  one day before my period was due I started spotting light and then I got more intense cramps and my period came strong right after.  This pill DOES work!
