I've been on Loryna and Lo-Esterin Fe previously and I did not do well on those - bloating, weight gain, mood swings etc.  
I was hesitant to try Tri-lo Sprintec, but will say its been great! I'm using it primarily to keep regular menstrual cycles and eliminate horrible cramps I was having all throughout the month. The cramps are basically gone (one day of cramping on my period now), my skin has become more consistently clear (which has been a major issue since I was 10 years old),  & my periods are regular. I have not experienced mood swings, bloating, or other unwanted side effects. Very mild nausea a few times is the only one I've noticed, and I believe the longer that I take the pill, it will diminish even further.  I used to believe there was not a pill out there for me, but keep trying until you find one if that seems right for you!

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: This drug is a life ruiner. I was on Trinessa for a while and doing fine before I randomly got switched to this for no reason. Since starting this drug, I have become nauseous, lightheaded, depressed, constipated, and extremely fatigued. I can only wear loose, flowy clothing or I will get heat flashes and pass out (I'm only 21). I have headaches regularly. Anxiety tics that I worked hard to get rid of years ago are back. I have painful cystic acne that I never had before and I've gained weight. Taking this drug almost made me fail a semester of school and it cost me multiple friendships because I was too fatigued and depressed to leave my room and socialize. My self-confidence is at an all time low. It is not worth it. This drug is cruel.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I am 19 years old and have been on Junel 1/20 since I was 16 years old due to really heavy periods where I was bleeding through super tampons in 30 minutes. I thought I would share my experience since there seem to be a ton of bad reviews and wanted to shed some light. No side effects! Weight gain was zero. It has made my boobs bigger. Sex drive actually increased. no acne. I take the pill continuously due to my horrible periods and I never get a period unexpectedly. This is also a very low dose birth control that I was put on because high dose pills make me throw up so if you have that issue I suggest this medication! I highly suggest you give it a shot! I was so worried when I started it due to all the negative reviews but everyone is different and it doesn’t hurt to try because you can’t always change :)

name: Lessina
comments: Do not take Lessina!!!! I developed blood clots in my lungs for which I was hospitalized for and almost died!  Do NOT take this

name: Ajovy
comments: I tried Ajovy in February after failing on numerous drugs and Botox for chronic migraines. Although it worked very well to reduce the migraines, it also rendered me inactive as my joints were extremely stiff and sore. It was not compatible with my very active lifestyle and I quit. Now I am taking a natural butterbur and magnesium supplement with phenomenal results and I can race again!

name: Gianvi
comments: GREAT for acne! Acne cleared up within a month of using the pill. I have been on Gianvi for about 6-7 months and overall had good experience with it. No mood swings, hair loss, or weight gain. Periods are extremely light and no cramps. The only bad thing about this pill and also the reason why I will be switching to an IUD is because I have NO SEX DRIVE. Having sex is painful and I am disinterested in having sex. Me and my boyfriend have sex less frequently and usually ends shortly because I am in pain. Vaginal dryness and also chronic yeast infections!! I have had about 4 yeast infections and bacterial vaginosis after getting on this pill and I am sure that it is not just a coincidence. Very sad because besides this problem I really liked the benefits of the pill.

name: Take Action
comments: A guy and I had sex it was the first day of my fertile window, no condom....he did not finish in me.....but I was still scared! I went on with the day, the next morning I got up and went to Walmart and got the VCF gel  (spermicidal gel Nonoxynol 9 Gel) insert, but I still didn’t feel okay with just that! So I went to Walgreens later that day and got Take Action! About 6 days later I was terribly nauseous. The next morning I woke up and my period had started. It wasn't like a normal period - very dark blood and not very much bright red. It lasted for 4-5 days. I took the pill on the 21 of July and it is now the 7 of August and I’m still having brownish discharge when I wipe! It is soo confusing I have taken several tests and all come back negative.....but I guess we will just wait the process out!

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: This has been the worst birth control pill I have ever been on! Cystic acne all over my cheeks and my acne wasn’t terrible before starting this medication. Do NOT use this BC pill, it will make your acne worse.

name: Adderall
comments: I'm 72 years old and was having problems maintaining concentration and focus.  Kind of like ADHD, but instead of being hyperactive, I was falling asleep.  Doctor gave me 5mg of Adderall once a day.  Seemed to help a little, and after a couple months, I started taking 10mg 1xday.  Works much better.  I have not noticed any particular side effects.  They say it helps with weight loss, but not for me.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: Just like many things, everyone's experience will be different. It is my first time ever taking birth control, my boyfriend and I are very sexually active so I wanted to be safe and get on the pill. We have unprotected sex all the time without him ever having pull out. Despite all the negative reviews, I gave Tri-Sprintec a try. I didn't really notice the "side effects" until the third month in, which is normal. The only negative thing I can say about this pill is that it has increased my appetite. I gained roughly 5-7lbs, I found myself snacking a lot more and just having an appetite all the time. My boobs also grew a bit and they're more tender. As far as acne, I haven't broken out at all on this pill. It works and I'm not experiencing mood swings or anxiety, I take it at 4pm everyday.

name: Cryselle
comments: Comments from people with positive reviews assuming things like “Women who rated this pill poorly just didn’t give their bodies time to adjust” are so disheartening to see. This pill gave me crazy back acne, headaches so bad I couldn’t get up, and awful anxiety for months on end. I assure you that I gave it plenty of time to see if I would “adjust” to this pill and I had had enough of feeling like I was going insane waiting for that to happen. If this pill worked for you, that’s great. But there’s a large number of us it didn’t work for and that’s okay. Birth control is completely dependent on body chemistry and while some people have done great on this pill, people who have gone through horrible things because of it are completely valid in their reviews as well. Be careful and watch your emotions and mental health when being on Cryselle.

name: Jolivette
comments: I had weight gain and severe hormonal acne after 5 months on Jolivette. I would not recommend.

name: Apri
comments: I’ve been using it for almost 3 years on continuous intake and I’ve been able to cease my period without spotting in betweens packs. I’ve been a pill user for almost ten years to stop my horrible symptoms when I have my period, and this is the only one where I haven’t experienced any side effects.

name: Cryselle
comments: This is the first birth control that I have been on that didn’t cause any harsh side effects! I was mainly placed on it because of my acne which has cleared dramatically. I believe It caused weight gain in the beginning but it has stopped. I was 135 before starting it and now I’m 140. I’ve been 140 for a while now. I can’t recall any mood swings or rapid heart beats.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Despite being a low hormone birth control, I have found a similar amount of side effects compared with other higher hormonal bc pill methods. Yet, knowing that less synthetic hormones is generally healthier for the body, I am staying on the pill and giving it higher stars. On a side note, I have sadly gained 10 pounds in one month; am hoping my increased breast sized may account for this in part. My acne has improved but it is far from gone. No negative effects on my mood thus far.

name: Take Action
comments: I took this pill after having unprotected sex the last day of my period which was July 5th. I was kind of nervous because of the possibility of precum so 13 hours later I took it. I did have some cramps and felt very fatigue. A week later I had brown discharge that lasted for two days. On the second day it turned light pink but just was spotting. The following two and a half weeks a was stressed to the max! I thought I was losing my mind!! My nipples were extremely sore, I had bad headaches, and just wanted to sleep. I did have a little bit of nausea and got nervous that maybe I could be pregnant so I took a test and it came negative. On July 25th my period ended up coming a day early after being extremely emotional the day before and having bad cramps. I had my period for the full length of time and I’ve never been so happy to see Aunt Flo! These reviews helped me while I was stressing. The pill worked for me and it honestly had to do with timing.

name: Ajovy
comments: I will start with my headache days were slashed from about 15 to 2-3, so that's awesome.  Nothing else had ever worked for prevention.  However,  my pants were instantly tighter after starting Ajovy,  but I hadn't gained weight.  It's like I'm retaining water from the waist down. I now have HORRIBLE anxiety,  waking up in panic attacks.  That's when I sleep.  I've had insomnia since I started 3 months ago and nothing will help me sleep.  I hate to stop the only thing that's worked for prevention,  but I can't keep this up.

name: Lessina
comments: Loved it at first and but now I'm totally over it. The first few days I got head aches, that went away quickly and didn't bother me much. The first week I was nauseous, that went away and was bearable. First month went by smoothly. Second month was absolutely bad. Non. Stop. Bleeding. It's not a heavy flow, just light spotting , but three weeks of light spotting is horrible! I've been PMS'ing for three freaking weeks! Fighting with my boyfriend, paranoid anxiety, acne all over my body AND A HORRIBLE VAGINAL ODOR it's not going away and makes my bf not want to have sex. So what's the point of bc if we're not even having sex?! Right now I haven't bled in 3 days which is a  miracle but the smell still lingers and I'm showering 3 times a day.. my Dr keeps telling me to wait the 3/4 months for my body to adjust but the stench is unbearable and I'm probably going to switch brands.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I'm only writing this review because before starting Junel Fe I read so many horrible reviews, I wasn't even going to try them! But I did and I love them!! I use to take Karina and I hated themmmmm!! I love Junel no symptoms at all except for increased sex drive, so that's not a bad side effect... overall I love them... I guess everyone's hormones are different so you have to find what works for you...

name: Amethyst
comments: I was on Amethyst for 2 years and I LOVED it. I spotted my first 2 months and then had no periods, my skin cleared up and I LOST weight! My breast grew two bra sizes and I definitely did NOT lose my sex drive! I wish this worked for everyone as well as it worked for me!

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I'm 36, 182 pounds, and I was ovulating on the day we had sex and my partner didn't pull out. So I went to the local pharmacy and took the pill maybe 40 minutes after we had sex the same day. I took a pregnancy test 7 days later and the test came back negative, twice. About 6 days after I tested for pregnancy, my cycle came 2 days earlier than scheduled. I was scared and worried, had sore breasts and had a lot of hunger pains. I know it's easier said than done, but just be patient and know it'll be ok and it works.

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been on this birth control for about a year now and I really do like it. I was very scared at first because I saw so many bad reviews and got very anxious when I first started taking it. The truth is I never felt any horrible side affects but I did gain a bit of weight since I did notice I was starting to eat more and more. I know every body is different and I guess I was very fortune to not have any of the intense side effects many on this post were saying about.

name: Ajovy
comments:
My miracle drug! I have taken Topamax, depakote, did the ketogenic diet, and tried to manage my migraines for years! Since I can remember, I didn’t know what was like to not have a headache that would become a migraine.  Sometimes 5 days straight and mostly almost once a week.  
Since I started Ajovy 5 months ago, I had ONE very minor headache and it did not become a migraine! 

I am a believer! This is completely worked for me.  A 100% success rate.  Thanks Ajovy!

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: I was on this birth control pill for about 4 month's and it was just not for me.. I had terrible mood swings which were affecting my relationship, started having dark thoughts and was sinking into depression, I lost my appetite completely. It may work for some but i guess just not for me..

name: Adipex-P
comments: Started the Adipex-P June 4th and it is now July 31st and I’ve lost 35 pounds. I’m now at 180lb. No complaints about this medication but I wouldn’t advise taking caffeine while on it or you won’t be able to sleep for days. Lost 17 pounds the first month. Helps me feel motivated and I’m able to fall asleep just fine. The first week I wasn’t able to get much sleep but my body soon became use to the medication.

name: Ajovy
comments:
It's a GODSEND. I've had migraines for about ten years, due to a combination of Lyme Disease and/or Bartonella and/or Ehlers Danlos and/or CSF leak. 

I was fading in and out of migraine on a daily basis, and utterly incapacitated. Botox helped soften them, but the migraines continued.

Then I tried Ajovy. The first time I got a 3-month pack, I didn't refrigerate it, and it had little effect. The second time, I did it properly, and WOW!

As long as I get enough sleep and avoid very loud places, I'm fine. Rainy days and caffeine are fine. Sometimes I can feel the migraine TRYING to happen, but it just doesn't break through into a real full blown migraine. 

Right around my period, and right before I get the next shot is when I'm most prone to minor migraine, but overall, it's been AMAZING.

I've got other health issues so I might not be noticing side effects that others do. I'm willing to take most any kind of side effect in stride if it means I can be without migraines.

name: Apri
comments:
This birth control is not for me. 
It can put me in the worst mood imaginable. If I don’t take it at the same exact time everyday I cramp the next day. Makes my boobs sore 2 weeks in & made my chin break out more. 
This is the 2nd one I’ve been on, I got put on BC for bad cramps and so far it’s helped but I still cramp. 
I do feel like I have lost some weight though.

name: Adderall
comments: Started off with  Adderall  5 mg IR twice daily.  Overall, this is a very low dose.  I have found it was more effective and safer to take it every couple of days.  At least for me.  I have tried 40mg and 60mg before so I am very aware of how intense it can be.  If you take it every day you will end up increasing the dosage.  Try to use it sparingly and try doing activities that produce dopamine naturally like exercise or walking and listening to music.  This will help you feel healthier while taking it.  Overall I think it is helpful but definitely feels unnatural and can't believe they give speed to children.

name: Jolivette
comments: So far so good! I was previously on Ortho Tri but then swapped to generic version TriNessa and it was horrible!! I had break thru bleeding for like a month then bad headaches and I felt like I was going insane with my moods and feelings. I asked gyno to switch me to something not so hardcore and she prescribed Jolivette. Its been  great!  No break thru bleeding, slight headache (once in a while) bigger  boobs and, sometimes  I break out. Other than that I’m doing ok on this pill. I started taking it mid June and I’m on my second pack so I hope it continues to be the same all year. You have to remember to take it at the same time every day, set an alarm because it will not work if you’re late.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments:
60 days of awfulness. I was on Orth Tri-Cyclen Lo for 14 year before switching to Tri-Lo Sprintec. I don't believe it was an equivalent generic.

I’m a strong, independent, hard-working, successful, and happy woman who is very driven  — motivation was the first to go. I gained 12lbs in 1 week. I was irritable, emotional, anxious about everything. I was depressed and had dark thoughts (which I knew was crazy) but couldn’t think straight enough to know I needed help. I had zero sex drive, felt bloated and horrible. Nothing mattered (relationship, career).

I realized I wasn’t alone. After stopping Tri-Lo Sprintec I started thinking clearly, the hazy brain fog was gone.

I switched to Aviane - I'm 3 weeks in with zero side affects. I’m feeling myself again.

Not everyone has extreme reactions to Tri-Lo Sprintec but if you’re on here looking for answers - talk to your doctor. I have submitted this to the FDA and Teva as a formal complaint.

name: Ajovy
comments:
I inherited mind blowing migraines from my grandmother. Since I was 16 I have had 2 a week that leave me helpless in the ER or suffering for 20 hours straight at home. I got tired of taking Imitrex and other harsh medications and refused taking beta blockers for prevention. I had to push my Neuro to try Ajovy, almost like he didnt believe in it. For me to go online and post about anything, it has to be life changing. Ajovy has completely removed my migraines. In 7 months of injections I have yet to get one single migraine. I have pushed my boundaries with all my triggers to test the drug and to my surprise, I can now drink alcohol, eat chocolate and anything else under the sun. I really got my life back and even basic menstrual headaches are very mild and managed with Advil. 

Whomever invented this drug should be proud. This was the best decision I have ever made.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I started this pill when I was 16 for my acne, it was the first pill I ever took. It wasn’t until about a year or two later that I started to realize all the side effects I hadn’t noticed. I was tired ALL the time... like sleep 10 hours at night wake up and take a five hour nap after doing light activity kind of tired because I was drained. I lost all sex drive and arousal. This really took a toll on me emotionally because I was 18 years old and dry as a desert. I was a moody miserable mess and couldn’t stop crying over literally anything. My acne slightly improved but it’s hard to tell if it’s from the pill or my dermatologist visits. This pill did the bare minimum, it kept me from getting pregnant. Stay away from Tri-Sprintec especially if you’re young.

name: Afeditab CR
comments:
I have been on Nifedipine ER for a year to treat my B/P and I take it with Metoprolol & Losartan.  The nifedipine has been effective in keeping my B/P stable (the Metoprolol & Losartan by themselves not so much).
However, I have to put up with bad side effects - swelling of feet, some heart palpitations, flushing of face (on & off), sleep disturbances, really bad neck & shoulder muscle pain, these side effects will last from 4-6 hrs while the nifedipine is working in my body.  I’m talking to my doctor about getting a possible substitute to see if has less side effects.  I don’t know if these side effects are very common but this has been my experience.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I am on my second month of taking Junel Fe 1/20.  I have gained  15 pounds  without changing my eating habits at all  and have had my period for the 16 days.  I am going to give it one more month but I assume I will go off of it.  That’s a ridiculous amount of weight gain and I took it to not get my period in the first place.

name: Take Action
comments: I took the take action pill almost 3 weeks ago. I had dizziness and horrible cramps the first few days after taking it. Then everything seemed like it was okay, but I have now had heavy bleeding for a week now. When I have my periods, they are heavy. This isn’t as heavy as a period, but definitely still a lot of blood. I’m getting a little concerned because the amount of blood has been consistent and has not slowed down. Has anyone dealt with this?

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started off on the lower dose and I hated it! It made me moody and I had lots of breakthrough bleeding. Once they upped my dose to this you would think the moodiness would get worse but the exact opposite happened. I felt normal again. My periods last 4-5 days with only cramping on the first 2-3 days. And the cramping is not bad at all compared to what I went through when I wasn’t on this pill. I’ve been on it for a very long time now and no pregnancies or terrible periods. Definitely works for me

name: Ajovy
comments: I suffer from daily migraines. First two doses were rough. Fatigue and nausea for 3-4 days after injection. Fatigue and nausea not as acute with 3rd dose. Hang in there and have since had 3 more doses. Fatigue only lasts about a day and no more nausea. Now to the headaches: dose one and two very little improvement. Dose 3 some improvement. But after dose 4, huge improvement. I sometimes go three consecutive weeks without at a headache. It's been a miracle drug for me. I'm very happy I hung in there until the 4th and consecutive doses.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Do NOT take this birth control. I’ve been having my period for a month ( which is normal when taking BC because it will eventually regulate) I have only been taking this for a month and a half. I have never been more depressed in my whole life. Crying three times a day. Extreme suicidal thoughts and fits of rage that I have never experienced. Thankfully I have a very patient boyfriend who knew this might be the side effects of the medicine, but I would seriously try any other birth control rather than this one. For some people it worked well, but I feel like it is a hit or miss. Definitely a miss for me. Just this morning I almost checked myself in to a hospital bc I was so sick of these deteriorating thoughts. I feel like I have no control over my mind. I’m getting it switched ASAP tomorrow morning, but please take this into consideration before you start taking this poison. I would not wish how I feel right now on my worst enemy.

name: Aviane
comments:
I've been on this pill going on six years now, and I cannot recommend it enough. My once debilitating menstrual cramps are much lighter, and my period has shortened by three days. The pill is so consistent, I can monitor my cycle down to the hour my bleeding will begin. 
I have had no negative side effects at all. My acne has been reduced, but has not completely disappeared. The pill is effective at preventing pregnancy. Great birth control option that I have my own control over.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I used to be on Advair for over 10 years and now they switched me to this generic one which is cheaper. But it doesn't help my asthma at all and makes it worse! But now the Advair costs $60 because a generic one came out

name: Take Action
comments: I've used it twice. First time was easy and got period a bit late but was still a success. However this second time was different. I had unprotected sex on May 28, took pill 45 min after and my period was due two weeks from that day. No crazy side effects. Fast forward end of June and I still had no sign of period. I was extremely worried and my prayer mode was on. July approached and my period was 3 weeks late! Still too scared to take a test because I was scared. But on July 3 I saw sign of period. Much different than my regular period though. Was very dark red almost brown all 5 days. No period symptoms (headache, acne, bloating, cramps, mood swings) and it was a lighter flow. To be on the safe side of things I decided to finally take the test and I fortunately received a negative result. If you’re reading through these reviews right now, relax. Stress caused mine to be extremely late. So once I calmed down i finally got it! I definitely do think this pill works.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: The ProAir HFA Inhaler constantly clogs

name: Ajovy
comments:
49, migraines started at 12 years old and I tried lots of different drugs over the years. Topamax was the worse. I took 1st Ajovy Shot 10-31-18 and had no migraines and no bad reactions. Then 12/18 noticed a weight gain and bruising under my skin on forearms and shins, but still migraine free. Now fast forward to May 2019 and had gained 28# and covered in red blotches. 
 I saw a hematologist, took last Ajovy shot on May 31, 2019 then had major migraine July 6.  I was switched to Emgality July 12 per neurologist and had severe edema in legs & feet and a general feeling of exhaustion.  I am having to take spirolactone to keep swelling at bay and have gained 5 more pounds and  the bruising has come back.  I am being referred to MUSC.  I have not had a migraine while on the Emgality but several bad sinus type headaches.  I might be unable to tolerate this type of drug.  The weight gain and bruising is depressing as the drugs did work on my migraines.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been on this birth control for a little over a year now, I love it, the first three to four months I had very bad mood swings and normal PMS but after those months I felt fine. Two side effects that I did notice is I never have a sex drive. Another is heavy discharge but nothing too hard to handle. Other than that pill works great I’ve used it a whole year taking it at 8pm and now I’ve changed to 12pm still never had problem and never been pregnant!  I’ve also had my bf finishes inside  many times still not pregnant! :-)

name: Ajovy
comments: I started with Amovig, which worked, migraine episodes decreased but when I did have one I ended up in ER due to pain. My Imtirix did not budge the pain.  I've been to ER for migraine once before in 30 years. I was also bruising on Aimovig so my Neuro changed me to Ajovy.  It works too, migraines have decreased but I cannot stay awake. I am getting sores and abscess which I have never had before, that won't heal or take very long to heal.  I recently had blood drawn which shows it is also affecting my immune system.  My PCP told me to not take these types of medications anymore and I agree.  Sounds like these need more testing done.   I hope all these issues go away soon.  This is horrible!

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
I did not expect to take Aftera TBH.
It was a early morning and I decided  see my ex boyfriend. We had sex right when my period were over but we didn’t use a condom. He said he pulled out and told me that I didn’t need any type of plan b but I was scared so I had to, by 5 pm me and my best friend went to take the Plan B and had a talk with the doctor he told us that it was “ the better version of the plan b, because they used to make 2 pills of this” so we bought it. The next day I started to feel tired and had back pains, started spotting for a whole week , had abdominal pain. After awhile I started to get paranoid because I was about to get my period, but I didn’t received them at all, so I started to panic and searched up for comments on Aftera, I was scared and started to cry. The next morning I went to my best friend house to get the pregnancy test, I was so scared at the point were I was shaking, the test came back negative after a whole month..

name: ParaGard
comments: This cannot be a full review of paragard because I just got it yesterday, but as soon as I got it done I thought that I needed to come online to share my insertion experience because I was TERRIFIED to get it done based on what I was reading online. I know everyone has a different experience but for me, insertion was not NEARLY as bad as I expected based on what I'd read. I have given birth before to one child, and my doctor offered an injection "blocker" which I'm sure helped - I got it placed in one area (she said they could do up to three injections). The pain was very bearable - I would say a 2 out of 10 at worst. Since then, I have had extremely minor cramping and barely there spotting. If you are concerned about pain, talk to your doctor but I was nothing short of relieved and felt obligated to put a different narrative out there online!

name: Lessina
comments:
My pharmacy switched me to Lessina from Aviane saying that it was just a generic brand and basically the same thing so I took it for 4 months. In the first month I noticed my anxiety started to flare up out of control and 
I would get very bad migraines. Then it got worse, I was short of breath from doing simple tasks or even nothing at all. then came numb arms and chest pains and the doctor telling me I have extremely high blood pressure (I've always had great blood pressure). Then I started experiencing excruciating pain from the base of my spine all the way up into my skull and my jaw, I could hardly sleep. I drove myself crazy trying to figure out what was causing it, then I read the side effects of this birth control and realized I had over half of the severe ones. I stopped taking it and all those horrible symptoms stopped. I was so relieved. I know everyone is affected differently so just keep an eye out for the extreme symptoms so that you can get help if you react adversely.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Do yourself a favor and stop reading online reviews as they will literally drive you insane. I convinced myself I was in fact preggers (somehow developed ALL the magical symptoms...in my head of course). With that being said, things happened with my significant other and needless to say we were both a little tipsy so I needed to take this pill. It worked for me, side effects weren't too great but it got the job done. Plan B has failed me once, this did not and it's only second time taking an emergency contraception. I downloaded a fertility app "Glow" which gives you a more accurate time frame of when you would be ovulating just for a peace of mind. I should mention that I am over the recommended weight limit as some reviews suggested (in case you're not a perfect size 2 yourself and are worried). Just relax, buy a pregnancy test (as I did, just in case) and hope for the best.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Got on this pill in January. It is almost August and I’ve had breakthrough bleeding nearly every month. This month I’ve had my period three times in three weeks. I’ve finally requested to be put on a different pill by my doctor. I cannot stand the multiple periods in a month.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I started taking Junel FE 24 a little over a year ago when my Gyno recommended it to me after I complained about heavy, painful periods and acne. She told me it’s her favorite BC pill to prescribe, and I see why. 

This is the first BC pill I’ve taken, so I have nothing to compare it to other than horror stories I’ve heard from friends, but I quite like this one. I’ve had no issues other than some minor weight gain (less than 10 lbs), my periods aren’t painful anymore, and I haven’t had an acne breakout since I started taking it! 

I used to have a pretty irregular cycle - it was not unusual for me to go two or three months without a period - and while they only lasted 4-5 days, I’d bleed so heavily that I had to wear a bad as backup to a heavy tampon if I knew I’d be out for more than a couple of hours. Couple that with breakouts at every period, and cramps so painful it was hard to get out of bed, I needed a solution, and for me, it was this pill.

name: ParaGard
comments:
Had the Paragard put in just over a week ago and the side effects were SO severe that I had to beg to get it taken out only a week after. PLEASE do your own research on copper toxicity related to the insertion of the IUD. There is no information about this on the NHS websites but thousands of people have been affected by this. More research needs to be done on this contraceptive. 

Due to word length restrictions, I can only list my side effect symptoms: 

- anxiety and panic attacks 
- significant hair loss (2 bald patches a month before my wedding!!) 
- bloated stomach
- zero energy 
- brain fog (felt like a zombie)
- craved junk food (normally eat clean)
- insomnia (usually sleep like a doormouse)

I got it out a few days ago and am already feeling SO much better. Not 100% better but I’m seeing a huge improvement already. Trust your instincts over and above a medical professional telling you you shouldn’t have any symptoms from it.

name: Amrix
comments: All I can say is: WOW! Amrix works! I have tried every muscle relaxant under the sun, including Valium, the gold standard of hospitals. Nothing seemed to help. I have moderate to severe muscle spasticity and rigidity. I was in agony before Amrix and noticed a difference on the VERY FIRST DAY! Since I have tried all the alternatives my insurance company had suggested, I was able to get this pre-authorized and covered. If you suffer from muscle pain, spasm, rigidity and trigger points, this is a MUST try.

name: Apri
comments: I decided to get birth control & was prescribed Apri. I was 21 at the time & it was my first time getting/going on birth control. Apri has given me no harsh side effects. In fact it cleared up my cystic acne, regulated my very irregular periods, and has helped to minimize the severe back pain I would get during periods. Although I didn’t gain any weight, Apri did make my breasts grow. Taken on time, everyday, Apri has proven to me to be a very good birth control.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: When I first started taking the pill I don’t notice nothing until a month later I start noticing my personality change I became real mean and low patience with my kids I new something was wrong I kept picking fights with my baby father over really small things like I should be taking bipolar meds or something I gained a lot of weight in my stomach area also I couldn’t really get sleep at night because I felt so depressed and stressed I will never prefer this birth control to no one all these side affects from one little small pill it’s not that serious just use protection

name: Jolessa
comments: Ok so I was on my period for 30 something days and I went to the doctor and all the wanted to do was put me on birth control which I did not want for many reasons !! So basically they didn’t do anything ! 20 something days later I’m still on my period ! Day 54 I wake up and get out of bed and blood just starts running through my clothes all over the floor !  My husband rushed me to the E.R . I had 2 obygn exams there but there was too much blood to know , an ultrasound but nothing was found. All they could really tell me was I was sick with anemia from loss of so much blood and they put me on jolessa for 5 days.  The first day I took 5 and lesser each day. So never found out what truly happen or why my cycle was 54 days and what happen that morning !! Very scary situation and even more scary that trained doctors couldn’t even figure it out.  Overall the jolessa made me feel awful !! Didn’t have a cycle for 6 months.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
So I just started using this last night for the first time. I have had horrible acne every since I was a tween and even worse after 2 kids. Clindamycin and Benzoyle did not touch it. I have read the reviews and to start, my doctor and pharmacist stressed to me NOT to wear this gel on my skin out during the day in the sun. That could be where the bad experiences are coming from. It is supposed to be used at night time before bed strictly. Also to wash off before you go outside from the night before. I am waiting to get into a dermatologist so this is an experiment for me in the meantime since nothing else seems to be working for me.

I will keep posted on how it affects my skin but I would get all the facts before using something as potent as this gel before thinking it will be gone in a week or 2.

name: Provigil
comments: Whether I take 50mg-100mg or 150mg, it always kicks in (if it even does) 12hr after taking it. 95% of the time, I can sleep straight through the med and I’m still severely dragging all day. This med doesn’t work for me.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I used Aftera only because the store was completely out of Plan B. The ingredients are the same so I wasn't pressed about it. That was until I realized I took it the day before my ovulation day. Now I'm not sure exactly when I ovulate, no one is, I'm guessing I had either just ovulated or was in the process of ovulating when my boyfriend came inside me. 40 minutes later I popped a pill and stopped stressing. That's the best advice I can give. Remember you're innocent til proven guilty and not pregnant until proven pregnant. I can't say for sure that this drug worked , maybe I took it before ovulation and it stopped the process. But more likely I think I was lucky enough to not get pregnant (your chances of getting pregnant even when you're trying to have a baby and you do everything right are around 20-30%) . Don't rely on this drug to save you if you've ovulated but take it just in case because maybe you haven't!  I got my period so not pregnant. Getting on a reliable birth control ASAP as I definitely don't need this stress.

name: Apri
comments:
I was on Apri for about 3 years. Originally started birth control as I have irregular, painful,  menstrual cycles and that’s apparently that was all they could do for a teenager with such “irregularities”. 
I loved it for a while because my period symptoms, and pain where basically non existent and my period was only ever 4-5 days along. No acne and didn’t gain any weight or anything. 
Before I got on Apri I was diagnosed with anxiety and depressive disorder. 
This pill played a huge role in what was an ongoing depressive episode for years. 
I stopped taking it in February and I still have my struggles but nowhere near as bad as I did before. 
So basically if you have a mental illness I suggest not taking Apri. 
There is a great chance it will worsen your symptoms.

name: Jolessa
comments: I always had heavy unpredictable periods and hated it. After spending two months straight bleeding an extremely heavy, clotting flow I asked my doctor about alternatives and she recommended taking birth control pills without the weekly break. I started on a different medication but switched to this one because insurance covers it at no cost to me. I haven't had a period in over 10 years and I've never been happier.

name: Aviane
comments: I've been on Aviane for 13 years.  I don't experience a single negative symptom and the few times over the many years I've missed a month (due to vacationing and forgetting my birth control pack at home), my cramps are significant.  On the pill, I don't experience cramps, weight gain, mood swings, or...anything.  Off the pill...I get cramps during my cycle.  This bc works very well with my system.

name: Cryselle
comments:
WORST BIRTH CONTROL EVER!!!
Positive: It helps with the bleeding and cramps.
Negative: I never had health issues until now. I’m having the worst anxiety attacks, panic attacks and depression.  I feel like I’m going crazy! It makes you feel you’re in a dark place... 
If you have these symptoms you should go to your doctor immediately.

name: ParaGard
comments:
The paragard is seriously heaven sent!  
I love my birth control for several reasons! 
1.I NEVER have problems on  it, my periods haven’t change, my bleeding isn’t heavier nor is my cramps worse. 
2. Me & my husband have unprotected sex  with just  the paragard, we  know it works amazingly! 
3. It doesn’t have any hormones, so I’m not a crazy cow to everyone!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started this for birth control. I didn’t read the reviews but just went with the recommendation of my doctor. I’m glad I did that so I wasn’t paranoid and looking to overanalyze everything. I had some abdominal pain week 1. My weight has remained steady. Appetite the same. No mood swings. Acne has improved but my skin is still far from perfect. Whenever I take the placebo pills my acne flares up again. But I can’t complain. So far so good!

name: Adderall
comments: Adderall is literally the only THING Period that I have tried that has improved my life in the slightest (I have ADD/Treatment-Resistant Depression ) - I got my Bachelors degree in Health & Psychology, I tried EVERY supplement herb, nootropic, etc. I'm commenting here is because of all the people saying how it drained them, or over time began making them feel worse - you need to educate yourself - one of the most important being, be SURE to be supplementing with TYROSINE, literally daily (tyrosine converts into Dopamine - like how 5-HTP converts to Serotonin) just like how SSRI's eventually "poop out" and just stop working (because they've used up the bodies natural serotonin) Adderall will eventually "poop out" on you, stop working, yet even worse when this happens, the more you take the WORSE you feel because its like revving an engine with no gasoline left in it!!! Theres plenty more to look into but even just taking Tyrosine makes a HUGE difference!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been taking Junel for 4 years and have always thought the pill worked great. No pregnancy, no weight gain, lighter periods, etc. But now I am starting to wonder if my more frequent hair loss is because of it. My hair was very thick before starting the pill and now I have average to thin hair. It has really thinned my hair out by my part line, to the point where I don't feel comfortable putting my hair in a high bun without a headband. I never put two and two together but I also have no sex drive since starting the pill. After reading these reviews, I'm starting to wonder if its all because of the pill.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
I thought it was just me not liking the new delivery system of Qvar. I told my Dr. the Qvar RediHaler wasn't working and he looked at me like I had 4 heads. I kept trying to use it and noticed the the thing would spray when I closed the cover!!! This is why I wasn't getting any medicine! I have been into the Drs twice once in April and again in June for out of control asthma.  I didn't think of calling them until reading theses comments. I will be calling them and letting them know of this malfunction and hopefully they will send me another. I did end up breaking the thing in half and just spraying myself and it worked!!
The Qvar company needs to fix this problem with the RediHaler or go back to the old delivery system. It's very apparent that the majority of users think it's awful!

name: Sprintec
comments: I have always suffered from heavy bleeding since I was 16 and now I’m 39. I was put on Mirena IUD but had to have it replaced since it fell out twice. Was put on Sprintec about 8 months ago and have been spotting nonstop straight like a stuck pig in a butcher shop ever since. There have been times where I have had to change my Super + tampon and over night pad all at once with in 15mins because I bled so bad and almost fainted. I also have fibroids I have not been able to keep my appointments with my gynecologist and have to keep canceling my ultrasound/consultation for an hysterectomy due to the bleeding.  And on top of this my new doctor said I should never have been put on Sprintec in the first place due to my high blood pressure. I hope this helps someone because I came here crying and fed up because I have no one else to relate to. Good luck ladies!

name: Take Action
comments: The condom ripped so I took this just to be safe. I had a period the week before this happened. 5 days after I took the pill I had bleeding as if it was another period which lasted 5 days (which I hope it was actually my period) not really any other side effects. But now it’s the 27th day since that one ended and I’m a little concerned. I’ve taken 3 tests and they all came out negative. Praying for a period right now. Just go buy another pill. This stress wasn’t worth it

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I have suffered with asthma my entire life so I am familiar with many drugs used to treat this disease.  Advair was prescribed to me 30 years ago and I have loved it from the beginning.  I no longer had to suffer with the jitters and hyper behavior, like ALL of my prior medications.  I take this daily/as prescribed and have no complaints or awful side effects.  Sometimes my breath smells bad as a result but I can breathe so I can't really complain.  Thank you-now if only I could get my insurance provider to cover it.
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Austedo
comments: Used Austedo for a  patient - Less somnolence than other VMAT2's without any anticholinergic like side effects.

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: Sharing my experience because I promised I would to calm others' nerves if it worked for me. I'm a 20 year old college student who had sex during my fertile window and the condom broke!! He finished completely inside of me. I had been on and off birth control, but was off it for a couple of months with plans to change to another form. I ran to the pharmacy and took Plan B within an hour of this happening. reading reviews that said that Plan B was ineffective during ovulation made me want to DIE. I was an anxious mess for two weeks. I did have some side effects after taking it, including swollen breasts (the first sign of pregnancy which sent me off the deep end) and mood swings. However, after much waiting, my period finally came..and four days early! My cramps are unbearable, but its better than being pregnant ... right? Plan B DOES WORK. IT IS EFFECTIVE EVEN DURING OVULATION. To the girl who's reading this with her heart in her throat, take a deep breath and know that Plan B works.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: Every birth control pill will react differently to each of our bodies ! The best thing to do is to just try it out and stop taking them if we see changes we don’t like. I personally LOVE this brand. My experience is awesome ! I was never regular so it has helped me get my period every month. My mood swings are normal but I feel more energetic, I lost weight and I feel better than ever! Sex being involved, we all know that nothing is 100 percent accurate but I had unprotected sex with my partner over a year and I’ve had no surprises thankfully. Continue the routine with a pill and see if you could either love it or hate it! Glad to give another opinion and make the best decision that suits your body(:

name: Adipex-P
comments: Hello, I am 44 years old and I was 182 pounds 3 Months ago. I started diet by my self and I was able to lose 10 pounds. I went down to 172...Then I stuck.  I finally went to my doctor and he prescribe me the Adipex pill. I started last Thursday at 172.5 pounds exactly  6 days later i am down to 166.6 and its not even a week yet. I will keep you posted. As far side effects only the 1st 2 days, light headache but I am OK now, very thirsty  I started walking every day for at least 35 minutes( I still have a problem with my foot so I go very slowly, but I am trying). So far I love it. I am not hungry, and I am very careful what I eat. I eat , vegetables, fruits, lots of water and fish. Sometimes small piece of Grilled chicken, I forget to eat, but I am trying to eat in between, veggies or fruits because I don't want to gain all the pounds back once I stop the medication. I will take it for 3 months. So I still have long way to go. I need to go down to 130 . 36.6 pounds to lose.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on birth control since I’m 15 years old (now 23 years old) because of the chronic pain and bloating I would get on my periods not to mention the very heavy flow. I’ve been on 4 different pills. I was taking Necon for 3 years, which was my favorite pill. Unfortunately, my pharmacy said the manufacturers  were no longer making Necon and I had to switch to the generic brand of Nortrel. I’ve now been on Nortrel for about 2.5 years. I have only one complaint and it is a very crucial one... I receive HORRIBLE migraines. Other than that I react okay to the pill. My mood is fine. I don’t PMS. My flow is light. Periods last 3-4 days. I could say weight gain, but I’m not going to blame my overeating on a pill... that’s just me being unhealthy. As fast as I gain the weight, I can lose the weight so that’s the issue. It’s only those darn migraines. When they hit... they hit hard.

name: ParaGard
comments: It does prevent pregnancy, but I've had many problems with ParaGard. Ever since, my periods have been like night & day from what they were my entire life (I am 39 yrs old). I bleed 3 weeks a month & my cramps are much worse. Today I made an appointment to have it removed. I chose to look up some info in the hopes of finding that other's had gone through this & relief is on it's way. SO MANY other issues I have read here are also things I've been dealing with. I've had depression & anxiety, I've gained 60 lbs. I've experienced vaginal odor that I never had before. I'm in shock that so many others have had these symptoms. I just thought I was going to get my normal periods back after it's taken out in 2 weeks. Now I'm attributing other serious issues to the IUD and hope so badly that things go back to normal in all areas. NOT WORTH IT! DO NOT GET THIS IUD!

name: Ajovy
comments: Daily headaches have improved! I’m really only getting headaches during my period, which is an improvement, but I gained 12 lbs within 3 months of starting the drug. I’m 8 months in and may discontinue or switch to one of the others and see what happens.

name: Jolessa
comments: I started taking Jolessa in May 2018 and it worked very well for me until recently. I started Jolessa because I had really bad cramps while on my period and heavy bleeding, Jolessa seemed to fix that problem where I never really had any cramps and had a very light period. A couple weeks ago I noticed that I was spotting, which I had never had on this birth control before, but I thought it was normal. Then I started to have AWFUL cramps to the point where it would bring me to tears. After this went on for about three weeks I made an appointment with my OBGYN for an ultrasound, where she found that Jolessa caused me to have a blood clot in my uterus. Ever since I stopped taking Jolessa, my problems have stopped and I’m hopeful that my blood clot will dissolve by my next ultrasound appointment.

name: Aviane
comments: I’ve been on this Aviane pill since February (so about 5 months now) and I absolutely hate the way it makes me feel. Ever since starting Aviane, my periods have been at least 10 days long or more and my last period lasted a full 2 weeks which is incredibly annoying. I have the worst mood swings ever and cry at the slightest things and often find myself hysterically crying for no reason. I have felt incredibly depressed since starting Aviane and want nothing more than to feel like my old self again. The only positives of this pill were that I didn’t gain any weight, didn’t experience any acne breakouts, my sex drive didn’t decrease, and most importantly, I didn’t get pregnant! I talked with my doctor and she believes the reason for my symptoms is that the dosage of hormones is just too low for my body so I received a prescription for a pill with a little bit higher dosage (Marlissa) and will be starting that soon.

name: Adderall
comments: I have always known that I had ADD. However, I was in grad school, and I was studying for up to 10-12 hours a day. I found myself reading and re-reading and was having a hard time retaining information, because I couldn't stay focused. I would study for hours. Long story short, for my master's degree, I had to take practice timed test for NP boards, I failed it. My instructor told me to get tested for ADHD,  and get on medications. I did, and it was the best thing I have ever done, and wish I did it sooner, it cut my studying by half, because I'm very focused. I didn't have to request extra time for my NP boards, and I passed with time to spare. I have no side effects; incr. HR, BP, I eat and exercise, and don't take it late in afternoon to avoid insomnia. I only take it when I study and not everyday.  I believe it's about making the drug work for you and not let the drug control you.  Medication "holidays" are great to do.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been taking nortrel for 6 years and have been the first contraceptive pills I have ever tried. I am 30 years old and have not had any problem or side effects. No weight gain at all. Probably the only thing would be a lighter period lasting 3 days but I won’t complain about that.

name: Nora-Be
comments: 49 years old got on this medication to regulate insanely heavy periods. At 7 weeks I have not yet had a period - yay! However, in the last two weeks I began developing lower abdominal pain and cramping on right side. At times there is a great deal of pressure, causing an urgency to urinate. Very distracting and uncomfortable and has me using the bathroom every hour. My doctor said to try to stick it out but I am getting off of this medication due to these side effects. I read online that progesterone can cause changes and functioning to the GI tract  like mine. I also have some nausea and heartburn with this medication so I don't think it is for me. Also noticed my hair falling out at about week 5. Everybody is different, but I think I will try and more natural approach to lightening my periods. Good luck everybody!

name: Qvar
comments: I’m so annoyed (understatement) that Qvar changed my 3 month of inhalers to 1 at a astronomical cost.  My 3 month inhalers worked just fine.  Now I have to pay for a one month inhaler at the same price I got 3.  AND WHEN I OPEN INHALER IT COMES APART SO I CAN'T GET THE MED INSIDE UNTIL I PUT IT BACK TOGETHER.  It sucks, damn drug companies.  I will need to contact Teva directly

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I absolutely hate it. Took it for 1.5 weeks and stopped because I was bleeding; and I still am. It’s been three weeks of bleeding now. I’m miserable. 

Mood changes (for the worst) 
Generally feeling more irritable than usual, probably because I haven’t stopped bleeding for three weeks. 

It’s not worth wrecking your body over. NEVER AGAIN.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: My Doctor prescribed  Proair Respiclick instead of my Proair inhaler.  It us horrible when I need my rescue inhaler this does absolutely nothing to help me breath. I also find that I have a problem trying to inhale the powder when I am already short of breath.  Terrible medication

name: Amethyst
comments: On Amethyst birth control I spotted kinda a lot for the first 3 months, I have been on it for about 6 months now.  I still some spotting but very minimal, hardly noticeable and only for a few days, sometimes before it would be over a week but not more than 2. I haven't had any other physical symptoms though, and no noticeable mental health changes (wasn't perfect before but if anything has slightly improved because previously my periods caused bad mood swings and self loathing). Honestly, I've had some positive physical changes- my butt and boobs have gotten bigger but I haven't really gained any weight in my stomach or elsewhere and my metabolism seems about the same so far.

name: Kariva
comments: I started taking Kariva for irregular periods after being on another pill. At first, it was fine because my periods were lighter but after a few weeks I started getting terrible cramps, bloating and my acne got awful. It also completely changed my mood and my sex drive is absolutely non-existent. Will definitely be switching.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I have abnormal bleeding with heavy clots every day. I go for days if not weeks or months with spotting after an 8 day cycle. Back in December 2018 I got the Mirena IUD and my body expelled it on the 29th day. I got it the second time and again it came out by the 2nd week. My Dr. recommended Nora Be and after reading all these side effects I decided not to even bothered with it. So thank you to all of you because your comments do help.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I have been on Advair 500 for many years and my asthma has been under control. Before taking this I had attacks all day long. Now they have made a generic that I have been on for almost 3 months. My attacks are coming back. And insurance will no longer cover Advair.  It’s very frustrating. I also have coronary artery spasms which are due entirely to the severe asthma. So now not only am I having to use the nebulizer more but I’m also having to take nitro more for my heart.
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: Lessina
comments: I realized after trying about three different birth control pills I never really had side effects from any of them except for my first one which   gave me acne. This pill cleared up all my acne and I realized to not trust the reviews on birth control websites because if you think about it the only time people are going to write a review about their birth control is if it’s not working for them. People don’t get on these websites to talk about how great they are for them. I’m not having any issues with Lessina as I’m sure most people are this birth-control is fine

name: Nuvigil
comments: I was prescribed this for Narcolepsy when I was 16 (am 23 now). My doctor wanted to prescribe to me Modafinil, its sister drug, but for reasons unknown to me (idk maybe insurance or laws. I really don't remember). I had an adverse reaction that sent me to the hospital. Almost went into cardiac arrest and probably would've had I not gone to the emergency room when I did. Uncontrollable shaking and heart palpitations (heart rate 160+).

name: Seasonique
comments:
I've been on this pill since 2008.  I've been period free since 2009 - I skip the placebo week and move straight to the next pack.  When I first started the pill I had horrible side effects (mood swings, breakthrough bleeding) but these have all gone away.  

I used to have horrible cramps back when I was a teen and that was the initial reason for going on the pill - I actually would go home sick due to the pain.  Obviously not an issue now.  

Definitely would recommend if you want to be period-free.  It may take a few months to get to that stage, but well worth it.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments:
Ok Tri Lo-Sprintec works for preventing pregnancy but honestly I don’t know anymore if it’s worth it. I have been on it for 4 months now and recently I find myself crying, without appetite, sad, I feel so hopeless right now! Not even my little baby cheers me up and this is not me, my assumption is that this pill is messing up my mind. I should stop it and try to be my happy self again though I don’t know what pill to try now all of them have the same type of feedback. I’m afraid to try another one that might be even worst. I just wanna feel happy to be alive again. 
Secondly I’ve been having pain in my breasts and they feel heavy and swollen like when you breastfeed burn and I'm not breastfeeding since months and months ago!! Anyone else felt breast pain on this pill? 
Oh !! Third but not last my libido has decreased a little bit significantly but I have noticed is not the same as before either. 
So Yeap. I’m thinking to give up on this!

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I had been on Qvar for a couple years.  I didn’t realize  for a while  but when the inhaler changed to the RediHaler my health went downhill.  My thyroid was affected, and I ended up with adrenal fatigue as well. No appetite, and after 9 months I was dropping weight fast.  What finally clicked was my super super dry mouth-thrush.  I started researching and found that the RediHaler can have the side effects-but they are rare.  The day after I stopped this medication my appetite was back.  2 1/2 months later my energy is slowly getting back to normal, but I need to rest a lot.

name: Jolessa
comments: Been on Jolessa for 11 days and counting.  Had nausea, headache and stomachache the first three days.  That’s done, but now I’m still bleeding even though my period finished almost a week ago.  Woke up this morning with brown blood running down my legs and saw big clots on the toilet paper when I wiped myself.  That has never happened to me with any of the other contraceptives I’ve taken (Yaz, Tri Sprintec, progestin-only pills, Nexplanon).  Doc says to keep at it for the full three months but I think I’m ready to call it quits with Jolessa.

name: Adderall
comments: If it wasn’t for Adderall I would be a basket case no questions asked. I'm 55 been on it since 2014 on an everyday basis. I'll take a day off every so often, but it's a rare occasion. My Blood Pressure is 122/74- pulse 64 when moving around normally. Resting my BP is lower along with the pulse rate. If you are relatively healthy heart wise no problems. I know one guy who's pushing 76 years old and he's still taking his prescribed dosage.

name: Qvar
comments: I have had a good experience with Qvar but my doctor won't give more prescriptions.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
I made myself a promise that I would review this if it worked for me. I had a mishap during sex and the condom slipped off. I was not entirely sure if he ejaculated in me or not. At first, I was going to play it out since it was at around one a.m but I got super paranoid since I was ovulating. I got Aftera 5-8 hours after the mishap. 
The symptoms I had were beyond crazy. My boobs were itchy and sore, I was tired all the time, peeing frequently, constantly bloated or nauseous( basically most of the pregnancy symptoms for about two weeks). 
I took two pregnancy tests which both came out negative despite symptoms. My period was late by about three days. It was so light that I thought it was spotting. Came for less days too. On to my second month, my period came in a week early and is very heavy. 
I hope this soothes your anxiety. I did not get pregnant and I hope your experience will be good.

name: Seasonique
comments: I am on my 3rd month of this birth control and at first glance I thought this would be wonderful. I recently switched from Nexplanon to Seasonique and I'm starting to regret that change. I have been bleeding for 17 days and it does not seem to let up. I am still experiencing menstrual cramps on top of the bleeding and I am not seeing a light at the end of the tunnel. Although I want to continue the pack, I am having second thoughts. Nexplanon isn't great, but this isn't a holy grail to your period answers either. Pick your poison ladies.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I used Qvar since 2007.  I considered it my miracle drug because it had my asthma under control.  I almost never had to use my rescue inhaler.  THEN the inhaler design was changed. I could not get the counter to go down; therefore, I didn’t know if I was getting any medicine.  I tried 6 of the new inhalers. The counter did not go down for any of them. I talked to three pharmacists, and I demonstrated how I used it.  All three said that I was using it properly. I also talked to the manufacture and they wouldn’t send me anymore since they had replaced the first three. I also talked to about 10 pharmacists on the phone. I also reported it to the FDA. They should not have taken the old design off the market until they were sure the new design worked.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: No problems. It reduced my periods and cramps, worked effectively as birth control, and I didn't experience any side effects.

name: Claravis
comments: My 16 year old son will take his last dose of Claravis today. It has been a game changer. He started on Bactrim at age 13 but it made him too sick to continue (nausea). We tried Minocycline for a couple of years but the results were minimal and then it just stopped working. In October of 2018, his dermatologist was worried about the increased scarring he was seeing and suggested Claravis. I was very reluctant due to internet horror stories about the history of Accutane. My son was desperate so I agreed to let him try. Luckily he had very few side affects (dry skin, chapped lips, occasional nose bleeds and some fatigue as expected). Today his skin looks amazing. He has some residual scarring but hopefully that will fade with time. As a worrier, I have to say I am so grateful that we tried this. The cost was RIDICULOUS and the blood draws were stressful but the results have been amazing. It takes time but don't give up.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: So , my boyfriend and I had protected sex on the 26 of June. but the condom broke and he came inside me. Hours later we went to go get a Plan B but didn’t have enough so we got Aftera. I took it as soon as I got it . I was supposed to get my period on the 30th of June but didn’t get it until the 6 of July. That really scared me because I thought I was pregnant. But, overall it worked so that’s just what I’m thankful for .

name: Ajovy
comments:
40 year old female. I've been suffering from chronic cluster headache for 20+ years. Just started getting migraines in the last 5 years. I take nortriptyline and lamictal for prophylactics, and maxalt and cambia for rescue meds. Seems everything has stopped working. Had my 1st shot of Ajovy 2 days ago. I'm SO EXHAUSTED AND SORE ALL OVER already. I don't know if I can do a 2nd dose. My 3 little boys destroyed my house 2 days in a row because I just...cant.
Do these side effects get better?
I haven't had a headache yet, but I guess I've gotten so used to them I can at least keep up with the boys. The fatigue is very worrisome.

name: Ocella
comments: I’ve been on Ocella for about a year and 7 months, I was put on it after I took Loestrin Fe 1/20 due to break through bleeding after 6 months of taking it. Ocella never gave me any noticeable side effects. No weight gain/loss, no depression or anxiety. Periods always on time. And it 100% prevented pregnancy. The only side effect that I still barely get is slight nausea if I am awake super early. It tremendously helped my acne and my periods are always on time. Remember every person will have different effects on their body but I feel as if this will reassure some people on it. However, the one thing I just started noticing was the blood clot and DVT risk being higher in BC’s containing drospirenone so with that being said I will be looking into changing to a different brand (only because I’m a worrier about stuff like this).

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
My  inhaler malfunctioned after the counter showed respectively 28 and 52.  This forces me to order a new inhaler before my insurance will  partially pay for it.  Also, I was out of town last time this problem occurred.

I will be asking the Dr. for a new prescription—-if possible an inhaler that will not be a Redihaler type.

name: Ajovy
comments: By the second month of injecting 225mg, I have had a miracle response. No more migraines. And I was having them on a daily basis. Suddenly after the third injection, I am lethargic, spacey, can’t recall simple words, and  experiencing significant anxiety. My injection site is very red, inflamed, tender, and itchy. I am scheduling to be seen by my doctor because I am very worried about the sudden appearance of side effects. I will not be using Ajovy again.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have tried numerous birth controls over the past couple years, I had a problem where I would be on my period for 3 months straight off for a month or so then my period would come again for another straight three months and birth control is the only help. Junel Fe has been wonderful for me, my periods are short and light and at most they last for four days, no side effects at all this has worked wonderful for me.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Not the same. I was on ortho tri cyclen lo for 15 years (age 16-31). Initially went on it after a round of Accutane in highschool to help keep my hormonal cystic acne at bay. It worked great and kept the babies away all throughout college and in my later 20’s. I went off it a couple years before my husband and I were planning to conceive to clean out my system. After I had my baby at 34 I was put on mini pill. Overall I didn’t mind Heather but I did get nausea on it and my periods weren’t predictable. I asked to switch back to my tried and true- ortho tri cyclen lo, only to find out they don’t make it anymore! Insert huge sad face with streaming tears. Still hopeful, I tried the generic version- this one Tri-Lo-Sprintec. It is definitely no way like it at all. My chin has completely broken out and my ovaries are swollen to the point of barely walkable cramps- 2 weeks in. This never happened with Ortho. So upset they don’t make Ortho any more I will probably stop using the pill all together.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I have had irregular periods but recently in May, I had a period for about 3 weeks and I was tired of it. So I went to the doctor and was told Tri-Sprintec would help, I started taking it the beginning of June and have been on it for almost a month now. With no luck, I’m still bleeding constantly. I continued the pill to see if the bleeding would eventually stop but unfortunately it hasn’t. During the first week I received loss of appetite, extreme anxiety, night sweats, depression and nausea, and the side effects still occur. I’m going to finish the pack bc hopefully I’ll receive some luck but I do not plan to continue this pill after this first pack.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Worst birth control on the planet. I experienced every negative side effect immediately after starting it (nausea, headaches, bloating, fatigue, complete brain fog, dizzy, horrible cystic acne), and now, after deciding to completely quit it 4 months later due to these side effects, I got diagnosed with a DVT. A freaking BLOOD CLOT in my leg, after being on this for only 4 months. And, after reading other reviews, it doesn't sound like I am the only one who has experienced this. Hundreds of dollars later for tests and medication, now I have to take blood thinners for 3 months. STAY away from this mediation!

name: Lessina
comments:
I would not recommend this pill to anyone who has prior anxiety issues.  Typically I am able to keep my anxiety under control with exercise and diet, however, on this pill, it has been off the charts.  Every day I go from being okay, to running scenarios in my head that are outrageous, to feelings of impending doom, to being okay again.  My chest constantly feels tight and my breath is short.  At first, I wasn't sure if all this was the pill or the changes I have going on in my life (new job, going on a trip without my kids, husband transitioning jobs), however, while I was on my period the issues were manageable and I didn't feel like a complete nutbag all the time.  
Along with the above, the hormonal acne I currently have is getting worse and I am retaining a ton of water.  I am sure this pill works great for some women but it is absolutely wrecking my system and in the process of trying to get off it now.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I can’t believe it took me 6 months to figure out this pill was making me lose my mind. I have been on Trinessa Lo for about 3 years, and when they discontinued it a few months ago during the winter they put me on Tri Lo Sprintec. The pharmacist said that it was the same. HA. I have had insane mood swings, depression for the fors time time in my life, irritability, fatigue, and no libido. My good friends mom is a OB and is getting me on a new pill. This should not be a substitute for orthotrycylin Lo or Trinessa Lo, it freaking sucks!

name: Cryselle
comments: I love this birth control pill. My period lasts a total of three days and is very light with little cramps. Without the pill I am a heavy bleeder with severe cramps that make me throw up. This pill is a life saver.

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: I took one month of this pill and immediately broke out with acne worse than I’ve had in years. I also had early breakthrough period for days. Going back to my other brand.

name: Sprintec
comments:
I have done NOTHING but bleed while on the Sprintec Pill. I have bled, and bled, and bled, to the point where I needed to use Bladder Leakage pants to help with the bleeding, as I would go through Pads and tampons like CRAZY.

I used a whole box of a 18 tampons in ONE day. (Super AND regular) they were both DRIPPING. (Tmi, I know) 

Honestly, This is the WORST medicine I have EVER taken for Birth control. Would NOT recommend to ANYONE. 

I don't even take the Sugar Pills!

name: Cryselle
comments: I have been on Cryselle for 5 years now. At first it did its exact job, prevented pregnancy and regulated my period. I became an emotional roller coaster once I got on the pill but my mom and I always chalked it up to teenager issues (I got on it when I was 16). Once I got older and grew to realize that I was severely struggling with anxiety and depression, I felt it was best that I got off. I only got off a week ago so I can’t say what side effects come yet, but I will say that this pill makes anxiety and depression so much worse than I could have ever expected! I also struggled with severe acne in high school. Never any weight gain though, but with the depression, I had severe body dysmorphia and anorexia could have just kept my weight down.

name: Antabuse
comments: I'ts been a hit and miss venture with Antabuse, mostly hit. Sometimes I would take it for 2 months, miss a day, and then fall off the wagon that very night because I "forgot" to take it that morning. I literally cannot skip even ONE pill or else I will drink. BUT, if I take the pill every day... no drinking cravings. I can walk right by the LCBO and not be tempted. You must be vigilant when taking this med and not skip days. Put the pill where you'll see it every morning. I had mine stuffed in my desk drawer partly because I didn't want the wife knowing I was an alcoholic. The other thing that has aided me is my faith in my savior, Jesus Christ. He has given me so many chances to get my act together, and every time I fall I come crawling back to Him on my knees, crying... and He forgives me every time! Hopefully one day I will be able to stop taking Antabuse but I think it will be at least 2 years before sobriety is 'cemented'.

name: ParaGard
comments: Cannot wait to get this out of me. I have had horrible insomnia, fatigued and tired all the time, feel weak, headaches, sometimes get nauseous for no reason, I have HORRIBLE cramps, menstruating or not, I've had the WORST anxiety and depression issues, awful thoughts that worsen it, no libido whatsoever, hair is constantly tangly and dry, and I get these weird painful, rashy, bumps on my face that stick around FOR EVER. I just don't feel like ME anymore and it all started after I got this IUD in Feb 2018. DON'T risk this.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I started using the new  Qvar RediHaler inhaler in December, 2018, and had issues almost from the start. I’m happy to see that others have as well, because my pharmacy made me feel as if the fault was mine. I know the RediHaler is ineffective because I had an old inhaler that had 100 puffs left on it, so in March, after many calls to the company (and they did graciously replace the inhalers a couple of times at their expense, but to no avail) I finished out my old inhaler and I was fine during that time. Now that I’m back on the new inhaler, I’m wheezing again and I’m very unhappy. Anyone who suffers from asthma knows all too well how frightening it is to not get relief from a trusted medication.  This once effective, expensive medication (I pay out of pocket) is no longer doing it’s job!  Please find a way return to the original dispenser without compromising the quality of the medication.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: This RediHaler device inhaler cost too much  and broke halfway through using it

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I had to switch from Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo to Tri-Lo-Sprintec  due to my original being discontinued. The first 2 out 4 weeks of each birth control pack is just fine. I didn't mind the weight gain and my mood swings were similar to my other birth control. HOWEVER, this birth control will seriously messes up your health. I've been having constant migraines and at one point thought I was having a heart attack. I talked to my doctor about my symptoms and she agreed that it was best to get off this birth control. It gave me panic attack like symptoms and is not worth preventing pregnancy. My period come 3 days late anyways so I spend those days panicking if I'm pregnant. Do yourself a favor and invest in something else.

name: Sprintec
comments: I struggled with irregular periods ever since I started my period at 14, so at 18 I decided to go on birth control (also because I became sexual active). I've been on it for about 7 months now, and my experience has been overwhelmingly positive. For the first three months it made my emotions a little weird, my periods heavier, and my breasts tender, but now that my body is used to it I have 0 side effects whatsoever. No weight gain at all (in fact, I've lost a bit of weight), no decreased libido, no spotting or mood changes. It's also made my skin incredibly clear which is a nice plus. I love this birth control because it's worked so well for me.

name: Apri
comments: So I've seen a lot of bad reviews and I was kinda shocked. I used to take this some years back and because I didn't know how to get more or just too embarrassed to get more I stopped using it. My experience on it previously was really good I had no acne, no periods, no babies. My mood was always good a little more fiesty but I had more confidence. I lost weight probably 10 pounds I was a little too skinny. My sex drive was through the roof as well, which could be uncomfortable at times (I was single then). I went on different ones after that nuva ring gave me leg pains so I stopped it loestrin Fe I think. Those sucked so I went back to old faithful, my acne got really bad after I got off nuva ring and hadn't had acne since I was 17

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I’ve have been on Junel 1/20 for about six months. I was on Aviane which I really liked had no complaints. I got a new doctor who switched me to Junel (no at all the same)  I had a really heavy period for the full 7 days for the first month. After that haven’t had a period since. Which is my favorite thing about it. The only side effect I’m experiencing just recently is vaginal dryness, even when I’m in the mood. Which is a bummer cause I haven’t experienced that till now.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: This pill was the worst decision of my life. I started off using Mononessa as birth control and to regulate my period around 4 years ago and stayed on the pill until now.
