A month ago I switched to Tri Lo Sprintec to help some weird acne I was getting constantly  on the Mononessa , but the  Tri Lo Sprintec is just was horrible. All the side effects hit me hard, the migraines, anxiety, depression. I had around 3 panic attacks that last hours for every week so I decided to ditch the pill and now I’m letting my body just clean itself out.

name: Take Action
comments: Took this within 2 hours of having unprotected sex, 9 days after my last period started. Had bad stomach ache, cramping, and headaches a few days after but no period. Took a test after 3 weeks like the insert recommended: positive. Bought 2 more pregnancy test brands out of disbelief and all came back positive. Do not waste your time on this pill. It doesn't work.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
Junel Fe 24 is a good birth control have a ton of discharge but thats pretty much it.
I get barely any bleeding now, versus before my periods were 5 days and heavy.
No cramps
No acne
So far no babies but we pull out too
I love it

name: Plan B One-Step
comments: READ THIS SIS. I had the worst case scenario by far and I’m NOT PREGNANT! I’m not on any birth control and did not use a condom. How stupid, anyways, we had sex on the day before my ovulation day, therefore it was my fertile day! He finished in me and I was shook because I didn’t think he’d actually do it! Well, he did. I freaked out! But like idiots, we had sex two more times within 2 hours and he finished in me again. So that’s a total of 3 damn bus loads of his kids in me. Within the hour of our last round of sex, I bought this and took it immediately. The only side effects I felt were tender breast, whew, they hurt for about two weeks! Also mood swings. I was aggravated and emotional as anything. But I got my period today. Thank goodness. It was really a miracle. Stay protected ladies. I’m definitely wearing protection next time. Remain calm as well and PRAY

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I am 34 years old. I have 2 children one is 8 and one is 6. I switched to this birth control from Ortho. I got pregnant on this pill. I had to have a abortion because I am not able to have another baby. I was 6 weeks pregnant. I took this pill everyday I never skip one pill. This has put me in a depression and now I can’t get out of it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have Stage III endometriosis and have had two surgeries in two years. I was put on Nortrel continuously for the past few years and never had endo symptoms, no sore breasts, no period or spotting, and overall didn’t feel emotional or anything. Unlike most here my pharmacy gave me Necon saying it’s the same (it is the generic).. even though the binders aren’t. And I had two weeks of sore breasts and just started my period for the first time in two years. Terrible pain and issues. So I would take anybody’s opinion with a grain of salt, even mine. It fully depends on how your body metabolizes ALL of the ingredients not just the active ones! Ratings on medications can only get you so far without trying it, unfortunately.

name: ParaGard
comments: So I tried it 2x. 1st after my 2nd child. I gained lots weight, got acne, cramps and bleeding heavily. Finally it fell out about 2yrs later. My doc said my body rejected it. I feel like they have false ads saying it has little side effects. Gave it the benefit of the doubt tried it a 2nd time since my birth control pills were no longer covered by my insurance. Huge mistake. Same thing all over horrible acne, gained 40 lbs in 1 yr . Nothing helps me lose weight. I was going through tampons  & a extra heavy flow pad with in 1 hr. kept bleeding thru my clothes not to mention 10 day periods. My life was on hold had to miss work cuz I was bleeding so much. Finally I couldn’t take it anymore got it taken out after 1 year. My skin is so clear never break out anymore not even before periods. My periods back to 3 day and light. Lost 7 lbs in 1month so far! Never again! False ads lots of side effects. Obviously I’m not the only by reading sum of the reviews. Wish I would of read on it sooner!

name: Sprintec
comments: If I had rated it during my first 1-3 months, it most likely would have been a 3 or 4 at best.  I had weight gain, increased acne, moodiness and bloating, oh the bloating! I stuck with it and I am really happy I did.  Over the last six months, I’ve dropped the weight, my skin has cleared and although I still get a little moody before my period, I think that’s pretty normal whether on bcp’s or not. I take it religiously and it is the only form of birth control I use in my committed relationship. I have had no pregnancy scares. Bonus: FREE on my insurance, which is truly a blessing because I was paying $150 a month for Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo (which was a horror story for me). If this pill gives you problems in the beginning, consider waiting them out, because for me it truly did did get better each month.

name: Reclipsen
comments: This birth control although effective gave me the worst acne of my entire life. I have been off for 6 months now and around month 4 my hormones started to regulate again and my face looks so much better. Now I’m just working to get rid of the scarring and uneven skin tone. I tried many different things while taking this birth control to help with breakouts but nothing worked!!!! If you are breaking out and taking this switch or get off BC all together .

name: Apri
comments: This pill sucks. I was always anxious but this actually made me depressed. Also I felt hungry every 5 mins and nauseous for the rest of the day. I always woke up dizzy, I broke out with acne. And I was always lightheaded and fatigued.  Advice to people that don’t want to feel like rubbish never take this!!!!!!!! I’m warning all of you.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This is my 5th month being on Junel Fe. At first, I got nausea and my doctor told me to take at night with a snack which helped a lot. Not getting nausea anymore. My periods are so much lighter but sometimes longer. I had no other side effects from this medication.  Everyone's body reacts different to meds so do not listen to others until you try it. I am going to continue taking it and hopefully it will help me get through perimenopause because my periods were awful before taking this. I couldn't walk without blood pouring out of me. I recommend this pill.

name: ParaGard
comments: The only regret I have with Paragard is not getting it sooner. I love it! I put off getting an IUD for so long because of hearing about how painful the insertion was and was surprised when it only felt like a heavy cramp. It wasn't bad at all. In the 3 months since the only difference I've noticed is slightly heavier periods. My sex drive hasn't changed at all, I haven't gained a single pound, and now I don't have to worry about birth control for 12 years. I couldn't be happier with my decision.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took Necon in my 20s and had no issues.  I just restarted last week, but I am 47 now.  I thought I was just having a bad week, but my moodiness is awful.  Extreme anger and frustration over the littlest things.  Sleeping only 2-3 hrs a night and that's with the help of benadryl, melatonin, and ambien.  Gained 5 pounds.  No motivation to work out.  Craving carbs and naps.  I need to stop taking this med and see what happens.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
Had to use this in two separate occasions. He didn’t finish in both scenarios, but I vouched for the pill anyways. 

  For the first time I took it less than an hour after the act. Period was on time, but wow the flow intensity was weird. 

  When it happened again, I took it a whopping 71 hours afterwards. Period was a day later than expected and the flow intensity was weird again.

  Overall, the product works but you better get ready for a whack period.

name: Cryselle
comments: This pill has made me so dizzy and lightheaded every single day, and given me the worst anxiety attacks!! I have never had any health issues or issues with anxiety until I started this BC. I am dizzy and anxious sitting here typing this. It's the worst feeling. And due to the dizziness/lightheaded feeling it sends my heart into over drive and it starts pounding then I get nauseous and have severe anxiety.  I am glad I looked up the reviews before going to the ER thinking I have some major brain issue going on because I have been so dizzy every. single. day. As of last night I have stopped taking the pill. Pray this feeling goes away in the next few days so I can go back to being normal.

name: Gianvi
comments:
I was on Nikki for about 4 months for PMDD. According to my doc, it should've been working by the 3-4 month range. And while it took my period away (yet added spotting) and lowered some symptoms, it really only took away any predictability of my cycle. Instead of knowing exactly when to expect my downturn, I would wake up each day wondering if it would be a good day or a bad day filled with thoughts of suicide, nausea, & panic attacks. 

When my 4 packs of Nikki were done, I requested Gianvi. I've only been on it a week, but I've noticed significant improvement. My breasts are still VERY tender/swollen and my acne's still flaring, but I've actually been able to play with my daughter and enjoy it. I've been able to handle my high-anxiety dog without losing my mind. It's not perfect, but to not have the Jekyll/Hyde complex that is PMDD, even for just a week, has been amazing. I definitely intend on continuing with Gianvi for a while. Hopefully it continues improving my quality of life.

name: Gianvi
comments:
I have been on this birth control for six months now. 
Before I started taking this: I had the worst period cramps, sometimes I would have to miss work/school because I was in so much pain. My periods were very irregular, would fluctuate from 21-50 days. I had never taken another birth control. 
Pros: my periods are regular, lighter, and I experience very mild cramping. My acne has cleared for the most part.  NO WEIGHT GAIN!!! 
Cons: I do not know if this is from the pills, but my vision has gotten significantly worse. My periods are VERY light which make me nervous at times. 
All in all, I would recommend this. I am kind of interested in switching since I never have before.

name: Ajovy
comments: At first, I felt like this was a miracle and I was having way fewer headaches and significantly less severe. In recent months my symptoms have changed significantly and are more frequent.  Rather than starting up the side of my neck - I start feeling nauseous and or agitated.  I am also having a lot more visual and word recall disturbance but not pain.  It often takes me a few days until I figure out that I have a migraine as it is manifesting so differently. Then when I do take an Imitrex and some Advil it does go away.  Wondering if others have experienced this kind of change in how their headaches manifest?

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was on Levora I struggled with weight gain, anxiety and depression regularly but I didn’t think to connect it to my birth control. Then I was switched to Portia due to kaiser discontinuing Levora and the first month seemed okay I thought my body just needed time to adjust. Then at the second month I started getting migraines, then it was the serious weight gain and my anxiety and depression went through the roof. I was extremely suicidal and dangerous no only to myself but anyone close to me as well. I was unable to function as a person anymore and I decided to stop taking it and within the first week I felt like a new person and my weight dropped dramatically as every week passed. It’s honestly scared me and I will never use a hormonal birth control again. Never again.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started the Junel 1/20 pill over a week ago then started my period . My periods used to be like 4-6 Days no it is  past the 8th day and my period still hasn’t stopped . Going to call a doctor to see how long it’ll be before my period stops . I read other reviews and it says it won’t stop for after a month then after that you won’t have one at all . So I’m just going to call the doctor and wait and see the results.

name: Ajovy
comments: I took Ajovy monthly for 3 months. I've had chronic migraine (inherited) for 35 years, with 25 migraines/month when I'm not on a preventive, 15-17 with a preventive (current preventive is duloxetine). Ajovy and duloxetine interacted to cause quite a few SEs, which seemed to be duloxetine SEs amplified/potentiated. The deal breaker SE was such extreme fatigue-nearly impossible to wake up after 8 hrs sleep. Sleep was so deep it was actually scary. Almost passed out (back into sleep) daily in the shower, etc. No improvement in severity, duration or frequency of migraines. Quit Ajovy and SEs went away. Just keep in mind: many long-term SEs of this drug and interactions with other drugs are still unknown. Just keep in mind: CGRP affects many processes in the body and inhibiting it may not be wise.

name: Velivet
comments: I’ve been on Velivet for a few years now to regulate my period. For the first year and a half I was fine, but then I switched packs with a friend for a week because we were on vacation and I forgot mine at home. When I restarted on Velivet it was awful. I threw up all the time and could barely keep anything, even water, down. I stopped taking them for a month because it got so bad, but I recently restarted due to a bad period. I’m feeling nauseous 24/7 and I have to throw up before I sleep because the nausea is causing insomnia. The only good thing I can say about this is that it cleared my skin, but trust me it’s just not worth it.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I had unprotected sex on June 1st. The condom broke and I was in my fertile days. I have been on birth control pills for like 5 years but the last couple months I had not been taking them responsibly. I was pretty worried so I took Aftera. 1) Aftera is the SAME as plan B, it is the generic version. 2) Once I took Aftera, I had the worst nausea of my life. I stayed in bed all day and I had abdominal cramping for 2 weeks. 3) Aftera WORKS. I went to my doctor on June 14th for a blood pregnancy test (they are more accurate) because I couldn't wait any longer to know. It came back negative. After convincing myself I was pregnant for 2 very long stressful weeks, I found out I wasn't and Aftera did its job. I have taken Aftera before and did not have any side effects, but this time I had pretty bad ones. Spotting (the week before my period which made me think it was implantation bleeding) headaches, bad cramping, nausea, etc. All in all, like everyone says on here, trust the pill.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I was on the old design of the Qvar inhaler and totally fine. I have had the same issue as many other people have commented- it randomly does not dispense medicine when used leading to uncontrolled asthma. I'm on my fourth redihaler and this one started malfunctioning at 83 doses left. The reason I noticed the first one was malfunctioning? My asthma became dangerously out of control and upon inspecting my inhaler after taking it I saw white mist slowly spew out AFTER I had already taken a puff.

name: Sprintec
comments: I really like this birth control! It’s my first time ever using any type of birth control ever. In the early months I did experience some pretty bad breakouts. It would be large red bumps that weren’t  a pimple but right under the skin. Once that bump would go away another bump would pop up. This went on for a month or so. Now my skin is flawless I would totally recommend this birth control. You do have to give it some time to regulate with your body! I often have sex while on this birth control and have not experienced any pregnancy scares. My period cramps are less intense but still there along with my period. I don’t experience any super bad mood swings. I have been able to lose weight with the help of diet and exercise while taking this birth control.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I started this pill maybe 3 years ago but I was on and off due to : lack of sexual intercourse and the side effects of the pill. Side effects included; severe lower back pain, blurry vision, depression, and extreme tiredness. This is the only birth control I've been on and I seriously would like to try different options. Not to mention, I've picked up weight using it smh

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: This inhaler is not effective for someone who can't get air into their lungs. The way it works is by sucking the medicine out of the inhaler, and for those who barely have lung function there's no way to get the medication into your lungs so you CAN BREATHE. I almost passed out today trying to get this thing to work for me, but luckily I found an old ACTUAL inhaler that saved me.

name: Copaxone
comments:
I was on Copaxone 40 mg for 2 months before I quit. It was my 1st MS drug; I hope I won't react so poorly to the next. 
For me each injection just really hurt. It *burned* starting 15 - 30 sec in, even with an ice pack. The burn was intense for ~15 min, then in ~1 hour it lessened enough I could limp off to bed. Welts ~2" in diameter formed on my arms and thighs, and lumps formed in my stomach or the back of my hips. The welts were painful and hot for 3-7 days (thigh injections were the worst; I cried after those). The lumps itched for ~5 days after stopping hurting (~1 day). Not to say they weren't bad too; just less so. 
The burning was bad enough that by the 2nd month I had my husband do the injections; I just couldn't bring myself to put the needle in anymore.  
Does everyone who uses Copaxone feel like this and just suck it up? Am I being a wimp here? I hope not.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: At first I was skeptical of going on a higher dosage. I have noticed weight gain and acne, but I believe they were due to other issues not the birth control. My periods got lighter again, and my cramps and period only lasted about 3 days compared to 7-8 on the lower dose. I will be going back to my doctor soon just to check up on it since it's been about 3 months. But all in all, I don't think this birth control has done anything but its job. I only give it a 7 because its been about 3 months but with added stress.

name: Ajovy
comments:
Miracle drug!!!! 
No side effects and have gone from 9 terrible migraines per month to less than 2. Randomly ended up getting my first injection to coincide with the beginning of my menstrual cycle which is when headaches are the worst and did not get ONE headache through the first cycle. Second cycle (and haven’t done my second dose) still NO headaches!!! 
One headache was from eating a trigger food and the second was minor. Both required only half a dose of sumatriptan to recover. 
I honestly feel like I have a new life. Someone said they were a super responder- I don’t know if that is a technical term, but I would say that I qualify for that term. Unbelievable results!

name: Gianvi
comments: If you have or had anxiety DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL. from someone who suffers from anxiety day to day, this pill made me experience anxiety attacks like I've never felt before. Terrible depression followed, I never had a history of depression and this pill gave it to me.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took Necon in my 20s-30s.   I am 40 now and have been on Nortrel  (generic of Nortrel) for 3 months.  My pros: regular, 3-4 day periods, light flow, no to little acne, intense sex drive in week 3 (no dryness here), no depression/anxiety or lack of sleep (I take clonazepam), rare headaches, rare spotting.  My cons: extreme bloating (Midol helps), weight gain/ increased appetite, mood swings, irritability, fatigue, cramps, nausea (I take ondansetran), gas, backaches (I take 800 mg Ibuprofen).  Besides weight gain, there are 2 cons that can be age vs the pill.   I see cellulite on my legs and my hair is thinning.   I noticed most reviews are from girls younger than me so I can’t compare.  I love the light, short, regular periods.  I am able to live with the majority of my cons.  I am looking at ways to diet & become more active.  Take at your own risk but note your symptoms.  See what you can live with, medicate (if you are okay with it-it helps).  For me this is not the best but it's not the worst either.

name: Aviane
comments: I have been taking the Aviane pill for about three months now and it’s honestly been great! My boobs definitely grew two cup sizes and my acne flared up at first, but everything balanced back out after the second month. I highly recommend this contraceptive !

name: Cryselle
comments: This pill Crystelle is downright terrible. I could not give a more honest opinion. Yes, it does it’s job of protecting you from pregnancy, but the side effects are NOT worth it. I’ve been taking it a year and a half now and not once in my life have I ever had acne until this pill. My face feels like a gravel road because my skin is so haggard. So that right there has ruined my self confidence, and on top of that I’m more depressed than I’ve ever felt in my whole life. Constant mood swings. I feel fat, pimple ridden, moody, and all around awful. But hey, at least I’m not pregnant. Totally not worth it ladies.

name: estropipate
comments: I was in a state of shock yesterday when I found out that Ogen was discontinued!!! Have been on it for 31 years and in perfect health, heart and bones are remarkable and bloodwork is of a 20 yr old. No side effects what so ever with this medication. MD had tried several other Estrogens and felt absolutely horrible with many side effects. Why in the world would the pharmaceutical company discontinue this med that provided so much relief to women . In my opinion they should take all the other estrogen meds off the market, esp. Premarin which causes more harm than good. Hope the drug companies re-think this one. So sad, esp for me now!!!!

name: Ajovy
comments:
It stings during injection, but that's it. For two to three days after, I felt on and off nausea all day. Nothing more. I will ask for something this time around. My migraines were either totally gone or reduced for nearly three weeks starting from the first day. My overall body pain also seemed somewhat reduced. The migraines did start to come back normally around week three. I'm due in a couple of days for my second injection. 
I was shocked. I terrified because have tried everything. Suffered from all the horrible side effects from trying new drugs and diagnostics for 20+ years. Nothing but pain meds helped me and we all know how it feels in this day and age to be someone who rely on pain meds. You will still need them, but I am grateful for any reduction.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was reading a lot of these reviews and honestly can’t relate to most of them. Fortunately, I’ve had a fine experience using Portia except for one side effect.. But I’ve been on Portia for about a year and a half, and actually got randomly switched to another brand in which I even requested to go back to Portia! I only get one day of cramps and a 3 day period, so it’s been nice. The one bad thing is the severe mood swings/ depression I get the week before the placebo pills. At one point, I was starting to think I had a bipolar disorder! (Before realizing this was due to the birth control). Thinking about switching to a new brand just because of that, but I may return to Portia in the future.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: PORTIA. IS. HORRIBLE. Every year around May I get prolonged periods. Mostly all the years I have used Levora besides this year. My doctor prescribed Portia to me this year and said it would stop my bleeding and clear up my acne. They lied. Though I only took this pill for 5 days I experienced the most worst case of nausea, migraines, and reflecting on my previous days mood swings. I have became very irritated with everything and everyone. This pill makes me feel so horrible and it has done nothing for my acne. I gained 2 lbs. while taking it and I don’t recommend for others to take this pill.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This was the first birth control I had ever been on, spotting in the beginning and I will say the positives is that I get my period for like a day and always know when it's coming. However, I've always had some depression issues but right up until I started taking this medicine I was the most mentally healthy I have ever been. As soon as I started taking birth control my moods drastically changes and I have such anxiety about everything, cry all the time and everything scares and worries me and I lost drive and focus to do almost anything, wouldn't recommend if you already have hormone issues and imbalances because this throws you for a loop and makes you go crazy and I feel bad for the people who have to deal with it and see the changes in me, because I used to be able to feel happy and now it's harder. Need a new birth control soon to level out my moods and I can start feeling like myself again.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I switched to Tri-Lo-Sprintec from Yaz because I hated the side effects on Yaz. Pros: I did not experience any loss of libido, my moods and mental states were normal, no weight gain, cramps under control, no abnormal bleeding, and most importantly I did not become pregnant. Cons: I am now experiencing an apparent allergic reaction to the sun (being in the sun for even a short time even with plenty of sunscreen, my skin gets red and itchy for days afterwards - photosensitivity reaction) plus I started having migraines after my first cycle on Tri-Lo-Sprintec. After 8 months on it, I've found some migraine triggers and now only get them once a month - during the inactive week of this pill (or about a week after starting a new pack straight away) so I'm stopping this particular pill to see if something with a different dose of hormone stops the apparently hormonal migraines. I can deal with the sun rash but I cannot deal with the migraines anymore, which is sad because otherwise I loved this pill.

name: Lessina
comments: Wish I could rate a zero. I used to be on Aviane and LOVED it. But  my pharmacy randomly gave me Lessina and told me it would be the same, it’s just the generic brand. I totally thought that made sense so did not think anything about the change. I’ve been on this dosage for 4 years and never had issues. On the Lessina brand I gained about 15 pounds and I spot for a month about every 4 months. NOT WORTH IT. ill be taking my 3rd trip to the gyno this Friday for spotting and will be getting off of Lissena.

name: Take Action
comments: Took Take Action May 14th 26 hours after unprotected sex, just missed my period. Naturally I took a pregnancy test which was positive, so then I took 3 more... all positive... my sore breast, bloating and tiredness are obviously a sign of what the pill didn’t protect against.

name: Gianvi
comments: I didn't realize that I had depression until after I started taking the medication. This tiny pill has changed my entire life, I am able to be the person I have always wanted to be without feeling mentally exhausted from being kind, energetic, or optimistic. I have been able to lose and maintain a healthy weight (was able to lose about 5 pounds, I am 5'3 weighing 123 so it's not like I have tooo much to lose, but still) ANDDDDD for the first since I was 11-years-old, I no longer have acne. After a decade of trying medicines and topical solutions and being a very healthy eater and exerciser, this pill is the only thing that has gotten rid of my acne for good. I know some people have a horrible experience on their birth control and I personally had no expectations of it, in fact I didn't think it would change anything. I can't imagine my life now without this medication and would recommend anyone at least give it a shot.

name: Gianvi
comments: I switched onto Gianvi after taking Loryna for several years, Gianvi is the generic for Loryna. The effects aren’t much different, and both have been helpful for my PMDD and my period in general. My cramps decreased in frequency (though not in intensity), and my period is long but less severe than it might be without the pill. Psychologically speaking, I feel a little better all through my cycle, and my mood and behavior are a lot more stable when my period comes close.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: ProAir Respiclick had zero effectiveness for me. You would have to be a long distance runner to be able to inhale this powder into your lungs. What a waste. This was just another way for the company to get a patent for albuterol so they could make money. If I could give a minus rating I would. I got this drug due to a mixup with my insurance where they said they wouldn't cover the HFA. I think they got so many complaints and threats of lawsuits that they quickly changed their coverage options. I know I was definitely on the phone with them.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on this for 2 years since I was 18 and have had a great experience. My doctor started me off on Taytulla and I had so much anxiety from it. It cleared my skin, my boobs did grow a little, and I don’t notice a change in weight gain at all. Protects from pregnancy. I started the pill to help with acne and to help with me being emotional the week before my period, during, and the week after which left me with one good week out of the month where I wouldn’t cry everything! It fixed it after a month and my skin after about 2 months. One side affect I noticed was my skin did not tan the same and I was more prone to burning. Now that it’s been 2 years, this side affect has subsided. But so has it’s positive affects. I feel like I break out more now than I did in the past 2 years and that I am starting to be more emotional like I used to be for a longer amount of time around my period. Might just be the point I’m at in life but figured i’d share!

name: ProAir HFA
comments: This inhaler is good when it works.  After 60 puffs the inhaler clogs and will not spray anymore. It's not a good thing when you have chronic asthma and you are not sure if your fast acting inhaler is going to work when you need it.  I will be talking to the doctor and insurance about switching to Ventolin again

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I find that  Qvar Redihaler doesn't dispense all the time.  Like it runs out too soon.    My COPD has gotten worse because I thought it was working and only sucking in my air and not getting any of the medicine

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Before taking June FE 1/20 I read almost all the reviews online. Majority of the reviews were bad which caused me to become worried about taking it. I then realized everyone’s body is completely different and may have different reactions to the pill. So I thought I should try it out for myself. I’ve been on the pill since October 2018 to this day and so far I’ve only had one bad side effect, chest pain. The chest pain isn’t that bad, but it does come and go. I was worried about having anxiety attacks because I do suffer from anxiety, but my anxiety has been pretty much the same, nothing crazy. Another side effect I have noticed is breast growth, which is fine by me because I was an A cup. I would advise other females to take it and see how your body reacts to it. Don’t be scared and remember that everyone is different. Once you start taking it, look out for the side effects and if you have any, consult your doctor/Gyn right away! Good luck :)

name: ParaGard
comments: I love my ParaGard! I’ve had it for a month.  Insertion was uncomfortable but nothing you can’t handle. Some cramps the first week, and a slightly longer heavier period, but again nothing not manageable. I love how I can’t feel it and how it is hormone free. No adverse side effects, and the best part is how I still ovulate and keep a healthy cycle. I’ve been on the pill and Mirena before, and had emotional PMS and also terrible acne. None of that with ParaGard so far, and I often react quickly to things. Don’t fear all he negative reviews. Usually people who are most angry angry write the most reviews. Most people get it, enjoy it, and move on with their lives without writing a review. I feel healthy and positive and love owning my own birth control in a positive and non hormonal way! No one method is perfect but for me it’s a great fit based on what’s available.

name: Apri
comments: Wow oh wow this medicine Apri has messed my body up, to begin when I began taking it I thought I was going crazy. My body did not adjust well at all. I was  so depressed and moody.  I was on Apri from May 2017 to August 2018 and when I stopped taking it I felt instantly better, and happy. My only thing is my periods still have not returned. Again this was the worst experience ever.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
My boyfriend & I had unprotected sex on the morning of May 18th (4 days after my period ended). He did not finish inside of me but after reading stuff about pre-cum I began to freak myself out. I am not on any type of birth control and was getting close to my predicted day of ovulation so I went to the pharmacy and took the pill 13 hours after. 5 days after taking it, I began to get horrible cramps and bled for 3 days. The bleeding was light and not like a normal period. I also experienced INTENSE mood swings and intrusive thoughts. I was so sad that not even my boyfriend or best friend could cheer me up.I also had the ovulation type discharge for about 2 weeks.The side effects of this pill often mimic pregnancy symptoms so try not to read too much on the internet.  

While it has been as LONG and anxiety filled month, I woke up today to see that my period arrived pretty much on schedule (1 day late) and I have never been happier! Your period will come even if the pill throws you off a bit :)

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I told myself I would write a detailed review after using Aftera because reading these reviews was the only thing keeping me sane while waiting for my next period to come. First off... I read so many negative reviews of people saying this didn't work and they were annoyed they didn't just spend the extra money for plan b. Ladies... this drug is the SAME EXACT thing as Plan B. All of the ingredients are exactly the same and the only reason it cost less is because generic meds are funded and advertised differently. In fact, I am sure many of you are on generic birth control pills or have been prescribed generic antibiotics in the past and they all work just the same. We also don't know the details of the comment poster's sex life, meaning if they are having regular sex, they could have fallen pregnant either before of after taking emergency contraception and blame the unintended pregnancy on the pill not working. Try not to freak yourself out too much by reading the negative reviews :)

name: Lessina
comments: I've been on Lessina bith control pill for a year. The first couple of months I was spotting a lot but then I started to have a normal period. I don't have any bad side effects. I've always had anxiety but its just the same as before so its not the pills that’s giving me anxiety. Everything else is fine and now my period are lighter and shorter. Just remember to take them on time everyday for this to work well for you.

name: ParaGard
comments: Do NOT get the ParaGard. I have had it for 4 years and it's a nightmare. If you have heavy periods, they will become like a flood of blood every month. The flow did NOT reduce over time. I'm talking literally gushing clots with brutal cramps. But, it works as birth control, hence the 1 extra star and why I kept it in. Then, over the past year (after having it for over 3 years at that point) I started developing increasingly worse PMS symptoms, which grew into PMDD. Especially over the past few months, I am suffering from severe PMDD that I believe to be caused by the copper IUD. Do some research on how copper raises estrogen and copper toxicity. I have an appointment to get rid of this awful thing in just a few days. I cannot wait. It has taken so much of my life - I literally can't get out of bed during days 2-3 from level of bleeding and cramps - and move on with my life. This is "non hormonal" (why I went on it) but literally has messed up my hormones.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been on Nortrel 7/7/7 birth control for less than a month. At first, everything was fine and I was only bloated. After a week, my appetite increased and I gained 10 lbs from eating more. I've been getting horrible headaches since starting it. I've been having terrible mood swings and have snapped at people for no reason or for petty things. It's almost cost me my relationship with my fiance. I can't sleep right anymore despite me taking my medication for insomnia (currently running on 4 hours of sleep, actually). I break out randomly on my forehead, chin, and chest. But hey, I'm not pregnant. It's not worth the side effects in my opinion.  Make sure to let your doctor know if you suffer from depression, anxiety, BPD, etc. because this pill with mess with you bad. I will be switching back to my previous pill since I was better off on that one.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I loved this birth control Nora-Be, it cleared my skin issues and it didn’t give me headaches until I got my period. I went from having a moderate flow to heavy flow, having to change every 2hrs because my tampon is soaked through and this was the first day of my period. I’m on my third day and it’s still the same, emailed my Dr to get a new prescription.

name: ParaGard
comments: My personal symptoms regarding copper toxicity; heart racing, anxiety insomnia, depresion, lethargic, headaches , no energy, migraines so bad I couldn't see, fatigue, shortness of breath, chest pain, memory loss, mental fog, loss of taste, metal taste in mouth, low sex drive, my body odor was 10 times worse under arms and vaginal, hair oils double, my eyes turned darker dirty looking, the white part of eyes turned yellow, my veins in my eyes ruptured, pain in eyes, vision  problems, nausea, vomit, diarrhea once a week, weight gain (20pds), felt like my body was shutting down .Oh and one more got candidiasis.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I have been using Veltin for about 5 weeks now. At first I was worried when I started using it because it made me break out across my forehead. Luckily, the pimples were small and not severe. My skin has adjusted to the medicine, and although I still have some pimples, I’m pretty happy with the results. I’m going to continue to use this product throughout the summer.

name: ParaGard
comments: I will say I started off loving Paragard. Insertion was easy. My first one expelled within the first month which is common but I got a new one placed. I loved it for about 2 years then I learned about copper toxicity. I can account some of my SEVERE disabling mental illnesses to this device. The first 6 months cramps were worse but manageable and ever since my PMSing has gotten horrible. I basically have the flu symptoms for 2 days before every cycle. My breasts grew practically overnight somewhere between 16-18 months with the Paragard. Before I was barely filling out an A cup now I’m a D cup. Nonhormonal my ass, it influences hormones. I’ve had stomach problems, UTIs, yeast infections, smells from down there, pain with sex, chronic fatigue, bloating, allergies developed, memory issues/brain fog, skin problems (acne and persistent eczema that I’m just finally getting to clear up) I’ve gained weight and overall just feel like garbage. Please avoid this device

name: Aviane
comments: I have been on Aviane for a month now, (never been on birth control before) and I am going to start a new pack tomorrow. Personally, I have had no weight gain (I actually lost weight), my moods were a little off the first couple weeks but they are back to normal now. I experienced mild spotting at the beginning. However, I did not get my period during the placebo week so I am a little confused about that. I spotted for around 3 days right before placebo pills- but I don’t believe that it was my period. Also, my skin has broken out significantly (which could be because of my period coming soon????), but it has definitely not done anything to help my skin so far. hopefully my skin will clear up, because then this pill would be amazing!

name: Junel 1/20
comments:
I've been on Junel 1/20 for a year now, and I'll be switching off of it next month. There have been quite a few symptoms that I have now traced back to this. 1) weight gain! 20 lbs in 3 months. I haven't gained any extra since then, but I have started a drastic workout program and started eating better and I can't lose it. 
2) No sex drive at all. 3) Moodiness. My poor husband. 
In all, it's not horrible, but it's not right for me.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I switched from Lyza to Nora-Be about 3 months ago and was told it was the same thing. Same hormone, dosage and everything. But it does not feel the same and I can't figure out why. When I was on Lyza I felt even better than without birth control. But once I started the Nora-be I started feeling depressed within the first few days, and it just continued to get worse! I thought I would level out after some time, but no, it's still continuing to worsen. It is like PMSing 24/7 (including the cramps). An emotional rollercoaster ride that just won't stop along with unexpected physical discomfort like joint pain, bloating, headaches, and it's even messing with my blood pressure! If you react sensitively to hormones, then this one may not be right for you. Although everyone's body reacts differently! I would recommend Lyza instead as a similar alternative for a more levelled experience (especially emotionally).

name: Take Action
comments: I took this emergency contraceptive because I was with a friend drinking and well we got down to business and he pulled out and we did it the next morning as well which was unusually short but he pulled out, I wanted to be extra safe because it was 2 days before my ovulation, but I was blessed with no cramps or extreme mood swings and my period came a.few days earlier and was on track with the 28 day cycle

name: Seasonique
comments: I'm actually surprised of all the negative reviews. I love this Seasonique for my birth control. I've been on it for almost 5 years now. I do remember when I first started taking it I did have bleeding for almost 3-4 weeks. After that I never had an issue and now whenever I get my period it is very light and only lasts 3 days. The only way this birth control could get better was if I didn't have to take it everyday

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Took Tri-Lo-Sprintec for 8ish. months because I had really bad, painful, heavy, inconsistent periods. It definitely helped make them more consistent. When I wasn't on it, my period would start light and the last few days would be heavy. However, when I was on it, it started heavy and ended up light. It helped with the pain, which was really my biggest issue, but each period was still painful and heavy. Skin cleared up after 5 or 6 months of using it, which was a plus. I asked my OBGYN if I could skip the placebo pills and she said if I had an event I could but its not something you can do consistently on these pills because you can have break though bleeding. So I tried it and it was AWFUL, my period was delayed the first few days I didn't take the placebo pills but started and lasted like two weeks. Not only was it long but it was like my periods before birth control: SUPER painful. Overall, its been good to me but I'm not going live in pain anymore so I'm gonna switch.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: The ProAir RespiClick instructions "Inhale rapidly to use"....I have a breathing problem...does this make any sense what so ever?  This is the most useless delivery system for this type of indication.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I have been using Portia birth control for less than 1 year. I had the IUD for 2 years but had to come off of it due to getting numerous cysts. Prior to the IUD I was on Levora which worked well until it didn't. Anyways, I was already diagnosed bipolar a 5 years ago but have had unreal mood swings, weight fluctuation, depression, anxiety, and low sex drive ever since being on Portia. I found this blog today and I am low key annoyed that I didn't look into these side effects sooner. I am coming off of this medication and consulting with my OBGYN demanding for alternate birth control. I DO NOT recommend this form of contraceptive to ANYONE.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: Like the others say,  the ProAir ResiClick is not effective. Sucking as hard as you can to get medicine to your lungs did not help during an asthma attack. The old method inhalers are far superior. I wheeze terribly still after using. Do not recommend.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have suffered from chronic migraines since I was a teenager and I am 41. I have tried every medication, almost 5 years of Botox, & nerve decompression surgery in NYC over 2 years ago. Migraines have always come back. My neurologist has put me on Ajovy, I have taken 1 dose...3 weeks ago, no change in my headaches, but I have never felt more fatigued in my life! I can easily sleep 14 hours & still take a nap if it’s my day off. I also feel dizzy, constipated, & my hands & feet feel numb & sore at times. I will not be taking the 2nd dose. I normally workout a few times per week but haven’t had any energy to do so. Also, with a busy nursing career I cannot afford to feel so sluggish or dizzy. I really wanted this to work. I am disappointed again. My neurologist was optimistic & also told me the only adverse reaction was at the injection site, very misleading if you ask me.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I started getting acne after I turned 40, hormonal, cystic acne on the chin. I was skeptical that anything would work. Within 2 weeks on clindamycin with tretinoin, I saw a difference. Yes, it will get worse before it gets better and it does burn and dry the skin at first, but hang in there because the results are amazing. Living with acne affects your self esteem at any age. At 45, I would have people point and ask what happened to my face. Now, I get so many compliments on how youthful I look and how clear my complexion is. You don't need to use a lot, but make sure you cleanse well before (I use micellar water). Then I follow-up with CeraVe lotion. I can't tell you how this has changed my life. I always touch my chin in amazement.

name: Copaxone
comments: Diagnoses in 2006, started on Rebif which early killed me.  Crashing Blood sugar levels.  Got on Copaxone, first 20 mg every day, then 40 mg 3x/week.  Besides the minor effects of tingling, fatigue, slowing down, no major issues.  MRIs show minor progression.  Nov 2018 my insurance notified me it would no longer cover the cost.  I’ve been working with my doctor to find the next med, tried Tecfidera, stopped after 3 weeks the side effects were so horrible.  I want back on Copaxone.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I would never knowingly recommend Portia to anyone I know to take it. Other than putting on a little bit of weight in the first 2 1/2 months seemed like everything was going fine. Then that third month was about to hit and I was nauseous, I had breast tenderness and was sleeping for 15 hours a day. I figure I must have been pregnant. The fatigue was so horrible but then I lost my eyesight twice within a week and had migraines so bad that I couldn’t function as a person. Not symptoms of being pregnant, that’s when I finally went to the hospital to get a MRI done. I wasn’t on another medication. I had my blood work checked everything came back normal. I have now been off Portia for 3 weeks now and still having headaches and migraines from time to time.  Sure I didn’t get pregnant but I also didn’t have sex because I never saw my other half due to me sleeping so much and the severe migraines that I’d wake up with and go to bed with.

name: Nora-Be
comments: I was on this pill three days. I started taking it 4 weeks postpartum as directed by my doctor due to breastfeeding. Experienced horrible stomach aches, similar to food poisoning. I started bleeding very heavy and had severe cramping. I became very moody and experienced stomach bloating and gas. I am 24 hrs free of this pill and feel 100 times better.

name: Junel 1.5/30
comments: I took the Junel 1.5/30 contraceptive pill for 8 months and I would have to say that I was not satisfied. In fact, I was happy to switch to a different brand this month because the symptoms were so bad. Junel was the first pill I had ever taken and I would say the only things it helped me with were to stop pregnancy and regulation of my period . I started on the lower dose one and I actually increased my dosage to 1.5/30 thinking it would help the side effects, but it didn’t. I just regulated more. I originally went on the pill to help with acne and I would say it got slightly better, but I still got heavy breakouts 2 weeks before my period. The worst part I would have to say, though, were the mood swings. Before birth control, I was NEVER a moody person. This pill caused me to have terrible mood swings to the point of having bad thoughts and being enraged at minuscule things. This pill also enhanced my anxiety when I was on the lower dose as well. Overall, I would say this pill did not work for me, but maybe it will work for some of you.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I have been on Tri Lo Sprintec for a little over 6 months now. After trying the Progestin only pill which caused side effects such as anxiety, depression, nausea, headache I then was switched to Sprintec which caused abnormal bleeding for nearly three months. I love Tri Lo Sprintec! It took awhile for my body to adjust. I had some weight gain. No other major side effects. It tremendously helps with irregular, heavy, painful periods and all other PMS symptoms. My mood is also much more stabilized on it. Everyone is different. Do not let the reviews from others scare you from trying this one. You'll eventually find one that works for you! This one just happened to be the one for me.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Last year I was switched to Portia. I had changed my BC because of my insurance.  I felt like my insides wanted to fall out. My hair starting thinning . I was always tired. I was so depressed.  I could not hold back my tears. I did not think my BC was the problem. I also had an abnormal PAP for years. Now all the sudden I am abnormal?  I continued to take Portia for a year. After a year of major depression  I then started spotting ALL the time. I spotted after sex.  I had such heavy periods I would have to leave work after only wearing a tampon only for an hour. Since I have stopped my periods are short. I don't have weird brown spotting. I don't get emotional as much! Portia Sucks! I dislike what you have done to my life in just a year. I gained 40 pounds in less then 4 months. I cried myself to sleep for nights. . Now I might have cervical cancer? Every year I get checked? and after  less then a year with PORTIA? I might have cervical cancer?

name: Adderall
comments: Adderall IR destroyed my mental, emotional, and physical health. I started out in high school with XR, switched to vyvanse, and everything was working fine. I became severely dependent on this medication. I could not get out bed without it; I was miserable if I was not on it; I isolated myself from everyone; and it led me to other addictions which I will not discuss on here. My grades were going  down the toilet ( I could not complete any work without it), and I started buying it from the streets. I had to go to inpatient rehab for this medication. I started a 12 step program and for 6 months I have been off this medication. I feel more balanced with certain coping skills (community outreach, yoga, meditation). Please be warned Adderall IR is equivalent to methamphetamine (I talked to many addiction specialists, psychologists, and social workers).

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: New  Inhalers device fail when still half or more of the medicine is left

name: Ajovy
comments: I had my first injection on May 1st.  Within a few days had a terrible migraine. Started having flu like symptoms,  dizziness and severe depression.  Two weeks after injection I developed severe intolerable neck pain that I have never experienced before. I also had more migraines and will not be using Ajovy again. This drug did not help me at all. Glad it works for some people.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've encountered so many problems with this pill. Constant infections after intercourse. Smelly discharge before and after periods. Headaches, high blood pressure, mood swings, depression, anxiety, irregular periods, intense anger, zero sex drive. The thought of having sex with my partner was repulsive. It's a massive mess. I was on it for almost a year. Good thing I found out what was happening. It almost cost me to lose my child's father. It can ruin relationships. Terrible experience.

name: Apri
comments: DO NOT TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL! I was previously taking Yaz and loved it, however I lost a bunch of weight (eating right and exercising) and the pill couldn’t regulate to my new body. I was having a period for 3 weeks and my doctor recommended I take this as same hormones just different dose to the Yaz. I have been on it for about a week and have had the worst side effects. My mood swings are constant. I could be fine yet crying for no reason. I had diarrhea for 6 days straight causing me to now have a hemorrhoid. I’ve always had great, clear skin and now being on this birth control, I have had crazy breakouts on my chin. I’ve gained 10 lbs in one week and feel like I’m going to vomit at any moment. I recommend staying far away from this

name: Ocella
comments: I was on Ocella for about 14 years. I didn't gain weight nor get acne. It was actually a GREAT experience. I'm now getting off it to clean my system but I highly recommend this pill. I would get my period for about 3 days with no pain.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Side effects from Aftera were horrible expecially the dizziness and light headedness period came right back on THREE days after taking pill  Period was literally  3 weeks early ,pill worked I guess but messed up my cycle really bad

name: Ajovy
comments:
Less than a week from the injection, my migraines were much more intense; increased nausea and vomiting and pain was off the chart! Also, the frequency has worse in that the migraines are more frequent, which I didn't think was possible. I have chronic migraines, at least 20-25 a month. 
This injection was not helpful but rather harmful.

name: Gianvi
comments: I was prescribed Gianni to help with my acne. I didn't notice that much of a difference in my skin, however my mental health definitely took a big hit. I already suffer from social anxiety, but this took it far beyond that. After the first month, I noticed that anything and everything was making me cry. I would start hysterically crying, my anxiety would go through the roof and my panic attacks increased from once in a blue moon to having one at LEAST ONCE A DAY. I felt extremely fatigued and depressed and would have episodes where I just spaced out for about two minutes.. just staring at something and not even thinking about what was going on around me. Aside from my mental health, I also had severe cramping and my period has been messed up since taking this birth control. I'm currently on my 3rd week of bleeding and am still waiting for my period to go away.

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: I love this birth control Loestrin 21 1/20 compared to Yaz, Ortho-Tri-Cyclen, Mirena, Seasonique, Depo provera I do get mild headaches but no weight gain or acne. I was on it for Endometriosis and it was great

name: Ocella
comments:
I was on this pill for a year then tried to switch to Nexplanon so I wouldnt have to remember to take a pill every day - HUGE MISTAKE. At least for my body. I'm back on Ocella and I'm BEYOND happy with it in comparison. Gives me the clearest skin, went from B cup to D cup without gaining weight elsewhere, and its worked well as a birth control so far!

Ladies- the scariest thing about birth control (besides all the nasty side effects) is you really won't know what works for you until you try it. Everyones bodies are different and will react in different ways.

I hope you find what is best for you :)

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been on it for about 4 months. This is the start of the 5th month and since I started the pack (6 days in). NAUSEA! I take it at night before bed after a meal and I wake up around 5 horribly sick I end up throwing up and still not feeling better. But other than that I loved it. Never gained weight or had acne.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I have been on the Junel 1/20  pill for 5 years so I'm going to be honest. I gained some weight (my eating habits don't help), headaches and migraines are more frequent. Back and neck pain that I never had that isn't due to the weight gain. Slim to none when it comes to sex drive. My acne never got bad though, that's a plus. I got on this pill because I never had regular periods, and when I did have a period it was heavy flow for two weeks at a time. I haven't had a cycle since being in this pill. I know all of this sounds negative, but I do enjoy being on this pill for it's strength and peace of mind. It won't work for everyone, but in my case, I don't think I would want to be on another pill.

name: Kariva
comments: I just started my third month of Kariva. I switched from Junel Fe 1/20. Before, I would get insane mood swings and depression. On Kariva, my mood is balanced as long as I take it at exactly the same time every day. I haven’t noticed any weight gain or change in my sex drive. I had a horrible migraine the first day I took it; after that it’s only happened one other time. My periods last 3-4 days and are light. The only side effect I can’t stand is that I can’t sleep. I have trouble falling asleep and, once I do, I wake up throughout the night. I’ve been dealing with that for two months and I’m trying to hold out and see if it gets better because it is a great pill otherwise.

name: Aviane
comments: At 35, I have tried many bc pills out there. I post reviews, good or bad to let people know of possible benefits or side effects. Low dose levonorgestrel has been the best pill for me. Always the least side effects. Inactive ingredients played a part in how each brand affected me as far as spotting or not. I was switched back to this type of pill after 3 weeks straight bleeding on a minipill that only got heavier. This pill slowed a lot of the bleeding, but still have some light spotting. The nurse said once I have that 7 day withdrawal bleed, I shouldn't spot any longer on active pills next month. She most likely is right because any pill I have ever used that has less than 7 placebos or is designed to eventually stop my period, my body retaliates and I get breakthrough bleeding until I switch over to a brand with 7 placebos. Hope this helps any of you ladies having bc pill issues.

name: Ocella
comments: About to finish my first month of this Ocella birthcontrol I was prescribed it by my gynecologist for my acne, because my Tri-Sprintec wasn’t helping anymore. So far this has been one of the worst months- horrible headaches, chest pains, and the worst would be the anxiety I’ve experienced. I’ve always had anxiety but this past month it has been completely out of control and crippling. I’m not sure what I’m going to do because I’ve read it takes three months for my body to get used to the BC, but I don’t know if I can take this much longer.

name: Ajovy
comments: Ajovy has been very helpful at not only keeping migraines at bay but everyday headaches as well. I just wish I could use it every three weeks. The last week before my next shot is due is noticeably worse. Peace

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was prescribed the pill Portia after my last miscarriage because they did not do Levora anymore at Kaiser. Portia is one of the generics of Levora so is suppose to be the same. Worst mistake of my life. Before Portia I was on the implant nothing ever happened so I love the implant. I wanted something short term after my miscarriage so I could grieve without getting pregnant in the mean time. So I asked my doctor for Levora which I used as a teen prior to the implant. She gave me Portia instead. Since then I have the worst nausea I have ever experienced. Migraines that debilitate my everyday functions. Once I was so weak from my migraines and nausea I couldn’t even drive myself home after leaving from school sick. Not to mention it’s adverse reactions to my depression medication!!! I’m officially done with this pill!!!!!

name: Provigil
comments: Does nothing for my narcolepsy. I stay on it because the doctor told me to and I’m not competent enough to know that it’s not working. Also I look like a drug seeker if mention anything, and don’t agree with the doctors recommendation. It gives me some anxiety, my body feels awake but my head feels sleepy. Does nothing for brain fog I get with my narcolepsy. Armodafinil works better

name: Adipex-P
comments:
It does work. You have to work with Adipex though. You have to stay hydrated. You have to eat at least 1000 calories if not 1200 daily. You have to exercise a little. Even if it is just walking. You need to also take it very early and take it around the same time each day. Like 6am. 7am. I would not go past 8am if you are sensitive to medications. Otherwise you will be up all night long ready to run around. 
You also need to change the foods you eat. We are fat because of what we eat. This is not a magic pill that will melt your fat away. You need to correct yourself for it to really help you on your weight loss journey. This is all common sense. It raises your heart rate up (it's almost like speed). That is what gives  you the energy that we are all lacking. For me Adipex is a fantastic appetite suppressant. Good Luck.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Well girls I will tell you my experience, I had unprotected sex, a moment of uncontrol.  After that lack of control I had the most stressful week of my life, I took the pill 4 hours after the act.  It was the first time I took a medication for this, as the days passed my level of stress and anxiety increased.  I did not have any kind of side effect.  This caused my stress to be increased.  But already on the 7th day I had some cramping and sensitivity in the breasts and I was happy with my pains.  Then my period was quite normal a little pain and heavy bleeding (but sometimes that is normal in my regular cycles).  In my life I had never been so happy for the arrival of my period.  So the pill worked.  But after that period my next period is 25 days late and I'm getting stressed again, since my cycles are very punctual.  I have no idea what to do ... as I read often happens when taking this medication out of control your next menstrual cycles.  I have no idea what to do.

name: QNASL
comments: Non-stop allergies this year - finally requested QNASL script & it was EXPENSIVE & of course the insurance would NOT cover any of the $275 but the pharmacy applied some discounts & got it down to $132.  I left the pharmacy & within 2 minutes the sneezing & runny nose started- I grabbed the QNASL & it STOPPED the symptoms instantly.  I still have breaking thru nose draining  but I think after 2 weeks of QNASL I will get total relief.  There are some side effect risks but I am willing to take that risk because I have tried ALL the OTC's sprays & pills & believe me they have side effects that are intolerable over a long period of time.  I am 75 & this is a blessing right now.

name: Apri
comments: Let me tell you.. this Apri birth control pill has been something terrible. I was put on it because my hormones were messed up bad and sometimes I had a period that wouldn’t stop for a month then I didn’t have a period for like 3 months. So my obgyn put me on Apri. I also have PCOS. Anyway I have terrible headaches, my sight has gotten terrible, made my anxiety worse, no sex drive at all, & the worst thing I gained 40 pounds in like 6 months. This pill is straight the worst thing ever!

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I can definitely relate to all of the 1 rating comments as my medicine was not coming out of the Qvar RediHaler stopping at the 50 counter. Remember, there is a solution to every problem!  Seeing as this new device doesn't work properly I have worked out how to fix Qvar rediHaler device so it works  -  you can pop off the top part which twists off, and you manually press for your medicine!! No more wasting and getting a new haler.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I have been on Qvar 80 for about a decade. My asthma was completely under control. Now the last 2 Redihalers have been a nightmare.  My current one squirts out liquid seconds after I inhale. If I leave it in my mouth. It shoots out the medicine and it hurts and causes me to choke. I have had so much more trouble with my asthma attacks, my asthma isn'r controlled.  And since my Medicare insurance won’t cover it, I’m paying for an expensive inhaler that doesn’t work.

name: LoSeasonique
comments: Ive been taking this birth control for almost 6 weeks now and let me tell you, the only good thing about it is that it has helped me gain and distribute weight where I need it and made my breasts bigger. Other than that, I feel like absolute rubbish all day everyday and my job requires me to be active and on my feet, ITS HORRIBLE. I take medicine for the nausea, so thats fine. But I'm extremely tired, my body aches more than normal, the change in my mood is not okay, and I've been bleeding for over a week now, way earlier than my period should be. It started out as just spotting, but now I'm heavily bleeding and its making me very anxious. I'm gonna take the last week of pills tomorrow because this just isn't worth it. I do not recommend this pill, Definitely look for something with better ratings maybe?

name: Lessina
comments: The anxiety from this Lessina birth control pill was bad for me.  I had to stop taking it. Also the acne I could tell was getting worse. I was highly stressed. So people with depression and anxiety to be prepared for how this Lessina could affect you. I haven't been on it long at all, but I stopped almost immediately.

name: Take Action
comments: I took Take Action  emergency pill the next day after having unprotected sex - even though he didn’t finish  inside me but just in case. I felt just fine for 2 days but 3rd day I felt dizzy all day long thinking something is really wrong with my body and felt horrible whole day. Felt absolutely fine for a whole week but then after 10 days I started feeling  terrible again, woke up nauseous and dizzy whole day had to even take medicine for it . Got so scared thinking I might be pregnant but took pregnancy test and it was negative. Then again after 2 days I took another pregnancy test it still came out negative. I finally started my periods after 2 days delay . So don’t worry guys this pill does work it worked fine on me but I just felt terrible with its side effects!

name: Take Action
comments: Condom broke and I found it out only when we finished. It was right after the last day of my period. I got Take Action  emergency pill the next evening. In a week period came again. No any side effects, just normal cramps that I always have before my cycle.  I can assume that it worked. Hope it was helpful to any one reading and worrying

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I don't like Junel Fe24 at all. I am towards the end of my first pack so the past few weeks I’ve been spotting... the entire time. I haven’t started my period yet but it’s only the first day of me taking the brown pills. I just know once I finish I’m not taking anymore. The “breakthrough bleeding” is just too much. I have gone through so many panty liners this month than I have in a year. It’s very inconvenient. I will be calling my ob/gyn and finding something else. Other than that I haven’t had any other symptoms but I’d rather take those other symptoms over this.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: When I went on this Tri-Lo-Sprintec pill for acne and painful periods I was nervous. After reading the horrifying reviews and already having taken 2 previous brands of birth control that did not work well for me, I finally tried this. Tri-Lo-Sprintec has been a miracle on My stubborn, ever-present acne finally started to get under control, and I have the best skin I've ever had in my life--no joke. Also, I have less period pain and a lighter flow. I don't use it for birth control so I'm not sure how well it works contraception-wise, but it's been great for acne and periods. I haven't experienced weight gain, headaches, or mood swings. It took my body a couple of weeks to get accustomed to it, but overall it's been wonderful and easy. I'd just like to stress that everyone's different, and each person has a birth control that works for them. No matter what the reviews say, don't be afraid to try--you may be glad you did. If I'd been psyched out by these reviews I never would have had this amazing turnout. I love this pill!

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I was forced to switch over to Tri-Sprintec because they discontinued Tri-Nessa Lo. I have never had worse acne in my entire life. If I had read these reviews previously I would not have taken it. The pharmacy said it was "pretty much the same." It is not, I should have been put on the Tri-LO-Sprintec.  there are two different strengths of the Tri-pills, the low and the higher one. they changed me to the higher one. This medication has caused my depression and anxiety to spike in extremes. I have never experienced cystic acne until now. Full coverage makeup cannot hide the embarrassment I've been feeling in public for months. I've taken it for 3 months and it's been 3 days since I officially stopped.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Like many others, I switched to Tri-Lo-Sprintec birth control after Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo was discontinued. I had a previously bad experience with this, but I decided to give it another try since I really didn’t have any other options. Worst mistake ever! I have been on it this time for almost 4 months, and I stopped after the first week of my new pack, because I just can’t take it anymore. My skin has not been affected by this medication, but the bloating and weight gain is AWFUL! The only time I feel halfway normal is during the last week with the placebos, even with my period. Oh, and those have been much worse since taking these pills...heavier and cramping badly. After reading other reviews I’m starting to wonder if they’ve been the cause of my headaches as well. I’m not sure what I’m going to do instead, but I don’t feel like myself anymore while taking these, so they are no longer an option for me.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I switched to this Junel Fe 1.5/30 birth control after my last one was discontinued and it IS AWFUL. I constantly am having stomach cramping and vaginal dryness. I will not be taking any of it until i get a different birth control.

name: Ajovy
comments: I've been suffering with migraines since the age of 10, I'm now 36. My first Ajovy injection was in November 2018. I feel like it has cut down my migraines a lot. But every time I inject Ajovy I feel extremely tired, dizzy for a couple of weeks following the injection and side are I also feel like I'm losing hair, and gaining a little weight. I haven't changed my physical activity or eating habits. Is anyone else experiencing this? I tried to tell my Neurologist but he says there's no way Ajovy is causing this. Because these are not side effects listed by the company.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been on this Junel Fe 24 birthe control pills for 3 years now and have not had a problem. I just don't like how there are 7 inactive pills which means my period lasts 7 days, that always feels like forever. I haven't had any bad experiences with this medication. My face didn't break out, no intense cramps, just normal PMS symptoms when I am on my period. I would recommend this pill for anyone looking for a low dose birth control.

name: Aviane
comments: I’ve been using Aviane for 3 months, and I decided to change the brand. I don’t have any severe side effect, but I noticed I lost my sex drive and didn’t  get wet enough since taking this pill. I don’t have any depressed feeling or anxiety, but the problem of sex drive is a big issue for me.

name: Copaxone
comments: Copaxone didn't work for me, I had severe shaking episodes after administering the medication and my doctor suggested that I might be having allergic reactions to the treatment. I'm in the process of selecting another one.

name: Gianvi
comments: I started taking the Gianvi birth control to help with irregular bleeding and most importantly with hormonal acne. I haven't stopped spotting since starting the pill a week ago. It also makes me feel so nauseous and fatigued! Haven't noticed a difference on my skin yet. I really want to stop taking the pill because the nausea is horrible and I over all feel like poop. I will finish the pack and see how I feel over the next couple of weeks. If the nausea, spotting, fatigue, and skin doesn't improve... then I will stop taking it. These symptoms are not worth it for me.

name: Apri
comments: I was hospitalized last year due to severe anemia & very low hemoglobin. I'm 50 & unfortunately I'm still going through perimenopause. Because of this my periods are horrendous & I would bleed 18 to 21 days a month, be off my period for a week & it would start all over again. After being hospitalized for it last year & was treated with blood transfusion, potassium, magnesium & rest, I followed up with a excellent obgyn specialist. She put me on Apri & I have my life back, my bleeding is down heaps. Instead of suffering 18 to 21 days my period is only about 5 days with only 2 days heavy bleeding. I'm doing so much better & so thankful for this birth control. I also don't have any side effects.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: To keep this short and sweet, because of this birth control Junel Fe 1.5/30 I got a blood clot in my lung and had to be admitted to the hospital and be put on blood thinners. This pill is the actually so awful, between the 24/7 period cramps, rapid mood swings and super dark thoughts, and nearly puking everyday for a week and two days. May 7th 2019 marks the day an ER doctor told me I had a blood clot due to the Junel, two ER docs questioned me on why was I even taking this so, stay the away from this. And NEVER EVER take this.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have taken one Ajovy injection, continue to have headaches, but moreover, the body aches and joint pain are horrendous! No more injectable medication for me, as there is no way to stop the side effects. Definitely not for me.

name: Ocella
comments: This birth control has overall worked very well for me. I originally started birth control for acne and extreme cramps when I was 14 (I’m 26 now) and had first tried Tri Cyclen Lo which gave me a 3 month period and then tried Lo Estrin Fe which gave me a lot of cystic acne on my neck. Ocella I think helps my acne by balancing my hormones (I’m high in testosterone) and has made my cramps non existent. My period now only lasts around 3 days and is very light. The only downside is I think it’s made me gain about 10 lbs since restarting it after a few year break at 22 (I’m 26)... but weight gain may be from age as well.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: As others have stated, after using about half a puffer, it clogs or sprays your face after you pull it away. Ripping the device apart by peeling off the label and twisting off the top is the only way to use the second half of the medicine. Cleaning it doesn't always work. I changed to another drug since I  can't tell when it stops delivering medicine until days later when my asthma gets worse. This Qvar RediHaler is unsafe for asthmatics.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I was a huge fan of Trinessa, I was on it for a year and a half with no issues and no side effects. I stopped taking it for about 6 months because I was no longer in a relationship and just wanted to see if anything changed (Weight, skin, mood) if I got off the pill. I decided to start taking it again just to keep my periods more regular and because I forgot how terrible my cramps are without birth control. I went to my pharmacy and got a refill and noticed they discontinued Trinessa and was given this Tri-Sprintec stuff instead. I’m almost at the end of my second week taking it and it is terrible, nothing like Trinessa. I’ve had weird stabbing pains in my left breast, I’m tired 24/7, my anxiety has been awful, I’ve had no appetite and my stomach has constantly been upset, and I’m so depressed that I barely want to get out of bed. If you were previously on Trinessa and liked it, do not get this. I’m going to have to try and find a better Trinessa equivalent now

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started taking Junel because I was on Lo LoEstrin and had horrible anxiety, mood swings & was miserable but I took it for 5 years because it was the only birth control that didn’t make me super sick! I got on here to read the reviews & was horrified and almost didn’t take it. IM SO GLAD I DECIDED TO TAKE IT ANYWAYS. I’m 22 y/o 5’5” about 110-115 pounds when I’m not on birth control. Now I’ve been on it for almost 2 months and have not gained any weight, my boobs may have gotten like half a size better. I’m 113lb in the morning & 115lb at night. On Lo Loestrin I was a constant 120lb. My crazy moods are better. I don’t have acne like everyone says in there reviews (I  take biotin every night and have for months because my acne is pretty bad). I’m not a heavy bleeder and this pill has worked great for me. I am literally the most sensitive person to anything hormonal so if it can work for me, don’t be afraid to try it because of bad reviews!

name: Apri
comments: I’ve been taking Apri pill for about 4 months and I’ve had a pretty positive experience. I’ve experienced no nausea, no weight gain (I actually lost 2 lbs when I started taking it), and no depressive thoughts. I also feel like it hasn’t caused major mood swings. My only complaint is that prior to taking the pill, I had very few skin problems, and now I have quite a few blemishes that pop up here and there. Nothing too unbearable though. Medicine affects everyone’s body differently, so don’t turn down this medicine just because of varying reviews. Talk to your doctor first!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Junel is by far the worst pill I have ever been on. I was not one to believe that switching a brand name for another brand would have any effect on me since the hormone level would stay the same. Guess again. My pharmacy switched my pill after my 3 month trial of microgestin 1.5/30 after I had finally levelled out after 3 months, I had no anxiety, my period regular. Well I got Junel in its place and it’s been a living nightmare. I was placed on the pill 15 years ago for anxiety and depression.
