That’s just never happened before! And the improvement in sinuses I wasn’t even expecting! I am so relieved!!! I keep calling this a miracle drug and wished I’d had it sooner. I would give it a 10 if it wasn’t for the cost. I am very thankful there is help out there for co-pay.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: Oh god no do not get this birth control. It does fine with preventing pregnancy and stuff but I have never broke out so bad In my life. I have a great skin care routine and I never really had major breakouts just one here and there but my whole face lit up like a Christmas tree and I am so dry and itchy. I can’t believe the acne it gave me. Never ever again.

name: ParaGard
comments: Had this IUD placed after 4 years of being on using nothing  but condoms for contraception. Almost ended up in a mental hospital from copper toxicity. Knew something was very wrong but had no idea why because the side effects where not listed. Dark racing irrational thoughts that scared me, heart palpitations, unreasonable amounts of paranoia, extreme anxiety, severe personality shifts. Have read other stories than mine of women going manic. Finally figured out what was going on. The rep on the phone for Paragard told me “sorry that happened to you but the box says “this is not a complete list of side effects so sorry”. There is no complete list. Know the signs of copper toxicity so you can take it out early if you try this method. It will depend on your adrenal health and biochemical makeup but there is no way to know beforehand. I don’t want to scare anyone but I do want to share. I’m fine 1 year post removal but I lost everything and will never be the same

name: Jolessa
comments: Horrible experience with this birth control. Had INTENSE cramping start within the first week and it has only gotten worse. It’s a constant dull aching pain with waves of extreme stabbing pains all day every day. After 8 weeks I am calling it quits. Also, I started my period after 4 weeks... it was strange. However, did not experience any weight gain as many others have... overall, would not recommend at all. STAY AWAY!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was prescribed this birth control after I suddenly stopped getting my period. I had almost no side effects for the first couple of months and had a period every month, which was great. At the beginning of month 3, I broke out so bad to the point where I went to the dermatologist to get acne prescriptions to help improve my skin. Around the middle of month 4, I started getting really bad mood swings, anxiety, and depression, and would get an extremely bad migraine and chills the first day of placebo pills. The next month, my mood improved, but then I started getting headaches throughout the month and also really sore breasts, and also increased appetite. The sixth month, I still had the headaches, my appetite decreased, the breast tenderness went away, and I started getting really bad cramps and mild nausea. I got tired of the unpredictable side effects and changed my prescription, so hopefully I won’t have the same experience!

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments:
I feel absolutely terrible I have painful breast pains/tenderness,pelvic pain ,I've been super anxious and depressed, the nausea is my worst effect.  I could eat normal and still feel nauseous I wake up and feel nauseous. 
 I recently spotted for the first time and it sucked and I've never had such a terrible period. For my first month it caused heavy bleeding and painful cramps. It also hasn't effected my sex drive but the discharge is horrible I'm always wet. Also recently as of these past two weeks I've been diagnosed with a yeast infection and vaginitis and yesterday I went to urgent care and they did x-rays to find out the pills hormones have been causing me to be constipated - making my stomach growl after literally anything I eat.  I get gas/bloating so everything has been building up inside me causing the pelvic pain on my left side.  Now the only good effects are I've been  losing weight and my acne got somewhat better.  I hope to switch brands soon. I hope this information helps someone.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I do NOT recommend this pill!!!! I’ve taken plan b before and it did not have the same side effects at all. Plan B is more expensive but definitely worth it. I took this pill about 48 hours after sex and everything was fine at first. I then started my cycle about 15 days earlier than usual which I assumed was normal because I think it says it can either make your period early or late. Anyway my period has lasted about 9 days now (and counting!!). This seems insane to me considering my periods usually don’t even last the full 5 days. I have also had breast tenderness  since I even took the pill and got really bad cramps during the first few days of my period. In the end I guess it got the job done because I’m not pregnant. However I will never take this pill again. I strongly suggest taking the Plan B over this one if you can!!!! I only took Aftera because my pharmacy didn’t have plan B.

name: Gianvi
comments: This is the first bc pill that that prevented pregnancy and cleared up some mild adult acne without making me crazy.  Every other form of Yaz or other bc pills I've been on had made me an emotional wreck with extreme moodiness. I am happy to report  I have clear skin and a clear happy mind as well.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
I found this gel great, within a few days I saw results, my skin looked a lot calmer and pores looked better. 

However, it is very drying and makes my skin peel (on my chin) but moisturising often does reduce the amount of peeling and means that my face doesn’t hurt. I moisturise in the morning, midday, and about an hour after I’ve applied the gel, I only get the occasional peeling (but this could also be due to the harsh winter weather drying out my skin). 

I’ve noticed and my family and friends have said that they have noticed a huge improvement in my skin. It’s also evened our the texture slightly to reduce indentations in my skin caused by acne

name: ParaGard
comments:
At first I was really skeptical, because there are a lot of bad reviews, but I decided to still try it out anyway. I have never wrote a review on anything in my life, but I love this IUD so much I thought my review might help some people! 
Getting it inserted did cause some pain, it was about two big cramps and then it was in! The next two days I cramped very lightly, just like I would for a period and Advil took the cramping away! 
My first period with the IUD was a bit harsh, medicine and a heating pad helped though and I still went about my normal daily activities. My second period was about the same. 
All of the periods following that were completely back to normal, everything was exactly how it was before I got the IUD. I have had absolutely no physical changes, and I completely forget I have it. I love that it doesn't contain the hormones to change my body and that I never even notice it is there.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Do not take this!!! I have never had acne in my life, just started taking this. The first day I took this, I was nauseous. Then week two, I started developing cystic acne all over my face. It has also caused insomnia. I’m going to finish the pack, and try something else. Ladies stay away from this pill!!!

name: Lessina
comments: Wow. I started on the third day of my period, which was a Sunday as directed. It’s two weeks later and I’m still on my period (day 17). I have migraines 3-5 times a month usually, but have had them every other day with this. I stopped taking the pill about a week after I started and then had a migraine that lasted four days, even with using my prescription migraine pills. I had a large blood clot as well. I went back to the doctor and they suggested I try to ride it out. Nope. On day 15, my period, which had been light, came back full force and was heavier than it’s ever been. I’m waiting for my body to clear the hormones out, but it’s been just awful. If you have migraines, think twice before taking Lessina.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
The old inhaler worked fine. This new redihaler malfunctions. I had used about 40 puffs before it started not coming out properly. I will call the manufacturer to try and get a replacement but I am surprised to see so many others have had similar problems. Do they not test these out before launching? 

The new design is annoyingly big too.

name: Apri
comments: I am 20 and have been on this birth control for years. I mean at least 3-4. I can say I have absolutely zero sex drive whatsoever. I didn’t even understand how girls were even interested in sex at my age, or even in the slightest. It made no sense to me. It’s really sucked. I am still on it to this day because I am prescribed accutane and you have to be on a contraceptive to be on it. I haven’t noticed my skin get any better on this but I didn’t even know people switched birth controls and have been living in sadness for years. I don’t know if the sadness is from the birth control or not but it’s also been there for years. I hate these pills with a passion. Don’t be me who feels like an 80 yr old woman with no sex drive and just feels like general garbage

name: Lessina
comments: Would not recommend this birth control at all. Regret ever taking it. I was on Lessina for about 6 weeks when I realized I needed to stop. I was constantly tired and wanted to sleep. My weight stayed the same but I wasn’t on it long enough. I felt like my acne actually got worse- I had painful pimples that didn’t go away for weeks. On top of this I started to lose my self confidence and motivation. I did already have anxiety but was always able to control it but on this birth control my anxiety was terrible and I couldn’t control it- I had to hold myself from having anxiety attacks in school. I would easily get ticked off or upset over the smallest things. I started to experience depression and didn’t feel like myself at all on this pill. Forgot what it was like to feel normal and really happy like I used to be. DON'T TAKE THIS PILL

name: Gianvi
comments:
I have been on Gianvi for 5 months. The first month I had bad mood swings but that went away. My period is lighter. I still have some PMS symptoms before my period. My moods have been better. 
The pill has cleared my skin. I have not gained any weight. I really like this birth control.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Terrible anxiety,  depression,  mood swings with this brand of birth control. I've taken various forms of birth control for 16 years, this pill felt different. Felt awful on it, would not recommend.

name: Ocella
comments: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  Took it two times and was overcome by horrible irritability, depression and ridiculous thoughts.  I am a positive person and this was AWFUL.  As soon as I stopped taking it my mood went back to normal.  I felt as if Dementors (from Harry Potter Series) were sucking my soul.  AVOID!

name: Lessina
comments: So I started this B.C. About a month ago. Before that I was on Ortho Tri-Cyclen  for almost 3 years. Then all of a sudden I'm switched to this. Anyways I just got my period a day later than I was supposed to. (On the ortho my cycles are every 28 days on the dot!) I'm concerned because I only bled for one day and haven't bled anymore after that for3 days. So not sure if it's switching birth control pills or if it's implantation bleeding. Good luck ladies!

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: When my daughter started off using Veltin she had very bad acne and it seemed like she was getting an allergic reaction from a retinoid in another product. She used so many products and we were so sure this wasn’t going to work but the dermatologist recommended using Veltin and applying small amounts all over the face before going to bed.  After about a week of using Veltin her acne was gone and she had blemishes left and then after about a month her face was clear. It has been 6 months and she’s  still using it to prevent future acne and the results are amazing!

name: Apri
comments: I was switched from Junel to Apri because of breakthrough bleeding. While that has been fixed, Apri has some pretty serious negative side effects for me. My mood is completely unstable and swings terribly and my anxiety is uncontrollable. Sex drive is basically non existent. Other than that, no weight gain, acne, lighter periods and less painful cramping (my cramps were unbearable before)

name: Seasonique
comments: I've been on this birth control for about a year, and I like it just fine. It can be so hard to find a birth control that is right for you! This one is great because you only have to have a period every three months! I've read a few reviews that say they skip the sugar pills and forego having a period. I've tried that twice and both times I had a ton of breakthrough bleeding and basically had my period anyway. Maybe it's different for everyone. I have started getting migraines occasionally lately, which isn't normal for me. I think this may be a side effect of this pill that is fairly common. Other than that, the pill has worked really well for me! It doesn't make me gain weight, which was an issue for me with other pills.

name: Nuvigil
comments: Been telling Drs 20yrs about being excessively tired. Finally broke down bawling to my current Dr this year, she sent me for  Multiple Sleep Latency Test (MSLT) and I failed test. Finally had my diagnosis. Dr put me on Ritalin LA 20mg, lost potency within 5 days, increased dose to 30mg, still didn't work, seen sleep specialist, he put me on nuvigil, took it couple days, did not help at all! In fact it made me feel like I was going through withdraw from suboxone I take and felt it made narcolepsy worse. I take suboxone because 10yrs ago I used pain pills to "give me energy", I got addicted to pain pills obviously. Been on suboxone 6yrs. I was hoping I finally have a diagnosis of narcolepsy I could get on right meds and get off suboxone. My Dr wanted to put me on ritalin 20mg LA for morning and ritalin 10mg for afternoon but insurance wouldn't cover it. Only  30mg as a whole. I honestly think the dose she wanted to put me on would have helped but the insurance knows best right? Makes me so mad!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Has to switch to this after being on Loestrin for years because it got too expensive. First month no symptoms, second and third month I got my period twice. Gained weight and broke out which never happened before Loestrin or during. Would feel sick during my period. Emotions of depression and anxiety would kick in severely before and during my period. Since I would get it twice a month, I would only feel slightly normal a week out of the month. Cramps were insanely painful. Breast became so painful by the third month, just wearing a shirt or bra hurt. I am so glad I found these reviews because I thought I was losing it. After much research I stopped taking Junel the second I realized it was the cause.

name: CamreseLo
comments: I have been using a combination of Camrese Lo/ Lo Seasonique for 8 years now (used Lo Seasonique for about 2 years sometime in the middle. Purely just an insurance company issue). It took a good year/year and a half for my body to fully adjust. I used to get horrible periods with heavy bleeding and cramps so bad that I would have to stay home because I would need a bathroom every hour. After starting this, my periods got lighter and way more manageable. During the first year, I couldn’t get through a whole pack without having some bleeding. Over time, my body got used to it and now, all these years later, I rarely get a period at the end of the pack. If I do, it’s very light and doesn’t last more than a few days. No issues with weight gain or acne. I would certainly recommend this pill, but I would definitely say you have to give it some time for your body to adjust. Getting on a 3 month cycle won’t happen overnight, so be patient.

name: Ocella
comments: I took Sprintec years ago which initially worsened my skin and caused severe depression. Since taking Ocella for almost 6 months I’ve had great experiences. My skin is great, I barely have any cramps (before I had extremely severe cramps and heavy flow), and my flow has lightened. I am really happy with this birth control.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took this for 15 years. It gave me high blood pressure and increased heart rate 102-108bpm.  No moods swings or pregnancies. Regulated my period, reduced my cramps, and made my endometriosis go away. I switched to another BC and the high blood pressure stopped and the heart rate is at 100bpm.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: This NOT a rescue inhaler, in spite of it's marketing. As many have stated on here in the past, when you are having an asthma attack, you can't breath in deeply or quickly enough to get an adequate dose and in between each dose you have to close the cap, shake and reopen it.   I guess this company will need to be sued when someone dies from an asthma attack to make the FDA pull it off the market. Totally useless.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: The medication had severely dried up my skin. It is constantly peeling. Everything I do to it burns it so bad I want to cry. I can’t even touch around my under eyes. If helped clear up my acne decently fast. I’m going to keep using, but I hope the side effects go away SOON.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The changeover to the new dispenser - RediHaler - has been a disaster for me.  About half way through the doses on my first one, it stopped dispensing the medication.   I called the manufacturer who did replace it with a new one.  It is very expensive for the new RediHaler so that was a relief.  Now I am half way through the second one and it is not working again.  It acts as if it is dispensing but I definitely don't feel anything going in my lungs.  I tried to clean it with a rubbing alcohol tissue (like the manufacturer suggested) and it did not work.  I know it is not working because I can feel the asthma in my lungs after being in control for over 6 years.   It is very disheartening.  Also, I have no health insurance until next month which makes it even more nerve racking.  I called my doctor and  he is prescribing me a different daily inhaler so I don't have to deal with this again.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I've been a nurse with a private asthma and allergy practice for nearly 4 years, now.  I have also used the ProAir RespiClick device for my reactive airway symptoms to determine why my patients are complaining that they aren't experiencing any symptom relief with it.  I have no idea how the ProAir RespiClick even made it through trials to be approved for patient use.  This device is only activated if the patient is able to inhale forcefully and deeply enough to cause the powder to be released and inhaled. In the event of an asthmatic episode, the patient is already struggling to breathe deeply/forcefully, hence their urgent need for relief.  If someone can't breathe, it makes no sense that their lifesaving medication won't work unless their lung function isn't compromised. That would be like asking someone who is choking on food to swallow a pill to dislodge the food and save their life.  No common sense here, manufacturers.

name: Claravis
comments:
I completed two courses of accutane. My acne was never horrible but it was resistant to every other treatment I tried. My first course I took when I was a junior in high school, and I had amazing results. Clear, beautiful skin. When some acne started returning as a junior in college I took a second course, I think 40 mg/day for 5 months.

Near the end of that second course I became really lethargic, paranoid, anxious, and had brain fog and stomach issues. My skin started flushing a lot and still does. My high libido became non-existent.

I finally tried an antidepressant (celexa) for ~6 months in 2016 which helped. As time goes on I'm slowly feeling better, but my libido is still gone. Doctors say I'm healthy.

I just want to say be careful if you choose to take this drug. My first course was amazing and I decided I would be fine doing another one. I regret that decision.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: My pharmacy switched me without informing me from Trinessa to Tri Lo Sprintec. At first I was very skeptical and my mother warned me against taking it, but I have never had any bad experiences with other birth controls before so I figured this would be the same. Immediately I began to notice a change in my appetite as I would eat more than ever before resulting in weight gain. I also had almost no sex drive or desire to do anything with my boyfriend. I felt like I could not be myself as hard as I tried, once my boyfriend approached me about how I had not been myself whatsoever I knew I had to stop taking it. It was upsetting because despite all these side effects it is the first birth control that has ever cleared up my acne which I have struggled with for years.

name: Ajovy
comments: I have had daily headaches & migraines for over 7 years. My doctor started me on Aimovig first. After two doses, she switched me to Ajovy.  I took my first dose in October.  So far, I have had no redness or pain at injection site.  I've had no constipation, as long as I drink water.  Now, it has not helped my migraines at all (I have a min. of 15 a month).  For my daily headaches (range 6-8 on a pain scale of 0-10 (10 is worst)), I've noticed a slight decrease in intensity (range of 5-8 now).  I do have a couple of concerns. I feel like I'm a guinea pig.  I've noticed a decrease in healing of my accidental wounds & scratches, as well as a possible interaction with my Sulfa antibiotics.  I am trying this med, because I'm desperate to get rid of my pain, and I've tried everything else out there.

name: Adipex-P
comments: It hasn’t been a month yet,  I started adipex one tablet daily, never believed there is such pill to help me lose weight because I was tired of everything I tried, nothing worked out, until I started this miracle pill, as I said within 3 weeks I went down from 190 lbs to 169 lbs unbelievable!!! I'm so happy with my result, my goal is to go down to 155 lb or around... I’m 5’6

name: Qvar
comments:
Second time in the year with oral thrush. The redihaler sucks. Have been using Qvar since it’s inception in the market. Not a single episode of thrush with the other packaging (a mere, simple, all known pump). And the worst is that the pump presentation was completely substituted by the ready haler. The product goes into all your mouth crevices. Terrible presentation. 
At this pace I could have 4 episodes of thrush yearly and there is no other option but the redihaler. As indicated in the package I rinse my mouth.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I took this pill 48hours after I had unprotected sex (the day before I started ovulation) I’ve had slight cramping and lower stomach tightness. It has been 8 days since I had unprotected sex and I started spotting, I don’t think it is my period because it was very light and it only lasted a few hours. I’m also not supposed to start my period until December 10th and it’s November 28th so I really hope I’m not pregnant.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started taking this pill a month ago after switching from novium 777  it was a great pill I had no side effects but a super light period. While taking nortrel 777 I was nausea when I first started taking them but hasn't happen since the first week. It didn't  make the cramps go aways. Although other than that it seems to be working fine.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Am i pregnant? No. Do I hate my body? Yes. I haven't stopped taking this birth control yet but boy, I am READY to stop. I'm solely taking it until I can get an appointment with my doctor and switch to something else and am trying not to get pregnant in the meantime. I went on Junel and in the beginning it seemed fine, but I got acne out the wazoo in my jaw area and started getting cystic acne around my face that HURT. I gained probably 5-10 pounds as well and my nausea was so unbelievably horrendous, I had to resort to leftover zofran I had from a prior stomach flu. I went off of it for a couple months and tried sprintec but I had a full on period in the middle of the pack and bled so much it was unreal, so I went back on Junel in an effort to get that under control and have needed to switch to something new ever since. This was the first bc I've been on birth control ever so I know I still need some trial and error and I'll be looking into something new

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I also took Aftera at the beginning of Oct on the my last day of period, spotted around Oct 22nd, next full period started today Nov 26th. (8weeks later) It works as long as you don’t take it while ovulating according to older posts and it could delay your period for a month or 2 like me depending on how your body handles it.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: My name is keke me and my partner had sex  on 11/3/2018 using protection but the condom popped. I visited pharmacy to buy plan b , I ended up settling for Aftera not just cause it was cheaper but because it was my only option . I took it with in 72 like it says , I was nervous I had no side effects at all just my stomach felt a little tight.  But all good.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on this birth control pill going on about 2 months now. The pill was suppose to stop my menstrual cycle due to severe cramps and inability to function when on my cycle. I originally was on Vyflema but the prescription changed when I went to different pharmacy and how the regime was suppose to be taken changed as well. Problems started as minor spotting and very mild cramps to continuous spotting/bleeding and cramps everyday for the past 3 weeks. I thought at first it was because my body was trying to get use to skipping the placebo pills from the first pack however everyday the bleeding and cramping got worse during the second pack. I called my doctor today to have me switched to something else.

name: Gianvi
comments: This has been the worst experience of my life. I’m doing nothing but bleeding and bleeding and bleeding constantly for the past 5 months. Coming from someone who used to have bad anxiety and overcame it mostly... it has made me have anxiety attack’s a few times a week. I feel lack of motivation don’t know if that’s due to my constant period or the medicine. I’ve never had a good experience with any BC pill or depo shot.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The QVAR red inhaler has a terrible taste. It taste like anti itch medicine. I don't like how I have to wash my mouth out after and can't swallow. I liked my old QVAR inhaler. It has been really smokey so I have to use more. I don't like how you don't have a button to press. I felt like I have more control over my inhaler when I can push it down. I also feel like I get more medicine in with my spacer. I am going to the doctor and begging them to prescribe me to a different inhaler.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: I have moderate persistent asthma and severe allergies. I was taking a different medication and had several all night asthma attacks, daily episodes, and pleurisy for months. My doctor switched me to Advair 250/50 three days ago and the difference is night and day. Today is the first day in three months that I haven’t had any symptoms. I feel like a new person. Adviar is the best asthma medication I’ve tried, and today, I’m enjoying breathing deeply!
uses: Advair Diskus (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I was prescribed this and at first it was working well, but after about a week of using this product the area that I was applying the gel got a terrible rash. It took the acne away but looked almost like a burn mark and was quite painful. Would not recommend.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Like many others I was switched to Portia after Levora (which I loved!) was discontinued. Have to begin by saying I was skeptical of the whole gaining weight or having mood swings while on birth control stories but man did this pill mess with me. Giving it 3 stars bc it shortened & decreased my pain during menstruation immensely but it wasn’t worth the massive mood swings (namely unwarranted irritation & then extreme depression)— that just came out of nowhere about two months into taking this pill. My appetite also majorly increased & was much insatiable which was kind of a bummer. I think I gave Portia a fair shot but after about 4-5 months I’m switching to a diff pill—I understand everybody is different so this may work for some but definitely not for me.

name: Aviane
comments:
THIS IS THE BEST BIRTH CONTROL PILL EVER!
I wanted to share my experience with everyone because after choosing a wrong pill before I realized how important it is to search to find the right pill. I'm on my 3rd month so far and I see no effect on myself. My weight is the same, my skin is the same, I don't have nausea or a headache (as I experienced on my previous pill called Esme) My mood is normal as how I am as usual. I loved this pill because I see no effect. So, I can move on to my life like I'm not on a pill. I started this pill after reading so many good comments about it and I definitely recommend it!!!

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
Worked well for me before they changed the inhaler type. Now it is a challenge to get the medicine in my lungs properly; it's hard for me to take deep breaths because of my asthma. Just bought a new one because the last one stopped working at 40 doses left. As soon as I opened the cap, medicine sprayed out on its own, and I had to hurry to put my mouth over it. Don't even know if I got enough of the dose, but I hope so since the price went up significantly. Anxious to use it again, I'm afraid all the propellant might come out of mine too like a previous reviewer stated if it's doing all that on its own.

Thanks.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
I took Aftera about 2 hours after unprotected sex and it worked. The condom came off inside of me, so my  partner and I drove to CVS immediately and got Aftera for $44. I don't like to take meds on an empty stomach, so I took it after we got lunch. 

This happened and I knew my period was due 12 days later. I remember 5 days during the week after I took Aftera that I had short, 2-minute long periods of intense back cramps. It felt like someone shoved a pole down my spine, but it only lasted 2 minutes a day during each of the 5 days. 

As I mentioned, my period was due 12 days later. I actually got it on the 11 day, so early and damn near close to on time! The period was a bit heavier and more symptomatic than usual-I experienced a bad headache that lasted for all of Day 3, and I was very fatigued on Days 2-4.

These symptoms weren't too bad. I was worried after reading these reviews, but my friend/potential partner and I are so relieved.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The new design for QVAR sucks! It's very difficult to use and  it's hard to tell if it's working. The old push, release spray, and breath was much better. It's hard to  tell if anything is getting into my lungs. Combine the fact that the RediHaler is a very poor design with the fact that the medication is very overpriced--I'll be looking for an alternative inhaler.

name: Adipex-P
comments: I started Adipex on 11/8/2018,  I am 5'5 , I weighed in at 243lb at the time. It is now my 5th day and I have already lost 9lbs.  I am only taking half of the pill because the Dr. thought I should gradually increase after seeing what side effects I would have. At this time but have following a 1200 calorie intake. Side effects have been dry mouth and blurry vision and high heart rate but it is tampering down now that my body is adjusting. I love the pill but the only downside is the blurry vision.   I will continue to take to see if this stops if not I will just follow good eating habits and hit the gym

name: Kariva
comments: I have been on Kariva for a year now. I have a heart arrythmia that is aggravated my fluctuating hormones. It has always been more of an issue right before my period due to hormone changes, and is a PMS symptom for me. I see a cardiologist that has me on medication to control my arrhythmia on a daily basis. If my hormones are out of wack, my heart medicine can’t completely control the heart palpitations. I was having hormone related issues so my gyno put me on Kariva to help with everything. However throughout the month, I have breakthrough bleeding, bloating, mild cramps...right before this my heart arrhythmia goes crazy. I don’t feel like the Kariva is regulating my hormones properly. I do take the Kariva at the same time every day and never miss a dose. I have also developed extreme anxiety which only started after taking this BC. It also kills your sex drive. I will be asking for an alternative when I see my doctor next month. I have taken other BCs in the past with no issues.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: 3rd time getting this inhaler and it’s the 3rd time ProAir stopped administering the medicine early. This last time is the worst. Less than a week with 175 counters and it’s empty. Anyone have this???

name: Camrese
comments: I’ve only been taking camrese for a few weeks now (almost a month) and I’ve noticed I’m hungry all the time, I also have had mood swings I’m just now adjusting and not feeling sad all the time, I also have had some minor cramping, as well as occasional breakouts that fortunately go away within a day or two. However, I haven’t been taking this for very so long so these side effects may go away. Hopefully!

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I mean it got the job done, but my period was missed all month and it gave me the biggest pregnancy scare ever ! I got bad cramps and no period, and I felt fatigue and nauseous some days- I truly thought I was pregnant. It delayed my period a lot and I got bad symptoms and a weird odor ? Only gave it some stars because I ended up getting my period so woohoo!

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I began taking this for my period, which was really heavy and came with terrible cramps. While I was on it, I experienced terrible cramps. I have genetically good skin, but this medication gave me the worst acne of my life. It was embarrassing, not to mention painful. It also made me incredibly depressed, and I’d find myself cancelling plans with some of my favorite people to stay home and cry. I have decided to go off of it, and I am very excited to get back to normal. Based on other reviews I have read, many women have gone through similar experiences to mine.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments:
This pump is a joke I just sprung $52 out of pocket on this and was so disappointed!
DON'T BUY THIS

name: Qvar
comments: I’ve tried using Qvar on 3 separate occasions, each time I use it, it causes asthma symptoms (wheezing, shortness of breath), which means I have to take my rescue inhaler or albuteral right after taking Qvar. I refuse to take this medicine again! Does more harm than good!!

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I had been on Levora for about ten years when my pharmacy switched to Portia. I was told it was the same thing (generic version) but my experience says otherwise. I took it for about two weeks when I started noticing I was VERY gloomy/sad/easily triggered. I wasn’t as resilient as I normally am. I also started bleeding during sex and was so disturbed my it I almost fainted (I never bleed during sex and basically got my period out of the blue). I would NOT advise anyone to take Portia - the gloominess/hopelessness feeling I got from taking it is enough to make me quit oral birth control altogether. I’m really struggling to find a solution.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Was using Levora and Chateal before Portia. Portia has caused random weight gain, swelling in my arms and legs, abdomen area. I eat healthy and exercise regularly so I know that this was my only change. It has given me so much acne that I have never had before, depression, excruciating headaches that are crippling. It’s terrible. I have used Allese, Chateal, Levora and haven’t had any issues until PORTIA! Portia is the worst. I stopped it after a month and a half because of the crazy side effects and I am not willing to put myself through the worst I’ve ever felt again. Seek other birth control.

name: Lessina
comments: This one was rough. I’ve never felt more moody, depressed, and all around not myself on this pill. I stopped it after one month. Wasn’t even worth it. Every one reacts differently, but my experience on this was terrible.

name: Ocella
comments: Out of all the birth control's I've taken throughout the years, Ocella has been an absolute blessing! I started taking it a little over a month ago. Since then I haven't experienced any bloating or my usual hormonal acne breakouts! My skin hasn't looked this great since elementary school (and I'm 25)! Only side-effect I have experienced is I'm a little more frustrated near my period, but it's so worth it! 10/10 would recommend!

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I’ve been on this pill for almost a year and it’s been good, I don’t think my mood has changed a lot. I also haven’t gained weight or gotten acne! I was really worried about those two. The only problem is that I’m having two week long periods and that’s been going on for about 5 months and idk if that’s normal. Has anyone else experienced this? Before the pill I took the depo shot and had irregular bleeding too.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The new delivery system for Qvar is a disaster.  I have coughed non stop and don’t have enough air to even cook dinner.  I am allergic to albuterol so I have no rescue inhaler.  This was one inhaler I did not have an allergic reaction to.  I guess I will have to start trying a different medicine and will be sick with reactions until I find one that works.  I have a few words for Teva, but they are not printable.

name: Cartia XT
comments: Started Cartia 120 mg xt (9th med for BP) racing heart felt like medium (lexiscan) used for Nuclear Stress test. Severe Headache, increased BP 191/123 feel like garbage, called Cardiologist wants me to continue on it!  Ringing in ears won't stop.  Heat pounding so hard chest hurts and severe headache.  I am stopping it might as well be dead!

name: levonorgestrel
comments: On 9/30, the last day of my period, my husband and I had unprotected sex,Plan B wasn’t available at CVS so I took this pill 30 hours later on 10/01. A week later, 10/08 (aka my “expected ovulation date”), I experienced the worst tightness in my stomach as well as cramping/spotting, breast tenderness and severe migraines/light sensitivity. The week of 10/16, the spotting was gone but my PMS was out of control, hormonal cystic acne took over my face (terrible like my teen years, I am 31 now), and my breast tenderness came back with a vengeance. My period was due around 10/26 but I decided to take my first pregnancy test 10/23 which was negative. I took 2 more on 10/25 & 10/30 which again were negative. Still no full period as of Nov 2nd. Since all my pregnancy tests came back negative, I’m assuming it worked and my period will start eventually or next month. Overall it’s not worth taking especially with the symptoms/period delay

name: Antabuse
comments: Antabuse works!!!! It really helped me stay sober for 3 months- I didn't even think about drinking because I just knew it wasn't an option. Well...a few days ago I drank 3 light beers. I was violently sick!!! I threw up 3 times couldn't even hold water in my system. I'm glad it happened because I will never drink again as long as I'm taking Antabuse.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
I used QVAR (with spacer) for 4-5 years.  When it became unavailable (because it used a propellant (HFA-134a) for which environmental concerns might or might not exist), my doctor switched me to another asthma medicine, which I did not like.  I requested a return to QVAR and got the Qvar RediHaler.  While it sometimes quits working before 120 doses, it usually provides 100-110 (or more) doses.  I have no complaints.

I am puzzled by some comments here because Qvar RediHaler does not use a propellant, to the best of my knowledge.  These comments make me wonder if we are using different products.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I have never experienced anything more awful. I was taking levora and I loved it, but then it got discontinued and my insurance switched me to Portia. At first, I took two months of it and felt terrible. My breasts were so tender and hurting all the time, I had chest pains constantly and thought I had heart problems. I was incredibly moody and got sad or upset for no reason pretty often. I took a month break from it, but then felt like I had no choice to get back on since my insurance didn’t cover anything else, and things got worse. I have been getting panic attacks, feeling depressed and even suicidal, not acting like myself, shutting  everyone out and I finally realized that this drastic change is because of my birth control. It’s messing up my hormones and my mental health and it’s just not worth it. I cry all the time and feel so empty inside and I’ve never experienced this sort of helplessness before. Please don’t take this pill.

name: AirDuo Respiclick
comments:
From day one of taking this medication my throat has felt like I am swallowing razor blades and glass. Nothing stops the pain. 
 It also has not helped my asthma symptoms at all.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: my dermatologist prescribed this cream for my acne. I see many people say that a week after they had pimples and that's normal! My dermatologist warned me that it was a normal process and I can tell you that it's been 2 months I apply this cream and I have nothing (at the first week it's true that it made me break out but now I have no pimples:) )

name: Gianvi
comments: I was on this birth control for three years and I absolutely loved it and put up with it solely because it cleared my skin up beautifully. But ladies please please be aware that this specific birth control can increase digestive flora and give you terrible IBS symptoms. My symptoms were so bad to the point where  I required surgery and I failed to recognize that this birth control was the reason why. After this, I began to develop chronic yeast infections/ irritations. Making sex a nuisance and me being EXTREMELY uncomfortable. This pill may work for others just fine but be aware that the high levels of estrogen can take a huge toll on the female body.

name: Gianvi
comments: I kept trying to figure out why I felt so much better this month and why I’ve finally been able to lose some weight and abdominal bloating. I follow a pretty healthy diet and workout hard usually around 5 days a week and sometimes twice a day. Sadly, it never occurred to me it was my birth control! I’ve been taking Loryna for 3-4 years and will definitely NOT be taking that again. Previously I was on Ocella and Yaz. I’ve been on Gianvi for almost a month and feel so much better. I’ve lost weight and definitely the bloat. I haven’t noticed any changes in my mood and if anything my sex drive is better.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was on Portia for about 2 years. It worked miracles in the first 7 months for clearly my acne. After taking it for a month my face was basically clear but for whatever reason, my acne came back after a year and a half of using it. My sex drive was nonexistent but I didn't mind it since it cleared my skin. Also in beginning, I got nauseous every time I started a new pack but overtime that disappeared. Some pros are that it helped in getting rid of my cramps and also lightened my period. I'm now trying Yaz for my acne

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started Junel last month for the first time only because microgestin fe 1/20 was on back order. The pharmacist told me that the Junel had the same ingredients at microgestin but I beg to differ  in its affect on me because I had anxiety, my mouth was dry, and I was sweating. This stuff was horrible...never again!!! Thank God my pharmacy got the microgestin back in but without the iron

name: Ajovy
comments: My experience with this drug has been horrific. I injected it 2 weeks ago and have been sick ever since. It has doubled the amount of migraines that I get. I have also had severe dizziness and vertigo along with heart palpitations and anxiety. It has given me neck and muscle pain as well. I am nauseous and can’t sleep. This drug listed no side effects but  injection site reaction which I did not get. I expect to be sick for at least the full month that this drug will be in my system. This is not the miracle drug I was expecting. Teva is definitely not being forthcoming.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I have had a rather decent experience on Portia.  When it comes to my period, it has not improved my flow any, but it has lessened my cramps and the number of days my period is. My period used to last about 7 to 10 days and now my period lasts a maximum of four days. I have also lost weight instead of gaining weight like I expected. I have went from 132 to 120 ever since I started it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Ordered a refill on my b.c. pills. When I arrived to the pharmacy, I was surprised to see Portia and not my usual Levora. I was told that Portia has replaced levora. Took it for 2 nights and broke out in hives. Also experienced severe stomach pain, like sharp pains. After the 4th night called advice nurse. Saw a doc and thank goodness I am switching back to Levora - worst experience

name: Lessina
comments: I've been taking Lessina for 3 months now, I really like the pill only a few complaints such as breakouts here and there, migraines off and on and a very lengthy period. Before taking Lessina my cycle would last roughly 5 days, now it last about 2 weeks which is really the only reason I'm looking to change to another pill. On a positive note, no menstrual cramps at all which is amazing.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I took this for around 6 months and I'm not pregnant yet. I'm moving to a different pill because it mainly caused some depression and weird mood swings. I didn't see a change in my weight and my skin did clear slightly. My breasts grew about a cup. It's an effective pill, just not for me because of the effects it had on my mood.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The very first time I used this it sprayed for so long that when I took my mouth off it was still spraying and I dropped it. The 2nd time I used it, same thing (didn't drop it though). Third time I tried to use it, didn't work at all so apparently it's because all the propellent came out. So I basically inhaled tons of HFA's and ethanol. I'm sure that's great for my lungs

name: Kariva
comments: Started on the Depo Shot when I was 14. Although not having periods were nice, I still had every symptom of periods but without bleeding (headaches, cramping, mood swings, increased appetite, etc.). So 6 months later I got switched to Kariva, costing me approximately $50 a month, w/o insurance. I can’t say I’ve had any “major experiences” with Kariva. I started birth control with the intention of lighter periods which have gone from heavier 2 week long periods to a medium flow 3-4 days. I still have a few symptoms but I can’t 100% say it’s due to Kariva since I’ve been on it so long, such as moderate cramping, weight gain (due to large appetite) and occasional moodiness, but definitely nothing that I would say is ‘out of the ordinary’. As of the pregnancy preventative aspect, I’ve had sex occasionally throughout my time on Kariva but haven’t gotten pregnant even due to occasionally forgetting 2-3 pills a month. Overall, I would recommend Kariva.

name: Take Action
comments: It does work ladies. My bf and I had sex 3 days before my period comes, and he finished all the way inside of me. The next day he bought me the take action pill, I took it 18hrs late. I fell asleep after taking it, I didn't feel any symptoms. Today my period comes at work, a week late. And Again it works.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have not had a good experience with this brand. Like others, I used to take Necon, which I liked then got switched to this brand. Since the switch I have noticed an increase in anxiety and mild depression. I am a teacher so that comes with enough stress. This medication seemed to worsen it. I have never experienced such high levels of anxiety. After reading the reviews of this mediation I see now how it can affect some people. I am not going to continue with this brand.

name: Qvar
comments: this product works well, however; the last shipment that I received was a different applicator that is terrible! the number of doses remaining goes down but it fails to administer the drug many times. I never know how many doses are remaining because the count is way off. I have even tried to open and close slowly to ensure it opens fully and closes fully and still nothing but yet the number reflects that it worked. I have done this as many as 16 times in order to get one complete dose. PLEASE GO BACK TO THE ORIGINAL APPLICATOR!!!!

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I started this birth control pill despite the bad reviews. I was very scared thinking I’d have a bad experience. However, I’m glad I went ahead & tried it on my own. I was previously on Levonor, & I hated it. The first few weeks I experienced spotting. But it stopped after the first month of taking it. I haven’t experienced weight gain or headaches as I did with the previous pill. My biggest concern was weight gain. But thankfully, I haven’t gained weight. I actually think I’ve lost weight because I’ve been eating healthier and exercising more. I even feel like my breast’s have grown a cup size (yay!) Overall, I really like this pill.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve taken this birth control for 4 months now. I have irregular bleeding and cramping from it. It seems like I’m always bleeding than not. Didn’t work for me.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
I had unprotected sex for the first time on Saturday at around 6am and it wasn’t expected. He did not finish inside and he said he didn’t Precum but 
 I was still nervous - so hopefully this works. I took this pill 1 day later at Sunday 8pm, and I have experienced cramping and breast sensitivity. But , I still have not gotten my period and it’s Tuesday night, I am hoping it comes... I know it can delay your period by up to a week.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Before I started this medication,I had read reviews of it and I was horrified. It's now been a year and 4 months that I've been on Junel Fe and I honestly haven't encountered any issues. Before I was on birth control, I was depressed, had anxiety attacks very often, always tired, had my period for at least 6 days and had a lot of cramping. I never had any issues with having acne. Ever since I started I feel like a whole new person. Zero anxiety attacks, no longer depressed, very light periods that last 3 days (at most), NO cramping at all, and still no issues with acne. I constantly see reviews that other people leave saying that they're constantly nauseous or having headaches or gaining weight, but I personally haven't had any of these issues. Although this medication doesn't work well for some people it works perfectly for me!! Don't let other reviews discourage you. I almost didn't start using this medication due to the bad reviews I had read. I'm also glad I'm not pregnant :)

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: I use Quvar for Allergies. The Qvar 80 worked great. The new Redihailer is awful. I do not feel like the powder is getting into my lungs. I am coughing a lot and am using more that I did on the old format. I pay out of pocket for this drug. I feel like I threw $200.00 in the trash. Why did they have to change it!!!!??????

name: Gianvi
comments: I am almost done with my first month of Gianvi. I have tried just about everything for my moderate cystic acne and am sad to say it has so far gotten worse on this medication. I have a history of minor depression/anxiety but have been happy and unmedicated until starting this pill. Since starting this pill, my anxiety has sky rocketed and my sex drive has decreased big time. I am 2 days away from the sugar pill and debating whether or not to stop taking it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This was easily the worst medication I have ever been on, no competition at all. I know birth control is trial and error, but holy moly. I tried Junel Fe 1.5/30 for 3 months and I wish I could get them back. Not only did my boobs hurt 24/7 for the entire duration of it, but I was stressed over EVERYTHING the entire time. Truly the worst part about it though was that I lost so much hair and gained 5 pounds. The only benefit is that I never had a child, so seeing that this is the purpose of the medication, I'll give it a 3 rating haha.

name: Kariva
comments: I was on Kimidess for 2 years and it was great. When I moved and got new insurance, for whatever reason I kept getting Kariva and not Kimidess from my pharmacy. It has been awful for me. After little to no sex drive, hormonal acne and Perioral dermatitis appearing, I stopped taking the pill and am now hoping to go back to Kimidess. While all BCP work differently for different bodies, this one certainly did not work for me. Super disappointed I was even given this when my doctor never prescribed it! Ladies, be careful about generic BCPs. I personally do NOT trust them now.

name: Antabuse
comments: I used Antabuse to stop drinking in the '70s - blackouts, etc.  Used pure will power back then.  Then I started drinking again for about 15 years after being sober for around 30.  Then used Antabuse for about 3 years.  We moved and I ran out of Antabuse  I tried to quit again and my Primary Care Physician wouldn't prescribe it.  So, found another doctor who would.  Finally, at about 8.3 to 10 ounces of pure alcohol every day (computed via volume and ABV %), I've been alcohol-free for a couple of weeks.  Without it, my will to be sober would have broken 100 times a day.  It makes me pretty sleepy at first, but, from experience, my energy will come back.  Only have to make the decision once a day.

name: Take Action
comments:
Now, if you are like me, you're probably reading these comments and freaking out about the side effects. Hopefully this will help calm some of your nerves.
So on September 30th I ended up having a drunken hook up with a guy I didn't know that resulted in me not remembering whether or not we used a condom (good job me). Anyways, you can imagine my stress right? Ended up buying this pill because wal-mart was all out of plan b and taking it about 18 hours later. I was SO nervous about it not working and about the side effects but I can honestly say that I didn't really experience anything outside of the usual pms symptoms (little bit of cramping, sore boobs etc.). Not bad at all! Had a little bit of spotting in the days leading up to my period but overall it came today right on time. Not pregnant!!! So don't worry ladies, this pill works and it isn't as bad as it may seem online. Don't worry, you will be fine!

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: More powder on tongue than in my lungs.  Counter broke at some point so was never sure if there was still medicine or not. Definitely not possible to get deep enough inhalation needed to get meds into lungs when having asthma attacks.  (Used advair until I couldn't afford it and it came out of the disk easier.) Only chose this because of coupon offer since atomizer was too costly. Did like that the “freezer burn” feeling from the atomizer didn’t occur since I use the rescue inhaler at least 6x daily. I

name: Take Action
comments: I had unprotected sex, so i went and bought the Take Action Pill, I took it about 12-13 hours later. I was worried because I was a little over the weight limit, I was freaking out because some people were saying bad things about it.  Now we had sex Sep. 2nd, didn’t get my period until Oct. 12 , other reviews I read got there period way sooner then I did and that’s what made me scared.  I started to overthink that I may be pregnant, the fatigue/symptoms of this pill are very gnarly so please take that into consideration. I think my experience was wacky because I am a lot younger .  Just remember “ the pill does mess with your cycle quite a bit so don’t stress too much, it will only drive you insane, this pill does do the job its supposed to.  Don’t make the same mistake I have, USE PROTECTION!!"  I hope this helped a lot of the younger women ease their minds a bit.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I took Aftera about 12 hours after unprotected sex on the day I was ovulating. I opted for Aftera because Plan B wasn't available where I was.  I have taken Plans B, ella and other emergency contraceptives before. All very effective with little to no noticeable side effects. Other then throwing off your periods schedule. With Aftera I didn't have any side affection until about 7 days after I took the pill.  An extreme  amount of bloating, cramps  extremely sore breasts and a tightening feeling in the stomach . Which for me made me feel as if I were pregnant. Being that with both of my pregnancy's the tightening of the stomach was my most noticeable change in my body. I wasn't due for my period until 13 days after I had sex, and wasn't initially worried but with all of the side affects and having unprotected sex when ovulating it had me feeling as if I was pregnant. Day 11 arrived and the side effects were soo  strong, but period started. NOT pregnant!

name: Adipex-P
comments:
I started taking Adipex
On a Saturday which was September 1, 2018. I went to the doctor and weighed in on September 26, 2018. I have lost 15 pounds.  I weighed in at 335lbs and now 320lbs. I go back on October 26, 2018 and I will definitely let you know. I haven’t had any side effects at all! I mean none!! I do walk 5 days a week for 30 minutes, nothing else. I am very happy and I am starting to feel better about myself.

name: Gianvi
comments: I’ve just started to take this pill I believe 5 days ago and I would say it’s working great. I haven’t had any problems other than fatigue and moodiness. I was skeptical about taking this pill since there was mixed reviews but one of my good friends said that birth control pills work differently for everyone, so don’t be afraid to try it. My doctor prescribed me this one. This is the first birth control I took and I don’t have anything bad to say about it. Don’t rely on reviews because it may work for you unlike others!!

name: Ocella
comments: Just finished my first pack of Ocella. I am pleased so far! This is the 3rd birth control pill I have tried, first two were nightmares. I quit the pill all-together for 2 yrs but decided to start up again w/ Ocella. I was on Kariva then switched to Minastrin. I had AWFUL weight gain with both. I didn't change my diet, it was all water weight that was lost w/in a week of stopping the pills. So far on Ocella I have not gained any weight and do not feel bloated/ puffy. I am assuming that has to do with the  diuretic  effect of the progestin?  which I am all for if it keeps bloating at bay! The first few days of taking this pill I had extreme nausea but that went away. I also had a few headaches but I got that before taking Ocella. Given my past experience I was terrified of taking this pill. So far, it has been a breeze. I am hoping that it continues to be like this! Give it a shot and see how it works for you. If you have struggled with other pills in the past this may be the one for you

name: levonorgestrel
comments: So I took aftera because I had unprotected sex on the last day of my period. He didn’t finish inside of me , but I was worried about precum. After taking the pill, I started feeling tightness in my stomach and cramps. About a couple of days later. I also had some spotting a few days later from taking the pill. About three weeks later, I had tiredness, mood swings, headaches, more urinations, fatigue, increased hunger... just about the symptoms for pregnancy. Now my period was 9 DAYS LATE! But.... I got pink discharge, then I started officially bleeding about three days after the discharge. But I got my period, right now I don’t know about it’s heaviness or anything but it feels like it’s going to be a little bit more harsh than normal but pretty normal. It Works!   I'm not sure if it will work if you had unprotected sex while ovulating. I was very stressed and anxious so I made sure to leave a review for other women experiencing similar situations! Hope this helps! Good luck!!!

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: After reading all the reviews I'm very unsure what to do. I was prescribed treclin from my doctors. I've been using the gel for 6 days now and my face has broken out so badly. Did it sting anyone else when putting the gel on? I feel as though my face is getting worst and not better. I don't know whether to go to my doctors or to stick it out and hope for the best....

name: Aviane
comments: I’m still on this pill, but every website said that after 2-3 months that the breakthrough bleeding would end, but I’m almost on month 6 and my bleeding just won’t stop! I go at least 2 weeks on my period now and I get so frustrated!!! I ran out of period panties!!!!!!! I’m getting super moody too because of the long periods. I’m on the pill to reduce my previously long periods, but now they’re even worse!!!

name: Antabuse
comments: I am so frustrated. I have been on antabuse now for three months - my wife gives it to me and I really resent her. I am 50 years old, I am happy to control my drinking, but sometimes after a long day or when I am away on business, I really just want to chill with a nice cold beer. I started antabuse because once every 10 days I would get drunk, and knowing that my wife would be pissed off, I would get nasty and defensive about it. I wouldn't drive or cause any other trouble. I would drink 10 beers during the course of an afternoon, Uber home and go to sleep. I've tried AA for years now, and was on Antabuse before - never managed to abstain for more than 2 months. My view is this - I am going to drink alcohol again. The more I am forced not to, the more dangerous it becomes for me because at some stage I am going to rebel and over do it and probably kill myself. I am a successful professional, father of 3,

name: Take Action
comments: Going to start this off with Take Action WORKED for me but I had a whole month of freaking out about possibly being pregnant. I took Take Action 20 hours after unprotected sex. On the ninth day after I took the pill I started bleeding and  wasn't sure if it was my period or what.  It more then spotting but not as heavy as my normal period no cramping, lots of clots. Lasted for 5 days like my period. Than a week later is when I started noticing all the pregnancy symptoms! Like sore breast ,feeling sick ,discharge that’s when I really started freaking out. I’m not sure if this was the pill side effects or nerves but it was horrible took 9 negative pregnancy test 3-4 weeks later that didn’t calm my nerves I finally broke down and went to the doctor both urine and blood test was NEGATIVE a month later. I just wanted to maybe let people read my story and relate - the pill did work in my case. Everyone’s body is different and non of theses stories are alike so keep that in mind.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments:
I had hormonal acne for the past 15 years that no expensive skin product or ridiculous 10-step-cleansing routine would even touch. I finally decided enough was enough and was prepared to go onto oral antibiotics when I was prescribed this product instead.
I was absolutely terrified of the skin "purging" stories I had heard but have now been using this daily for the last 3 months, and have not had one breakout on the area (seriously- not one). Some dryness but I can deal with a little flakiness instead of breakouts!!! (this has gotten better over time just invest in a heavy duty moisturizer) - please do not be discouraged by "purging" stories as I almost was, it will work differently for everyone!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I started taking Junel in April of 2017, so it's been a little over a year. I'm 26 / 5'5 / 135 lbs. Not gonna lie, for the first 5 months I was totally fine and happy with the pill.   I didn't see acne, didn't gain too much weight (2lbs at most). Then... I gain 25+ POUNDS IN THE LAST YEAR. & 2-3 days before my period I become this complete witch and I'm so emotional and cry over everything and anything. I have never in my life had these types of symptoms before my period. I'm going to my gyno today to change my pill to something low(er). I didn't realize that the weight gain and episodes were from my birth control until it just hit me a month ago and I started to research it. Now I guess I gotta do some trial and error with new pills but what sucks is my side effects didn't kick in until months later. Now that I read reviews with other women having the same emotions and weight gain... It all makes sense. Makes me feel a little better that I'm not ACTUALLY crazy lol.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: This pill is a NIGHTMARE! this is my first time taking the pill, I only started taking it in the hopes of improving my very painful periods and I regret even trying it. I’ve been on it for 3 weeks now and my life has been totally ruined. I have crazy mood swings, major depression and mad rage! My face started breaking out even tho I’ve never even had issues with acne before. I have gained weight even though I’ve been working out and resisted most of the insanely strong cravings I’ve been getting. My life has gone downhill so I’m gonna stop taking this pill immediately. The sad thing is I have now lost faith in the pill and will just deal with my horrible periods.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: Both my husband and son use the redihaler and both have stopped working prior to the count being out. My husbands stopped with 60 puffs left, my son's stopped at 45. Complete garbage to not be able to get all 120 doses out for what they charge. Bring back the old style inhaler where they could actually get the medication out!

name: levonorgestrel
comments: So we had a little incident and we had actually have used plan b before but I went to pharmacy and they were completely out, I saw aftera and looked it up on google says it’s 75-89 percent affective. I’m not sure if it is or not yet but I even spoke to the pharmacist she said it’s the same effectiveness as plan b. I got it plus it’s cheaper and the other pharmacy was also out of plan b so it was my last resort. I took it within the same day of him finishing inside me not even in an hour or two span. I took it on the 30th which was two days before I was supposed to get my period and it’s now a week late and I do know that sometimes the morning after pills throw your period off. But I haven’t had any side affects or anything weird happen to me just haven’t gotten my period yet. And honestly looking at all these comments I’m kinda scared that it didn’t work since so many women have gotten pregnant after taking it.

name: Apri
comments: Going into my inactive pills of my first pack. Although this is only my first pack, it has been the pits. Very nauseous, but no vomiting. Bloated, more depressed, very irritable, overthink everything more than usual, almost no sex drive, horrible cramps, almost no appetite, lost all motivation for things, got bad chest pains, indigestion, heartburn.. you literally name it. I’m trying to give this pill a chance, but so far, it doesn’t seem worth it.

name: Gianvi
comments: I hate writing bad reviews, but PLEASE DO NOT use this birth control! I have been on it over a month and bleeding non stop, having anxiety attacks all day long while at work, intrusive awful thoughts, vision feels different and blurry, feeling depressed and moody one minute the next I’m fine. will not be taking anymore pills on this brand. I was on Loryna (which they say is comparable) and it is not. I felt perfectly fine on Loryna, and figured it would be the same on Gianvi. It’s not, I don’t want this to happen to anyone else, so please girls watch out.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I recently switched from taytulla to this horrible pill. Although it is cheaper. I have noticed extreme weight gain and acne, but worst of all extreme anxiety and depression! Which I have never experienced before. Horrible symptoms in just one cycle of this pill. I wish there was something else to take for the light periods that doesn’t cost $175 per month with insurance. I feel like women are discriminated against with all of this hoopla. Unfair

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I’m so afraid of having an asthma attack with this inhaler because I don’t feel any benefit and that’s probably because nothing is coming out. This is crazy!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I had a bad experience with Balziva. One week after starting new pack I would start spotting which will not stop until the end of the pack. I would not recommend.

name: Lessina
comments: Initially wanted to go back on the pill because I experience pretty severe PMS symptoms within the 10 days or so leading up to my period that really prevent me from my normal, everyday functions, due to a hormonal imbalance. Tried to stick it out for a little over 2 weeks but then couldn’t take it anymore. Was constantly tired, depressed and anxious within the first few days. Experienced severe mood swings at the start of week 2, crying for no reason and then suddenly would get angry and snap. Had insane acne and cravings from the start that I couldn’t resist, leading to a solid 10lb weight gain and painful blemishes, which only made the depression worse. Felt so self conscious and didn’t have the motivation to work out, which is something I love to do daily, during the entirety of my experience. Needless to say, probably some of the worst weeks I’ve experienced in a while. Started to return back to normal within a few days of stopping.

name: Seasonique
comments: I've actually been on seasonique for 10 years. I got on seasonique when I was 10 (because of bad cramps and ovarian cysts). Now I am 20 and I am still on this birth control! I choose to skip over the sugar pills to not have a period, and not once ever have I had random bleeding. I haven't had any acne in 10 years and have not experienced any hormonal issues. Also it has kept me from getting knocked up which is the best part.

name: Lessina
comments: My 14  year old daughter was taking this pill for almost a month and it sent her to the hospital since her doctor wouldn't see her. She had severe head aches, feeling nauseous, and feeling tired all the time. It wasn't until her dad read the reviews and figured out that her symptoms we're for the birth control pills.

name: Nora-Be
comments: First of all, everyone will have their own unique experience with birth control. My experience with this BC was pretty good. When I first started taking it, I felt a little dizzy and nauseous for about a week. I began taking this BC to treat for heavy periods. It definitely reduced my bleeding, as needed.  It also cleared up my acne and levelled my mood. What I didn’t like was the unpredictability of my cycle. Sometimes I would go 3 months with no period...sometimes I would have 26 day cycles. Sometimes I would go a month or two feeling great. Sometimes I would have PMS symptoms (mostly bloating, tender breasts, and some cramping) for months.  Knowing this BC is not as effective for preventing pregnancy, several times I felt like I might be pregnant and I stressed about it a lot. After 2.5 years of taking this BC, I decided I wanted something that makes my cycle more predictable and more effective. I’m now taking a low dose conventional BC and I feel so much better.

name: Cryselle
comments: I just finished the first month of this birth control. After taking tri sprintec  for years I started developing ovarian cysts that would make having sex painful. My doctor suggested switching my birth control to help with the cysts. Well, after 3 weeks of taking cryselle my ultrasound showed no cysts which was great but my side effects have been rough. I immediately became moody and  even paranoid. I felt like everyone was out to get me. I have been very bloated and very gassy. The worst has been the headaches. Especially on the last week of pills which I just completed it was daily severe headaches. My Dr. Switched me to Mircette and I took first pill last night. Hopefully this will be a better experience.

name: Kariva
comments: I’m 23 years old. I’ve switched from Viorele to Kariva because my pharmacy decided to switch it and I just ended up taking it. I definitely do feel a bit more emotional than usual, but I don’t know if it’s casually linked to the Kariva. I realized a small rash of white pimples next to my mouth - which I’m hoping  is not a side effect and is nothing serious. I’ve only been on this new pack for a week now, but I don’t really have any complaints. I liked my previous bc Viorele, and they have the same exact active ingredients... so far I’m ok with the switch.

name: Adipex-P
comments: I have taken this medication for one month, I lost 13lbs with exercise and eating extremely healthy. I would not believe any of these reviews saying they lost 30lbs in a month, it’s not true. I had a talk with 3 different doctors because I had seen these reviews before I took it. You’re not going to lose 10lbs a week, it will help, but it’s not a magic pill, you have to put in the work to lose it, more of an aid than anything else.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: The Qvar RediHaler is the worst design I’ve dealt with in an inhaler. As another reviewer said, when the inhaler gets to the (approximately) 60 doses remaining mark, the mechanism stops working and the medicine slowly sprays out after I’ve finished inhaling.  I used it today and when I was done I looked into the inhaler to see if it was visibly plugged and it let loose into my eyes. Very disappointed in the redesign. This has happened to both of the RediHaler inhalers I’ve had so far.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I used Aftera 36 hours after having sex and not using a condom. The pill took effect and gave me symptoms five days later. I had horrible breast tenderness, cramping, and fatigue. My period did come on its expected date. My period was a bit heavier and a bit longer by two days, but at least I'm not pregnant!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Before Junel, I (5', 90 lbs) was put on Vienva for severe cramps as well as a birth control method, and soon after experienced severe (worsened) depression; though it did help with my cramps and decreased my flow. The depression got so bad that I asked my doctor to switch to a lower dose, and Junel's been working just fine. I think I have been on it for 5-6 months now, and I do still have depressive episodes but I also had them before getting on any hormonal medication, so it's hard to say whether or not Junel causes/worsens it. My cramps still show up here and there for a few hours when my period starts, but they're MUCH better than before. I'm lucky to be able to say that my weight and acne levels have been about the same since starting.

name: Sprintec
comments: I have been taking sprintec for 1.5 years. This is the first birth control that I have not had any side effects. I have tried the shot and other pills before. I will stay on this for another 3 years. Cleared up my acne. Went from a full face of acne to nothing. My periods are only 3 days with no pain. I would recommend this pill to anyone.

name: Gianvi
comments: I have only been on Gianvi for a month and a half and absolutely do not like it. Started spotting while on active pills, then started bleeding heavily for over a week and still am. It’s a never ending period!

name: Jolivette
comments: My doctor switched me to this from NoraBe. I'm so glad she did! I often forget to take my pill. When I would forget with NoraBe, I'd feel meh all day. I have an active 3 year old who I stay at home with. If I'd miss a pill, every little thing she did would stress me out. With Jolivette, if I miss a day or don't take it on time, my family doesn't notice as much. My old non-existent sex drive is gone! I had absolutely no desire do anything. Now, my hormones are all levelled out and I actually find myself initiating which is something I haven't done since before my pregnancy. I don't notice any other side effects besides breakthrough bleeding. I've been taking this for two months and my cycle still isn't on a regular schedule. NoraBe had me menstruating every two weeks. Now Jolivette is causing breakthrough bleeding so I'm never sure if I'm actually starting my period naturally or the breakthrough bleeding is happening when my period should be starting.

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: After trying several different combined pills, this one is by far the best. I suffer from moderate acne that would flare up every month to the point I felt so self-conscious I wouldn't want to leave the house. 3 months later and my skin is completely clear, not even so much as a tiny pimple. Along with the acne I had before, I also had very heavy and painful periods-also gone. I now have 3 days of light, pain- free bleeding every month and my mood is better than ever. I would definitely recommend this pill!

name: Junel 1.5/30
comments: Junel 1.5/30 has been working really well for me for over 3 years. I hardly ever get a period (1-2 times a year max) and I never experience cramping anymore. Also I haven't gotten pregnant so I know it's working! I know everyone is different but this pill has been perfect for me!

name: Adderall
comments:
Been on Adderall for 5 years now, 15mg twice daily. Started on 10mg 2x daily but the lower doses are associated with aggressive behaviors. Is it a flawless savior? Do I still struggle at times with ADHD?
Absolutely! Medications, i.e. insulin, all have side effects. As a patient, you must ask yourself if the side effects outweigh the benefits. 
I refused treatment until age 32 which has been beneficial to my physical health.

If you are at the mercy of ADHD, I strongly advise you to use some of the new apps with or without meds. Daily for the 1st 3 weeks is simply miraculous. 
Lastly, the world or your coworkers don't need to know about your diagnosis. ADHD is still stigmatized as a disorder that only stupid people have. My 1st RN job I was viciously bullied once word got out about my ADHD!!
By my fellow RNs!!
Now I make more than a Nurse Practitioner!!
#Strength

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: My pharmacy randomly switched me from Microgestin to Junel after a year and since switching 4 weeks ago I've had terrible night sweats causing me to have to change clothes and sheets because I'm soaked, extreme bloating and weight gain of about 5 pounds, acne and greasy skin (I've never had acne in my life except an occasional pimple), terrible cramps (never been much of a cramper), and also mood swings.
