I had zero of these side effects on Microgestin and will be talking to my doctor about prescribing me ONLY Microgestin and not giving the pharmacy the freedom to randomly switch me even though it has "the same active ingredients."

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I switch from Levora to Portia about two months ago because Levora was discontinued. It is by far the worst two months. I have had a dramatic increase in acne. Levora really helped my acne but with Portia I am having constant breakouts everywhere. I have chronic headaches and feel very nauseous in the mornings. I feel an increase in my appetite. I tend to feel very down most of the times-sad for no reason. I am very unhappy being on this birth control

name: Junel 1/20
comments: First time ever taking BC and I was on this pill for 5 months. The only symptom I had for a while was being very emotional. I completely stopped having a period in the 3rd month which I enjoyed. In the 4th month, I got really hot tempered for about 2 weeks then I mellowed out for a while. In the 5th month I started having symptoms of depression... always crying for no reason, sleeping and not eating. I stopped taking them because it was a struggle to be that depressed. I did NOT have any weight gain, acne problems, or libido decrease.

name: Take Action
comments: GUYS!! do not worry! The guy I had sex with finished inside of me (I was so mad I made him buy me plan b, but he bought me take action instead, I thought it wasn’t going to be as effective I was sick to my stomach because I usually get my period around this time of month. I was breaking out like crazy. I was in class and I got my period! It went through my pants I was happy and mad at the same time. My period is really heavy and the cramps are horrible. Just pray and don’t stress I promise it will work!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve taken this pill about 5 years and I love it. My weight is maintained, my skin is clear and less oily, I have a perfectly scheduled period. I started taking it at 16 as contraceptive and super bad periods. Before taking it I had a 10 day, heavy flow, bad cramps that I was prescribed to Vicodin for. Junel saves lives, I never want to stop taking it. I can say I’ve had a very low sex drive, but I’m okay with that.

name: Amethyst
comments: You do have to give your body a lot of time to get used to this one. I bled for a few months straight, as it worked in my body, now I don’t have a period at all, and no spotting! Any birth control is going to mess with your hormones and cause bleeding the first few months. They warn you before taking it!!! They tell you to expect bleeding for the first SIX months. You can also read it on the paper they give you with the pill pack. I know everybody’s body will not react the same, but it takes almost a year for your body to be regulated  with a new birth control.

name: Lessina
comments:
pros: short periods, no mood swings, no acne, increase sex drive 
Cons: ~10 lbs of weight gained over a couple of months

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been on this pill for a good year  and a 1/2 or so.  I started because after having my 2nd daughter, I hadn’t gotten my period for a year. She was exclusively breast feed  as was her older sister (got my period back with her at 10 months old). So it’s been very effective in preventing pregnancy and I have had no bad side effects until recently.  Within the past 3-4 months, I’ve noticed I’ve been having mood swings, emotional outbursts and horrible migraines (which historically I’ve never had), decreased libido (hubs works a lot now so no big deal),  dizziness and fogginess. Throughout the course of using, I did notice depressive emotions.  I’ve now been off for about 1.5 weeks and my headaches are lessened and I’m noticing positive mood changes however, my uterus and lower back are in mild discomfort and pain. My appetite has also gone back to normal so no overeating lol. I want my girls to have a happy mama.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I love my proair, but I do have many issues with faulty inhalers. I am constantly having to clean mine out because it will just not press down anymore and get clogged up quite easily. Does anyone else have this problem?

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: 33yo. I just threw this out. Tried it for a week and I have 3 huge volcanoes on my face only where I applied it. I don’t have time to try acne gels that promise to clear up skin after it’s been purged. No thank you.

name: Junel 1/20
comments:
Second month on Junel fe. I'm 35yrs old never on birthcontrol before, this is my first time ever. 
Cons: horrible acne (never had acne before),  cramps, painful intercourse (never had before this) 
First month on it I had nausea, as I'm finishing the second month it has subsided. First period started really light and got heavier which was a bit disappointing, was under the impression that this would help lessen the heaviness. 

Pros: Prevents pregnancy. Loss of appetite. 

I will give this a total of 3 months but will probably switch if the acne persists and periods don't get lighter.

name: Camrese
comments: I was on Camrese for a few years. I absolutely loved it since I only got my period every 3 months and I wouldn't have to worry about it besides then. The only reason I got off of this pill is because I had a blood clot scare so I decided to stop taking birth control with estrogen. If this wasn't a risk, I would be more than happy with taking Camrese for longer since I had such good results with it. Upon ending this BCP, I have noticed breast tenderness, more happiness, and more PMS effects. My period started a few days right after taking my last pill too. If you can look past the blood clot, stroke, and heart attack risk with the combined pill, I would definitely recommend Camrese!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started this pill about 2 & 1/2 years ago, I am realizing now that I gained 25 pounds in that time. My mood swings are awful... really good highs and really bad lows. I never had a big appetite but now eat everything even when I am not hungry. Junel fe was prescribed to me for my really awful cramps, my slight acne, and my heavy flow. It made my acne a lot worse but helped with the cramps and heavy flow for a while. I am also anemic so the iron was supposed to help me feel less faint and weak but did not really work. It was a lot more effective in the first year, but once being on it for too long I think my body just got used to it and I began to see all the problems I had in the beginning.

name: Sprintec
comments:
I don’t really do this (write comments) but since I went through hell...I thought I’d share my experience. 
On my 3rd week of the pill, I started heavy bleeding and thought...OK this could be breakthrough bleeding. But I began bleeding heavy - clots big as my palm. I became short of breath & felt a shock through my body & felt dizzy. I was going in circles. I got an appointment with OB/GYN right away. DR did an exam, everything was ok but my pulse was 180!! He sent me to the ER. They put me on IV fluids, exams, tons of blood work, & at the end I received 2 bags of blood. 
They ruled it was the BC that got everything so wacky D/T all my labs & exams were ok. They advise NOT to take again. I'm on meds now to help stop the bleeding & will have a follow up with OB/GYN. I understand that the outcome of the med is different for everyone. Reason I took this BC was to regulate my periods. I would have heavy periods but never this heavy. I hope this helps anyone looking into taking a BC.

name: Nora-Be
comments:
I have been on this pill for 1.5 years now after being on the combination pill for almost 10 years.  It does its job by preventing pregnancy and I no longer get the intense, debilitating migraines that I had while on the combo pill but I will say that my acne and oily skin has increased.  It's not all over but it seems like I always have one that will randomly pop up on my face and back every other week (WHYY??) and I also need an oil blotting sheet every other hour or so.  I have never had a period or spotting while on this, nor have I had any PMS signs. Which is kind of nice but it can also make me second guess whether I am pregnant.. 
When I first started it, I was scary exhausted for the first 3-4 weeks. It was as if I could fall asleep at any given minute during the day.  But after that I adjusted to it.  It's kind of a meh pill but does what it's suppose to!

name: Adipex-P
comments: So today...9/21/18...I am starting adipex. At the doctor yesterday I weighed in at 213lb and I am 5'4" . My doctor made sure my heart and blood work was good before starting. He recommend that I take half a pill in  the morning and the other half around 1:00pm. My goal weight right now is just to get out of the 200 club. I weigh in at the doctor in one month and am determined not to get on the scale before that. My husband and I have joined Planet fitness to help in this journey and we have 6 boys to raise so we want to be healthy for them. God bless everyone that is on the same journey to be healthy. Will keep everyone updated. Thanks for reading

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I had bleeding 5 days after taking this pill. This may not be  your period! These are the side effects of the pill. But I finally got my period with 2 weeks late. Aftera has worked for me but gave me nausea and abdominal cramps, but at least it worked.

name: Aviane
comments:
I was on this birth control for a few years. I had absolutely zero problems. No weight gain , no terrible cramps although I did have normal cramping.
I did feel emotional at times but not anything that was affecting me majorly. 
I was switched to a different birth control and I’m not happy.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I’ve only been taking this pill for about a month but so far I am very happy with the results. I was very nervous to start Junel based off the other reviews but I’ve have a fairly positive experience. Before taking Junel I would get terrible cramps (that would cause me to cancel plans/ responsibilities) and extremely heavy periods. I now only have very minor if any cramping at all during my period and a significantly lighter flow. The only semi problem I’ve experienced is a little acne but I’m sure this is just because my body is normalizing to the hormones and hope this begins to go away. I hope this helps and reduces some of your nerves about this pill :)

name: Nora-Be
comments:
I’ve been on Nora -be now for 2 years and it’s work good but it gave me Most has of the side effects: 
blurred vision
breast pain
changes in menstrual period
chills
dark urine
decreased vision
diarrhea
difficulty with swallowing
discouragement
dizziness
double vision
feeling sad or empty
general tiredness and weakness
headache
heavy non-menstrual vaginal bleeding
hives
light vaginal bleeding between regular menstrual periods
loss of interest or pleasure
migraine headache
nausea and vomiting
It’s reall makes me feel sad all the time even in the happiest times I can’t feel happy any more .

name: Adderall
comments: I've read some of the comments comparing this medication to 'street meth.' That is simply not true and further stigmatizes Adult ADHD, since many still inaccurately claim it's something you grow out of. Well, it isn't and my childhood ADHD went untreated and I could barely function at school. Since taking a combo of Adderall and Wellbutrin, my brain and my life is no longer a disorganized mess. As a kid, I was an untreated C+ student and as an adult I have a PhD. I regret the years I wasn't helped. Medication plus cognitive behavior therapy plus Adult ADD support groups = a better me. If the medicine doesn't work for you, that is your individual response but it doesn't represent all of us.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I have to say that this inhaler is nothing but a joke, perpetrated by the manufacturer. First, the medicine is never effective! Second, the delivery system constantly clogs and you have to soak it and wait for it too dry. Last, the counter does not work right. More than half the time it just does not work because something is wrong with the delivery system and will not be replaced by the manufacturer! That they make you go without is a crime against every user! This product should be outlawed! This is a very poor inhaler! I do not recommend anyone to use this product. If your Doctor prescribes it ask for a different one! If I could have given a rating of minus 10 I would have!

name: Nora-Be
comments: I’ve been taking this for 4 years. I like it well enough. I do have abnormal periods though and it didn’t help my existing acne problem but I have never gotten any crazy side effects from it! And it has prevented pregnancy thus far. The regular pill was causing migraine so this was a great alternative for me.

name: Apri
comments: I have to say the best birth control I've ever been on I have high free testosterone and diagnosed with PCOs. Still have sex drive an think Apri even increased it more.  I haven't got any acne on it so far either. I'm not moody or anything that I noticed yet I've been on it 5 days so far. If I notice anything different I will repost.

name: Lessina
comments: I was only on this pill for two weeks and immediately discontinued use due to massive weight gain (10lbs to be exact), mild nausea daily that was similar to morning sickness that lasted all day, headaches all day everyday, and the kicker, IMMENSE chest pain.  My friend passed away from a PE directly related to this pill last month (per the coroner). She was 32. DO NOT TAKE THIS.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: It worked.  My girlfriend took the pill on July 9th within 18 hrs of unprotected sex after the condom broke.  8 days later she had a light period for 4 days.  A month later around the first week of August she had extremely sore boobs.  On August 20, she had another period that was extremely heavy.  I sweated about this the whole time and read every review on this site and others.  Just wanted give some hope to the next person whom reads this!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
Doctor switched me to Junel Fe after being on Taytulla for months. I don’t have many good things to say about Junel Fe. 
My face is worse than it has ever been. It made my hair dry and it has started to fall out. And I have had terrible cramping from the beginning.

name: Gianvi
comments: I was so nervous to try this after reading the reviews but I'm so glad I made the leap.  I'm 35 and have been struggling for a decade with next-level awful cramps (vomiting/unhealthy amount of Advil), moderate cystic acne and PMS that made me psycho. I stuck it out since I had bad birth control experiences before but no natural remedy worked for me and it wore me down to the point where I couldn't stand it anymore. My doctor recommended Gianvi and I've been on it 6 months now. My face is virtually clear, the cramps are so mild (more like bloating), the emotional stuff is manageable and my weight has stayed the same. The first month was great. Month two and three were rough emotionally as my body adjusted (really dark thoughts) but I stuck it out on my doctor's recommendation since my cramps and acne were better.  I don't know if my 25-year old self could have made it through those two months but I'm kicking myself for not having taken this years ago.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I had significant weight gain, constant bloating, fatigue, and nausea. This was by far the worst birth control I’ve ever been on. It was used to treat endometriosis, but I would rather have the symptoms of it than I would the birth control.

name: Camrese
comments: I have had really bad pain with my periods for 30 years. I have tried other birth-control and this, by far, has been the best. I have no pain  I have had really bad pain with my periods for 30 years. I have tried other birth-control and this, by far, has been the best. I have no pain plus I don’t have a period at all. Would definitely recommend it.

name: Lessina
comments: Got my period weeks early, I feel tired all the time. I’m currently experiencing the worst headache, I've ever had in my life! I highly advise AGAINST taking this birth control!!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This is the best BC for me. I have zero side effects I love it ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Nora-Be
comments: So I was on Nora-Be for 2 years I gained like 40 lbs no change I eating habits.  It was supposed to replace my previous birth control pill Yaz which I think worked way better.  After starting pill my periods became longer 7 days or more it was 3-5 days I also had almost constant spotting have to wear pad all the time.  I recently stopped due to all these reasons my biggest reason I had crippling depression, anxiety, extreme fatigue, abdominal pain. Almost immediately after stopping the pill my depression and stomach pain went away.  I now have the energy to work on loosing the weight. Do no recommend this Pill and has to be taken at the exact same time very inconvenient.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I have been on this birth control for about a year. It does a good job at avoiding pregnancy and preventing acne. However, about 6 months in I started to notice that I became severely depressed. I’ve been thinking really bad thoughts (self hate/self harm etc.) And lately I have been having extreme anxiety to the point where I can’t even function properly. I feel like I am going crazy because I can just be sitting down or doing anything and suddenly I start crying for no apparent reason. I’m constantly sad all the time and it’s extremely exhausting. I think I need to speak with my doctor to discuss getting off this birth control. I personally don’t believe the pros out weigh the cons.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I’ve been on this pill for about maybe 5 months. I used to take microgestin which made me extremely tired all the time. When I started Junel I noticed immediate appetite increase, and I’ve gained a lot of weight. Also, I almost never get acne and this makes me break out constantly. I don’t feel depressed or tired like I used to but I want to switch due to weight gain and acne, this pill does nothing for my cramps either, still the same pain as before. I don’t recommend this pill.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I couldn't help but write a review on this medication. STAY CLEAR OF IT if you are struggling with acne. I used birth control for pregnancy prevention and control of acne. I started this medication and my skin was the worst it has ever been in my life. I gave it 5 months and I have cystic acne on my chin that is still clearing up. Will never use this pill again and would not recommend it.

name: Reclipsen
comments: I would definitely NOT recommend reclipsen. Just two weeks into taking it my chest broke out, and my chin. Also now I’m EXTREMELY greasy for no reason!!!! If you’re looking for a solution for acne this is not it. Also now I have a pimple on my cheek!!!!

name: Take Action
comments: We had a condom break so I took this within 12 hours. I wasn’t sure if I was near ovulation because my cycles are between 32-40 days. I had no immediate symptoms but I started a “period” 1.5 weeks later (1.5 weeks earlier than my “expected” period) which started off as brown discharge and turned into heavy bleeding with clots and mild cramps. I was bleeding through a pad an hour and it really scared me. Then it subsided into what seemed like a normal period and ended after 5-6 days, so I assumed it just made my period come early. I began to notice symptoms, continuing on for 1 month including bloating, headaches and extreme fatigue. I took 4 negative home pregnancy tests and both urine/blood tests came back negative at the doctor 4 weeks after we had sex so I am NOT Pregnant! I still don’t get why this medication has given me symptoms for such a long time after - the fatigue has to be the worst. I’ll take it over a baby though and hope it goes away by my next period!

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments:
My insurance switched me from Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo to Tri-Lo-Sprintec. I wasn't a happy camper that they did this, I was told its basically the same thing. Little did I know those additives were not the same thing.
I took Tri-lo-sprintec for 2 years, I developed anxiety and was depressed pretty much the entire time I was on this pill.  I was having really depressed  thoughts and felt like I was going crazy. I've never had a panic/anxiety attack until I started taking Tri-Lo-Sprintec. 
I've been off it since Jan 2018 and I don't have those depressed thoughts, my anxiety has immensely decreased and I haven't had a panic attack since.

Do NOT let your doctor give you this stuff. I told my Gyno I ONLY want Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo and no substitutes . Usually insurance companies will cover this product if your Doctor asked for strictly that item. Don't let your mental health decrease so insurance companies can save money. You're more important than that.

name: Gianvi
comments:
I wish I could rate this with 0 stars. 
I took ONE pill and it was the worst thing that ever happened to me. I took the first pill at 10pm and by 1am, I couldn't breathe. The worst anxiety I've ever experienced in my life hit me and it hit me hard. And coming from someone who has suffered from anxiety and depression and takes Prozac, this wasn't anything close to what I've experienced in the past. I've dealt with death, loss, body dysmorphia, etc. This was the worst pain I've ever felt. I said rash things to my boyfriend and almost lost my relationship. I stopped taking it but the hormones are still in my body after 2 days. I haven't eaten for 48 hours and I'm still extremely anxious and my had has been flooded with intrusive thoughts. Please, do not take this pill.

name: Jolivette
comments: I got pregnant on this BC

name: Take Action
comments:
I had a crazy night and had unprotected sex ! I freaked out and decided to take this pill (first time I tried it ) I took it maybe 12 hours after.  I didn't have any of the side effects until maybe 1 week later and had some spotting and that is pretty much it. I've taken  3 pregnancy test all of them were Negative! 
This thing was a life savor because I wasn’t ready to have another child ! 
TAKE IT !!!! IT REALLY DOES WORK !!!!!

name: LoSeasonique
comments:
Started the generic almost 3 months ago. 
Pros: No spotting
Cons: my breasts are larger and ALWAYS super sore. It's made it painful to run like I usually do.  Altered fat distribution and noticeable loss of muscle mass. 
Neutral: I've noticed I still have my normal PMS symptoms when I would have started my periods including a feeling of fullness in my pelvis, increased breast tenderness, and irritability with random crying.

name: Aviane
comments: I was so afraid of taking birth control again after having so many bad experiences with other ones but I am so happy I gave this one a chance. Previous pills I was on Kariva, Sprintec, Orthotricyclen- ALL made me gain weight; super moody, and always depressed. This pill works for me, honestly. I have zero side effects, no weight gain, my skin is so clear it freaks me out. The only side effect is my breasts grew from an A to a full B.. they're still growing I'm a little concerned but hey free boob job essentially! So girls if you had a bad reaction to the pills I mentioned above maybe give this one a try!

name: Nuvigil
comments: This medication takes time to get into and out of my system. The transitions are terrible for me. Lots of anxiety and scatterbrains. I am very emotional on this medication. When I am tired of the lump in my throat I quit taking it. When I can't stay awake and my job is at risk I try again. The end results are always the same. I don't want to do anything, go anywhere, and can't quit crying. The first time I took it 2 months. The second time I took it 5 months. And now I have been on it 5 days and am calling it quits. It does not keep me awake. I get huge headaches. There is no reason to live for me while using this medication.

name: Lessina
comments: I started this birth control pill after removing the Mirena. I was given this pill as the generic to what my ob/gyn prescribed. I wish I would've left it at the pharmacy! This is the WORST PILL EVER!!!!! Let's start with mood swings, weight gain, tender breast, depression, decreased sex drive and edema. I would NEVER recommend. I discontinued after being on the pill for 1.5 months. I actually stopped taking birth control pills all together to allow my body a chance to get back to normal. This by far was the WORST experience with birth control.

name: Sprintec
comments: So I read all the reviews here for the most part before getting my birth control by mail. I was really nervous and worried but I still ended up taking them. I felt a little nausea in the morning after taking them at night but nothing serious. I have PCOS and I started BC for that reason. I have started losing weight and I think its from the BC balancing my hormones since I have not gone on any diet or changed my routine. I recommend this BC. I am about 300 lbs and dropping and I am also of Latin heritage. I hope this review helps someone.

name: Apri
comments:
I was on this pill for nearly 6 yrs and my life had turned upside down. I had no clue that these pills drove me to depression, anxiety, paranoia! My gyno placed me on this pill due to amenorrhea, I started getting my period and some acne. Then I started developing these negative thoughts and emotions I couldn't control. I thought it was just my job and stress, but these pills started all this negativity swarming throughout my body. 

I feel into such a deep dark hole on these pills. I decided to do some reckless things. I accumulated debt and did what I thought I had to do to overcome this depression. I thought about death daily. I had pressure on my chest, intense anxiety. 

These freaking pills ruined a portion of my youth! They should be banned if possible! I’ve been off them for around 5 months now and truely feel at peace and normal again.  I’m sharing this story in hopes no one has to endure. Avoid at all costs!!

name: Camrese
comments: Camrese was the first multi month dose birth control pill I have ever been on and when I had it I loved it so much!!!  Now my Walgreens doesn't even carry it so they forced me to take Ashlyna which worked for about 1 month then I got horrible weight problems, acne out the wazoo and I have been miserable and my period has been going on since month 2 week 2 I am now on my  third week of my period, am severely anemic, and my blood loss is dramatically changing my blood pressure. I have dropped 20mmHg and am now 105/69. I cannot afford to lose anymore blood but walgreens will not fill my Camrese because they only carry Ashlyna and are withholding everything so I cannot even get any birth control to stop this bloody mess in my pants! NOT ALL PILLS ARE THE SAME! I want my Camrese back so desperately so I can have something that works!

name: CamreseLo
comments: I am rating this birth control (BC) an 8/10 because it truly has helped me control my horrible bleeding and bad cramping with my periods. The reason I took 2 points off is due to the bad headaches I got for 2 weeks and the spotting I had for the first few months. This has seemed to stop now. I have not gained any weight and my skin has cleared up from my former hormonal acne. I am so happy I was prescribed this pill. I am no longer worried about getting pregnant and I finally have a light and manageable menstrual cycle. My period lasted 2 days as compared to off the pill it was 7-8! My sex drive is better due to my ability to not be worried about unwanted pregnancy. Thank you Cam Lo for making me feel normal again! :)

name: Cryselle
comments: I am currently on the hunt for a birth control (BC) that doesn't impact on my libido as much. My OBGYN recommended this one after a year of being off BC. I have been trying other BCs. She gave me three months supply and told me that it takes a month for my body to get use to it. Boy, let me tell you! If you are even remotely depressed or struggle with anxiety, steer clear of this BC. After taking this for a month, I was 10x more depressed, and really dark thoughts were emerging, and my anxiety was high. I can say, I stopped taking it four days ago , and I feel so much better! I already made my appointment for next week.

name: QNASL
comments: Qnasl works great when the pump works. If your pump drops the count more than one at the time stop using and contact the manufacture immediately or they will do NOTHING for you.  This happened to me, the pump dropped count almost 10 at the time and it got to zero was to fast. I contacted the manufacture and they told me that because it was already at zero then there would be no way for them to test it and nothing that they could do for me. Forget about replacing their defective product. Very expensive medicine and poor information available regarding its issues.

name: Take Action
comments: I am EXTREMELY FERTILE. I was without birth control for a couple of months. My boyfriend and I had unprotected sex. At first we weren't freaking out until I looked at the calendar and realised I was near ovulation if I wasn't already. I took this pill about 23 hours after unprotected sex. I was sure I was pregnant because after I took it I had early pregnancy symptoms just like my last pregnancy . VERY MOODY. My breasts got bigger and more firm just like when I was pregnant. I got nauseous and threw up five days after taking the pill. But almost two weeks later I have started my menstrual cycle on time. I was sure I was pregnant and scared. I really got early pregnancy symptoms just like my first and only pregnancy. So please don't freak out if you get pregnancy symptoms until you take a test and know. That was a really stressful and scary two weeks for nothing when this pill really worked for me.

name: Lessina
comments:
First time on BC and got prescribed this, the first couple of weeks were fine. I was advised to skip the white pills since I had planned a vacation. I spotted for a week straight then started bleeding. It's been 2 weeks now 3 weeks total and I am still dealing with it. I have no other issues than longest period I have ever had and on and off cramps. 
Waiting to see if this changes on the third month or if I may need to switch or maybe stay off BC all together.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I've been on this birth control for more than a year and I love it. The first month I had nausea, headaches, and I was very emotional. Now I'm used to it no stomach pain or anything. I take the pill at night before bedtime and wake up good.

name: Seasonique
comments:
Been on seasonique for just over 2 years. While getting periods only four times a year is great, its never been a true reality for me.  Out of the three months that are within a pack, the first two are great, but every time I hit the third month I start spotting.  But not even just a regular little bit of brown discharge.  It starts like that for a few days and about a week or so into that 3rd month I begin getting very large clots.  It resembles a light period almost, as if my entire uterine lining comes out in these clots.  This lasts for a few weeks, all the way up until my last week of pills... which is when I'm supposed to get my period, which I don’t because I lost all the blood in the 2-3 weeks prior to that.  
This medication has also made me gradually gain 20 pounds since I first began it.  I cannot wait until I get off this pill.  2 more weeks and then I will not be getting a refill.  I have had a enough.  Do not recommend this medication.

name: ParaGard
comments: I had this IUD inserted two and a half years ago. At first I had mild cramping, heavy periods but I got used to that. Constant copious discharge was inconvenient but I wore panty shields every day but after a while just found myself constantly ‘coping’ with the symptoms. I started to gain weight no matter what I did still not suspecting the IUD until I started thinking back to when I began to have  unexplained weight gain. I had it removed  5 days ago and I’ve lost 4 lbs no longer feel bloated all over and my blood pressure is now back to normal instead of the unusually high reading on paragard. NEVER  AGAIN!  For those of you who think we are being mean for posting a negative review, it’s not meant to be harmful but helpful to other people suffering the same way. Everyone is different just sharing my experience so other people are aware as I wasn’t for 2 & 1/2 years

name: Gianvi
comments: I am so glad there are other reviews here. I thought I was losing my mental health. This pill has made me an absolute crazy person. I can't tell you the effects this has had on my life and my relationships (friends, work, boyfriend) I've been extremely depressed and have had bursts of rage and or tears, I started to realize (in the midst of an emotional breakdown) the way I was reacting to things was not normal, I finally connected the dots and realized it was because my pill changed to Givani 3 weeks ago. I've  been on BC for 10 years so I don't think it was just an adjustment. Also had really bad acne but that was the least of my worries.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I never in my life had a negative experience from a birth control pill until I switched to Junel Fe. I was extremely irritable to both my husband and my two year old. I lost crazy amounts of hair. My hunger sky rocketed and I would raid the fridge as soon as I got home from work. I was angry all the time on this pill. The only plus to this pill is that I did not have acne break outs, my skin was clear. But the amount of anxiety and irritability that comes with this pill is not worth it. It took me awhile to figure out what was causing all these horrible side effects because I never experienced side effects like this. It was so bad that I fear to try another pill.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I tried Portia for 3 months, switched to Levora I think for 3, then back to Portia. I have absolutely no sex drive. In the past 7 months, I may have been interested in sex twice. Which is severely under what it used to be. I would not recommend Portia, although I do realize everyone responds differently to medications.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: Due to weather and humidity along with smoke in the air ended up with breathing problems. Used a Prepair Inhaler DID NOT WORK.  My wife found a Provental Inhaler in her purse (carries for me in case if Asthma problem) INSTANT RELIEF with the Provental Inhaler.  I think 2nd class item Pro Air needs to be taken off the market!!

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I started this birth control while in high school as a normal contraceptive. After 3 months I began to notice a serious difference in my mood. For the first time in my life, I experienced anxiety so severe that I could not leave my house in fear of everything. I cried day and night over absolutely nothing. I was scared all the time and sad all the time. I immediately stopped the medication after I began to feel this side effect and it still took me 3-4 months for my hormones to balance out again. This experience was years ago, but I have been traumatized from it to say the least. I am writing this review to warn some of those who have anxiety and are worried about enhancing the severity of it. I do not suggest taking this birth control.

name: Lessina
comments: On my third month of lessina. Hasn’t cleared up my acne yet like I hoped but so far this is a good birth control. I had spotting the first month and now my period is super light, almost non existent, which is a plus. Duration went from 5 days when I wasn’t on any birth control to now maybe 3 days. Hoping in the next coming months my acne stars to clear but I definitely recommend this birth control

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I loved this medication for a while before I made the connection that it’s causing me HORRIBLE frequent, 3-day migraines. Aside from the migraines, it did better than my previous meds which caused acne. I was thrilled to get rid of the acne and my periods are spotting at best. Sad to learn this is causing the migraines and I’m switching to new pills today.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: The first day and last day I started. I had multiple crying spells at work (Starbucks) for no reason but this medicine. I would not recommend for individuals suffering with depression. Mood swings like crazy I was super happy at first then crying hysterically the next. I went off of it. I know it takes 3 months for the side effects to settle. However I was terrified to eat at all fearing I would gain 20 pounds or get a full face of cystic acne. Think this sadness happened right away didn't take 3 months to kick in it took a few hours.

name: Jolivette
comments: This medication is not for me. I started it a few months ago after an ectopic pregnancy. My mood has changed so much to a point where my anxiety and depression were so bad I thought I was losing my mind. My headaches have increased and I cry a lot. Not normal for me. I also have Hypothyroidism and it actually changed my levels. After reading what other people have gone through I have decided to stop this medication immediately. I seriously thought I was going to end up in the Psych unit!

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: When I went to my pharmacy, they told me Portia had taken the place of Levora.  Well, I took this for one day and hated the reaction of it immediately.  It gave me jitters and anxiety.  I am going to ask my OBGYN to get me back on Levora immediately.

name: Jolivette
comments: I was prescribed this pill suddenly after my insurance decided not to cover Nora Be anymore. I suffer from anxiety and take Zoloft to control it. After taking just 6 days of this pill, it made me almost loose my mind. I would tremble and shake, heart palpitations and had the worst anxiety attack I had ever experienced. Do not take this if you issue like me!

name: Adderall
comments:
Adderral has given me some of my life back. I can tell you this for certain. Without it I was lost and on the brink of suicide. Now I can be a father, husband and most important a normal human being again!

I take 20 mg, 3xs a day. It is still not enough to keep me from napping twice a day before 5pm, but it helps.  I still feel as if I’m in a fog for most of my morning and afternoon, but at least I'm not worried of crashing my car or falling asleep on the job. 

Personally I have not suffered side effects. My blood pressure is very good, I don’t get jitters, and the medicine actually calms me tremendously. Without it I was simply a mess!

If you even think you may suffer from Narcolepsy, take this medicine. I can’t say that enough. Take it, and find some happiness again!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been on this for about 2 weeks and its the first pill I've taken, but I have had horrible cramps (which never happen to me) and my heaviest period to date. I have pretty clear skin but I've noticed a few spots showing up in my lower cheek area but nothing alarming yet. I have also noticed my appetite is through the roof which is abnormal for me. I will finish out the pack and see how it goes but I'm not sure about continuing after that because of the cramps and hunger.

name: Jolivette
comments: I’ve been taking this pill for about six months because of migraines & combo pills were giving me serious depression. When I started it I bled for three weeks. Not spotting, heavy bleeding. They said I’d adjust and finally I did, but my periods became even more irregular, painful, and heavy. Then I noticed that sex was becoming painful, orgasms were even becoming painful! I was super dry down there and irritated, my breasts were always sore, tons of cystic acne, I was getting hot flashes and sweating tons, basically menopause at 22 but still bleeding! And then the final straw: I started getting yeast infections every two weeks like clockwork. Ridiculous. I’d never had any problem like that until I started this medication. I discontinued it one week ago and immediately felt better. Everything is back to normal everywhere and I’ll never take a mini pill again. The only good thing I can think of is an increase in cup size, and that’s not worth it if everything hurts!

name: Take Action
comments: My husband and I had unprotected sex in the morning by mistake and went to the nearest store as soon as possible to get an emergency contraceptive pill. I've never had one before and that was my first time. I bought a "take action levonorgestrel 1.5 mg" pill based on a suggestion and had it about 3-4 hours after the unprotected sex. I took  pregnancy tests one day before starting my period and both of the tests were positive! We can't have kids right now and I'm totally disappointed. I'll never buy from this company ever again.

name: Antabuse
comments: I've been on disulfiram for 12 days. (Naltrexone and Topirimate were useless for me.) I still get urges, but, my motivation is FEAR. When I get the urge, I tell myself I literally CAN'T or I'll end up in the hospital. It terrorizes me! I've changed some habits, too. At 5 pm, I make sure I'm at the mall or some place etc..I've changed my eating habits. Drunks NEVER eat before they start drinking. You can't get drunk on an a full stomach. So, I eat a meal shortly before 5. This definitely helps kills the urge. I'm just now getting over the drowsiness. It DOES go away. I no longer have to get up at 2 am to drink a gallon of soda for dehydration and no longer get sick in the afternoons from withdrawal symptoms - my body hurting for 5 o'clock to roll around.  I also look better. The ruddiness in my nose and cheeks have gone away. I recommend this drug if you feel you could be motivated by FEAR. That's the only mechanism you can rely on.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been taking Nortrel for a few years now after trying a few different pills. I have a very hard time finding one that’s doesn’t cause breakthrough bleeding all month long. This is the only one that has helped with that issue but it comes with its own consequences. I get extremely moody & have spells of minor depression. I also have zero sex drive, but that’s been an issue with every pill I’ve tried. I have gained weight but I also don’t eat the greatest & getting older. So, I’m not 100% happy with it but it’s the only one that doesn’t make me bleed all month which is my biggest concern.

name: Camrese
comments: I've been on this medication for a little over a year now to prevent my period altogether as I used to have extremely painful cramping, and it has made my life so much easier. The first pack of the pills (3 months) was mostly fine, no major mood swings or weight gain, however at the end of the third month I did experience about 12 days of very painful cramping and light spotting, which is not typical for me. However since then, I've not experienced any cramping or bleeding, which has been amazing. I'd highly recommend this medication, though be prepared for a bit of an adjustment period during the beginning.

name: Qvar
comments: Picked first rx of qvar, paid $90 after insurance paid out, next time used their coupon paid $65.  After that continued paying $90 each month.  Told by CVS they are adding the coupon.  Seems they're giving the insurance, co the discount instead.  SMH.  Thinking of switching to mometasone.

name: Take Action
comments: I promised I would write a review to hopefully calm some women freaking out like I did. Trust me, this pill works if taken within 72 hours. I took it twice in one week during my fertile window and during ovulation. The first incident I took it after 30 hours, and the second incident 30 min after and I am not pregnant. I experienced cramping after taking the pills and my period came a few days earlier with no horrible side effects (in fact I had no cramping on my period surprisingly, it was one of the happiest periods I’ve had). Now I am back on birth control, as this is not a form of contraception. However it does work, so please breathe and relax. God Bless xo

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: 100% DO NOT RECOMMEND! 2 years ago I struggled with acne and it cleared up but recently started coming back. I visited the doctor to look into birth control pills to regulate my period and also help my acne. I've been on the pill for about 2 months now and it has made me gain 10 pounds and I went from having small whiteheads here and there to massive cystic acne clustered on my cheeks and forehead. This pill has also caused me to suffer severe anxiety which I have not experienced before. I am definitely switching to a different birth control.

name: Camrese
comments: I’ve been taking this for 6 months (just got my 3rd package) in order to control the bleeding from  my nexplanon implant (a whole different, hormonal and acne driven story). I can’t tell if the birth control cleared my skin, or simply leaving teenage hood and entering adulthood did. Either way, it’s done its job as far as controlling the bleeding caused by the implant. Libido seems lower (except on the period pill lol) but I can’t say for sure if it’s the medication or not. No weight gain, no change in breast size, less acne (not attributing it to the medication though) and no mood issues. It does it’s job. 7/10 because by the time the 3rd month comes around I get some spotting before I even start the period pills, although I don’t really care that much.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: It really doesn't work. I do not feel the powder release. I'm confused as to whether or not to take another inhalation. If I don't the problem will still be there and if I do I might overdosed. I have an appointment with my Primary Doctor in 2 days and will ask her to prescribe the albuterol I was taking before.

name: Qvar
comments: Made breathing extremely difficult and felt at times could not breathe

name: Reclipsen
comments: Hated this birth control!  It was effective, sure.  Regulated periods, check (although I never had an issue with that before).  The worst thing about this (for me) was that it gave me horrible mood swings!  I did not recognize the person that I was while on this BC and it didn't occur to me for a long time what was causing me to act this way.  I was so mean and I'm normally a very happy, chipper kind of person.  I eventually just decided to do without and haven't gone back since (2+ years).  I feel SO much better.  It only took a few weeks for me to feel "normal" again.

name: Reclipsen
comments: I've been on reclipsen for 7 months so far and I believe this will be my last. I started tracking how I feel every single day up to my cycle day. I started to realized reoccuring symptoms on the same cycle days of the medication! I'm finally throwing in the hat. Last month my neck became sore and my shoulders and back pain has escalated! Well now I can't even move my neck side to side on the same cycle day. I believe this medicine has not helped my IBS (irritable bowel syndrome), has made me have heart palpitations, a few days before my period I get really deeply depressed on the same day every month and have extreme dark thoughts. I've had tooth aches, headaches, strong cramps, black blood, bladder pain, extreme weightloss, no appetite, dizziness, seizures, constant anxiety, extreme fatigue and weakness and all these weird things over the course of the last few months. My periods wouldn't come till 4 days into the sugar pills, and I would suffer the last week of the pills, and 3 days into my period.

name: Apri
comments: This is the only birth control I have ever used and I have had absolutely NO negative side effects after being on it for more than 2 years. Pros of this prescription is it cleared up my acne and my period comes every 28 days without fail.

name: Take Action
comments: So I hate to have to say this but I’ve had to take this more than once due to condom mishaps ... but so far it has done its job, I usually grab this pill within the first couple hours, however once I grabbed it three days later due to money issues and it still worked. In addition I used this on my ovulation day and it worked! I always get my period 5 days after taking it as well, no matter when my period is scheduled to arrive. The side effects are very gnarly though, no exaggeration the cramps are beyond painful and the nausea and fatigue really kick in. But you’ll be okay, promise ladies just be patient .

name: Cryselle
comments: I have been using Cryselle for about 6 years now and I have had a great experience all in all. I originally started the pill because I had unbelievably horrible cramps every cycle that started a few days before my period and continued for four days after. It's a 28-day pill so the only difficult part of the drug is just remembering to take it at the same time every day in order for the contraceptive aspect to be effective. I never really had skin problems so I'm not sure how Cryselle affects skin but it definitely didn't cause any skin problems once I started taking in it; my skin is still mostly clear. Of course I'm not sure how effective it is as a contraceptive but considering I did have unprotected sex a few times while on the pill, I never had any pregnancy scares. In general, I'd recommend Cryselle to anyone looking for the birth control pill.

name: Antabuse
comments:
I tried acamprosate and naltraxone. Both were jokes. Finally I tried Antabuse. I heard many stories online that some could even drink on antabuse. I was in fear. It was my last chance. I wanted the drug to make me sick, terrible sick. Because I knew I would eventually experiment. Few days passed sober one day I had a urge to drink I wanted to experiment so I took a beer, afraid and scared I finished my first beer. Once the beer was in my fear vanished I ordered another and went home. Slowly I got what about to happen. A feeling of heart attack. I wasn't able to breath. But inside I was happy - my biggest fear that antabuse wouldn't work wasn't true. It was working promise. First time in my life I booked a cycle rickshaw for 10 min walking distance asked the driver to drop me at whatever price. I puked ,unlimitedly had terrible headache.  I was so happy that next weeks I took my antabuse everyday. 
Side effects: I sleep 24*7 on weekends and wish I had more time to sleep. Too much fatigue and drowsiness.

name: Jolessa
comments:
Reason for medication also includes irregular menstrual cycle, Bilateral breast pain (ongoing), menstrual migraines.

Years ago; I was on the brandname Seasonelle and had minimal issues. When my insurance changed at 23, I tried Jolessa due to the brand name being $235 (circa 2012). I remember having terrible mood swings, weight gain, acne, so I stopped taking it. 

Fast forward to 2018, I asked my doctor to try BC again due to irregularity and breast pain. Since the name brand drug  now costs $435, I was forced to try Jolessa again.

I have bled for 26 days straight and have stopped taking the pill. There has been no “trade off” as far as my symptoms being reduced.. I have had cramping, breast pain, and headaches and the excessive bleeding. I do not recommend this generic medication.

name: QNASL
comments: Qnasl is by far the best drug that has ever worked for me. When my allergies are acting up I can normally breath partially through 1 or 2 nostrils while I'm up walking around but as soon as I sit down, they lock up. I'm on shots, singulair and zyrtec and I think I could stop the shots and stick with the other three and be good. Unfortunately my insurance thinks Flonase should work fine but it doesn't so I've been forking over $230 and recently it went up $30 more. This truly is a miracle drug for me. But these guys are awful charging an arm and a leg for medicine. I've been taking one spray a day to make it last longer.

name: Jolessa
comments: My experience with Jolessa hasn’t been bad. I started the pill about a year ago. Just like with most birth control pills, they all come with a few side effects. I noticed while on this pill during the last month of taking it I would have a lot of spotting but not an actual full blown period, I found it annoying because I’d constantly have to wear a pad/liner over the course of the month because of the spotting. Birth control pills definitely affect your mood change as well especially for me, I tend to feel more grumpy and short tempered. I also feel like you gain more weight while on birth control.  My recommendation before starting this pill is to know that you’re basically shutting down hormones in your body which causes these side effects, so don’t think the entire experience with birth control will be terrific, all the while it does help prevent pregnancy and menstrual cramps which are the reasons why I’m on Jolessa. But give it a try and see how your body adjusts to it. :)

name: Apri
comments: I started taking Apri about three weeks ago. It was nothing but a horrible experience for me. From the start it was nausea, dizziness, throwing up, on and off eating habits some days I could eat, some days I couldn’t.  I had extreme mood changes I was snappy towards everyone all the time. I had severe cramps that seem like they would never go away. All of these issues I thought would only last about a week to two weeks then go away. But they only worsened as I kept taking Apri. I started having pain in my kidney it started to hurt when I used the bathroom. Then the pain went to both sides and then down my legs. My legs would ache to the point I could barely walk. All I could do was sleep. I’ve never had any other issues with any other birth control until Apri. I do not recommend .

name: Seasonique
comments: This birth control has literally ruined the past few months of my life. Not only have I gained almost ten pounds, about a week after I started taking it I started bleeding. I have since been bleeding and today is day number 16. I have the worst cramps, headaches, and heavy flow that I have had in YEARS! Not only does it keep happening, I am clotting... and the blood looks horrible. I also developed a rash on my legs, and my doctor told me to keep taking it! I will absolutely NOT keep taking these pills.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I used Veltin about a year or two ago, but stopped after about 8 months due to pharmacy switches and such. I remember that even then, this really helped my acne clear up and my skin to look much healthier. I’ve struggled with acne and minor breakouts over the last few years, and it’s most likely due to hormonal reasons since I’m still in my teenage years! I was able to resume using Veltin about a month or two ago, thank goodness! Now, my skin looks so healthy. I’ve also been using Aczone over the past two years, which definitely helps control my breakouts, but when I re-added Veltin, my skin has completely cleared up. I don’t think I’ve seen my skin look this healthy and clear in months!! It will dry out your skin though, but my dermatologist recommended to use a CeraVe moisturizer, which has seriously helped with preventing dryness and flakiness. I love this medication so much though; it really had worked wonders for my skin!

name: Lessina
comments: My doctor has originally put me on Aviane but Walgreens gave me the generic brand which was something else. They then stopped giving me that and switched me to Lessina. Which I was taking for about a year. It was working great. I had no bad side effects. Wasn’t affecting my mental health. I’m actually trying to switch back to this now. Since I finished all of my refills I went to a different doctor to get the same prescription. But they gave me Vienva. I’ve been taking it for two months now and it’s made me really sad. Unmotivated.

name: Take Action
comments: So let me start off by saying this past month has been very stressful. I had unprotected sex July 5th. I took take action 13 hours later on July 6th. I do not use birth control and he didn’t use a condom,  he came inside me fully so I had to take Take Action. I didn’t have any side effects until a week after which was when I started bleeding randomly. At first it was brown so I freaked out because I thought it was implantation but the blood proceeded to turn bright red like a normal period. It only lasted for 3 days but my normal period is 4-5 days. My expected period was supposed to come July 28th-30th. I just got my period today Aug 6th. I didn’t take any pregnancy tests because I didn’t want to scare myself and I had a feeling it would come soon so I decided to wait. I’m over the 166 lb weight “limit” by quite a bit. I weigh 212lb and i’m 5’9. anyways please don’t freak out too much because the pill will most likely work if you use it as directed.

name: Adipex-P
comments: Adipex 37.5 is the real deal. This is my 2nd time on adipex. The first time I lost about 80lbs in 3 months. The  first 3 days I lost 12 lbs adipex is an appetite suppressant and it will for sure make you less hungry. Also monitor your blood pressure because adipex does elevate it. Try not to consume energy drinks or anything with caffeine in it. The weight will fall off pretty fast depending on your eating habits  - just be patient.

name: Aviane
comments: Aviane is the BEST birth control pill I've tried, don't let the bad reviews scare you! I've been on so many: Microgestin, Azurette, Apri, Trinessa, and Tri-lo-sprintec to name a few. I've had side effects with all of those. I had things like breakouts, bloating, insomnia, constipation, mood changes, breakthrough bleeding, so I was nervous to start this. I have not had a single side effect on Aviane! I was worried about maybe having breakouts since I have sensitive skin and was previously on Accutane, but my skin has been smooth and clearer than ever since starting! No bleeding, bloating, or mood changes. I wish I had started it sooner. And my doctor said it's a great low-dose pill. If you have tried them all and lost hope of finding a good pill, try this one, trust me!!!

name: Cryselle
comments: I would not recommend this pill. I've been on this pill for for 5 years and at the beginning it was okay to use for my acne and to use for regular periods but over time my acne comes back horribly I have severe anxiety and I  hyperventilate. I absolutely have no sex drive. It's been making me beat myself up. My mind goes crazy all the time overthinking. I have extreme anxiety and depression and I have crazy mood swings. I realize that I've been changing the way that I am and being angry for small things or I cry for super small things. I've also been having chest pains that I read is a side effect I would not recommend this pill and I'm deciding to go off as soon as my pack is up. I would not recommend it long term

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: This is a Fantastic Pill (Loestrin 21  1/20) I was originally on Microgynon and it gave me moodswings, headache and bloated feeling . Since I switched to loestrin 20 all that has gone and I now feel myself again. My periods are light had 2 days of very light hardly nothing spotting and took them back to back x2 packs no problems. Definitely found the right one for me. You all should go for it!!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been on Junel Fe 24 for almost a year now, and it has been WAY better than the patch I was on before. I swapped because of crippling nausea. I use it for birth control, but it really helps my periods too. Sometimes I don't even get a period and when I do it's short and light (usually). I have around the same amount of acne that I usually do, no nausea. The main problem I'm having is low sex drive. I'm almost never in the mood, and when I am, nothing is satisfying. Going to see about switching to a different brand in a few weeks. Cigna completely covers it for me.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I overreacted the first few days and got scared I was having a heart attack haha. It can mess with you if you read everything online. But truly, your body is just getting used to it, you shouldn’t stop taking it the first week -  that’s so silly (unless your really ill). I've been on it for a bit now and I like this first ever birth control for me. I’m 20 and I’m pretty active. I always drink a lot of water and prop my feet above my heart for about 15 minutes a day because it’s good for you. Especially if you’re worried about blood clots. Just listen to your body(: it’ll be fine.

name: Cryselle
comments: I started cryselle as my first birth control drug. When I started, I bled on and off for about a month. After that, everything was great. Very regular periods lasting about 5 days with only 1-2 “heavy” days. Just experienced the normal teenage acne problems, nothing out of the ordinary. No cramps. Some weight gain but was also a part of growing out of adolescence. I’m 20 now and had to switch pills because over the past year, periods have gone down to about 3 days with very light cycles and have had pre-hypertension for about 2 years. Now my blood pressure qualifies for hypertension so I switched in hopes it would come down. Also experienced breakthrough bleeding of brown discharge for two weeks straight. Assuming it was a lot of old blood that had accumulated. After switching, my body has finally let go of all that old blood (there was a lot) so just be mindful of that. Was on this pill for about 4 years and it was a good run

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I have been taking this pill for 10 months. It has hardly done anything for my cramps. They've gotten progressively worse throughout the months and my period lasts for 6 days. I've had many mood swings, increased anxiety, and even depression. I still get breast tenderness and I've also experienced lack of appetite. I would not recommend this pill, especially if you are looking for something to help with cramps.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I felt nothing after taking it. Always had to revert to nebulizer. Decided to open it up and found the powder in cluncky form. I had to smash it up back to powder. Afraid of using it when it's a life/death situation.

name: Adderall
comments:
Adderall (Amphetamine) will seem fantastic the first time it is prescribed.  But as the years go by, and tolerance increases, you will need more.

It also down regulates dopamine in the brain 
(which eventually  means that it has been associated with dopamine depletion in the strital area of the brain and frontal cortex)

Dopamine effects pleasure.  When it becomes low
(the brain will compensate by lowering dopamine when taking Amphetamine, because Adderall increases it)

When this happens you will need to continue taking it or you may experience what is called anhedonia 
(Look that up)

This is a very dangerous drug that can permanently change brain chemistry

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I’ve been taking this pill for two months. I got on this BC pill to regulate my cycles. I was having two cycle every month. So my doctor figured it would regulate them. And all this pill has seem to do is make them 10 times worst. I have THE ABSOLUTE WORST DEADLY CRAMPS!!!!! Not literally deadly but just imagine the cramps. Sometimes I’m at work and I just have to sit down because it hurts so bad. One time I fell to my knees it hurted so badly. Not to mention I still have 2 cycles every month. Nothing has changed with the regulating the cycle! I always had anxiety but it’s way worst now. My sex drive has gone out the window literally!! I have no desire to have sex. And I get THE WORST headaches..And I hardly ever have an appetite.. My experience was the worst but I would never tell anyone not to try it. Because everyone’s body is different and it may work for you so good luck!!!

name: Velivet
comments: I’ve been on this birth control for almost 2 years now. During my first year taking it, it worked well. Did it’s job (no kids), sex drive was fine, mood was good, I still experienced cramps during my period, nothing too hard. Then, I switched doctors and wasn’t able to get any refills for 2 whole months, so I wasn’t on birth control. After that, I went on Velivet again and omg everything changed for the worst! I’m very emotional (sad and moody), experience bloating randomly, and I get very painful cramps randomly throughout the day even when I’m not on my period. During my period, the cramps are way worse! My period is also heavier. I honestly can't wait to switch to a different birth control pill. I’m not sure why there was such a drastic change after going off of Velivet for 2 months. I thought maybe my body was adjusting to the pill again, so I decided to give it a few more months. But it’s now been 6 months and I’m still experiencing the same symptoms.

name: Lessina
comments:
WORST BC EVER! I had used this after giving birth to my son.  I would get really bad nausea that would last a week and would make me think I'm pregnant every month, it would do that then I would get my period. I've had horrible  depressed thoughts and just horrible horrible experience with this pill. I didn't gain or lose weight
 Did have some acne blotches every now and then

name: Take Action
comments: Alright so let me first start off by saying. I was just like every single female here, panicking freaking out that it wouldn’t work. Let me tell you my story. Me and my bf had protected sex on June 9. The condom had broke (all the way) and he wasn’t sure if he had went already or not. I ended up taking it about 12 hours later. The pill I took was the take action pill (which is literally the same thing as plan b just cheaper). I took the pill and about 4 days later had a very light period. I bled for about 4-5 days (as per usual with my period). I started getting cramps, nausea, and bloating. I also started gaining a lot of weight and had horrible mood swings. After my period did not come, I really started to panic. I ended up getting my period literally 24 days later. Those 24 days we’re literal driving me crazy. I was so worried about being pregnant and had the absolutely worst side effects. Ladies, please be very considerate of the side effects of this pill.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I am using the Proair Respiclik correctly but don't feel any of the powdered medicine coming out

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Had one of those "oh no moments" I was about 2-3 days away from ovulating when it happened, took the pill the next morning, only experienced sore breasts and bloating. Started seeing pink discharge day 27 of my cycle (I'm normally about 28 days, but it'll sometimes be a few days late) and that made me worry because last time I had pink discharge, I ended up pregnant. I waited about a day, wasn't bleeding much, discharged turned dark brown, still worried. The next day, my period actually started. Way to scare me, period!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This was an awful experience for me. I started and immediately I had cramps and was bloated and uncomfortable. By less than 2 weeks in, I had a humongous cystic pimple on my leg, which I have never had before, as well as small bumps on my thighs. My face became oily and I broke out there as well, as well as my chest, collarbone, and shoulders. I had trouble sleeping and became  so depressed every night before sleeping. I had mood swings like crazy and felt bloated all the time. No weight gain so far however. I’m stopping this pill mid pack because of the severity of the depression I have never had any serious issues with depression, only slight acne that was very under control, and a very healthy sleep schedule.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: Crummy product. DOES NOT WORK

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
It works well until the counter is red. The first one quit with “20” still left; my second one stopped working at the # 16.
With the high cost, I want to be able to get all 120 doses.
So frustrating!

name: Kariva
comments: I was on Kariva for about 2 years. Up until the last 3 months, everything was great. It made my period lighter and regular, only had slight cramps on the first day, skin clearer, boobs even grew from a small b to a small c. I decided to change to a different pill recently because I was experiencing emotional side effects. I have always struggled with anxiety but I was very stressed out due to life circumstances but noticed heavy mood swings. I wanted to try switching my pill before I tried a psychiatric medicine. I would still recommend trying kariva to everyone, It’s worth a shot and I liked it for a long time!

name: Nora-Be
comments: I have been on Nora-Be for about two years now. I really love this birth control. I have tried a combo pill before but it made my migraines worse. I am happy to say that this birth control doesn't make my migraines any more severe, and I'm thinking it might even help control them. While on this my periods have lightened as well. Instead of the 7 or 8 days of heavy bleeding, I now bleed a little less over a span of 4 to 5 days. I get very light occasional spotting in between periods but nothing my normal underwear wouldn't catch. The effectiveness of this is very well also. I have not gotten pregnant in the two years I've been on it. I've even missed a couple of days of it after having sex. That's risky, so don't try it! But this stuff really works and I am beyond happy with it.

name: Jolessa
comments: I’ve been taking Jolessa since 2016, and I’ve had some weird side effects from it. During the 3rd month, I would experience weird brown discharge and VERY slight bleeding for the whole month, which causes me to wear very thin liners for an entire month. I would also experience slight cramping, but nothing too terrible and it isn’t an everyday thing. Other than these two effects, I don’t have any other complains about Jolessa. (With the out-of-pocket expense, I found a coupon that does save me quite a bit on the pill itself, so I don’t actually spend that much every 3 months, but that’s how much it would normally cost.)

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been on Lessina for quite some time now.. I’m currently 18. I work out about 3 days a week and have regular eating habits, etc etc. From my experience so far, Lessina has been effective for birth control purposes (hopefully). However, I’ve noticed that over the course of taking the pills I’ve had frequent headaches, bloating, increased sex drive, and I haven’t seen anyone else with this problem, oh and but my hair is thinning out too. Of course, I can’t be 100% it’s because of Lessina but since I’ve started taking it, my hair has thinned very much to the point where I have to color in spots with makeup and whatnot. Other than that, my eating habits are completely normal, my period is regular, and I don’t have a significant change in emotional behavior like many others. Good luck :)

name: Cryselle
comments: This was my first birth control pill I ever took. I wanted to start birth control to help my really irregular periods. I was probably 16. I was on it for awhile and then switched to a different one to help acne, but switched back because I felt this was a better fit for me. Now years later of been it ever since and it definitely does it’s job of preventing pregnancy, but I’m finally starting to realize why I’ve felt so emotionally and mentally miserable. I was one day away from scheduling an appointment to get anxiety medication before I looked up these reviews. On top of the constipation and stomach aches, this pill has sent my anxiety and mood swings through the roof. I’m annoyed at any little thing, I cry so much I can’t control it, extremely irritable, irrational thoughts I can’t control, and a constant lack of energy. My sleep has been so bad, I can’t stay asleep to save my life, and sometimes I just feel like I’m mentally going crazy. I wouldn’t recommend this

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I promised if this ever worked for me I would write a review. I’ve read these reviews over and over again to stop myself from giving up. Now on week 10 and my skin is almost perfectly clear. Do NOT GIVE UP. Weeks 3-6 were the worst for me and I thought it would never work. Slowly, but surely, it does work. Fight through the breakouts and don’t worry. Give it its full 3 months before tossing it. You will not regret. Simplify your skin care routine. I only used face wash and moisturizer in the morning with Ziana (biacna in Canada) at night. This has fixed everything and is clearing up my scars. Good luck

name: Camrese
comments: I love Camrese. Before I started taking it I had a lot of acne. After being on it for a few weeks, my skin cleared up completely. I get a pimple every now and then but I think it’s from other reasons. My excruciating pains from my periods have significantly decreased. I’ve been on it for about a year now. I haven’t gained any weight, I’m not emotional anymore, Iibido is the same, BUT.. I have one complaint. I’m STILL having breakthrough bleeding! I thought it was just my body being stupid & forcing periods because of my irregular normal periods w/o the pill, but I’ve read a lot of the same type of complaints. It’s once a month. It's about 7 days of bleeding, (warning, TMI) and it’s not normal blood, it’s dark brown. It’s very very irritating and it stresses me out! I specifically got on this pill to stop my periods and here I am having them still. It’s a huge deal for me, if this wasn’t happening, would rate this pill 100/10.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Okay so I had a slip up June 27 2 days after my cycle had just ended (Broken Condom) the following day I headed to my local CVS to get Aftera I took the pill no worries. My boobs were sore for two days as always when I expect my period it went away then July 11 came and I was spotting (6 days after ovulation) I thought it was my period but it was just spotting it didn't even fill a pad but it was red fresh blood so I wasn't sure to call it implantation.  Anyway I spotted for the following 11 days with light cramping period was due July 18 the spotting continued. Today JULY 22 I have began to bleed enough to need a pad which had me feeling super excited and blessed I believe maybe my stress level had a lot to do with the spotting and late bleeding. I use to get my periods late in the month so maybe its just changing back to that I think it was some kind of hormonal imbalance, but I Vouch for Aftera because I'm not pregnant (I took aftera 15 hours after sex)

name: Plan B One-Step
comments:
I had unprotected sex around my ovulation time a month ago. It just kind of happened quickly and before I knew it, he ejaculated inside of me. Due to this being a newer relationship and me being a teen (late teen, but teen), I didn't have a big need for birth control before this so I was not on any form of it. 
I took plan b 10 hours after. Then 6 days later, I had the brown "spotting". It was very liquidy and there was a lot of it for 3/4 days. 
Weeks go by and I miss my period. I'm usually spot on and never miss especially because I wasn't on birth control. My stomach was hard and bloated for the entire month of waiting for my period and occasionally I had cramping in my stomach and uterus, my back hurt, and I could hardly eat. I was CONVINCED I was pregnant. I'm 11 days late on my period, but I finally got it today. My guess is since I took it so close to ovulation that messed me up. Listen ladies, I had every symptom in the book and the odds were against me and I turned out okay.

name: Copaxone
comments: I was diagnosed with Relapsing MS August 2017. I started on 40mg Copaxone Injectable 3/week. At first it didn’t seem so bad. Then after the repetitiveness, I began having terrible site reactions after 5 months. I tried sticking it out, but then I started getting bad headaches, weight gain & joint pain. I decided to switch to a once a day pill.

name: Lessina
comments: I've been on it for a month and so far I've gotten 2 period that lasted for 8-10 days and I know its because my body isn't used to it but hopefully it gets normal in about 2 more months. If not I'm switching to a different birth control

name: Take Action
comments: Ladies, let me just start off by saying this has been the most stressful month of my life. I took this pill about 3 hours after the condom broke. I was definitely ovulating around that time and I realized that only after the incident. I waited 24 days for my period to come and it just came today after I left the doctors office (was getting a blood test for pregnancy). I had every symptom, nausea, dizziness, you name it. Took 5 tests (all negative, except one very faint +) and I've barely gotten any sleep because of all this. I'm definitely going to be starting birth control again because it is NOT FUN stressing over this when you're only 18. I had to get my mother involved as well, which was even worse. Moral of the story: practice save sex and some men couldn't care less about what happens afterwards. #not pregnant

name: Kariva
comments: Was on Kariva for 3 months, would have stayed on it if I wasn't for the negative side effects I got from this pill. PROS: Breast grew from a B cup to a C cup. No depression, feeling sad or moody. Shorter, light periods 4 days at the most. CONS: Extreme vagina dryness, so extreme I couldn't climax at ALL for the entire 3 months. I had acne that broke out on my forehead, chin, chest and back. I'm already really skinny and wanted to gain weight instead I lost about 8 lbs.  Overall, just couldn't put up with the dryness down there it ruined sex for me, after 3 months of taking it had my doctor switch me to a new pill.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been taking this birth control for about 2 or 3 years. There are plenty of horror stories on here but I haven't had any terrible experiences. I’ve been on multiple pills since age 15 due to extreme cramping and heavy periods. This helped the cramping some, however I do get mild hormonal acne at age 23 and I’ve decided to switch just to see if it will makes difference. No weight gain (no breast enlargement either) no crazy mood swings. There is a lower dose of hormones in this pill so it didn’t change my normal body.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: GOD THIS BIRTH CONTROL IS AWESOME. As my first birth control pill ever, I can say this pill has been super good to me. Much lighter periods and no cramping. No pregnancy scares. No more acne except for the occasional pimple. My sex drive hasn’t changed. No nausea or headaches. I’ve been on it since the beginning of January and I’m more than happy with my experience so far. :))) Don’t listen to all the bad reviews!! It may work phenomenally for you.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Been really worried. Had unprotected sex with my partner. I actually came inside her in the heat of that moment and after 1 hour found out she was ovulating. She suggested plan B but on getting to CVS I was recommended Aftera. She’s supposed to start her cycle today but till now she’s not even had any cramps. I don’t want her to be pregnant. It’s barely 5 days ago since we made love. I am really worried sick.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I am not able to suck hard enough to release the medicine. How is someone having asthma supposed to do a quick powerful inhalation?! After watching Respiclick tutorials and following instructions several times, it did not work. With the aerosol Albuterol, I feel instant relief in the tightness in my chest. The respiclick it gives me zero relief. I have called the manufacturer and will be reporting my experience to the FDA.
