name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I started birth control to help with my excruciating periods (average of 17 days long and horrible cramping)
And since I've experienced horrible breakouts, mood swings, a huge increase in anxiety and depression and my sex drive is practically non-existent. As well as those I have a decreased appetite. I hardly eat, yet I'm gaining weight and it's all going to my boobs and thighs.
My periods have gone from 17 days to about 10, but I still have horrible cramps and sickness. 
I was off of the pill for about 2 weeks and I felt like my normal self. Less anxious about everything, less moody, my sex drive increased, but when I started taking them again it all went back to the horrible way I was before
I don't really recommend this brand.

name: Kelnor 1/35
comments: Everyone please keep in mind that no one will have the exact same experience with birth control. The most important thing you can do is talk to your doctor and perhaps get a hormone panel done to see which pill might be the best option for you. I was on kelnor for a year, and I’m just about to switch to yasmin. I have pretty much no complaints, except that my acne has gone back to the way it was before starting birth control. I also gained a bit of weight but that is most likely from excess eating. Switching to yasmin to see if it clears up my skin. Other than that, Kelnor made my periods almost non existant (I used to have horribly painful cramps that would make me throw up, and would have my period for 8 days.) I have depression, but it didn’t seem to make it worse. If you’re about to go on this, stick it out for 3 months and if its not working for you, talk to your doctor about switching.

name: Antabuse
comments:
I've struggled for years with daily drinking at least one bottle of wine per night but more often than not, it would progress to nearly two.
I beat myself up every day with guilt and still could not get past the 5pm trigger.  Say nothing about the money I was spending. $15 bottles most of the time.
Went to Counsellor who referred me to a GP who prescribed 
Antabuse. 
I am now Alcohol Free for 18 days.  There is no going back. 

I remember feeling the same resolve when I finally gave up cigarettes many years ago.

DRUG FREE at last. I'm going to treat my body with the utmost respect from now on.

name: Lessina
comments: I started taking it due to heavy periods and HORRIBLE cramps. I’ve been currently  taking it for 3 months. The only side effect I’ve gotten is bad nausea on the plus side my periods are now regular and I get NO cramps at all

name: Velivet
comments: I have been on velivet for about half of a year, have actually experienced less mood swings, fewer cramps, and I'm overall happier and seem healthier. I don't know if it has made me lose weight but I'm down 5lbs from before, but that might not be a side effect.

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments: absolutely disappointed with Loestrin 21 1/20. My nurse suggested this to me because my microgynon was making me feel sick. WORST MISTAKE EVER!! What is even in this pill. I have been sick all week. I had extreme heavy bleeding even when taking the pill. This is absolutely ridiculous. I am never, I  repeat never taking any birth control pills again. My period felt so forced and fake like the blood is forced out and feels so sore all the time. No way am I having 3 periods a month. Usually I come on normally on my 7 day break 2-6th and then I come on heavy on  the 16th and then heavy again on the 27th there is something definitely not right here!!

name: Adderall
comments:
All the generics ate horrible.  Teva who acquired barr has not improved.
The brand is teva- generic does not work. I want something comparable to original Barr. I'm struggling and drowning back into depression -  generics are not the same. FDA doing nothing to help all of us that ate struggling

name: Lessina
comments: I was recently switched to Lessina due to my other brand giving my constant anxiety and sadness. The first week of taking Lessina I felt so great and hopeful that it wouldn’t bring the side effects in which I read in the reviews. Once the second week came along it was rock bottom. I took one pack in total because I was trying to give it a chance but I had to the back to my doctor to get it changed. It was the worse panic attacks and depression I have ever felt even comparing my last birth control to it. I would cry so much that I would have to throw up, I couldn’t breath or control my panic attacks at all.  I’m giving it 3 stars because It actually helped clear up my skin and I didn’t gain weight like many have said, so that was a positive. I highly do NOT recommend this birth control if you have any bad history of mood swings with other birth controls.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I switched to Junel 1/20 recently from taking Tri Sprintec. And personally I enjoy Junel 1/20 so much more. The only side effects I get is having a headache, feeling drowsy after 1 hour of taking it, loss of appetite and a little mood swings. Yea, these are side effects that many may be frighten of, but honestly, it's so much better then my side effects from taking Tri Sprintec. When I took Tri Sprintec, my side effects were depression, weight gain, breast growth, cramps, constantly in a bad mood.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I’ve seen a lot of bad reviews for Tri-Lo-Sprintec but honestly I got so lucky with this being my first bc pill. I have no major side effects of depression, weight gain, anxiety etc. the only thing would be a slight decrease in sex drive but that’s about it! It has worked really well for me and I have little to no complaints!

name: Lessina
comments:
I have taken Lessina for only 2 months.
I was so scared of trying it because of all the negative comments on it, but for me I have no side effects whatsoever! I get emotional when I'm going through PMS but that's 100% normal for me. 
I take mine before I go to bed (I work overnights) so at 9am so if I do get nauseous, I don't feel it at all. I haven't gained weight, normal PMS acne, no crazy mood swings. It feels like I'm not taking anything at all!
I give it a 9 because I'm not sure how effective it is yet lol. But I'll find out soon lol.

name: Adderall
comments: I'm a 21 yr old who suffers from extreme ADD and Social Anxiety. I've found that Adderall 20 mgs IR 3 times daily to be a life saver for my ADD and social life. I actually go out and can maintain friendships/relationships. I've tried Focalin (D-methylphenidate), Ritalin (racemic form methylphenidate), Concerta (Mph er), etc and Adderall beats them all by far. I started out on 10mgs twice a day and have found this dosage is the most effective at keeping my moods stable.

name: Lessina
comments: I've been taking Lessina for about 4 months now. I used to take seasonique for whatever reason they prescribed me  awful birth control insead. I'm so moody and literally hate the world and myself. I cry all the time honestly have the worst mood swings I've ever experienced. I stay so depressed that all I do is want to lay in bed and cry or sleep. I've gained 20lbs from this and got some acne. I constantly have the worst crushing migraines I've ever had in my life. Just all around worst experience. It work s for preventing pregnancy but it's not worth the emotional state it leaves you in.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: Why is this still on the market? The inhaler as I already did complain about years ago, does NOT  puff adequately at all into the lungs or even the throat, it barely puffs into the mouth! Not enough medicine gets to the back of the throat or lungs!!! This is a weak inhaler -  take this off the market!!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I started Junel because I began to get my period every 2 weeks. All was fine the first 3 weeks. It helped my depression/anxiety and mood immediately. When I started the placebo I got extremely depressed. I always had depression, but was now it was a really dark depression. It had been 2 days and I couldn't stop hysterically crying. On day 4, it was the absolute worst - I decided to call my sister. She knew I had been to the OB recently and asked when I started taking my placebo (I have an app for that,) day 1 of taking the placebo was when they crying began. OB was closed so we decided I should start taking them again. Monday they called and told me to stop it, I refused. I was starting to feel normal again. They put me on it continuously, no placebos. I had no side effects as long as I took it everyday, but if even 1 day got skipped I would be crazy. I was recently was able to wean myself off of it and wouldn't take it again.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I find that it doesn't work either; I was having bronchospasms a few times this season, and the ProAir RespiClick does nothing.  First I thought that it was because I had shortness of breath, but with the HFA inhaler, I was still able to get a fairly decent dose, even in the middle of an attack.  Trying to see if I can switch back to old school inhaler

name: Camrese
comments: I have been on Camrese for 6 months now. For me personally, it has been my miracle birth control pill! I have not had any weight gain, no spotting, and no pregnancy! I did notice the first two weeks I was really moody but getting past that I am glad I stayed on it! It has been amazing for me and I highly recommend this bc pill. Everyone's body reacts different but it's definitely worth trying in my opinion!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Switched to Junel 1/20 for one month and GAINED 7 POUNDS!! I have never been over 115lb and as soon as I started this pill I noticed I gained weight... turns out it was seven pounds! I have also never had cramps this bad before!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
My pharmacy switched me from Microgestin to Junel Fe after they stopped carrying Microgestin. I've been on this birth control for almost 3 months and it has been the worst time. 

After I started taking this I noticed that my skin started to break out, which never happens to me, I am 22 and have NEVER had skin problems aside from a stray pimple here and there. Since beginning this my skin has been all over the place and I can't get it under control. 

I've been bloated and gained weight since taking this. I have been on several other BC pills prior to this and the Microgestin and I've never had such an awful time. Microgestin was perfect and gave me no side effects at all and Junel Fe has been ruining my life for the past 3 months. 
 
When I talked to my pharmacist about needing to switch from this she said since they have stopped carrying Microgestin and using Junel Fe a ton of people have been having the same issues.

name: Take Action
comments: Just got my period on the date that I normally would, so the pill didn’t mess with my cycle at all. I took the pill no more than 10 hours after “the accident” no side effects nothing! So the pill worked for me and I was even ovulating at that time so don’t worry ladies you should be fine :)

name: Jolessa
comments: I have been taking Jolessa since October 2016. I have only had a few months this whole time that I did not spot or bleed heavily. I have bad cramps during my period and clotting while on this pill. I noticed that my sex drive is much less and I am more dry during sex. I was not like this before I started taking this. It does prevent pregnancy. I am not sure if it is worth taking anymore. I recently found out I have a corn intolerance and Micro-crystalline cellulose is in this pill. My skin is super dry and I did gain weight. Some of these symptoms could be peri-menopause since I am 45. I did read that it is supposed to help prevent those symptoms but it has not for me.

name: Tri-Lo-Sprintec
comments: I’ve been on Tri lo Sprintec for over a year now and at first it was fine, here and there I would get a little mad and emotional but that subsided, but then as time went on I was so overly mean and irritable. Also up until this month I  have had debilitating panic attacks and anxiety to the point I feel like I ’m going insane and yet there  is nothing wrong. I’ve always had anxiety issues but not this bad. I will be getting off this pill. Has anyone ever felt this side effect randomly after a year or so of being on it ?

name: Gianvi
comments: Can't say I'm a fan. I went on Gianvi for acne and mood swings. The first two months were a really rough adjustment.   I levelled out after that and my acne seemed to calm down a bit, but my mood swings were still bad. It's been 6 months now and I'm going to kick this pill to the curb. I've had bad acne flair ups, menstruating twice a month, and my mood is up and down constantly. If the reason you are taking a medication is to help rectify a problem, and that problem becomes worse, it's not worth it.

name: Ocella
comments: I had the Mirena for 3 years and hated it! I developed cystic acne and my periods were at least 2 weeks long each month. I got it removed and immediately started Ocella. It's been great. My periods are not longer than 5 days each month and my skin looks amazing! I rarely get break outs; but if I do, they go away MUCH quicker than normal. The only negatives are that I'm moody, bloated, and have heavy cravings during my cycle. The normal PMS effects I guess.

name: Aviane
comments: Before I begin my review, I would like to point out to other viewers that some other reviews may scare you, but you should not be intimidated by them, as everyone has a different experience on birth control.  That being said, I was iron deficient due to my menstrual cycle, but I was extremely against birth control as a solution for irrational reasons (weight gain, acne, chest growth).  Once I began taking Aviane, it not only did its job of regulating my period within the first twenty four hours, but it also cleared up my skin and stopped my hormonal mood swings for the most part.  Weight gain has not been too much of an issue either, as I have not gained a noticeable amount of weight.  Overall, I have been very happy with the results of this medication, and would recommend it to others, especially those with heavy menstrual cycles.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Started taking Portia about 2 months ago- had to stop because I was not myself at all! Felt like a cloud was over my mind at all times. Caused EXTREME anxiety, depression and mood swings. Lost friends and broke relationships, after 2 days of accidentally not taking I noticed I felt like myself again and refuse to go back on. PLEASE watch your body and your mental response- don’t want anyone to have to go through this because of a silly pill!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I was on Nortrel (Necon previously) for about 3 years and satisfied with it somewhat. I took it continuously because otherwise I had wild continuous breakthrough bleeding after the sugar pills. While on it I went from 120lbs to 150lbs. With serious changes in diet and exercise I was able to get down to 145 which I wasn't happy with, but dealing with. Recently due to upcoming lifestyle changes (starting work, I didn't want to have to deal with pills everyday) I switched to the Nuvaring. After 1 month on the ring I have lost 8 lbs, despite working out only 3-4 days a week compared the 6-7 I was doing previously. I can't definitively say it was the switch, but the correlation is there. Everyone is different, but I can say that this pill due to the higher dose may have effected my weight negatively.

name: Camrese
comments: I’ve been on camrese for over 2 years now and I love it. I enjoy not getting my period every  month. I’ve had a little weight gain but nothing terrible. Maybe 3-5 pounds. Also my acne has significantly improved. Boobs are the same size maybe even smaller (which is most likely from working out). Occasional mood swings but not as bad as I was before BC. No depression. The only kind of pill I’ve ever taken and I love it.

name: Junel 1/20
comments:
If there was an option to give 0/10 I would. I’ve been on Minastrin for years but it costs be about $50 a month due to my insurance coverage, so I decided to switch to Junel 1/20. I had zero issues with Minastrin. So there I was, day 3 of Junel 1/20. I had to leave work because I was throwing up, even laying in bed I’m nauseous. So sure, I might be saving money by taking Junel, BUT I was crying due to my mood from this awful awful birth control and I was throwing up at work, just talking made me want to vomit. I called my gyno in tears and thankfully they switched my prescription back and called my pharmacy. 
Never ever EVER EVEERRRRR take this awful medication. Made me cancel a date I was looking forward to. 
Sure, instead of paying $50 for BC I only paid $6.35. And no wonder. I wouldn’t have even paid a dollar for this  garbage!!!! 
Awful. Just awful.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I had very clear skin until I was 17. I have been suffering from Acne since then in the year 2012. Been on antibiotics, tried benzoyl peroxide none of the prescribed medications worked. I got so depressed, I would avoid family or friends because I did not want them to see the state of my skin. This year I said I need to get my skin clear by all means. Went to the dermatologist and got prescribed this gel! Life saver! Have not had a spot since I have used it and that is 2 months so far. Alongside this gel I went for microneedling at my local beauty spa to get rid of acne scaring they recommend a course of 3 to 5. I am on my third one and all scars have disappeared already. I might say though my acne was very mild and scaring was very little. Hope you find something that works for you :)

name: Junel 1/20
comments: Junel 1/20 is terrible! My doctor put me on this pill to help with my Endometriosis, and it has done nothing! I’ve had experiences where I’ve bleed for a month straight and it’s done nothing for my pain! I still fall to the ground and lay there for a few minutes before I find the strength to get up! LADIES your doctor knows the body but YOU know your body better! If it’s been 3 months or 10, if you have issues please change your pill because you’re doing more harm then good

name: Velivet
comments: I have been on Velivet for 12 years and have never had a single issue.  My periods are lighter and extremely regular.  So specific that I know the exact day and time of day I'll start. There's always a trial period when taking a new medicine so definitely get this medicine the full 3 month try.

name: Cryselle
comments: I was on this for a year, they told me this birth control helped with acne so I listened. I noticed my skin was getting worse but I always suffered from acne since I was 13. I noticed a change in my behavior, I would get angry a lot, cried more. I recently decided to stop taking this medicine to do an experiment to see if anything would change when I stopped. My acne has completely cleared up now I'm off it  I just have a zit here and there. I'm also happier, not as tired. I even went to my dermatologist and she said she's never heard of this birth control to help with acne which is really weird. So for anyone who is deciding to try this as there birth control I wouldn't recommend it, especially if you're using it for an acne regiment. I have seen people comment that they have tried this for a month and noticed more acne, and some people were saying that's because there body didn't get used to it yet. Well I'm here to say that I was on this for almost two years and I had the exact same issues the whole time.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I went to the dermatologist seeking help for young, hormonal acne before it got worse. I tried clendimycin. It worked until my skin began to break out. My dermatologist recommended Veltin. It worked well, however, my skin dried out. It started to peel back, almost like a bad sunburn. I recommend using veltin, as long as you use a moisturizer with it. I am going on an excursion out of the country soon, and I was starting to run out. (Note: it is recommended not to use a benzoyl peroxide with veltin which decreases the effectiveness of the product.) I dismissed this claim and I am using a non-prescription benzoyl peroxide product, at time of spot treating problem zones with veltin. No complications have came yet, however, use with caution as this product WILL dry your skin, and even more irritation will occur if using a more vigorous product at the same time. I recommend this product for moderate acne.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I would not recommend Balziva. I was on it for a little over a week and developed a DVT in my left arm. I was hospitalized and placed on blood thinners to help and I will still need to continue to take blood thinning medication.

name: Hydromet
comments: After coughing for almost a year and taking many OTC coughing meds, my primary care physician gave me  Hydromet and my cough was under control. I was no longer coughing during church or work and I was able to sleep without coughing. And there were no side effects.

name: fluticasone/salmeterol
comments: Got oral thrush bad, even with rinsing after using my inhaler. Also by the 3rd day could hardly breath. Was terrible. Also it may be generic it is still same copay and price of advair. Not good deal. Teva pulled a fast one on FDA. Not same as advair at all.
uses: AirDuo Respiclick (fluticasone / salmeterol) for Asthma, Maintenance:

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Listen, I have been taking Junel Fe 1.5/30 birth control for 2 weeks and my side effects are nausea, occasional vomiting, low sex drive, dry vagina, painful vagina, dizziness, insomnia, weird heart fluttery feelings, and headaches. It's been TWO weeks & I genuinely feel near death. OHHH & I've started to get bumps on my face. Getting off of this as soon as I possibly can.

name: AirDuo Respiclick
comments: Got oral thrush bad, even with rinsing after using my inhaler. Also by the 3rd day could hardly breath. Was terrible. Also it may be generic it is still same copay and price of advair. Not good deal. Teva pulled a fast one on FDA. Not same as advair at all.

name: Jolessa
comments: This medication is awful. I immediately started with breast tenderness/ soreness, then came joint pains and massive headaches. Then there were sharp pains in my lower abdomen that would last about ten seconds and I would have them throughout the day. I’m barely 19, healthy and have had regular periods for the past two years. I just wanted something to help cramps and it sounded like a dream when my gynecologist told me I’d only bleed 4 times a year ! I just finished my second month and I’ve been bleeding for 6 days now ! I’m not even supposed to be bleeding! I’m not even talking about spotting I’m talking about HEAVY bleeding. Before I started this medication my periods were light/regular and only lasted 5 days MAX. This is one of the worst decisions I’ve ever made, the side effects are not worth it. I’d rather get my period every month than deal with this. Don’t get on this medication.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: I was switched to Portia from levora when my pharmacy switched manufactures. The only issues I had with this birth control was that my emotions were very high the week before my period and I experienced a lot of water retention/bloating. However, I already suffer from severe anxiety, OCD, and depression regardless that has always gotten worse around my period, so it is hard for me to tell if this is a side effect or merely just part of how my body deals. I hear a lot of talk about Portia being blamed for weight gain, but scientifically there is no evidence that hormonal birth control leads to actual weight gain. I have gained weight however, I noticed a change in my diet as well. I was not eating well, craving sweets and more food than normal so that is what is responsible for my weight gain I believe. Any way over all this is a good birth control. My boyfriend and I never use protection and I tend to take my pill late and I have never even had a pregnancy scare. Love love love

name: Take Action
comments: Long term effects for 2 months I used this pill in April’ every month I’m spotting when my period is usually always 5 days long combine with cramps I’ve been so bloated for 2 months with bad back pain weeks I was so tired couldn’t stay awake this month I’m much better I guess I’m trying to see people experience from the pill.  If you've fallen pregnant from this pill  what  were your symptoms before finding out you were pregnant or how was your symptoms  even after taking it. I don’t think I should be having side effects this long. Also I have frequent urination  a lot.  This is month 2 and still spotting. According to my calendar I’m late

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: Was on pulmicort 180 for just over 16 years worked amazing then my insurance decided not to cover it anymore which they only covered half in first place. Then doctor put me on qvar 80 inhaler. A little issues at first, but got better and asthma was well maintained again. About 3 months ago they came out with qvar redihaler. HORRIBLE!! I have to take rescue inhailer with this 1-3 times a week. I used to only have to take 1-3 times a year with pulmicort. It doesn't even feel like I'm getting anything in lungs when taking. Would not recommend to anyone! Going back to doctor this month and begging them to contact insurance company and ask them to please start covering pulmicort for me for it is needed. Its $120 vs $60, but I'd rather breathe!!

name: Adderall
comments: I have had Narcolepsy for 25 years, 5 of those years I went undiagnosed, another 5 figuring out a treatment that worked for me. Initially, treated with Ritalin and developed a tolerance. Tried non-amphetamines and they did absolutely nothing! Then started Adderall, I had become a new person again, had a life. Able to hold conversations, cook a meal, and drive a car again, all without falling asleep! I was even able to work and have been working for the past 15 years. The dosage increased over a period of time, but for the past 9 years I have been on 180 mg per day and it has controlled my Narcolepsy without any side effects or need to increase the levels.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
So I know a lot of people (myself included) rely on reviews when trying or purchasing new things.  I was prescribed Junel Fe as my first BC ever and came on here to see how it made people feel.  I'll be honest, reading people's negative reviews on this site TERRIFIED me. But then I remembered - most people leave reviews when they have had a negative experience with something.  So I wanted to come and give an honest, positive review to put to ease the minds of anyone who may be doing research and becoming increasingly nervous. 

I've been on Junel Fe 1 year now and not felt a single symptom, it's like I'm not even taking anything. Period comes lightly on the second day of the final week of pills like clockwork, which puts me at ease since before using this my period used to come a week late or more often and made me nervous with my now fiancee despite us using condoms.  Literally zero issues or complaints. And my insurance covers 100%.  Don't let the negative reviews scare you.

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments: First I'll complain that Teva redesigned the delivery mechanism for Qvar so that they could maintain a patent that was expiring and continue to charge a high price. Next, I will explain that this delivery mechanism has been faulty in two inhalers so far. As the count approaches 60 inhalations left, the mechanism appears to clog so that after I have completed a deep and long inhalation the inhaler continues to spray medication. That either means I didn't receive the full dose or that medication is being wasted. I am following use instructions perfectly, but the problem persists. I talked on the phone with Teva and they had me send the first inhaler back (I had two from our mail order pharmacy). They promised they would have our mail order pharmacy send a replacement, but that was weeks ago and has not happened. This company is failing its customers by price gouging, low quality of product and poor customer service. I will be talking to my doctor about an alternative medication.

name: Jolivette
comments: I honestly didn't even know all the issues I've been experiencing were due to Jolivette until I switched to Heather, and was doing research to compare it to this one. I have had the worst side effects! I have literally gone completely crazy, had multiple psychotic episodes, I'm shocked my boyfriend is still with me too! I became super depressed, unmotivated, lazy, I was having night sweats so bad I would be soaked when I woke up. Insomnia like crazy. So glad I switched and definitely will never go back on Jolivette !! It literally almost ruined my life.

name: Gianvi
comments: I got on gianvi after yaz because it was cheaper. It helped to clear my hormonal cystic acne. I started in February of 2016. 2 months later I noticed weird symptoms with my eyes. They were constantly aching and it hurt to blink. Fast forward a year and a half and it’s still getting worse (I honestly thought it was from me getting older). Turns out I had severe dry eye and inflammation, which would cause migraines (never had these before). So I went on some medication to bring down the swelling in my eyes. Come to find out that my birth control is the only reason for my weird eye symptoms and migraines. Got off the birth control and less than 5 days later, my eyes went completely back to normal. Was on this stuff for over 2 years. Took forever to realize.

name: Lessina
comments: I took this pill for two weeks. On the 14th day I was ready to seriously harm myself. I had a complete emotional breakdown. I went to the ER and was prescribed anxiety pills and told to immediately discontinue this pill. I seen the reviews and got worried but I have never had a problem on any other pill. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PILL TO ANYONE!!! IT SHOULDN'T BE AN OPTION FOR ANYONE OTHER THAN THOSE ALREADY TAKING IT!

name: Nuvigil
comments: I have taken nuvigil for having two jobs and it is a great help....no negative side effects...except for my wallet! I recently got a coupon, tried to use it and the price with my insurance ( not medicare, etc or public assist) was over $125.00 although coupon said first script free and refills as low as $5.00!!!! Not true!!!! Now have to go back to Dr. and get script for generic. Mom is right.....Nothing is free. This is poor business procedure.

name: Camrese
comments: I had my daughter March 30th 2018 she was a premi baby.  After my 3 weeks of healing I started this birth control and I’ve been bleeding ever since . Today is May 31 2018 and I’m still bleeding heavy . I use to take this birth control as a teenager and it use to stop my period for a few months at a time and when I did get a period it wasn’t heavy and it only lasted 3-4 days . It also made me loose a bunch of weight . I don’t know what the difference is but something is totally different here.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
Worst birth control ever 
clearly didn't prevent pregnancy for me

name: QNASL
comments: I used QNASL 80 MCG for years. I think the steroid with the propellant worked great as it really got the medicine deep into the sinus cavity. Unfortunately, my insurance stopped covering and the product became way too expensive at full price approximately $230 a unit. I also experienced side effects when I ran out. There is no generic yet and the cost is about as much as a weeks groceries for family of 6. The medicine became a luxury I could no longer afford even with QNASL discount card my HC premium rendered the savings null.

name: Qvar
comments: I have been on this medication for quite some time; about 5 Years now I want to say. I have never had a problem with it, but I want to point out that recently they made a change in the packaging and it’s absolutely impossible to use. I don’t know if I’m just weak, but you have to push and push and push to get it to work. I can’t believe somebody would approve this change. It’s awful! Other than this new thing, when I was taking it before, it very much helped with my asthma. I wasn’t having to take my ProAir rescue inhaler at all, only about once every two or three months when allergies would arise.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: It was an awful experience, mood swings weight gain and I had cystic acne which developed with in the first month of taking it. It ended up ruining the skin on my face. I have huge scars the dermatologist is helping me removing them but it scared me for life. Do not take.

name: Antabuse
comments:
After trying abstinence, hypnotherapy, meetings, I was finding that nothing worked. This was a last resort for me. After a few days of taking Antabuse medication, I drank and found it very uncomfortable to do so. My eyes were bloodshot, my face red and flushing, chest hurting and feeling nauseous, eyes blurred, dizzy and ready to pass out. Despite this, I still drank a few more times and had the exact same reaction. If I drink now I mostly throw up and pass out for a few hours and wake up really sweaty. It has really taken the joy out of drinking. Every time I drink on this medication the more adverse I feel to alcohol. I've started drinking alcohol-free alternatives because what's the point in drinking alcohol but throwing up and passing out after a single? All I know is that I will keep taking the medication, and I'm wanting to drink less and less.

I wouldn't recommend this as a first port of call but if you've tried a few things and nothing seems to work then give it a go.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I took Junel Fe 1.5/30 for three months before I switched to a new birthcontrol . It did effectively prevent pregnancy and gave me a regular period. The first couple of weeks consisted of terrible nausea and extremely tender breasts. The nausea did subside after the first month or so. My breasts have been tender the entire three months and have grown very much. Although I did not gain weight, I did have really bad mood swings, non-existent sex drive and DEPRESSION! I didn't notice until the end of the 2nd month going into the third one, but I was constantly unhappy and my mood could switch at the drop of a dime. Before taking this pill, my sex drive with my boyfriend was extremely high, but after I began taking it, we've gone nearly 2 months without even touching each other because of me (feel so bad). 
The pills affect everyone differently so it really is trial and error.

name: Take Action
comments: I had unprotected sex Monday (May 14th) around 11:00 pm, during my fertile week. The next morning, approximately 10 hours later I went to pick up the mifepristone  (MFP), I grab this one since it should do the same job . My side effect where mild, ranging from sore breast to cramps, nothing too terrible! I did get my period a day earlier than expect (24th)!!! This pill does work.

name: Ocella
comments: I was using MonoNessa for 1 year before my doctor switched me to Ocella. I absolutely regret agreeing to the switch. I was perfectly fine with MonoNessa except for being a little dry “down there” during intimacy. I prefer that than what Ocella has done to me. I wake up with a headache almost every single day, I have a raging appetite, and I’ve been on Ocella since April 15 and started spotting April 18. It is now May 25 and I have not stopped spotting (sometimes heavier) AT ALL. For over a month now and this is just insane. I don’t suggest this pill to anyone.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I love being awake for three days during allergy season because I can't breath. It's the best! Almost as great as the $60 I'll never see again for wasting on this placebo!

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments:
I started so my boyfriend and I could have sex without protection. The first week I ate SO MUCH. My appetite grew that I amazed everyone around me eating so much. The second week I got such bad nausea I threw up. Third week I feel a lot better.

BUT I noticed that when I was having sex I was SIGNIFICANTLY dry and had  noticed my drive to want to have sex decreased. I had had a very high sex drive and I’m usually very aroused. But lately it seems like sex is a chore and I really have to focus to try and enjoy it a little. So while the side effects of nausea and increased hunger went away, the lack of desire to want to have sex the first month and dryness was enough to turn me off.

My friends warned me about the side effects and that a lower sex drive would happen. I decided to stop taking the pills because while I believe the nausea will go away, the lack of desire, and 
dryness I don’t think will because of the hormones. So I decided to stop. But at least I didn't get pregnant lol

name: Gianvi
comments:
Gianvi has been a disaster. I was so excited to take it as I needed a birth control method and also have adult acne and PCOS, and it's supposed to be good for that. After the very first pill I felt very bad, with heavy fatigue, nausea, and headaches. I thought I had a stomach bug and just needed a day to rest. Then I started having panic attacks and severe depression. I had to leave work it was so terrible. Over the next 7 days the nausea and headaches persisted, and I alternated between periods of panic, anxiety, severe anger, and sadness. One day I sobbed the entire day for absolutely no reason.

It ruined my sex drive. I couldn't get wet enough to have sex at all. I have run 25 miles per week for two years and never missed a week, but for the 7 days I was on Yaz I couldn't run because I was so exhausted. Even doing the dishes or taking a shower was too exhausting. My acne got  a lot worse.

This drug is dangerous!

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I have allergy induced asthma, depending on how harsh the allergy season is I might have no symptoms or I might get really bad asthma. So in late April through May I will typically have my asthma symptoms and attacks. This year I was given this ProClick powder inhaler and it really does do nothing. The first few doses it did leave some residue on my tongue but now after using it for 3 days it's not making a difference and it doesn't even feel like it's dispensing any medicine! $45 copay and I'm sure my insurance picked up a pretty big chunk of the cost. Total waste! The company who makes this inhaler should be investigated for fraud, imo this is a defective product.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: Aftera worked for me. Took the pill 16 hours after unprotected sex (while I was ovulating). Did not experience any side effects and got my period 14 days later on the expected date. I did have cramps when my period came but my periods come with horrible cramps anyways so it wasn't too bad for me. I recommend it!

name: Lessina
comments: I started Lessina about 2 months ago. I really like it. It has stopped my period altogether. My acne has gone away completely. I’m very happy with it.

name: Copaxone
comments: OMG, first time taking copaxone after taking avonex for 20 years. It is unbelievable, no side effects. Even though I am happy that avonex was there and I truly believe that because I stayed on it my MS is controllable it was a pain, the side affects were too much. I am happy to try copaxone, I was not happy with injecting myself daily but since there are no side effects....that helps. :)

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: Like most I also find ProAir RespiClick has no use.  It doesn't help me.  I want my aerosol instead. I would like the money back on 3 of these . I was told it would be my old aerosol  and when I go pick it up it's this ProAir Respiclick .

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: The best way to describe this product is a total "lifesaver"! Reading these reviews, I've noticed people are too quick to judge this product within the first few weeks because they are not patient enough to wait for results. Topical creams take a few months to work their magic and truly take effect. I did not start to notice results until 4 full months of using this product. I went from terrible hormonal and cystic acne to completely clear skin, similar to the results you see from oral Accutane pills. The only reason I do not give this product a full 10 rating is that it is extremely drying. If you don't moisturize 24/7 your skin can get to the point where it flakes off and you cannot apply any makeup over it. However, with a proper routine, this can be avoided. You also need to beware the sun, it causes you to get severely red or even blister. Truly, the pros outweigh the cons. This product is fantastic and it been the only thing to help my skin!

name: Camrese
comments:
I’ve been on this birth control for 3 months now (just got through my first pack) and honestly I have very little complaints. I haven’t gained weight, no spotting, no nausea or dizziness, no change in libido 
However I did notice that I’ve become much more emotional since I started camrese. It used to be kind of hard to make me cry now I will at the drop of a hat, but for me the pros outweigh the cons majorly

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I absolutely hate this "new inhaler " it does not work !

name: Cartia XT
comments: Taking 120 mg of cartia XT for weaning off of a beta blocker for blood pressure. Sent me into tachycardia which woke me up to going 165 beats per minute. Never in my life have I had a heart issue. As I'm taking this medicine it gives me skipped beats which are definitely uncomfortable and I have this sinus congestion that has lead to a annoying cough. I'm hoping I can wean off this medicine and not have to deal with a racing heart. Also experiencing heightened anxiety with this medicine.

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been on this pill for about a year. When I first started I had irregular spotting for about a month and then my period began to come regularly. After about 4 months my moods swings have been on 100. During that time of the month I do get cystic acne in the chin area. On the bright side I am not pregnant, which is a plus! One down side is that the pharmacy I use was out of stock for a couple of days, which could have gotten me pregnant but I’m glad I was able to hold out until I have taken the pill for a week straight.

name: Gianvi
comments: I started Gianvi March of last year and requested this brand specifically, because a friend had told me how well it worked for them, and it is the generic for Yasmin, which is often used to treat PMDD. I was seriously suffering mentally and emotionally every month before starting Gianvi. Granted I have battled depression/bipolar disorder for quite some time, but everything was so much darker right before my period. I was extremely irritable to the point where everything set me off and I'd get violent, I was crying uncontrollably, completely hopeless, suicidal, etc. In addition to this, I also suffered from pretty bad acne (I'd get large, painful, cystic-like pimples every month that would then often take months to go away). While I still do get acne (I've had it since my early teen years), I no longer get the kind of acne I had been, and it is much more manageable. I'm so glad I gave Gianvi a shot.

name: levonorgestrel
comments:
After having unprotected sex, Plan B One Step is usually my go-to emergency contraceptive. However, upon arriving at the pharmacy, there was none available, but next to it were 2 Aftera pills. I was very sceptical because I've never heard about this brand. Because I wanted something immediately, I decided to purchase this drug and took it approximately 15 hours after having unprotected sex. 

Here I am, 3 weeks later with abdominal cramps. I went to the doctor today, where I found out I was pregnant. I had a feeling I was because my body felt different; bloated, unusual abdominal cramps and dizziness. I would not recommend this pill to anyone!!! Very disappointing that it didn't work. I've taken Plan B even later than 24 hours and it has worked. Be careful, ladies and good luck!

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I had asthma as a kid. I kind of grew out of it. Recently, I have been getting very short of breath. Turns out I have a respiratory infection that brought my asthma symptoms back. I was given a prescription for a respiclick inhaler. I remember when I was a kid the feeling of the inhaler kicking in and being able to breathe again. That doesn't happen with this inhaler. I don't remember what medication my old inhalers had in them but they were a lot more effective

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: This birth control was awful. While it did it's job in ensuring pregnancy prevention, I experienced the worst headaches and cystic acne of my life. Horrible mood swings and painful cramping. Do not take this medication if you have other options.

name: Gianvi
comments: The first probably 5 months of this pill was awful. My skin got worst, I spotted, and I had bad anxiety. However, it's been two years now and I have never been happier. I haven't had a bad pimple in MONTHS and my acne completely cleared. We stopped using condoms and have been fine, no scares. My period is only 3 days and very light, plus it starts always on the hour! It's amazing. Plus, I lost about 10 pounds from 127 to 117 at 5.4'

name: Qvar RediHaler
comments:
This should not be sold as a drug for young children and the previous model should not have been pulled from the market. 
My 6 year old is having trouble inhaling with enough force and holding breath to get the medicine. As the old form has been discontinued we got this redihaler on a Friday. Big mistake!
It’s now Sunday night and we are up with coughing. Praying the rescue inhaler works before we have to go to the ER. 
The instructions for this are literally the opposite of a spacer. What research was done before making a new device for kids.  Terrible decision. 
Unfortunately there is only on competitor and it costs more per dose. This is terrible! We are scared.

name: Lessina
comments: Based on my experience with this pill so far (3 months) I would not recommend it. I get very nauseous after taking and have had a low mood (tired and depressed). I also get indigestion now which I never had prior to taking.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I totally recommend NOT having unprotected sex anytime knowing the possibilities pregnancy. I understand things happen so don't feel bad, I've used both Plan B and Aftera. There have been a couple instances where the Pharmacy was out of Plan B, the pill everyone says is better. I have taken Aftera and it has worked for me, it's the same just cheaper. I highly recommend using it as soon as directed on the box  within 72hrs, but taking it earlier is more likely to be effective (NO LATER than 24 hours). I am aware if the condom brakes, and the chances of getting pregnant even with it on. It's always smart to be safe, and use protection  rather than relying on the Emergency Pill alone. Keep in mind whether protected or not we all are accountable for our actions and must understand that there are consequences. ALWAYS play it SAFE and GOOD LUCK.

name: Junel 1/20
comments: First and foremost, most of the reviews that are negative are due to the fact that women aren’t patient enough to bare the immediate side effects. You need to wait 3 months before you decide to switch or stay on the birth control. I’ve tried several different birth controls and this one has worked the BEST! However, the first month you’ll be hungry, constantly. Try to drink tea or have smaller meals throughout the day to avoid weight gain. I really really love this medication. I feel back to myself, I gained probably 2-3 pounds the first few weeks actually but it’s been 2 months and now I can control my appetite. I recently got my period and didn’t experience ANY PMS. Just the first day I got my period I was moody. Little to no bleeding, still got minor cramps but not bad enough to take Midol. Overall, try this medication. But stay on it. If you really don’t like it after 3 months then you can switch.

name: Tri-Sprintec
comments: I started this pill that was recommend by my gyn as most effective for acne. The first 2 packs were complete opposite for me. I broke out on parts of my face that I never really experienced acne on before. However they weren’t cystic like or big and red like I usually would get on the chin area. At the third pack it got significantly better. I no longer had new breakouts. And now at my fourth pack my scarring has faded for the most part and around the placebo week I get one small breakout but nothing crazy. If you’re just starting this pill and aren’t sure if you should stick it out I’d say give it 3 months as recommended by the experts.

name: Copaxone
comments: Was on it for 2 yrs then it just stopped working

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments:
Used to use albuteral for my reactive asthma, for when I occasionally smoke which I know I shouldn’t. Guess I’m
going to have to stop because this stuff literally does nothing for me whatsoever even after like two times the dosage. This product is going to kill someone because of its lack of symptom relief. I’m happy/ disappointed to see so many other having the same issue

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been on this pill for only 4 days and I can't stress enough... DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL. I used to take Necon and had a really great experience. However, my insurance switched me to Nortrel and I seriously wish I had read reviews before starting it. I am having constant stomach pain and mood swings. I already suffer from anxiety and somehow this medication has made it SO much worse. I am going from nervous to happy to depressed within a matter of minutes. This stuff is horrible and I am switching ASAP. Be warned ladies.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I've been suffering from migraines for at least 10 years. Part of my problem was neck pain causing them which I fixed. The other factors was hormonal migraine. When I was able to get control of my migraines through physical therapy, I was still getting severe ones during my period. I take nortrel 1/35 continuously.   I have just one period every 3 months. It's been a life saver. My migraines have reduced dramatically in terms of frequency and severity. As a bonus my skin is super clear. I went from having 12 migraines a month to about 3. This birth control is amazing! I personally have had no negative side effects, it's been great.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: Nothing comes out even if you use it according to instructions. Dangerous--I reported it to the FDA. If you have the same problem, please do it too.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Like most, I was taking Necon which was discontinued so Nortrel was / is its replacement. Nortrel has been the worst experience ever, especially days before and during my cycle. Per my experience ( migraines, nausea, and stomach cramps that feel like something is ripping it apart) all of which I didn't experience before, I don't think this drug is safe. I don't have cysts but the side effects of this drug is sure to cause some problems. I've decided to have my doctor change my prescription.

name: Copaxone
comments: Diagnosed in 2000. Lost all feeling in half of right arm. MRI showed innumerable lesions in brain & 3 on spine. Also evidence of MS in spinal fluid. Immediately began Copaxone 20 mg daily. Swank MS diet limiting saturated fat to 15 grams per day. Have  taken Vit B, D , Coq 10, chorella ( for the amino acids), multi-vits, sphingolin ( Myelin protein) , evening primrose oil & fish oil w/ food at lunch.. Also apitherapy ( hugely helpful) sting myself with live honeybees whenever possible . I Had one exacerbation in 2005 where I was dragging my foot when walking & was put on steroid intervenous  drip for 2nd time ( which reversed all symptoms..). I exercise 3 times per week with mild cardio (stairclimber, weights, swim) don't push myself except to get heart rate up to about 130- 150 with push at the end. No real symptoms except for occasional tingling & minor balance issues. Naps also very important . Massage also helpful... Something is working... Don't know what...

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I am sick of feeling horrible with this inhaler.  I never get any relief.  My pharmacy tells me this is the "preferred" drug of choice with my insurance plan.  I pay $25.00 copay and am getting no relief for my asthma at all.  I wanted to go back to my aerosol inhaler, however the insurance denied that request.  We should not be made to purchase a drug that the insurance company feels is in our best interest.  Listen to your patients-This needs to be recalled before someone dies from an asthma attack

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I’ve been on this pill for about 4-5 months now and it’s been pretty good. I used to get HORRIBLE and CRIPPLING period cramps but this pill has helped that so much and has regulated my period and made them shorter. But the downside of this pill is that it has made my emotions super out of whack!!!! I cry for no reason sometimes or I’ll be mad for no reason it’s just super frustrating. And makes me super nauseous!! But that was only when I was starting it the first 1-3 months so now everything feels more regulated and I don’t feel like the emotional mess it used to make me (I still get nauseous every once in a while but it happens)

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I have only been using this product for a few days and I haven't seen much improvement but after reading these reviews I wanted to share what my dermatologist recommended. She told me not to follow the directions in the box, rather keep your face damp (wet, but not dripping wet) after washing it and then apply a pea size amount of the product to the entire face. So essentially, you are working the product into your face with the water to help reduce dryness. This is a great tip because I have pretty sensitive skin, and my skin has barely gotten dry in the few days that I have been using this. If you're experiencing extreme dryness or any textural problems, I recommend you try this tip out! Hope that this helps someone out there.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: Unfortunately Portia caused such profound nausea and vomiting that it was impossible to take. I even took it with a big meal (dinner) and tried taking it before bed so I could sleep through the side effects - I ended up waking up at 2am throwing up several times. I tried this 3 nights before I called it quits. Going to switch to a progestin-only pill to see if this helps with the nausea. Good luck, ladies!

name: Jolivette
comments: I previously had heavy periods for more than 10 days with heavy bleeding. This caused me to have iron infusions on a regular basis. I was losing my hair, had high blood pressure, insomnia, migraines and the list goes on..after only 2 months on Jolivette .35 my periods are what I think are normal. I've never had a normal period ever. I'm currently using panty liners with regular or light tampons. Prior to this only overnight pads and Super + tampons. All other symptoms have all gone away. Only minor cramping. Love this new pill. Let's see what the next few months brings.

name: Camrese
comments: I hate this birth control. I am now on my 4th pack which makes a year. The first pack was the brand amethia which worked like it was supposed to. Then the pharmacy switched to camrese and it has been hell ever since. The first pack of camrese I made it through the first 2 months with no period. Then beginning of the 3rd month I started my period and I bled the whole month. Picked up the next pack same thing. I switched from monthly to this because I was tired of having horrible periods now I have to deal with them for a month. I've gained 20 pounds, migraines non stop. Don't switch if you don't have to!

name: Lessina
comments: I’ve been taking this birth control for almost a year. When I first started on it, I would have random bleeding that seemed to last three weeks. When my bleeding finally regulated, I started feeling super bloated, so much so that I took a pregnancy test and guess what it turns out I’m pregnant. Not far along enough to cause bloating, but I know I didn’t miss a pill. Surprise!

name: Take Action
comments: I'm writing this to help people be less worrisome. I've taken this pill twice and both times were in my ovulation window (2-3 days before I ovulated) and it worked. The first time I took it on the third day and the second time to took it within 2-3 hours. It DOES work. I got no symptoms each time and my period was really heavy with slightly bad cramps but I'm not pregnant so yea! I would recommend if you don't have enough money but if you do I would recommend actual Plan B just to be safe.

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I specifically asked my Dr. to switch me off of the Ventolin inhaler to the ProAir inhaler. The Ventolin inhaler seems like it does not give a big enough puff, whilst the ProAir inhaler gives me a smooth problem free puff without having to take a second one.

name: Claravis
comments: Isotretinoin (Claravis) CHANGED MY LIFE. My only regret is not going on it sooner (I started at age 22). If you are on the fence, do it. The only side effects I had were dry lips, some back/tailbone pain and some depression (though I think this was more so from the birth control). I wasted so much of my life hiding away because of my mild to moderate acne. Be patient, and this will work. It's better than being on antibiotics for long periods of time. I was on it for 4 months, and my skin keeps getting better after. It did not clear up my hyperpigmentation, but I know that will fade and I can cover it up. Monthly blood work is so worth it to be able to wake up in the morning and not worry about pimples. Use Carmex lip balm ( for me way better than Aquaphor). And go out and live your life!!! If my acne comes back (praying it doesn't), I would be happy to take this again.

name: clindamycin/tretinoin
comments: I have light acne, just many little ones on my forehead and this clears up my skin within a week every time it breaks out again. It seems to dry out the pimples and make your skin quite dry and flakey but if you use a moisturizer after you’ll be fine. Absolutely love this and recommend!!

name: ProAir HFA
comments: I use an inhaled cortical inhaler daily for maintenance but for those occasional times I need a rescue inhaler, the ONLY ONE that works is Ventolin HFA - 1 puff and almost instant relief.  I could suck up half the cannister of ProAir HFA and still not be able to breath.  This stuff is awful and my insurance company forces it on me.  Reading all of the terrible reviews of this product from actual users like myself, I can only conclude that ProAir HFA is giving substantial kick-backs to insurance companies to get them to force this rubbish product on subscribers.

name: Gianvi
comments: This birth control made me feel AWFUL! I had terrible back and abdominal pain while taking it and even for some time after it. It took my body awhile to adjust and to feel normal again after taking this pill. It caused migraines, fatigue, and mood swings. I also experienced changes in my digestive system and felt bloated most of the time. I felt my personality completely change on this pill. Overall, I would not recommend anyone to put this pill into their body.

name: Antabuse
comments: My son started to use this over the weekend.  He almost died in an accident in 2014.  He has been drinking severely for years.  As parents who love him so much it has been such a difficult time.  Lots of tears, financially cleared out, in between jobs, friends trying to help him and praying day and night for my son to stay alive.  May this be the answer to our prayers.   Some things we cannot do alone some of us need more help.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I feel great no side effects on my end! My periods don’t last long and they are regular thankfully

name: Cryselle
comments: I’m 21 and have been on cryselle since I was a junior in high school. I initially started it because I was having bad period cramps and clotting. I would pass out from blood loss and pain. Cryselle has completely eliminated all cramps and heavy blood flow. My periods only last 4-5 days! I love it! I also had no side effects

name: Nora-Be
comments: I have fibroids and was given Nora Be to help with heavy periods. I’ve been on the pill maybe 15 years. It has made my periods at times non existent to random, but that never bothered me. Throughout these years I have had issues with weight gain and excessive hair shedding but never thought it was because of the pill (although living a vegetarian lifestyle with moderate excercise). I got off the pill to get pregnant and of course throughout my pregnancy. Interestingly, I immediately began losing a lot of weight and my hair never looked better. Now the great hair was due to the increase of blood flow due to being pregnant, but not the weight loss. At the end of my pregnancy, I weighted 30 lbs less than the start, even though the doctors had me on a high calorie diet. I got back on Nora Be after delivery and gained a lot of weight over the years. I never thought to look up other experiences until now. I think I will stop using Nora Be and see how it goes.

name: Fentora
comments: I am tremendously grateful for Fentora and the people whom make this med possible: the manufacturer, my pain physician & my pharmacist. I continue to battle Esophageal cancer, have had a full Esophagectomy & a thoracotomy on each side. This drug works within 2 minutes, doesn’t present any side effects & allows me to complete many tasks I couldn’t do without this medication. The cost is outrageous; however, Medicare and USPF provide an unbelievable level of support to me financially!

name: Kariva
comments: Sorry also have horrible mood instability with this medication

name: Seasonique
comments:
Keep the Faith! My first 6 weeks was pure misery. Constantly bloated, crying, never ending period. Had it for the whole first 6 weeks. I called my Doctor after the first month, begging her to change my BC, but she asked for me to finish out the 3 months. I'm so happy I did, as SOON as the 6th week, all side affects faded away. I am no longer emotionally all over the place, sex drive has returned. No bleeding or even spotting. Yay!!! 
I was scared reading the reviews, so I wanted to post that it did change for me. Hope this helps !

name: ProAir HFA
comments:
ProAir is the worst inhaler ever made. My job's rx plan used to cover Ventolin and Dulera. I used the Dulera once in the morning and once at night. Ventolin in emergency situations. The Dulera helped manage my asthma. When I did need to use the Ventolin inhaler, it delivered a strong blast that opened up my airways. As mentioned before, my job's rx plan stopped covering it. So I had to use my inhaler more often. Then they stopped covering the Ventolin. 

When I had to get the ProAir, I noticed the difference right away. The blast was very weak. Plus the container gets clogged 8/10 times. My son has asthma as well and he has autism. What is one of us or both have to use this cheap inhaler and nothing comes out? I'll you what would happen......we wouldn't be able to breath because the damn thing doesn't work. How can this device be clogged so much? Why is this inhaler even allowed to be sold?

We all should band together and sue the makers of ProAir.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have been reading these reviews and my daughter started out on this and was doing really well, then started with cystic acne, weight gain and moodiness and as it turns out, it's not the name brand Junel, the pharmacy switched it to the generic on her.  Now that she has insisted that they give her the name brand, she has lost 6 lbs the first month and is happy again.  For all of you that are having a hard time, it might be because the pharmacy has switched you to the generic, which is not the same.  Insist on the name brand.  It has made a difference in my daughter's life.  She's 20.

name: Gianvi
comments: I just wanted to share how extremely grateful I am for Gianvi! I was on Yaz for about 3 years and switched to Gianvi for the past seven years because it was cheaper. My face has been completely clear (after trying everything from topical treatments to multiple antibiotics) and my period has been very light - usually only lasting 2 days. I am worried about breaking out again after I stop taking Gianvi and I hope to stay on it as long as I can.

name: Cartia XT
comments: Not really sure if this drug is for me. My blood pressure is still not normal and neither is my heart rate. It more likely raises it. Also occasional skipped beat feeling.

name: Copaxone
comments:
I had my first MS symptoms in 1985; diagnosed with RRMS in 1990. Started on Copaxone in 2000, 18 years ago. When they came out  with 3x a week injections, I switched to that.

My course has been largely benign: most of my symptoms involve sensory sensations on my right side, a few times those sensations have been pronounced enough that it causes weakness/numbness in my foot and some trouble walking. 

I  haven't had a relapse for 8 years now; not sure if it's because I have mild MS or if it's the Copaxone. For now, I'm not willing to go off it to find out.

Of all the MS drugs, I think Copaxone has the most manageable side effects. I've never had any problems aside from being a little sore after the injection and getting those lumps after repeated injections. Years back I stopped injecting in my arms/legs because I don't have a lot of fat there and the lumps I felt in those areas eventually went away. It took about a year, but they did disappear.

name: ethinyl estradiol/levonorgestrel
comments: This has been the worst birth control I’ve ever been on. Great at controlling my period so I don’t have two periods in a month anymore, but I’ve been so nauseous the past two months. I have to stop taking it. I’ve been throwing up + nauseous every single day. Can’t eat hardly anything without getting sick. My mood has been up and down. I feel like laying in bed every day. No motivation. It’s horrible. But the worst symptom by far is the nausea for me. I hate throwing up more than anything else on this planet, so feeling like I have to all the time is pretty much my worst nightmare. I highly suggest something else if you want to feel even the least bit normal. This is the first pill I’ve ever been on that makes me feel this bad.

name: Jolessa
comments: Switched from tri sprintec because of side effects started jolessa.  The first 7 weeks were great no side effects no issues. I'm now ten weeks in. I started spotting at the end of week 7 which was normal but it kept getting heavier.   I've been bleeding heavily for 14 days now,  longer than any of my periods before birth control.  I've also had cramps so bad that it caused vomiting  which has never happened before. I'm nearly doubled over in pain half the day and constantly nauseous. I saw one doctor they told me to stick with the pill so I did but my symptoms only continued to get worse so I got a second opinion from a doctor trained in this field.  She recommended stopping the pill. So I did  the bleeding is the same after being pill free for three days  I've been really sick nausea,  and headache.  Starting jolessa was great and I thought it was helping but if I knew it would have been such a nightmare I never would have went on this pill

name: QNASL
comments: Absolutely great!  I was prescribed flonase and all of the other aquas nasal sprays for my constantly stuffed and inflamed sinuses, and they never did anything.   My new dr prescribed QNASL - which sadly my insurance refused to cover, so I suffered on the water-spray for a few months - I found the mfg coupon though and decided to give it a shot, within a few days my sinuses were clearer than I can remember.  I've not noticed any side effects or issues.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: After about 30 minutes of having unprotected sex where an ejaculation occurred, I went out and bought an Aftera pill. It was about $10 less than a Plan B. I immediately took it after purchasing. After about a month of stressing myself out and frantic worrying, my period came (slightly early). Just a forewarning before taking: my cramps were the worst I have ever had them. They actually caused me to sweat they were so extreme. All in all, if I ever need one again (hopefully I won’t) I would recommend Aftera. Ladies don’t stress yourself out and trust the pill. It works!

name: Ocella
comments: I majorly broke out eventually to getting pimples every day not hormonal acne but lots of zits and redness. I’ve tried a birth control before ,but now that I’m on ocella let me just say it’s a miracle for me , no side effects what so ever . Although each first day of the new pack I wake up having an upset stomach and anxiety it eventually goes away that same day.  I used the pill for my awful - I mean excruciating cramps and acne which have helped honestly 100%. I have no cramping anymore. I’m on my fifth month now and it has cured my acne. I’m not entirely clear but I’ve reduced my pimples to 2 pimples a month  and those pimples always show up the week before my period so my periods to blame for this. It was the best pill for me. But like I said this cured and helped my acne soooooo much have gotten so many compliments on how smooth my skin is . A miracle pill is all I’m saying (:

name: Lessina
comments: I began taking this pill after my insurance company sent this medication to my pharmacy instead of my Luthera. When I first started this pill pack I didn't notice anything yet, but at the end of the second week I missed a pill and then had break through bleeding for three weeks straight. I also began noticing severe mood swings and mood changes, breast swelling and tenderness, and pretty consistent bloating. I thought I would give it one more to see if my body just needed to adjust, but all the symptoms remained throughout the next month, aside from spotting a little less frequently, but the mood swings got 10x worse at the end of the month when I was on the inactive pill and my everyday anxiety increased substantially as well.  I couldn't handle the side effects from this and simply had to have my pharmacy order me the Luthera.

name: Jolessa
comments: I love this birth control pill. I haven’t had any issues and it does it’s job, besides darkening discharge a couple of weeks before the period pills. I think this is a small price to pay to have a period every three months (I often don’t even get a period). I highly recommend this birth control if you’re considering a three month prescription!

name: Loestrin 21 1/20
comments:
Started loestrin 20 after 5 years of using no contraception
heres my experience over the first packet
I take the pill at 9pm every night.
1st night within 7 hours of taking pill I had night sweats which lasted 15 minutes.  It didn't happen again since.  In the first week I got Thrush and sore vagina but it went away.
My period was starting when I started the first pack of pills which then stopped my period, I spotted lightly for 2 days instead then occasionally over the 2nd week then my period came between the 3rd-4th week for 6 days very light-medium, then all finished.  No more bleeding. 
- Breast growth. My breasts are fuller after 4 weeks.  A to B. 
I feel well mentally, other pills have caused me to feel low/depressed/irritable.
 Loestrin doesn't affect my moods much more than I am normally throughout my cycle. 
My libido is normal/high and seems unaffected  although I find I sometimes have more vaginal dryness during intercourse

name: Lessina
comments: Switched ob/gyns this past fall and she recommended Lessina since I’m now over 40 and didn’t need as many hormones (in the Dr’s opinion). I’ve always had an effective skin care regimen so I was totally freaked out when I developed ridiculous acne within 1-2 months of switching. I’ve also gained at least 10 or more pounds since I began the pill. I also read how some users felt sadness/depression and I’m wondering if a few blue episodes I’ve had may have been brought on by the pill. Hmm. On the up side, I did notice the increase in sex drive and the periods seemed to be short and smooth (no PMS, no cramps). Finally called the doc last week to complain so I’ve swallowed my last one. Really wish I’d had the sense to Google this pill sooner. Never again. I’ll be researching my new script too as soon as I get it. I’ve been off and on the pill since my teens and never once had this many textbook side effects. Geez.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: Just like everyone else I was on Necon for years no problem whatsoever. I got switched to Nortrel a year ago I'd say. I was a normal healthy person until I started this darn pill! The worst part about this pill is the nausea! I get sick almost every single day vomiting for hours and not being able to sleep due to an upset stomach and taking the pill a few hours prior. it's ridiculous. As for my periods they're all messed up. I could or could not get it who knows. For a year now I've seen doctors thinking it's some type of GI stomach issue. I'm beginning to think it's the stupid pill I am officially done taking these pills and if I start getting better I'm doing something about this as an writing to a company. I can see many females health have been at risk due to this pill and that is not alright! Nortrel watch out your reviews about to be bad.I've also been experiencing horrible moods along with depression and twice the anxiety I've ever had.making me feel like I'm unhealthy and insane.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: So my OB just started me on this medication because I have ovarian cysts.!! I’ve had brith control in the past and I’ve never felt any side affects, unlike Nortrel I’ve had the WORST nausea ever.!! Keep in mind I’m on my first week on this medication I couldn’t find the reason of what was causing the nausea until I looked up the medication and BAMB.!!! Sure enough it’s this damn medication that it’s making me feel this way. I already suffer from anxiety / depression as it is but with this medication it’s 10x worse. Low sex drive I cannot wait until my doctors office open so I can call and let them know hopefully they will change it.!! OVER ALL SUCH A HORRIBLE MEDICATION.!!! Do not take if you are very sensitive.!!

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: My insurance forced me to switch after having great results from Ventolin HFA for years.  I had an attack yesterday and this did absolutely nothing.  Luckily I had an older spare Ventolin inhaler in my car that helped me.  I will never use this garbage again.

name: Claravis
comments: Right before my 49th birthday I finally gave in and decided to start taking this drug. I started breaking out when I turned 40 and I couldn't find a drug or diet to relieve the symptoms over the next 9 years. I was resistant to taking this drug due to the reported side effects. I started taking the medication in June of 2017 and I ended in December of 2017.  The before and after pictues (June/December) tell the whole story. I only pray it does not come back.

name: ProAir RespiClick
comments: I don't feel like any medicine is coming out!! If the medicine is coming out than it doesn't help at all!

name: Junel 1/20
comments: I had been taking Microgestin since I was 16 and my doctor switched me over to Junel about 3 months ago and had me taking them continuously. Periods aren’t bad which is nice but I gained like 12 pounds within the first few weeks of taking it. I have always been a very thin person so I could tell something was changing. Just reacts to everyone differently, but not a bad BC.

name: Lessina
comments: Was on this birth control for four months. I am a pretty optimistic look on the bright side happy girl, but this stuff completely changed that. I became very moody, very grey. Very depressed for no reason. It worked but the side effects were not worth it. It made my head feel very cloudy and made me feel like I was stuck in my head. I ran out of my fourth month and didn’t have a chance to go get a refill right away, which turned into a huge blessing. My head started to become clear and I began to feel like myself again. Needless to say I will be looking for a new bc.

name: levonorgestrel
comments: I took this pill because the pharmacy ran out of plan b, it was cheaper so I was happy. Broke condom situation and I got nervous took it the next day I’m also on birth control so I didn’t feel as scared but still to be careful took this. I didn’t experience cramps or anything or what other people felt. I don’t know if I was mood or not because I’m naturally kinda moody. I think it worked well. I’m not pregnant and that’s all that matters !

name: Ocella
comments: every women's body is different so every person has different side affects. The worst side affects I ever had was from Nexplanon (severe depression, weight loss, anxiety, horrible acne, no sex drive) so I decided to switch back to the pill and Ocella was free under my insurance. This is the best birth control method for my body!!! No depression, no heightened anxiety, cleared up my skin 100%, I gained my much needed weight back and I got my sex drive back! Unfortunately you won't know how a birth control will affect you personally until you try it out but this is my favorite one !!!!

name: QNASL
comments: I suffer from chronic rhinitis and have tried all of the garden variety prescription over the years with none making any noteworthy relief.  My doctor gave me a sample of the Qnasl metered spray and it significantly decreased my symptoms within 24 hours.  I try to use it daily for around 3 months and then stop for about 3 weeks in hopes that it won't cease to be effective. It is the only prescription spray I've found that dramatically improves my sinus condition.  My insurance doesn't cover it but I got some coupons from the manufacture that brings the cost down to $75, but it's worth it.

name: ethinyl estradiol/norethindrone
comments: I have use this birth control for about 3 years. I have no cramps or any others side effect since using this pill it actual stop my endometriosis and PCOS from forming cyst and causing me constant pain. In addition, it help with my irregular period which I had for 6 months straight with heavy flow one week and spotting the next. I was prescribed to skip the placebo pills to help with my period and cyst and only get 2 day spotting once month. I have tried several different types of pill and method and this so far has been the best.

name: Adderall
comments: AHDH medications sucks.They don't treat ADHD believe me. They just delay it till the crash comes and you feel 40 times more worse.They have  destroyed the lives of hundreds of people due to prolonged use. They are just street meth.Believe me I have ADHD and the best medicine I would suggest are a non-stimulants like welbutrin and strattera.If they didn't work for you then never ever use stimulants they will ruin your life. Just rely on adaptogens eg rhodiola, ginseng, good diet, exercise and meditation. If study is a problem for you then use you hyperfocus and study something that you are interested in.You may have found some good reviews about these  stimulants however these people are new and they are unaware of there consequences.
